reviews.review: Cheaper and faster to travel to sites along the river. When I first traveled to BKK, I took taxis everywhere because they were convenient. Many had been good rides where the driver knew where to go without side trips to run up the meter. After several trips where they'd run up the meter, I'd started carrying a card from that destination, a map or have had the desk clerk at the hotel write it down in Thai.After several years I'd discovered the convenience, excitement and low cost of using the commuter ferry. From the Sathorn Taksin ferry landing for the price on only 18 Baht (15 Baht if you buy before boarding) you can travel as short or far as you want to most of the prime tourist attractions near the river at a cost far less than taking a taxi. If it's not along the river, then take a taxi from the landing.Wherever you get off the ferry, you have to walk and walk a lot, typically in the tropic heat and humidity and after you get to your destination, you'll have to walk some more. After 1 or 2 stops, I'm sure you'll be so tired, sore and dripping wet, ready to get back to your room for a refreshing shower. That's now why I suggest you do not use the high priced Tourist Ferry unless you have no concern for cost or you're a glutton for the above and want to max out the ticket.

What Fun on the Boats. Great fun riding on the boats up and down the river. It can be crowded and chaotic. Watch out how much they try and charge foreigners. Greta way to bypass Bangkok's dreadful traffic. Lots of sightseeing accessible to stops on the river.

Alluring. Travelling on the river is more of a sensible practicality as well as a trip in itself. The Chao Phraya river boats are quite an experience and a really good way to get to the Grand Palace complex. always feel relax when i come here//

Fun boat ride. We took a long boat ride on the main river and around some of the smaller tributaries/canals.It was a lovely trip with stops at temples along the way along with a fish feeding stop where hundreds of fish swarmed the boat for the bread we were throwing in.It was also interesting to see a different view of how the locals live along the canals, with the super-rich living side by side with the super-poor.

Mesmerizing. If you are in Bangkok, you should try exporing the chao phraya river. My friend and I explored the beauty of this river. we took a tour to the grand place from Central Jetty and it only cost us THB 100. if you have some extra money to fork out, it is highly recommended that you take a tour-guided cruise along the river whereby the guide will explain to you the attraction along the river.Its amazing what you can see along the river. you can learn about thai culture and see how people are living along the river.its priceless.

Take a private boat tour. Best way is to go on a boat tour, we went in a private tour. Our tour guide did not speak English but was very nice and tried his best to show us interesting spots. On the river you see how they really live and how big the social difference are. You can see a mansion next to a house in the western world would describe as a shed. Here you see the real Bangkok.
Worth your time. Cruise or just using it for transport, the river is a pleasant way to get around. Dinner cruise, cruise to visit popular temples. transport.

see bankok from the river. make sure you take the river boat taxi that the thai people use to comute.Do not use tuk tuk drivers to take you to the pier as you will only end up on an overpriced river boat cruise and you can see the same from the local river taxis and pay about 30 to 50 baht and not around 20 usd.
Nice. Nice little cruise along the river and many canals to venture down. Worth it just to see a different side of Bangkok

Unexpected river trip. Taxi scam took us to the river and a ridiculously quoted trip to the Royal Palace as we walked away in mock disgust the price was more than halved and the two of us set off up the river. Always the best way to see a city the river provides the perfect vantage point to see tradition, modernity, slick and shambles side by side. 30 minutes and we arrived at our destination ever more aware that not all scams turn out badly ...

Nice way to travel !. I went to Tha Maharaj and took ferries to Wat Pho, Wat Arun and AsiaTique. From Tha Maharaj it costed 40 bath to Wat Pho, another 3 bath to Wat Arun and 40 bath to go to the last pier before going to AsiaTique.

Cruising around . For 100 baht/person we took the boat tour on the river. It was a sunny day and I really enjoyed it.
Recommend!!!
A beautiful buzzing river!. Make sure you go to one of the piers and do a river tour! Beautiful to see the other side of Bangkok away from the huddle and bussle!

Chai Phraya River Boats . Mass Transportation when you have natural waterways as a significant feature of your region. Efficient, timely, nice views and flexible schedules. Best means of transportation if your seeing the sights along or just off the river.

Average. The condition of the boat is quite new and very clean. Would be great for couple. It was a bit noisy and people are walking around non-stop. Check-in was slow and had to wait even if we've arrived early.

Sathorn Pier ferry ride. BTS Saphan Thaksin train station just 15mins walk to the pier and its budget way to enjoy Chrao Phraya River ferry cruise across the river. The ferry itself is big and comfortable enough with seats for everyone who queue at the pier.

awesome experience!. went here last july 2016 this year and tried this river tour/buffet. Indeed a great experience! the food is plenty and yummy. The seafood and steaks are the best! Romantic evening for me and my fiance! Thank you for the experience! Highly recommended when in Bangkok!

Down on the River. The Chaopraya River is loaded with things to do. You can stay in any of the 100's of Hotels, visit tourist destinations like The Reclining Buddha, Asiatiquue, Khao San Rd, The Grand Palace,....... and the list goes on. You can take the passenger boat to its last stop from Satorn Pier for only 40 cents USD, and the one trip takes over 1 hour.The Great Chaopraya River.

Beware of Touts and Horrible Taxi Drivers. Beware of questionable boat company which literally takes you for a ride, claim to be an hour excursion but end within 15 mins with the excuse that river is too high tide and cannot pass thru some of the canal.
River cruise. An experience of a life time.We had chosen the International buffet in the cruise. Live music and songs made it more beautiful.

Interesting Views. The views from the river are interesting. Take a boat tour and ensure that the guide tells you about the history. It is the main river in Thailand. There are no longer the floating markets. They have moved due to the price of land along the river and other reasons. That was the only little disappointment.

Must do the Klong Riverboat Tour!!. This was by far one of the highlights of my holiday! This tour going through the Chao phraya river was absolutely eye opening taking you through the beautiful and unseen places of the city this was a great way to get away from the busy nature of Bangkok and see some of the true Thailand and how people live especially those living right by the river!

All the way along the river!. It's so nice to go along the river, especially on hot days, when the breeze cools you down. As well as the private boats and river tours you can go all the way from Saphan Taksin to Nonthaburi (where there's a market and lots of cheap food) for 14 bht (the cost of each trip). There are many great things to see along the way. It's quite crazy getting onto the boat, with so many people, so be ready to focus hard to get a seat!

Nice view except the cleanliness of the river . It's a great experience by taking boat to have a different angle of view towards Bangkok city. There are express boat services as well as cheaper rate boat (with color flag) services. I would think that it is a worthy trial for first time visitor.

wild and wonderful. I stayed in a small hotel on the banks of the Chao Phraya river and it is an experience that will remain with me all my life. During the daytime craft of all shapes and sizes ply up and down the river, ploughing through the green weed that abounds, often at unbelievable speeds and seemingly with no regard for Western standards of Health and Safety but also seemingly with no mishaps. A tug will tow three gigantic barges roped together in a line whilst a small leisure boat with a very long propeller shaft tears up and down at breakneck speeds. River ferries take up to 200 or so people at a time from one side of the river to the other, their routes criss-crossing at random. These ferries have no safety rails, gates or doors but noone falls in.At night the barges cease but numerous pleasure boats each laden with hundreds of mainly Western tourists cruise up and down, bedecked with coloured lights, and often with ecstatic dancers gyrating to music unheard from the river bank.Enjoy a meal or a few drinks overlooking this magical river and maybe take a ride on a boat (at least on one of the many ferries) and you will never forget it.Wild and wonderful.

A tour on the river is a Must, when in Bangkok! Take in the unique atmosphere!. I always take a tour on the local speedboats, on Chao Praya River, when in Bangkok! To sit in these long and fast boats who run commuters and tourists up and down the river, to hear the boatboys whistle signals to the driver, tp see the tugs and bargers on the river, and to see the people who live on board there boats, is a true pleasure! It gives you a true sense of how the people live their lives in this bustling city. Get off the boat, have a coffee or lunch at the local restaurant and buy a bag of breadcrumms to feed the fish! And it is dead cheap as well!!
River visit. Being a tourist, I chose to take the touristy path of visiting the must see Chao Phraya river. It was not as boring as they made it put to be. It has its unique flavours of Thai culture.

nice river and a nice way of transport in this hectic city. i ilked the river and liked it much when i used it as a way of transportation to go to the temples. it is very easy to use the boat for transport in the river. you just wait in the jetty and the boat will come to take you wherever you like .and also there is a collector in the boat who will collect the fare once the boat travelled.the fare is so cheap .something negligible. it is something about 15 baht which is 50 cents.

Nothing special. I used the river ferry only once to travel between two temples. I didn’t think that the river was particularly spectacular or it was anything very clean. I also had a walk around the banks of the river and found that the river cruises on the river were really noisy. In all, I think Chao Phraya River was nothing special. But it is a good way to beat the crazy Bangkok traffic.

It gives you a different view. We jumped on the public ferry from Central Pier & took the relaxing ride all the way to Phra Athit which I think is the last stop taking about 30 minutes & costing 40 baht per person.The ride gives you a different view of Bangkok & a glimpse of river life, including a little sightseeing on the way. It's definitely worth taking the ferry, instead of a taxi, if your staying in Silom & wanting to see the major temples further up.

A different way to see Bangkok. An easy trip to organise. We bought a day pass which meant we could hop on and off anytime. The views were good seeing old houses and new. Stops are plenty wirh access to most tourist's spots.

a must in Bangkok as firts time or 10th time visitor. each time in Bangkok we spend "time" on boats on the river, taxi boats tourist boats or a shore watching the river action and "lif"line for Bangkok
Beautiful river. The river through the city. Many star hotels are lined up in the bank of the river. Many Buddha temples and tourist attractions are along the river. A place take the pictures.

Agreat way to see Bangkok. Took the BTS skitrain to the end of the line and there was a short walk to the river where you book your boat trip. I would advise doing some home work on were you would like to go, the trip varies in price depending on were you are going the tour guide does let you know about all of the attractions in each stop the boat will bring you back to by the BTS station.

Chao Phraya River @ Saphan Taksin. Chao Phraya River's sunset has to be one of the most romantic scenes in Bangkok. Recommend you travel by BTS to Saphan Taksin Station during late afternoon and take a Free Shuttle Boat ride to Asiatique the Riverfront. While watching the Chao Phraya River's sunset, you can then enjoy a French or local Thai Cuisine of your choice and do a little shopping at the night market afterwards...
River trip. Beware of vendors trying to con tourists in to paying too much for a boat ride. We took a trip in a long boat down the Chao Phraya River, was fun but we perhaps paid too much for this.
river through the city. it runs through the city. Many star hotels are lined up in the bank of the river. Many Buddha temples and tourist attractions are accessible through the water taxi service

Two hours on a key trade thoroughfare in Bangkok. The Chao Phraya is a frantically busy trade route for the many barges moving product up and down the river. Taking one of the long and narrow powered boats towards the mouth from the Peninsula Hotel was a great way to see parts of Bangkok which would be impossible from a car - from the amazing majestic provate homes and commercial buildings and hotels to the oldest and ricketty shacks, just a rich experience on a great river.

A must do experience. If you thought drivers in Thailand were manic then take a trip down the river:)Seriously though if you hire a long boat they will take you down the canals were you can see a glimpse into how river people live:) kiddies playing and fishing, some very poor areas then some mega wealthy ones - I would say this is a must for anyone to do.
worth taking the taxi boats. amazing way to experience bangkok more like a local.even when it is a big adventure you see so many things around the river. i can higly recommend this.

Canal Taxi Boats are the cheapest and quickest way to travel in Bangkok . We decided to take the canal taxi back from the local pier. We found the pier via Google maps and then checked where the closest one was to our destination. Getting onto the river taxi for the first time is a little scarey, but the boat workers ensure that you are safe and will even assist you in getting on and off should you required the help. Is cost 18 baht per person to travel 18 stops each way. Each journey took around 40 minutes so is excellent value for money. There's no traffic, no delay and no fuss. Some stops are busier than others and the boats can get a little crowded, but can you really complain for 18 baht!? I think not!! It's a great way to see so. E of the sights as well, as you travel past mosques, temples and tourist attractions. We would definitely recommend this method of travel to everyone and anyone.

Wonderful River!. Similar to most rivers running thru a major city, you would think twice before taking a dip. But the distinct lack of the typical canal smell is a welcome change. Along the river are several touristy establishments which is perfect for a romantic dinner al fresco with the ancient temples of bangkok back lit by the abient city lighting.Overall a worth it dinner experience. It may be a little hot to eat lunch outdoors in bangkok.

Watch the City from Boat's Eye. A 40 Baht ferry ticket will give you a wonderful view of Bangkok. A very different from the river.... Quite Busy Area.... Can find Luxury Boats also... But prefer Ferry.... Less Price and Good experience.
Thrilling experience. The busy life on the river will excite you. Boats of all sorts. Enjoy a trip on the river. If you can combine It with a romantic night on a boat with gourmet dinner.

Alternative way to see the City. A 40 Baht ferry ticket will give you a wonderful view of Bangkok with a cool breeze to boot. You can take one of the many cruise boats along the river but I'd recommend using the ferry. At a fraction of the cost of the cruise options you'll pretty much see the same sights.

great way to experience bangkok. despite being filthy and being surrounded by thai people that are constantly trying to scam tourists, once you get on the boats it is a really nice way to see bangkok and experience another side of the city. anyone heading for a boat ride, be aware that there are private piers and public ones, and the private ones will try to rip you off any chance they get. i was actually threatened by the people operating the riverside travels pier. however, if traveling in a big group then taking a private boat would be ideal.

Easy. Despite previous reviews, I used the tourist(blue flag). It cost 150 baht for the full day on a hop on,hop off basis. 40 baht for one stop. You can get cheaper boats , but the simplicity of this one makes it good value. Links easily with skytrain. Watch out for the tuk,tuk drivers, as friendly as they seem, as they will try to take you to the private operators who charge around 1500 baht per hour.

Somewhat Unique Experience. Travelled from Phra Athit pier No.13 to Sakhan Thaksin pier No.0 along the Chao Phraya river. Nice experience to travel by boat in a big city and see how locals use it as a public transport for their daily needs. Comfortable ride but may be packed at times. Nice view from the river but water looks murky.

Must See When In BKK. Take a side trip to the end of the Skytrain and walk to the river which is the largest and longest in Thailand. If you want to go to the Grand Palace, Wat Pho, etc. take the river way starting near the Sheraton Royal Orchid or the Mandarin Oriental hotels. There are many tourist boats but i always enjoy taking the public river busses which cost only a few baht. Commute with locals to your destination or just ride and enjoy the breeze.
James Bond moment. Get on one of the super fast boats and head off to the floating market, past all of the river houses. Different world. Great

Calm and nice river and beautiful in both days and nights . We were in Chao phraya cruise and dined in several local foods and enjoyed international songs which performed by a wonderful singer that mede our night

Go to Thai Pier. We met a really nice gentlemen who advised us to get a Tuk Tuk and go to Thai Pier instead of the main places to have a river tour. When we got to the pier a really nice guy explained the different tours they offer and how much they were. We opted for the hour and a half tour that goes up the river, through some of the canals, it then stops off at Wat Arun for half an hour and finally takes you back to where you started from. We were on a long tail boat and just the two of us so it is more like a charter. The captin doesn't tell you too much but he did point things out. If was a nice relaxing hour and a half and we only paid 2400 Bhat.

Always changing. I loved sitting along the side of the Chao Phraya River, both in restaurants, in the small city parks and Buddhist Temples which dot its banks. I can sit for hours watching the river activity. The architecture, along its banks, is fascinating. From the ultra modern to the traditional Thai style structures. Everything from clumps of vegetation, to a row of barges, to both small and large long tail boats, to water taxies and the occasional extra long river cruise boats pass by. For me it's peaceful and serene.

Surasak Duangsawang.. Chao phaya river is the main river of Thailand starting from Nakornsawan province passing by many provinces down to Bangkok after that to gulf of Thailand.for foreigners Also can take a boat where the boat pick up passenger from the pier to see the view of both side and if you like to see something different then you can take a long tail boat where they take you to small canal.

A different kind of river cruising. We had an hour ride on this boat roaming the river between houses built on woods. U will get to see animals once a while... and despite a dirty river, bottom are living big fishes. Throw bread in and you will experience. There are river marketing too, grab a beer and sit down to relax the wind blowing towards you. One person will cost THB1,500 Tourist but if you have Thai friend bring you along, might able to save you half the price.

A wide dirty river. This is one big flowing mass of dirty water and waterweed with a number of boats in it. On its coast you can see marvelous palaces, modern buildings and horrible decadent dirty houses all at once.
See Bangkok by water.. A boat trip on the Chao Phraya is a great way to see some of Bangkok. Go around the canals to see the other side of life.

Try at least once!!. Have been on this twice with my mom. Need to be a little nimble as the boats aren't exactly close to the boarding platform and you have to jump across. My mom almost fell into the water which was quite funny. Try to do this at least once especially if you have been to bkk a few times. It will take you out to the remote villages...so check if it's a roundabout trip or get off after 2-3 stops - so at least you can say you've tried the river taxi. Don't expect stunning views either, the river is pretty dirty now, it is more for understanding how locals travel. Enjoy!
Nice Experience. Dinner cruise is great experience one must try in Bangkok. Food was great with live music. Must try.

Cool and convenient transfer. Just use the taks boot at the river and enjoy the viewsNo traffic jams! It cost almost nothing. Personally I would take the boat with the orange flag as this is more a local experience. The boats with the blue flags are for tourist and are more expensive as well.
Kids Vacations . Excellent it's worth visiting and having boat ride ... with locals and if wish to have Sea Food Buffet it was awesome experience highly recommended

DInner cruise of the river. If you don't mind standing in a throng of people and then being herded into a boat during which no one cares if you are old, disabled, or carrying a child they all just want to get on first even though there is assigned seating, then you would like the views on this river's cruises. You see many of the main attractions and the bridges and if you go when sun is setting you get a day and night view of the city and it looks lovely from the water. The food on the boats is awful despite being called an international buffet there was almost nothing I could eat and I am not vegan or have allergies, it was just not good. We were able to get the staff to put a table out on the deck for us where we enjoyed cooler air and a better view while we ate, had this not happened I may have jumped! And that is saying a lot considering the river is very dark brown and carries garbage barges up and down it all day

NOT TO MISS....... We had group visit to Chao Phraya River & had nice trip of whole river with live music, dinner & lot of dance. Surrounding are excellent very well lit up and can really feel the different view of different different big hotels & temple etc.
Vital river. Definitely it is a vital river supporting Bangkok and all the towns lyingby its bank. It serves as an important transportation mode.

Must See in Bangkok. One of the biggest landmarks in Bangkok, the river is typical of 21st century life here. Lots of beautiful architecture but also lots of old age structures as well. I have traveled on the river several times and always see something new.

First visit in BKK. Since 1968 I have visited Bkk far more than 100 times.Usually the flights from FRA arrived early in the morning.I dont like to waste the 1.day., But it was to hot and to exhausting, to do a City tour, and to much traffic(no Skytrain)So I chartered a longtail-boat for a refreshing drive along the Klongs with gardens and lots of friendly People.At 4 pmthe WAT ARUN was quite empty. For the 1.day the best expirience of BKK .

The arteria of Bangkok. Not only a touristic attraction (even if it a must for tourists, too) -but a commong public transport waterway for locals.May give you a good impression about several important sites of BKK

River taxi ride. We took the local boat taxi to just traveled from Grand Palace to Wang Lang Market. And then took another local boat taxi from Wang Lang market to supposely Wat Arun stop. But we were only told to go up the boat, and down to a stop opposite of Wat Arun. We were ignored by the staff at the stop, so we ended our trip of Chao Phraya River.
Nice river. Don't miss amazing view, exciting. Nice trip in Bangkok..It was in the landmark of Thailand. Good time to see the view and have dinner.

Beautiful view and nice cruise. I took a cruise when i was in bangkok on the chao phraya and it was quite fun. I stayed in bangkok for many many days and heard that this was something fun to do and it was!

Must visit . Nt to miss amazing food amazing view n a gr8 singer for vegans u hav lots f options to eat n lovely view
To dance to enjoy to eat good food a perfect place
River sailing. Went through river and was exciting! Could see across the banks Monuments, High End buildings, and low houses!
Nice oriental river. Nice water trip in Bangkok. It was in the middle of Thailand raining season but the trip was fine. Not so wet and not too hot. I had a good time.

Boat . Went on the boat, on the river, stopping of at different places, about pound for a single, just to remind ladies there are lots of monks who travel on the boats, and females are not allowed to sit next to them
I would recommend to go on the boats
Look out for orange flag
Must have River Cruise. The cruise on the river is an amazing experience at night. Soft romantic music on the emerald waters of Chao Phraya river and Indian food is a must have experience for all.
A good river recreation. Chao Phraya is a nice river with beautiful scenery and as a tourist we can have look around by using boat

Holiday. We bought the Tourist all day ticket for 150 bht each n stayed on the river boat most of the day getting on n off as we wanted. Brilliant way of getting around n seeing the sights.... Well worth the money n we had a great day!At the end of the Pier is the Asiatique boat which is free. This was a lovely place nice indoor n outdoor markets n lots of eating places.

Mode of transporation. This river is not so clean but many tourist places are just around the piers. The river is the common way people use via boat for visiting the tourist places. It's cheap and fun way to reach places.
Beautiful River to travel along. This river passes by some of Bangkok's best streets and area. Can see all the famous temples, palaces and at some place there's nice Bangkok skyline views.

A leisurely visit in the evening is worth it. One of the very romantic places in BKK by sunset is surely visit or a short cruise along the river. There are many options, choose wisely as there some expensive but not so good rides as well. Avoid lure of private boat ride - usually not worth it .. the dinner cruises are good but the food offered is not the best and you can easily find much better options in the restaurants near by. One of the very good activity you can do is to arrive by BTS to Saphan Taksin station (if BTS is your choice of transport in the city) and take a small ride along the river by boat ( its free) to Asiatique river front and having dinner there with wide choice of menu from French to local Thai cuisine.

Great way again to get about. Various ways to get on the ferris cheap scenic and fun. You can cross from one side of the river for 2bht or travel the length for about 60p bargain get on and off explore bits of Bangkok you would never see a must do on any trip

Enjoyable evening on cruise. Went with family n friends on Chao Phraya Princess tour. Enjoyed the evening due to following reasons:
1. Nice indian food
2. Nice indian music for dancing
3. Nice host n other crew members
4. Nice photography
Great Experience. I had a grate experience here with dinner cruise. Well organized.Enjoyed a lot and really a nice memory.

Come to the river to relax from the city. You can either take a boat and ride across much of Bangkok and visit the many little side channels (klongs?) or simply sit on a terrace of a restaurant by the river. Best of all places is the Terrasse by the River of the Mandarin Oriental Hotel

Traditional longboat experience. Took a guided boat tour of some amazing cultural sights and temples. it offered also some more insight into the lives of the people who live on the river. What amazed us was there is no trash, no litter floating around, the river is kept so clean. And tho tour offers a different perspective of Bangkok. Recommend to visit the royal barges.
take river trip. Enjoy shoreline of city take trip on river sure this ride will excite you few company offer dine cruise check those out and have romantic evening

Dinner cruise. Beautiful weather awesomely decorated sights beautiful buildingThe boat was from the riverside hotelCan enjoy the food only if u have a local language speaking companionNo desert no coffee no teaHot cup of water also chargedLive band only plays Thai songsGood idea to take on any other company

A great way to tour Bangkok. Bangkok makes extensively of the river and it provides a great ferry service. We have visited Bangkok a couple of times and have made extensive use of them. The Chao Phraya tourist boats (blue flags) are inexpensive and a day ticket can be purchased for TB 150, allowing travel up and down the river all day (until 9pm) to all the usual tourist destinations that are accessible from the river. Central Pier also links with the Skytrain, allowing you to pick up a train to travel to other parts of Bangkok.

Not to be missed. After a day or two of taxis, skytrain, taxis and tuktuks, taking the water taxi in the Chao Praya river was a terrific way to get around Bangkok. Take the public services and get a real feeling for how the locals get around. Very cheap. The views if Bangkok are a juxtaposition of rich and poor. River is not quite clean. I wiuldn't want to go swimming.

Easy Way To Get Along The River Spots. The Chao Phraya River has its river express boats plying up and down along the various designated piers. It's very easy to get to the various tourist spots in the old city since neither the BTS nor the MRT serve this area. To get into the system, take a ride to the BTS Saphan Taksin station which connects to the river express boat's Sathorn (Central) Pier. You can save some money by avoiding the blue tourist boat; instead take any of the orange, yellow, green/yellow or no flag boats. Do check out the piers map before going up any of them though. Tickets bought on board ranges from THB 10 - 32 (very far).

Dirty putrid water. I honestly don't know why anyone would get in this body of water if they can avoid it. It's dirty, it stinks, and there is zero visibility.
We took a river cruise that went through extremely poor neighborhoods with people going to the bathroom directly in the tributaries. Stay away!

Cruise the city sights. Good way to enjoy the city without traffic. Watch the sights from a cooling river cruise.
Regular stops to hop off and sighsee on route

every body should do this in bangkok. highly recommend spending a leseiurly afternoon on the public ferry going up the river from Sapan Taksin pier next to shangri la hotelThe ferry is very cheap and you can just get on and off where ever they stop , and there are many stops , soak up the ambience and see how the river is the tru heart of bangkok well worth the effort

use the river boat like a bus. A great way to see the Bangkok skylineThe first night we were there we dined on a river cruise.The next day we travelled by skytrain to the river terminus & bought a dayticket & used it like a hop on hop off bus. Points of interest all along the river a lifeline to the city
A glimpse of life on the river. This is a worthwhile trip. You get to see the other side of BKK. Reasonably priced and about an hour long ride.

Good view. Nice to float in ferry. I was staying close to Chao Phraya River ,ie near Sathorn pier. I chose to go by regular ferry to Wat Arun temple. Feery ride was good, cheap and could see many places with out getting jammed in Bangkok traffic. I suggest to use passenger ferry instead of river cruise,as it is economical and you could mingle with locals.

A fascinating and quick way to see Bangkok from another side.. Have travelled on the Chao Phraya River many times and always find this an enjoyable experience. Be it by long tail-boat, dinner river cruise boat or just a cross river trip to our hotel, its a visual feast. Try for a hotel with good river views as the constant traffic and movement is calming after the frenetic street level experiences in this great city. Beware splash back in the long-tail boats though as the water is not exactly pristine just yet.
Great Bangkok experience.. Forget tourist boat and get yellow flag boats from Saphan Taksin pier.Get off when you fancy.Temples, hotels, palace, markets ,Khaosan road, all acessible from the riley.

You'd be silly not to ride the Chao Phraya River boats. Wether it's a longtail boat or a ferry you'll be amased at the sights along the river and the traffic on it. It's cheap to travel and the ferry stops at all major attractions along the way. Even if you have to walk 5 or 10 minutes from the pier to your destination. Travel all day for 150b. It's a must do in Bangkok
Boat ride. There are several boats that can be taken to go to any part of the Phraya River. By the way, the boats that goes to Asiatique is free.

One of the best ways to get out of Tourist Bangkok. One of my favorite thing to do in Bangkok is to take the community public boats and go from pier to pier and explore the different parts of Bangkok along the way. At many of the stops there are nothing special to see, just daily routines and genuine Thai Bangkok life. A perfect route for photographers and others genuinely interested in culture, genuine food and social differences. The last time I did this it only cost 2baht per stop! Enjoy this forgotten pearl of Bangkok.
Amazing river. Very nice to see from above, like a skybar, or closeby. Even better, grab a khlong for a short tour with a stop at the market.A must do in bangkok!

Great access to multiple spots. This river has tourist boats that connect to a lot of tourist spots like Wat Pho, Grand Palace, Wat Arun, Asiatique market, China town, floating market .. Very convenient

See Bangkok from the sea. This is something you should do when you are in Bangkok and its also a good way of travel. You have different options, either rent a privet small boat or go with the public transfer which is a lot sheeper.

Simply amazing at night. This River has changed dramatically the last five years you find great restaurants and at night you enjoy a fantastic skyline of this vibrant City. A must-see place is for sure Asiatique we all the little shops and fine restaurants. Take a little boat trip from the hotel's like Shangri-La and you enjoy a great evening.

A must see on Loi Kratong. The candle lit model boats abound on the River at Loi Kratong providing a magical sight as they float downstream. My wife is very fond of the Loi Kratong song which she sings with great gusto at the Festival

Fun evening out on dinner cruise. We had our team dinner on board of the Chao Phraya Princess on one of the evening. The place is crowed with many different cruise and we had to wait to board our river cruise. The food was nothing to shout about, but the view was interesting and we had a great host - she managed to engage the visitors and kick up a dancing storm on board after dinner. It was a fun experiences for all of us.

Cruise one of the greatest rivers on earth for peanuts.. Hop on the local transit ferries for pennies and traverse this huge and vibrant city through its heart. Experience the thrill of leaping onshore as the boat momentarily pauses at the jetty. But more importantly get round this metropolis with the least hassle possible, no traffic, no honking, no fumes, no problem. If you are adventurous, take a smaller ferry up one of the huge khlong canals to more distant parts of the city.

Add some excitement to your trip. If you get bored by riding taxis, the BTS train and buses in Bangkok, try traveling by boat and cruise the Chao Phraya River. It's one way to experience the adrenaline rush together with the locals and other tourists. The trip can get more exciting especially during rainy season and during peak tourist months. The river is also a way to reach most of the temples in Bangkok. If you haven't been to Bangkok before, it's better to get a tour package so you can maximize your time. Just make sure that the company is a trusted one. There are several company stalls located at the BTS station.

A typical must do.. Everyone needs to experience the river. It may not be the cleanest you have ever been on but it is very busy and a great way to get around without the fight of the traffic. The long tail boats are a must, very Bangkok.
Nice therapeutic ride to enjoy Bangkok. Good and pleasant ride. The only thing you may need to tolerate is the guide whose English can be quite painful to hear.

Good. It is good to have such a big river passing through a metropolis if we can call Bangkok a megapolis. I went to many sites on boat, which I really liked it. It was a fast and cheap way. I missed the nightlife on boat.

Budget siteseeing. Just take the boat on the river to eighther side till the end, same price as short trip. It wiil show you the city from the riverside and deeper ideas of fabulous Bangkok. At the far end is a tempel worth looking at, you cant miss it! And if you want you can continue to an island with handicraft, good for souveniers. Half day trip if you do it slowly.Dont use the expensive tourist boat, i did not understand one word, ok, not native speaker... Maybe better for you...

Pleasant relaxing travel with excellent sightseeing as part of the experience.. We bought a day pass so we could choose multiple destinations and take our time at each. It was well worth it. Each stop along the river gives easy access to so many different great tourist spots and quiet little places that you might so easily miss if traveling any other way. There are several EXCELLENT Restaurant boats with fantastic food for lunch or even better evening meals and it doesnt matter what the weather is like...hot, or wet... you still get to enjoy the air-conditioned luxury as you eat and move up or down the river.
Experaincing on boat. Nice to hire the boat to take along Chao Phraya River, you can many things from both side of the river.Of course the water is not so clean.
A must do!. This is a must do when in Bangkok. Cheap boat transport stopping at Royal Palace,Wat Po, Temple of the Dawn,Khao San Road and China town to name but a few.
Nice. Take one of the ferry that goes across the river. You can also take your bike with you. Highly recommend.
Beautiful !!!!!!. I have seen this river by cruise it's very beautiful particularly in night time to watch city as wall as

The real Bangkok. This is a great way to see the real Bangkok, from the opulent hotels to the very poor local Thais housing. You can get on and off as you please there are approximately 6 stops and it is a cheap way to get to a lot of the tourist attractions 150 Baht return

Colourful river conveys the charm of Bangkok. The Chao Phraya River is one of the best kept secrets of Bangkok. Trips along the river are cheap, colourful, and easy to access from various stops. Saphan Taksin and Tha Pra Chan are two of my favourite places to catch ferries. From Saphan Taksin you can get ferries that go the length of the Chao Phraya, all the way to Nonthaburi. When I visited Bangkok in July, 2016 that hour-long trip only cost me 16 baht one-way. There are all sorts of hidden charms along the Chao Phraya. Getting on at Tha Pra Chan takes one to some great little Thai riverside restaurants and also to the historical Grand Palace area of Bangkok. There's little doubt that the Chao Phraya is one of the most attractive and efficiently used riversides in Asia.

One way 40thb, All day 150thb. 6 stops along a small part of the river. Stops to let you off quickly, nice to sit up the front to view both sides of the river.
If all the tourist attractions are on your list to see, then the 150thb would be best.

The heart and soul of Bangkok. This river is Bangkok, and bangkok is this river. Yes, there is much more to the city than the Chao Phraya. But nothing conveys so well the essence of this city than a short trip up and down the river with the canals and all the busy activity. The tree trunks floating next to the huge barges. Another way to enjoy it is by booking a room with a view in one of the many hotels in the shores. Certainly worth the cost.
Very dirty. The amount of trash floating around in the river is disgusting. If this is supposed to be one of the prime ways to go around Bangkok i hold my heart for the other activities.

No traffic jams on the river. The ferries on the river are a great way to get around, they are also inexpensive and relatively frequent. There's a lot to see along the river, on both sides and the river itself. If you're staying in a riverside hotel, watch the barges as they make their way to and from the harbour loaded with produce and goods.

Well worth a boat trip . We took a two hour boat trip on the river and the canal which enabled us to see both the rich and poor sides of the city back to back. We just arrived at a landing stage and a boat spotted us and we bartered the price for a group of 5. Excellent trip, and we go to see so much more than had we tried to do it on foot

Rocky . Plenty of boat rides from China town. An experience worth doing. Lots of water lily on the river. There are tours along the river you can do or if you just wanted to get to the grand palace, Wat pho. There accessible from the river

A source of endless entertainment. Our hotel (Sheraton) was located on the banks of the river and we sat for hours watching all the activity: clearing the weeds, barges transporting whatever, commuters making their way to work, tourists out sight-seeing. The very heart of Bangkok.

Amazing!!!!. I took the small river boat with guided tour and it was fabulous. You see the other side of Bangkok completely different from the streets side. Old and new, nice and ugly!!! :)Magical City..................... Enjoy the market at the boats station

Stay in a hotel on the River!. Hotels on the River like Chatrium Hotel Riverside and the Mandarin Oriental offer riverboat transportation which is much faster than walking and sometimes driving. The boats take you to the LRT.The river is beautiful with some spectacular things to see.

Its a huge river with luxurious hotels on either of its banks. Its a good place to be if you are staying in one of the luxurious hotels like Banyan Tree, Peninsula, etc to visit. There are free boot rides offered by the hotels to go from one bank to another. Its an experience in itself.

Take the ferry. For any visitor to Bangkok taking a trip on the river is essential. The easiest and cheapest way to do this is just to take one of the many ferries from Saphin Taksin bridge up and down for pennies.

Always good to be on the water. Crossed the river to Bangkok's "Green Lung" the other day from Wat Klong Toei to Bang Krachow in a small long tail boat for ten baht each way. The boatmanship was impressive.

Orange flag boat. This was interesting to see all up and down the river and see the daily activities of a typical Thai person. Can see the big palaces from the river. I would not want the water to splash me though as you would probably end up with some bad funk!

A wonderful way to spend and hour and a half. We decided to take the river cruise to kill time whilst the crowds to view the lying Buddha dissipated. We were taken to the river site by a helpful guide, who is obviously on a commission. The boat ride cost us 1000 BHAT each for an hour and a half. We were stocked up with cold water, fruit and bread to feed the fish. Boarding the long boat can be tricky and neither my entry or exit was done with any dignity. That's wasn't helped by a very choppy river, a pontoon that was bouncing up and down and having to climb over a protective siding and down into a moving boat. However, it was worth the undignified boarding. We went down a very choppy river before turning into the canals. Here we queued for about 10-mins to get through the lock. Then we were on our way past a variety of river houses from traditional, to ramshackle to modern. Plus of course a multitude of temples.Life on the river in all its glory. The lazy fisherman. The small river shop owners. People renovating little river houses. The boat sellers with their traditional tourist junk. A very big lizard was glimpsed gliding through the water. The water birds and the endless stream of long boats. Fascinating. Our first stop was Wat Arun. We had around 20-mins to feed the fish (for good luck) and view the temple. Given it was so hot, this was ample time. Our second and final stop was near the lying Buddha. Very convenient. We throughly enjoyed the boat ride. It was good value for money. All in all it was a very enjoyable hour and a half and it afforded us a fascinating view of Bangkok. Such a change from the concrete jungle of the city.

Interesting. Historically, Bangkok was called the Venice of Asia. This river is part of the great maritime transportation system. You take a ferry across the river for about 4 cents US. You can also take scenic tours along the river. An interesting alternative to other outdoor activities.

A different way to see the city. The boat system, contrarily to the trains, is not as well organised, but visiting the city from the river is pretty interesting: you'd get to see both the most luxurious places (hotels, buildings) and also poor houses that seem about to collapse. People hop in and out the boats at each stop, you'd see tourists and locals alike if you catch one of the inexpensive services.

Choppy. Can't do anything about Mother Nature, but the river is choppy. But, we did enjoy using it. Make sure you keep an eye out for water taxi's with orange flags. They are free and are mainly used by locals. Blue flags are tourist boats so expect to pay a bit more. Long boat tours through the canels are also a must do

Great experience . We took a boat which charged 1000 baht per person. Although it was very overpriced, the experience was surreal.The boat first took us to Wat Arun where we got around 20 mins and then it cruised along the river and then took us deeper into the city through a canal where you can get a taste of the real Bangkok and Buddhist architecture.

Must do.. Enjoyed the river by basic longboat and on large party river boat .Both very different but both very enjoyable . Great way to see the river and surrounding area . On our night on party boat there was a great fireworks display for the Queens birthday which made our trip even better . Would recommend both in Bangkok .

You can't "do" Bangkok without "doing" the Chao Praya River. Use the ferries, go for a cruise of the khlongs, take a waterside walk - the Chao Praya River is the heart of Bangkok, winding around and around the city before it heads out to the sea. This time it had quite a bit of floating vegetation, which provided us with some amusement as the ferries looked like they were floating on paddies.
Fun, nice views . Was really fun. The people on the boat were friendly. Watch out for getting out of the boat fare. You don't have to pay it unless agreed on up front.
Nice experience.. Buy the 150 baht ticket so you can just stop at any pier and get back on as much as you can to get the most out of it.

Boat great way to see city. Taking one of the many public transit boats along the Chao Phraya is a great way to see Bangkok from famous sites to river life to the variety of rivercraft to architecture.

the best choice. if you stay in Bangkok chiise a hotel or a residence on the Chao Phraya River , it is the best location . Everytime I have travelled to Bangkok I have stayed at Shangri La Hotel or Mandarin Oriental making sure I had a room with river view .Especially at night the river is full of life and light , many boats bigger and smaller . The water of the river is not clean of course but you do not have to swim in it .By the way during the day the river offers public boat transport which mekes you skip the deadly road traffic in Bangkok

River ferry and Private Long Tail Boat Excursion a must in BKK. Make sure as part of any trip to BKK you experience at least one river ferry ( example flower market /river walk to Wat Arun on other side) and also hire a long tail boat to visit the some of the canals off the river which make Bangkok Venice of the East. You can view the lock system, feed fish with bread bought from the Monks and get a real sense of life here in years past.
Charming. By day a fantastic way to move around Bangkok and get from one major attraction to the other. At night a romantic diner cruise is its best tourist attraction.

Love it. Rent a private longtail for 2 hours. . Great experience. On the river back waters you can see how the locals live Really enjoy thisBeen on the boats 5 times. Still love it. Very dirty with some dead dogs. But that is Bangkok
interesting view to see Bangkok city........ I go with family and we take long boat .it take hours and we see lot of new experience.great time........
A working waterway and view into real Thailand.. The river is a great short cut around traffic jams to Royal Palace and other areas. Go by more traditional houses and see how people live.

A must-do when visiting Bangkok!. Take the BTS to the pier and take a ferry to see the amazing architecture of Bangkok. It is a nice, calm way to see the city and not expensive if you take the local ferry.

Best way to get around Bangkok. This is indeed a working river, filled with tugs and barges and countless water taxis. Locals mix with tourists vying for rides. There are many different water taxi options, and some are more expensive than others. We took the Orange Line, I believe it was called, and rides up/down the river were a mere 40 baht per person. Why pay more? Boats stop at piers every 10-15 minutes. Definitely the cheapest way to get around, and a great view of Bangkok. We spent the entire day cruising up & down the river, hopping on & off whenever we liked. One of the best things we did in Bangkok!
Wonderful. U must take a tour in chao phraya riverNice views and it is a good refreshmentTour could be around 1-2 hours

Must do when in Bangkok . This is a must do if you are visiting Bangkok. There are several boat tours which you can purchase that act like a taxi/tour guide throughout the Chao Phraya river area. There are also some boats that will take you for free to certain destinations with in the area, but be prepared to wait a long time as several people are in line for these boats. So my suggestion is that you instead use one of the river boat tours boat taxi, they will get you to your destination much quicker & you're not so crowded by others in a boat. The river it self is not very pretty , it's super murky & dark of color too. But what matters is some of the scenery around the river, it's pretty neat. You'll get to see some of the elaborate temples, schools, hospitals & homes in the area. I do recommend that you visit during the night time that's when it's even better. You'll get the nice breeze of the river, & the city really lights up. You'll see several dinner river cruises with lots of cool flashy lights & party's happening as well. But I do recommend for everyone to try this at least once in Bangkok so you get the full experience of seeing the Chao Phraya river & know a bit more of Thailand's culture as well.

A great working river. Much cleaner without the reeds clogging this fast flowing working river. Always an enjoyable experience to spend time traveling along it to various small piers. A wonderful learning experience

I love the boat trip! (River City cruises). nice way of seeing other bits and pieces of Bangkok. If youre feeling lazy and want to just sit and relax whilst seeing the place this is the activity to do (specially during the midday hotness). this will give you nice views of Bangkok's famous temple (Wat Arun) and buildings. I love how this river is so lively and busy.

Try at least once when u r in bkk. The river system is so beautiful here and one can easily commute one place to another by boat without hassles. But be careful with the arrogant boat operators on shore who tries to push you to go on tourist boat for 40THB which is not worth. Take normal orange flag boats to commute which is cheaper and clean. In terms of river, it is not so clean but compare to the city rivers in India it is much cleaner. So enjoy your ride.

Coolest part of my Bangkok City Tour. I did a day tour and stopped to see many of the Wat's in Bangkok on a Saturday and took a boat ride on the river and through the canals. Seeing Bangkok from this perspective was pretty cool - I really enjoyed this part of the trip. IWe stopped an bought a beer from a lady on the canals. Cool thing to do and see a different side of the city

Good experience. My husband and I did a cruise tour with dinner.. It was a great experience. Please negotiate with tour operator for a upper deck table, in the front of the cruise (if its not raining). Seating in between of people is a waste. Its an international buffet, tasty.This is the second time i visited to Chao Phraya river.. first one for to see the loi krathong festival.
Interesting view of the city. We took a long tail boat for an hour and it was really interesting. It gives an unusual view of how people live along the canals, strongly recommend it.

Bangkok Holiday. A longtail boat ride on the river is a must do Bangkok experience - those things really travel - we clocked ours at over 45kmh at times - it gets pretty exciting. Do the canal tour as well - interesting insight in to "old" Bangkok - which has unfortunately almost entirely disappeared.

A feeling of a large Venise!. Discovering Bangkok by going this different transportation way. river water are not that nice, but you get to see houses from the other side, and be in the city with a different perspective. yet you will have a uniaue view of some beautiful temples. Use a speedboat that is fast enough, some are very slow, and noisy. Avoid those.

A Fabulous way to Travel. It's a wonder I only discovered the Chao Phraya River a few years ago, given the size of it, but it just wasn't a place I thought of to go and see. But since living in Bangkok, I have grown to love it. It's by far, the best and the most interesting way to travel. Not only will it get you to your destination quickly, it's cheap, dirt cheap (around 7 baht depending on where you want to go) but you will also see evidence of Bangkok's past; European buildings; canals; forts to name but a few. You will also get wonderful views of the city, both on the Bangkok side and the Thonburi side. There are boats available to hire if you want to take a tour of the backwaters and canals, or there are the normal ferry services to take you to wherever you want to go. Either way, don't take my work for it, make sure you travel along the river when you are in Bangkok, you won't be disappointed!
river cruise is ok. we did the river cruise and was ok, near the start was some fancy hotel and quite beautiful around the river but later was not much to see

Was easy to get around BKK if the places youi want to go to are near the river. Took the boat from one end to the other and was very enjoyable. A bit crowded but what isn't in BKK. Was a cheap way to get from one place to another to avoid the terrible traffic in BKK
A GOOD RIDE. withi the background the restaurants and the whole experience of the boat ride all over it is a good good rewarding experinece
fun!!. the hotel i stayed was just at the bank of the river.was fun to have a boat trip on this river.little dirty but gets you to the sights you wanto get without getting stuck in the traffic.
Take a boat on the river. Hire a boat for an hour with a driver and see the sights and the houses along the river. You can use it to get to the Grand Palace or many of the other stops along the river

King of Rivers. A visit to Bangkok will not be complete without a ride on its river boat or ferry on the Maenam Chao Phraya. This is the King of Rivers and Bangkok is the 'Venice of the East'. You can ride a tourist boat or ride with the locals on the public lines. Other options are long-tail boats, a river or dinner cruise.

River cruise. We stayed at the Ramada Plaza and had really good views of the river. Hired a long tail boat to go on a private river cruise, through the many small canals, to the small water market then back again. Saw lots of big monitor lizards sunning themselves on the banks and saw the delightful and varied water houses along the canal. The Chao Phraya river is very wide in places and the boats all seem to weave in and out of one another's way which can be a bit unnerving to start with.

Don't take the tourist boats!!. It is far more easier to take a local ferry along the Chao Praya river than travel through the crowded roads of Bangkok. It takes only about 20min to travel from Khao San to ythe south side of the river. It costs less than 30 bahts if you manage to find the boats that the locals use! One private boat owner tried to scam 2000 bahts (50€!) for a boat ride. In the end I paid 14bahts (0,4€) and saw the views as well. Efficient, clean, interesting and above all cheap! Try to use the boats with the company flags (orange for example), and remember that they may stop at different harbours!

In trip down the rover. We were staying near Khao San Road which is about 10 minutes walk from the Chao Phraya River and from there you can catch a boat to many parts of Bangkok. We wanted to go the Grand Palace which only takes about 10 minutes to get there on the boat and it is also a very cheap way to travel

Fast way to get to major attractions. We used the Chao Phraya Tourist Boat that starts the journey at the Saphan Taksin BTS Station, and boarded this hop-on hop-off kind of system to get to the Grand Palace, Wat Pho, Wat Arun (which requires a ''transfer'' to get to the other bank at 3 baht). We made the loop and had an excellent time looking at both banks and their beautiful temples and buildings. Be sure to get a schedule so you can plan the temple visist and don't need to wait too long for a boat.
A must do!. Just excellent for a 1 day pass day boat (150baht per person) or the dinner cruise at night (ranges from 700baht to 1500 baht per person)
Great river of the world. Busy river barges communters and tourist boats exciting..blue flag boat to get the feel of bustling and busy bangkok..travel in morning the best
It's a river. Not as exciting as you would imagine. The staff on the ferries were rude and grumpy. The river is filthy and the sight seeing was 3/10... not impressed
Great river of Bangkok. Great river! One should take the boat rides available to visit temples or go early in the morning to the floating market.

Alternative to taxi, reprieve from traffic. One of the reasons we stayed at the riverside was the access to the river and the ferry. Think that it is still the faster way to get around especially the main attractions for me the Big 3 which is the Wat Arun, Grand palace and the Emerald Buddha and the Wat Pho. Coming from the center of Bangkok via the BTS Sapan Taksin is the stop for the pier. There are 2 ferries, one is the local one which is around 40 baht each trip, and the tourist ferry boat which has the blue flag for 150 baht but, it's ride all you can -all day. Seems like a good deal if you are planning on going up and down the river, if you have time might want to just cruise from one stop to the end and come back just to see the sights. But, I also experienced waiting almost 30 minutes for the boat, and by this time the people started to pile up. The river is brownish but doesn't smell and considerably clean. Would also recommend the river cruises which ply at night. Beautiful way to see Thailand via river.

Best way to see tourist sites . Especially if your hotel is close to the river - a great way to get a feel for Bangkok avoiding the traffic which can be very congested in Bangkok. Find a way to get tot a river pier and then you can either get a 150baht day ticket and go up and down as much as you want
Take a boat . Take a boat for a James Bond experience in a rapid and very noisy long tail - this really will give you a Bangkok experience

Great view. Nice view and relaxing after long walks and bring your camera along. You can take ferry's which is cheaper only 14baht compare to boat 40baht for one way trip or 150baht for 1day pass, boat agents will try their luck when they see tourist so be smart.

Take a water taxi. When in Bangkok, take at least one water taxi on this river. It is good fun, ridiculously cheap, only THB14 (and you pay one price whether you travel 1 or 10 stops). Good way to get to temples, as the BTS and trains do not get to this part of the city

"Chao Phraya River by night: an absolute must". Loy Nava is the only luxury and romantic rice barge dinner cruise operating twice around sun-set time (18.00-20.00h and 20.10-22.10h from/to nearby Royal Orchard Sheraton Hotel) on the mighty Chao Phraya River. Enjoy delicious food from around Thailand while gliding along the historical landmarks of the Kings of the City of Angels. An absolute must for an unforgettable, romantic candle light dinner while in Bangkok.During daytime there are various water taxis and tours available: they mostly start/end at the BTS Skytrain station "Saphan Taksin" at reasonable rates. An easy way to reach the up-river Grand Palace is the express boat from Saphan Taksin BTS Station - cruise along Wat Pho, Wat Arun, flower market and many other interesting highlights.......Chao Phray river is the main artery and heartbeat of Bangkok.A luxury rice barge journey into Thai culture and the Thai heart. Five star dining, traditional culture and touring, on the only original antique teakwood rice barge on the river in Bangkok. Experience first-class Thai hospitality and delicious food from around Thailand in the comfort and tranquility of this luxury, open-air cruise.
Lifeline. I loved this river as i stayed close by. Loved using the ferry service. Felt lively and beautiful. Definitely worth a boat ride up and down. Also beats traffic in bangkok.

Good way to get around.. We were staying in the Dusit area and there was a boat pier a short distance away. It is a good way to get around and very cheap, for 14 baht you can go most distances. I would suggest avoiding the "hop on hop off" tourist boats which have a ticket cost of 150 baht - there can be huge queues to get on, and if you do the math, you are better off taking the ordinary boats for 14 baht par journey, as there is a limit to what you can fit into a day when taking into account the time spent at attractions.

Interesting. We took a long tail boat tour (1hr) around the canals. We got to see some beautiful temples and schools and a compete new level of living for those families on the canal. The river is filled with catfish and big water lizards! Not exactly sure what they are called but these alone are pretty cool to see.

Avoid the traffic in BANGKOK. Whatever form of road transport you use in Thailand you can be sure to get snarled up in traffic at any time. Of the day, using the river to get to your sightseeing destination is far better, there are various types of boats with varying prices, the touristy boats do cost more but we used the river bus, generally they are the noisy diesel boats with a orange flag on the back, they are fast and gets you to your sightseeing destination pier which are dotted all along the river bank.The river itself is a very busy waterway, there is always something interesting going on, there are many places to sit and watch the daily goings on and at night it's a lovely place to be just watching the world go by, there are party boats and restaurant boats at night they are all brightly. coloured and some have music.

best for grand palace trip. This is a boat taxi in bangkok..The best mode for travellin to Grand palace WatPho and Wat Arun..They have diffrent type of boat, like buses and trains; They have express , super express , settle n allThe boat are diffrenciated by flags.. The ornage flag is cheap and fast too.. den thy are others which wil not stop in many places but is costly too..The boat charges are same mostly for any station... Ornage flag costs 42 baht for any station u climb to to get down...

The giant river that flows through Bangkok. This is a gigantic river that cuts through the middle of Bangkok. It's the cleanest and best smelling of all of the rivers in Bangkok, too. There are a lot of boat tours and boat taxis on this river. The boat taxis are very reasonably priced, and the boat tours range from affordable, to intensely deluxe. There are also a lot of very nice restaurants with piers stretching onto this river. And nice temples and malls.
Amazing river cruise . This river is one the most popular and important river .We went for a cruise and it was amazing. The view of the city is very different from the river .

River Views and Mental Relaxation. When in Khao San, you can walk towards the Chao Phraya river and just get away from all the hustle and bustle. Perfect for a spot to meditate, exercise or simply relax and watch as the boats cruise the river.

Very interesting way to discvover Bangkok. Visiting the Chao Phraya River in Bangkok is a very unique way to discover some part of the city and the busy live along the river is very interesting.It is very convenient to use the Tourist Boats leaving from Sathorn Pier near Saphan Taksin BTS Station, just a short walk from there to walk to the ticket Counter, don't forget to ask for the River Map.There are several stops along the river and you can visit some very interesting sights such as The Grand Palace, Wat Arun and Wat Pho Temple and Chinatown. Also be aware of the walking distance fro the Pier to the sights.And on the way back it is possible to stop at the pier of some of the Luxury Hotels for a romantic Sundowner on the riverside terrace.There is also a complimentary boat service in the evening from the Sathorn Pier to the Asiatique, The Riverfront with a wide selection of Restaurants and Bars to choose from.Further there are River Dinner Cruises departing from the River City Pier, they offer romantic Buffet Dinner cruises with Entertainment and it is very interesting to see the various sights on the river beautifully illuminated.Also some of the Luxury Hotels on the River offer complimentary Boat transport across the river for they Guests and costumers who would like to use the Food and beverage facilities.

A great way to get around. We never really got how the boats worked and wished we looked into it more before staying in Bangkok as it seemed to be the way of travel. We were staying on the river with a view of the river and it was amazing just watching the amount of activity along the river day and night and all the dinner cruises, barges, tourist boats, fisherman ferries etc. We used a free ferry to go to Asitique Riverside and this was a fantastic service and Asiatique was a great place with loads of nice restaurants, bars, carnival type things. A great way to spend the evening.

The life blood of the city. The river forms in the central part of Bangkok and no trip to the city is complete without a trip on it.We never use the tourist boats which are three times the price of the local ferries. Now, easy to use friendly. They also hold the great view of the river and the city itself. With the traffic being as bad as it is in Bangkok is a really good option to get around too. Far easier than the taxis or tuktuks just jump on a ferry and then walk to your destination. It is quite majestic at night and wherever you're staying try to get there at least once.

Sky Scrapers, Temples, Palace, Small houses, Market, and many more thing can be seen along the river.. This is one of the most Vibrant area of Bangkok. you can see i simple house hat made from wood, Complex-Detail architecture like Palace or Temple, Sky Scraper, Market.... so "Vibrant". To travel by this river also cheap. And the best part is NO TRAFFIC JAM like roads in Bangkok.

Romantic Boat Cruise. This was a decent place to go on a dinner cruise with someone special if you like the romantic scenery in the night. Buffet was decent and the view is pretty with the lit temples.

Must go for a ride.. So much is along this river that it is inevitable you will cross it. The gondolas by the hotels are great but take one down the river and enjoy the small canals and see the real life. Having a guide is safer as the routes can be quite tight in areas.

The main river of BKK. Enjoyed the river cruise from downstream to upstream. Lots of tourists like me, be prepared to be patient. Also a cheap way to get to the Grand Palace n the surrounding temples.

Take the boats for a unique experience of Bangkok. We finally figured out how to use the boats on the Chao Phraya to get around town and boy was it a blast! I highly recommend taking the boats over tuk-tuks as it is such a fun experience, and quite cheap. We did not take the tourist boats, so I cannot comment on those, but the regular boats were so much fun. A great way to get from Khao San to many of the temples and the Grand Palace.One of our favorite boat rides was coming back from Jim Thompson's house (awesome btw) on the small canals. It won't take you all the way back to Khao San, but it will get you pretty close, and the experience is well worth it.

Many activities around it. Rating a whole river is tough. There are many activities around the river. You can visit Asitique Riverside. A nice pleasant place that will remind you of a small European town where you can have a drink or two by the river. You can also take a river cruise which i think is a bit overrated. Finally the river is also an alternate and practical traveling option in the usually heavy traffic laden Bangkok.

Interesting boat ride, take like a local!. Do take note which direction the boat is heading, a wrong direction will cause up to a good 30mins wait for the next 1 heading up. And loads of tourist from Mainland China squeezing onto the small floating platform, aint doing any good with the fast speed boats creating waves.It is another alternative route to visit the temples, such as , Temple of Dawn, Temple of the Emerald Buddha, Grand Palace and Wat Pho.

Rice barge tour. We did a Rice Barge and canal tour and enjoyed the experience to see. The guide explained everything along the way and we got to see a canal and how Thai people live alongside the River. Unlimited fruits and soft drinks plus local whisky were provided.

Took the Chao Phraya Tourist Boat up and down the River. We bought the tourist hop on/hop off ticket which might not have been worth it since it comes so rarely that it's not a convenient hop on or hop off. However, it was great to see the city from the water and although you could barely hear the tour operator, the guidebook showed what you were looking at.

Bangkok in an Hour. Friends were in transit in Bangkok for twelve hours and asked to meet up for a meal. They had never previously been to Bangkok and I wanted them to have a complete experience. No better way than by river boat on the Chao Praya in the early evening. The congestion on the boat with office workers and monks was iconic while in the background is the changing shape of Bangkok from ancient city to modern titan. We disembarked at Ta Tien and headed for our restaurant opposite the Temple of the Dawn. My friends were enchanted.

Boat rides on the smaller boats can get choppy. A great way to see another part of the city,,many landmarks with diferent perspective from the river .The palace and many wats.this trip is the best at dusk when everything is alight a great expieience.
Cruise in Bangkok river.... Each time when I go to Bangkok, I try to find time to move in Chao Phraya River.Between Kaosan and China Town it ´s the Best way to use...Fun ,quick, cheap....
A must do to get a feel of real Bangkok. We really enjoyed seeing what real life is like in Bangkok and learning about the River and its waterways.

Place for relax and river view. Avani Riverside Lobby on 11 Fl. Stunning view. You can see Chao Phraya River , Krungthep Bridge, Samre Church, Asiatique Riverfront, etc. Good view to watch Thai living with the river.

Day trip.. Very busy waterway. From early morning to late evening it never stops. From a leisurely day cruise to an evening dinner cruise. A mode of transport for people to a way of transporting goods. Always moving. And a spectacular view of it from our rooms at The Royal Orchid Sheraton.

Cheap must do attraction in Bangkok. Although not a 'real' attraction, it is obviously a very cheap and effective way to take one of the Phraya River boats to travel to one of the may sightseeing points along the river.

Can take short or long trips on all types of boats. I took a few Chao River rides in different types of boats. You can take a short ride or take a long ride. I believe you can ride from Ayutthaya to Bangkok in a boat if you wanted to. The small boats can be a bit scary considering the size of the river and how congested it can get. I've never seen a river as busy as this one. Take a few small trip and then you can take the Ayutthaya to Bangkok trip at a later date. It's not a must do but certainly take a small trip even if it's just to the other side of the river.
Loved our tour on the Chao Phraya river on the long boats. Loved our tour on the long boats down the river seeing where people live and work. A must if you visit Bangkok.
Sea Restaurant. Great place to be specially at night. Buffet dinner in boat with live music. You can choose what cuisine you would like to have in buffet and enjoy.

The very heart of Bangkok. The Chao Phraya provides access to down town Bangkok. Hop off the Sky Train BTS at Saphan Tachsin and go on the boat. At 15 Baht you can travel all the way up to see China Town, Grand Pallace and Wat Arun before you might see the tourist kitsch at Khao San Road.The river has tidal activity flowing up and down stream, sometimes it is very dirty and stinks. Not all the huts along the river are bling-bling, but that's Bangkok life ...
Busy. Busy river. Fun to ride on. Have tried both the tourist boat and the more local. It's also great to see that it's not only for tourists but that locals actually work here.
River Cruise. Was very relaxing and enjoyable.people are very friendly and helpful..would recommend the cruise and food
Interesting. Interesting boat ride with views of how locals live. Saw water monitor. One gets the feeling the river is slowly losing its battle against humanity and struggling with pollution

" Romantic chic definitely awesome Chao praya". this place must be one of the most romantic places to be in Bangkok ,the place itself is superb it feels fresh by water and there is heaps of history in the area from top notch old buildings to Five start Hotels this place is for all weather you single couple family or business man.Plenty of stip along the way Flower market , Grand Palace, China town , Little India and much more and all thai beautiful people living in Bangkok
Beautiful river. This river seems very busy plenty of boats to get you about. There is also lots of pokestops here! Haha. The river city shopping centre is here and also goes along to Asiatique.
River Cruise . All inclusive river cruise was ideal. Tan for a few on the panoramic deck then relax in AC interiors perfect for a steaming summer day.
Get on the board and go go go. Yes, Bangkok by water is another great venue to travel. Why go on land, but you can see the sights afloat and see ow life is daily.

The heart of Bangkok historical and cultural side. The most beautiful and interesting side of Bangkok. Traditional, typical, authentical, full of history and culture.. Sukhumvit looks another planet sometimes. The riverside is the charm of Bangkok and a mustsee in Thailand.

Great tour but dirty river. The tours itself are a great way of exploring the city and surrounding areas by boat. The scenery is beautiful and there is many good things to see. We stopped at a lock and stayed there for a couple of minutes waiting for it to open so we could go trough. The smell was terrible.Trash all around us, i have never seen so muchhouse hold trash float around in one place. It took us about 30 minutes to get the bad smell out of our nose. Really a big damper on a great trip.
Nice trip on the river. We took a boat to go from the north of tje city to the Wat Pho...ot was nice and pittoresque with all the houses on pillars. The boat is fast and cheap.

Simple and all the same. In my opinion, its just all the same in the picture. When you go to reclining temple its all there already. Youll got your profile pictures all the way. Thats what my opinion.

If you have some free time. You can take several types of boat tours and have interesting views of Bangkok. One of these tours would be travelling along the reiver and see the general Bangkok sky line and some interesting buildings. Another possible tours is in the side channels of the river, on the Thonburi side, with a stop for a snake show. And there are many more.You can take these tours from several piers. One of them is near the King's palace. Makes it very convenient to combine

Private longboat trip. We found two reasonable options to explore the Chao Phraya.From Sathorn pier, we took a 1hr private longboat trip. Got to see so much more than tourist stuff, real life happening by the canals that connect to Chao Phraya. Contrasts of gold temples and tiny house shacks. Children playing, boys cutting hair & fishing.Make sure to haggle hard for a better price than they first suggest. We ended up accepting 1200baht for 2 people. A much cheaper alternative would be the Orange Flag ferry takes you to each temple stop at 14 baht per ride. Avoid around 9am & 5pm - it's not the most comfortable at any time though. There is also a Tourist express boat at 190 baht all day ticket. Make sure to wear mosquito repellant by the water.
Best way to travel the city . We love using the river to get around the city. Easy and best way to see city . Great views.Lots of stops, very fast and very cheap.

Lazy aftrenoon relaxed trip. Ask to be dropped in RIVER CITY MALL by any local Taxi ( remember taxis in BKK are cheaper than TUK TUK). Reach out to the reception help desk and they will locate the cruise operator and you can buy the tkts. I thinks its 1000 Bhats PP and it absolutely worth it. So relaxing and unwinding. It cud take up to 3 hours and you will be served Thai snacks , fruits , etc etc. Don't miss it. So go ahead n enjoy.PS : Better pre book.

The way to get around Bangkok!. The hop on and off blue flag tourist boats are the way to get around in Bangkol. The cool breezes are welcome in the hot weather, there is a cover if it is raining, and best of all, no traffic jams!!
