The river is the heart of the city . Our family of 4 did the river and khlongs tour our first day in the city. Some of the tours can be a bit pricey but worth it. Our tour lasted roughly an hour and docked near the Grand Temple complex. Unfortunately we arrived too late in the day to visit the complex that day. Everyone enjoyed the tour. As expected we were taken to an area meant to be a floating market where we were encouraged to buy the usual trinkets and knick knacks. We politely declined and continued our tour. We also had the good fortune of spending time at one of the many restaurants located on the river one night. The food and the service were exceptional. The river is a very different place at night compared to the hustle and bustle of the day. If you are in the city for any length of time you must take advantage of the river.
Fabulous City views. Great way to travel around Bangkok. 14THB per trip. A little hectic but easy to hop on and off! Lovely views by day and night.

feel good. Thank you for give me energy back after tried for long time just seating beside and watching to you, i will back to you again soon.
thank and miss

Chao Phraya is a historic gateway. The Chao Phraya is a historic gateway to ancient Siam...leading to Ayutthaya, the former capital of Phra Nakhon Si Ayutthaya province in Thailand founded in 1351 ...river travel by river taxi or private hire is a great way to escape crowds . Go to Saphan Taksin BTS stop....tours are sold upstairs, but about half the price if you go to hawkers by the river taxis...tell them to take you to Wat Arun just upriver...best temple in Thailand..then down canals...stop somewhere to eat...can return you to Saphan Taksin or drop you at Grand Palace....tour there and take taxi to National Stadium BTS to get home...
River cruise. We did the evening river cruise on chao phraya river, around the start we could see lots of luxury hotels and later we saw temples by the side of the river, have ok food too

Bustling transport route. The river is large, and doesn't look too clean, but there are fish swimming about in it. There is always busy traffic on the river with barges, ferries, long tail boats, and restaurant and entertainment vessels everywhere. It was fun just to get on a commuter ferry and take the ride upstream to the end. Very cheap, and lots to see.You could use the river transport to access many places of interest including restaurants, shopping centres, historic places, and just local areas.

get a long tail boat about 300bt an hour great fun. Go by MRT to takshin see the hawkers and off you Go! Visit the canals see bangkok in the raw ,buy some tat from an old lady and look at the Riverside life around you.

Water has strong current. We took a private boat and went to this place where you have to pass through the canals and see the different houses and buildings along the river. It was not a dry experience at all but it was not a bad experience all in all.

Another side of Bangkok. When you're tired of the Bangkok streets, get the one day pass at the Saphan Taksin pier (accessible by BTS - Silom line) and for as little as THB 120 hop on and off going up and down the river sightseeing as per the booklet you get together with your ticket. End your trip with the visit to Asiatique for food and souvenirs.
Longtail Boat. Had a great time being on the boat and seeing the every day life of the Thai people going about their daily life

Just bobbing around'. We love this river and could sit and watch river life all day! It's full of tourist boats and the largest barges you have ever seem. They even have there house and dogs on them. Great cheap way to get around and fast compared to the city where you are lightly to sit in traffic for hours!!Great views of things to go and explore. Use this river, it's a great way to get around.
The river of Kings. Such a peaceful place, but a busy working river. Enjoyed watching the workers and the fisherman, but enjoyed the river cruises too.

Tourist Boat!. The Tourist boat that transfers up and down the river was great, 150 Baht for and all day unlimited ticket meant I saw quite a lot of stuff on the river. It made a nice change travelling the river instead of dealing with the heavy traffic of central Bangkok. All in all a pleasant and convenient way of getting around!

Boat trip essential. My nephew was in Bangkok so a trip to the Chao Praya was essential. It is easy to visit and do a boat trip after main temples and Grand Palace.River is a lot cleaner than a couple of years back and weeds cleaned up.Shop around for best price longtail trip.... few scam artists around working with tuk tuk drivers.Have fun exploring the klongs!

Clean river with good water transport. I traveled from Nonthaburi to Grand Palace. It was a nice experience. The boat is comfortable and on time. It also not so expensive. As a result, I travele again from Nonthaburi to Asiatique on the sunset. It was really beautiful sunset, especially when we passed a big temple (Wat Arum, I guest).

The colourful heartbeat of Bangkok . I would highly recommend travelling on the Chao Phraya by boat. You can get a long tail or alternatively just jump on the ferry service. The river itself is amazing as it is buzzing with traffic, from big long barges to beautifully coloured long tail boats. The greenery from the almost island like collections of greenery that float along the water also adds another colourful dimension. All of this set against the high rise of the city makes for a wonderful ride.

Best way to explore.. This is my fourth visit to Bangkok and never missed opportunity to travel by water taxi on Chao Phraya. During my earlier I explored the wonderful and aesthetically designed temples at the time of dawn and again at sunset. This time I walked to Rachawongse pier near to my hotel in China Town. It's better to board the water taxi that operates as public transport instead of tourist taxi. Its just 14 Baht per person one side and after reaching the last stop I got into return trip to River City pier paying 14 Baht again. By this journey one will get opportunity to mingle with cross section of Thai people including students,working people,young and old and also travellers from around the world. I advise every traveller to Bangkok to take this trip leisurely before venturing into routine tourist destinations.

Convenient and inexpensive way to get a pulse of the city. You have to travel on the Chao Phraya River to get a sense of the pulse of the city. You see a city of contrast: modern high-rises next to century-old houses on stilts; modern yachts next to old "Long Tail" boats; some pollution in the water but a river full of life. It is a convenient and inexpensive way to see the city. Many major tourist attractions line the river. Many river front hotels also operate their own boat. At the major ferry pier you can also hire a boat to tour inside branches of the river, where you will see the vivid contrast.
Go by local ferry. There are many options provided -the best i would say is the local ferry which runs every 15 mins or so.

Impressive. We had mixed feelings about the river, you have to see it but it's nothing special. Dirty but also full of fish. A word to the wise: becareful with your change upon entry, you might get swindeled by the old ladies in the ticket booths.

Longtail boat. The river seems like the heart of Bangkok. It is a convenient way to travel around the sightseeing highlights. We rented a longtail boat to bring us to the smaller floating markets and through the khlongs. Whole family loved it. Kids loved it because it just goed fast :)

Great transportation . Cruising the river is a great way to see the river life. You can get on and off along the way. The board are frequent cheap and clean. Plus air con. Or stand out the back to take in the sights

Good experience. The river is very busy (no thanks to tourists like us) and appears to be a lifeline for Bangkok. It is good for cruises and daily commutes from one side of Bangkok to the other - at very good rates if using public boats. Also useful for avoiding city traffic.

River of Kings. The river winds through the city of Bangkok. Suggest you take an evening cruise; it's cooler and the landmarks along both sides of the river are lit up against the night sky. You can also take one of the river taxis plying the river. Or, you can take a day tour to Ayudhya, the ancient capital of Thailand, go up by bus, and take the cruise down from there, on the Chao Phraya River in the late afternoon.

Brilliant way to travel. Get on a river boat and you achieve two things immediately; it's cooler and you avoid the unbelievable traffic. These boats are cheap and reliable and have you the length and breadth of the city in minutes but remember, they stop at 8pm

River cruise. There are many river cruises available on the Chao Praya river. I chose the 1200 baht cruise rather than the candlelit cruise Canary Travel have on offer because I was on my own and thought the romantic cruise might not be suitable for a single person. I booked online and went to River City pier before the appointed time of 19.30. No problems at all. Great photo opportunities en route especially Wat Arun and Wat Po and Rama 8 bridge.Finished about 10pm and went to Silom for a drink or two at the Irish bar. Great night.

Really nice views. There are plenty of expensive hotels from which you can see the river views, but I would recommend to go to the rooftop bar and restaurant of River view guesthouse. The prices were the same as any restaurant, it was really nice and we could have some rest in the sofas. The neighbourhood is quite interesting also to see, full of mechanics and lots of motors and chains. It was a nice and different experience.

Dirty River. I went out with craze to see Chao Phraya River. But it turns out to be very dirty river. Other than its means of transportation, I found up keep of river much wanted. I travelled on ferry boats and that was good experience for a change.

Cheap way to move around. Get the Yellow and Orange flags boats. It cost only 14 baths per trip and you can go almost to anywhere along the river with these boats.There are nice markets, malls and night markets than you can reach by river boat. Learn about hte stops and avoid traffic jams!

Important artery. The river performs an important role in the movement of Bangkok's residents and visitors.A city choking in traffic, this water artery flows well and gives a different view while travelling along it. A great way to get to a few tourist spots along it.
Dinner Cruise. Nice buffet dinner and music with the Grand Pearl Cruise on Chao Phraya River. We had a good time and enjoyed the sightseeing along both sides of the river.

The reason we visit Bankok!. Well.......there are other reasons too, but the river is a standout. To really experience it you need to stay at one of the many hotels along the river or, at least spend time in a bar or restaurant on a higher floor. We love the Royal Orchid Sheraton...have a look at some of the TripAdvisor reviews.What you see is the life blood of the city....the endless procession of boats going about their daily business. From the numerous ferries to hotel boats, work boats & of course the zippy little longboats with unmuffled car engines hanging off the stern. There's the slow progress of the giant barge trains - often more than four barges towed by what appears to be a tiny tug sometimes with a "tail-end Charlie" tug to help control direction.And of course this is just what you see in one view. For a few baht, take a ride in the local ferry to the end of the line. You see life in Bangkok as you won't from anywhere else....the markets, temples, residences & of course, people going about their everyday life. You could take a cruise in a tour-boat or a ride in a longboat if you don't mind getting splashed. Ther are also dinner cruises at night which show the river in a very different light.Yes, for me the Chao Phraya river is Bangkok.
The best transportation. I think its the best kind of transportation in bangkok. No traffic, no stairs, youncan see all the sight seeing in bangkok with a reasonable price.

Great river. Every great city has a great river. This is no exception. But it's still a 'working river' with more and more deliveries and comings and goings, largely because the roads are impossible. Ignore the long-tailed tourist boats and see it for the artery it truly is.
Charm of Chao Phraya River. At the night time, it was so pretty and charming along the river. You can take a boat along the way to many places

Worth boating across, don't swim!. This is the main river of Bangkok for all the boat, barge, and tourist boat traffic. It's good to see (along with all the canals) how it is important to the life of so many parts of the city.
Busy thoroughfare. The river is busy and travelling on it in a motorised longboat is an interesting experience. I also used the ferry to get around and they can get really packed.

The one day tourist river pass is a must when in Bangkok. There is no better way to cover the most important places in Bangkok, take a one day tourist pass and start early. Covering the length of Chao Phraya is a must do!

Good overview of the city. Much better and faster than a taxi. You get a wonderful view of the skyline of Bangkok. You have large water taxy boats. When you're more than five a private boat is cheaper, faster and a lot more fun.

Chai phraya river . Good place to visit ,the public boats you will find near Sheraton hotel . It cost you approx 50 bts they will take you till the end of river and than you had to buy tickets for return journey

Very god place to visit for a while and relaxing. chao praya river area is a comfortable area for temporary shelter . a beautiful place in the afternoon to enjoy the view wat po . a place that can make the mind calm and relaxed

A good place in Bangkok. It is a very good place to spent night on the river cruises in the Chao phraya river.A numerous cruises float on Chao phraya river each day. I saw a numerous building glowing with lights just like jewels on both sides of the river . The river flows between the city due to which I could enjoy the beautiful citylights on both the sides of the river. Eating tasteful Thailand dishes and seeing those sceneries and in fact the whole city of Bangkok are not forgettable for me . It is a nice place to visit and if you don't go to the river cruise and just stand along the dock , then going there is a waste of time and is a mere foolishness. The place from where the cruises flag off , has a beautiful shopping complex as well. Ultimately it is an another important tourist spot in tour of Thailand . It is a appropriate place to visit for all age group

Noisy and hyper touristic. We took several times the public boat and it was funny and original but it's crowded, noisy and not very clean. Nevertheless, we are in Thailand next there an authentic aspect even if most of people are not Thai on these boat. Take it one time for the fun!! (40 THB one way)

it's okay . we had one off the tour boat with the Guid it's nothing too spical but it's nice to do it you see variety off building and you get off if want you it's cheap to do it ,,we just had same time to kill we got off near the place it is the market look around bit had same thing too eat then too the boat to other side to one I off the temple
Amazing and enjoy. My family especially my children very excited and felt glad to climb aboard the chaopraya river crossing time of till

Great way to see the 'Venice of the East' as Bangkok still has many canals. Fun way to see Bangkok which is the 'Venice of the East' with many canals. There are many docks where you can hire a boat for a trip on the river and canals. You can just hire a set tour or request particular destinations. Lots of houses, temples and businesses are still have the canal as their front door. Really cool views. Some temples sell bread to feed the fish in the canal. There are occasional vendors in boats that sell food or goods. The long-tail boats can be difficult to get in and out of so be careful.

Amazing. Use the local boats. The river is the lifeline of Bangkok. The boat route connects various temples, neighbourhoods etc. So travelling through the boat, at least once, will be a good idea.The private tour boats are quite expensive. You can as an alternative take the local boats. The schedule is mentioned at the various boat boarding points. Hence you might need to wait but the price is unbeatable.

Another jaw dropping Bangkok experience . Went up the river to visit the Reclining Budha temple. Cheap well organised and a great experience seeing all the different boats darting around the river. A fantastic experience to see another aspect of this great city.

Good view for photo hunting. If you are backpackers and photo-hunter, you should go to this place. Using chao praya express arround 15 THB, you can go along the river (just one way). The city light at night was beautiful. You can go there while visiting asiatique. Be carefull for your camera, because sometimes the river water is splashing into the boat.

Overpriced tour. We definitely wanted to make a tour on the river, so we rented a private boat at 500 baht per person. The boatman showed us some interesting places, but we still thought the tour was overpriced.

Heritage of bangkok. This liver is not so clear for sure. However I don't know why I feel very long history from here. To know all about culture, my recommendation is take a boat tour. It's very easy and simple way to know all about culture.
Excellent private boat rides. Great to see how some of the peoplenof Bangkok live. A real eye opener and makes you appreciate what you have

Dimply beautiful . We stayed right facing Chao phraya river...the beautiful river changes mood in the early morning and nite time...we love to take the shuttle boat day in day out just to enjoy the scenery and colourful lighting during nite rides.

It’s a must to visit the attractions. The major temples, neighborhoods, and tourist attractions are accessible via the Chao Phraya River so not only is it a must just for the experience, it’s a must just to get to the temples. Look around for deals because the tourist boat down the river is essentially 10 times more expensive than the local boat. Ride the tourist boat once and then get your bearings and then happy travels to you.

All lit up at night! . We were really tight on time in Bangkok but still wanted to fit a river cruise in. We did the Banyan tree river cruise on an old converted rice barge. This was great for couples looking for a romantic evening on the river. It was more traditional and upmarket than the other dinner cruises and the food was amazingly good. We were staying at the metropolitan hotel next to the banyan tree hotel so we got the shuttle provided by Banyan tree to the boat for a small charge. A really lovely and memorable evening, highly recommended.

The Ride Through Bangkok. Well, this is not the most scenic river ride. This is not also surrounded by the serene nature. But, believe me, if you have not tried this one, you have not felt the warmth of Bangkok.Connecting all the important and tourist spots, this is the fastest, safest and most enduring trip. Getting down at Saphan Tasken - taking the Exit 2 to the Express Boatway opens up the world of Wats and other extensive tourist locations of the city. You can visit the Flower Market, the Grand Palace, The Wat Pho, The Wat Arun and a lot others in the various stops.It is very tourist friendly. No need to worry for the foreigners. Also, there are special tourist boats for more touristy attitude. And the Asiatique Riverside Night Market is also a must visit through the river way. It is exotic and uniquely beautiful.

cheapest mode of transport to visit grand palace.. This is one of the cheapest and fastest mode of transport if you are using BTS. If you are using BTS you have to get down at Sapan Taksin and then just get down the BTS and ctach the Boat to Wat Arun or Grand palace.

Great experience. Amazing. The buffet dinner was delicious with lot of seafood. The show on board was so presented that every nationality could hear /dance on a music of his country. Great experience.

See Thailand from the river. Great experience to visit the temples from the river viewpoint. Nice to see everything and especially where people live along the river and the government buildings and palace.

great attraction in Bangkok. this is great place to have boat ride -especially if you want to go to Wat Pho from the city center - boat tram is big (like a bus) and it is cheap (14 BAT per person). Also from the river you may see Temple of Dawn, which looks nice especially from the river. The whole trip is also a bit refreshing, as usual by the river.

Best way to get around in Bangkok. Take the river taxis up and down the Chao Phrya river - not only are they a way of avoiding Bangkok's terrible traffic, but they act as a sightseeing tour as well. The river taxis also link up with the sky train at Saphan Taskin, as well as having stops at main attractions, including temples, markets and Ko San road.

A big asian river. Interesting to see and have experience on the boat.
A good and different view of BangKok city, from the river water.
It is better to take a normal boat, like public transportation, not a touristic one.

The Long River. Travelling by the Chao Phraya River was a great experience. The cost is also very low (40 baht for one side). But dont forget you can go for a One Day Pass (150 Baht) where in you get an option of getting down at all the locations for shopping, etc.

Chao Phraya River Bus. I used the river bus to get to the Wat Pho temple and it was a very interesting experience. A bit like The Grand Canal in Venice but slightly more chaotic. It is a good way to see the city from a different point of view and also there are no traffic jambs, well most of the time!

Refreshing way to getto places near the Chao Phraya River. Take BTS to Saphan Taksin, and walk to the pier. Get a THB 40 ticket which will get you to the end station of the boat. If you want, you can take the same boat back to the starting point, and buy your ticket on the boat. Of course, you can get off at one of the several stops to visit a temple complex, or get to Koa San road. It beats being stuck in a taxi for hours. I have done it several times with visitors, and they were all enthousiastic.

The heart of Bangkok Chao Phrya River.. The River is one of the main of transportation in addition to import or export by shipping its still across river between Thornburi and Phranakorn not just these things long travel by river has prepared since center of Bangkok to another province such as Nornthaburi or Ayuuthaya. The River has join with Thai gulf by bored with Sumutsakorn province that is economic and shipping by sea city.

River cruises. See the river either by day or night. There are dinner cruises and daytime sightseeing tours. You can book through your hotel and will be picked up and delivered back. The basic cruise is not expensive....but if you want a good dining experience and traditional Thai music expect to pay appropriately. I really like the evening cruises. The various temple complexes and riverside restaurants are very well lit and look their best when seen from the river. The river itself is full of other craft, from long-tailed passenger boats to rice barges! Wherever your eyes wander you will see something that says this is Thailand and we have much to offer! Enjoy the experience. Pat, Brisbane, Australia.
Relaxing on the river.. Enjoyed being on the river taking the boat to the shopping areas along the river both day and night. Plenty of enjoyment for the entire family.
Busy waterway. The Chao Phraya River is a busy waterway with access to lots of attractions and hotels by ferry across or up or down the river. It also has lots of working barges coming and going.

Choose the public service and avoid toursit rip offs. You need to have the confidence to walk past all the tourist companies and just go on the stopping ferry with a day ticket of 180Baht. The river is vital to Bangkok life so going slowly and stopping off is really interesting.
Local boat the real one. LocalTake the local transportboat cost 40 bath. Look for it. You don,t have to pay more.Where to found. Mostly were it is busy. There is a infodesk.

Good vibes on the river of kings.. Live work play and stay on the river of Kings ( Chaophraya river ).
Perfect place for anyone with many restaurants and hotela along the river.

A poor tour. We had to paid around 1800 baht for the tour and totally not worth it. The river dirty and smelly, besides you are gonna be mob by the river traders, Probably the government could make an effort to beautify the river because its a nice place but with no maintenance.

This river has been cleaned up over the years and its a delight to see !!!. Yes, its so clean now that our guide, Kong, gave us bread to feed the catfish that came to us in a feeding frenzy. It's like no place you've ever seen before. You pass houses on bamboo stilts, wealthy homes made of teak, the Temple of Dawn, and many famous BKK landmarks. I even saw the elegant Mandarin Oriental Hotel where my favorite British author, W. Somerset Maugham, stayed in 1923, (for those who want to splurge, you can even stay at the Somerset Maugham suite if you like). We also passed the impressive gold domed hotel used in the movie, "Hangover II" which was filmed in Bkk. So don't miss it. You won't be disappointed !!!

it should have more signs and the guides. the tourists can be confused the stations, the boats and destinations because lack of the signs, clear guides....watching two beautiful waterfronts is interesting

A life force and fun. Brown and murky. Fast flowing. Occasionally floods. Took a boat crossing to see some sites but have previously gone on an interesting boat trip to visit riverside industries, crafts and life on the river generally. River taxi are also a good way to get around the city if you are game.

Must experience when in Bangkok. sumptuous Indian Food, live entertainment, was surprised to hear Thai lady singing Bollywood and local songs, she even sang Tamil & Telugu Songs...had a great time with family & friends...

Average place to visit.... Chao river is so big. And it covers many temple and sightseeing place. But just it. You should not be big wishes. There is boat tours that you can easily join them and look around along river. CheersErnur

A boat ride to Asiatique. Our group of six were staying in one of the serviced apartment in Sukhumvit area. We took the BTS skytrain to Siam station and changed line to Saphan Taksin. Get off from station Exit 2. From there heads towards the pier for a free ride to Asiatique. Operating time is 5pm to 12pm. Is a breeze riding along the river. Get to see different things in the evening and by night fall buildings and hotels with lights on.

Venice of Asia. The Thai Government see to it that the river stays clean. Lots of locals fish on the sides and lots of good hotels. Apparently, My partner and I was staying in hotel beside the river. Its a good base to start your travel if you want to see the Old Bangkok and the temples. You will see the authentic Thai life.

Madness. Get a private boat. We paid about 35 quid but I'm sure you could get it for half that. We wanted to go and be a certain time so it was fine with us. Go through the side lanes rather than the main river and expect to get some river traders mob you. They do take No for an answer but to be honest they live off our trade and for the sake of a quid or two.. well we bought some wooden camel keyrings lolFeed the catfish so take a loaf of bread. .. only one word of warning just after we had we saw a 12 foot fresh water crocodile and a massive snake (10 foot plus) so keep the bots out of the water you want to keep.

Would be lovely if it was clean. Having taken numerous Klhong tours and boat rides, being on the water is a new way to see Bangkok. You see small canals and homes juxtapose with upcoming skyscrapers as Bangkok old and new intertwine. However the water is very polluted and there is alot of garbage in the canals floating around. Of course BKK is a large metropolis but would be nice for the environment, aesthetic, and health of the inhabitants if there was more effort to clean it up.

It is dirty but interesting. The river is very dirty, you wonder why the government still allows all these polluting long tail boats to operate. The water is murky, but it's still very nice to get on a boat and cruise around as it offers some great sightseeing.

River trip. Easy to work out ,no need for expensive pre booked tours just hop on a water taxi,on some the conductor gives you info over the speaker system any way, a lot quicker than by road if you're destination has a nearby stop

It's a river.... Like any major city there are boats going all over the place. It has trash floating everywhere and depending on the day, can really stink. If you can negotiate for a long tail boat ride, it's worth the trip to see the side canals. Don't settle for the price they say or advertise, there is wiggle room with all the prices and ask for extra time at the floating market if you go for the same price.

A must for anyone in Bangkok. So often people stay in the Sukhumvit area without ever venturing down to the heart of Bangkok where the city began-The Chao Phrya River. Take the BTS to Taksin station, get off and board a boat for an upriver ride for $.50 . one of the top attractions you'll experience
great fun. Had a great trip along the river with some fantastic views along the way, perfect way to travel around Bangkok, no traffic to worry about here.

The focal point of Bangkok. To understand Bangkoks origins you should spend at least some time near the river, at least get a water bus a few stops along it, better still hire a long tail boat and go for a blast around the old town...

Staying along the River is Perfect. From our hotel room we enjoyed lovely views of the river. There were boats of every kind using this huge waterway. We were able to take a shuttle boat to various places of interest.

Exhilarating Boat Ride. My experience of the Chao Phraya River is astounding. A boat ride through the river will actually give you a glimpse of history on Thailand's rich heritage over time. And it so accessible, just head to the Saphan Taksin station of the BTS Skytrain and you can easily go for a boat ride to experience the amazing wonders that this city can offer.

Cruise on the river. Do remember to take the cruise both in the day and evening time because it will take you some of the most beautiful tourist attractions of Bangkok.The cruise is also pocket friendly and is accessible by the skytrain.

The EASIEST way to get around BKK. During my entire stay in BKK, I took the Chao Phraya Tourist River Ferry (You'll get it from the Taksin BTS stop). It's convenient and affordable (a couple of U$ dollars for the whole day). Just look for the English speaking guides in light blue shirts). The ferries start at 9am though so no need to start early and it stops at 5pm. It'll take you to Chinatown, Khao San Road, The Palace, and many other places. Truly worth it. I'd do it again and again.

Great boat trip! . We had read lots of reviews about getting the local water taxi but after seeing the queues and the amount of people on the boat we opted for a tourist boat. We had a boat to ourselves for an hour and a half, the driver took us down the main river where we could see the sights of the city and then off down the canals where we could see the real Thailand! The houses on stilts with locals going about their daily business were lovely to see and with a temple thrown in every now and again! We saw massive lizards, fish and birds and it was a fab way to explore the city! We paid 1500baht which is probably a lot for Bangkok but we felt it reasonable!
the view is great. it occurs wide range of emotions while the river Chao Phraya River is very large, quiet and in the Yaounde'll lives of citizens in Thailand

Heart of the city. A must not miss on any trip to Bangkok, this is where life goes on and on year after year, the real heart of the city. Just sit on the riverside or take an express boat, or ride through the klongs and just see city life as it is

Different beautiful views . We spent more than 30min to go from Wat Pho to The asiatique. However we didn't feel time because there are many different views when you are inside : modern building and traditiinal temples.

Don't drink the water!!. No, it's not the "Venice of the East". That's foolish poppycock from travel agents. The Chao Phraya river is muddy, dirty and ceaselessly churning. It's a great idea to rent a longtail boat for 1000 Baht for an hour trip through the canals and back. I loved this trip, not because it is visually pretty (it's not) but because it highlights how people really live in Bangkok. Well worth the visit.

Amazing . We took a boat ride accross the river which cost like 6 pence per person. There are many tours, always ask for the Thai price of any longer tours as they usually knock a third off. Always barter as quite expensive otherwise (for the tours, not the crossing!).

A panalopy of colour and culture. Like many river cites arond the world the Chao Phraya River both defines and divides Bangkok. Along the river is a vast array of colours and excitememt. New and modern buildings are juxtaposed with traditional or culturally meaningful buildings, both comfortably sitting next to each other. The activity along the river banks cover every angle you could be looking for - from grand temples to modern dining to shopping to just sittng and watching the world go by. My fav thing to do is to catch a public ferry and just explore. Anytime of the day or night is the right time to experence the Chao Phraya River.
Very nice cruise dinner . Nice cruise dinner we had... it was lovely and very lavish. We enjoyed a lot and will be memorable for us as always

Great fun and a great way to get around. The heart of old Bangkok and the best way to get to many of the major tourist attractions.. Take the express boat but be sure to take the orange flag local boat favored by the locals and avoid the tourist boat. The fare is only 14 Bhat compared to 40 Bhat or a day pass for 150 Bhatt. They go the same places with only a few extra stops that only take a minute more. Also tis fun to ride with the locals and get the experience. Just know where you are going and what numbered stop you want to get off as the staff on the local boat has limited English and may not be able to tell you where to get off. Overall the river is an exciting and busy place that NEEDS to be experienced by any tourist to Bangkok.
Good . Every grate coty has a good river in its hart. They were the highways of the past and tourism best asset today. Grate to get around in and on.

one of the best way to see Bangkok. To take time out from Bangkok's hustle and bustle and the heat/humidity, take one of the water taxis that run frequently along the river and take in all the smells and sites of the river from the small canals to the main river. You will see everyday life without feeling the pressure of the main roads and areas of the city and get a nice breeze to cool you down.

One time visit. Chao phraya river is best to visit in night to check out the lights and decor around the city...you get a free boat ride to asiatouqe river front which is again a place for shopping live music and good food

MUCH MORE FUN ON THE PUBLIC FERRIES. You may go on a tourist boat and that will have the advantages of a commentary about the sights and you will know where to get on and get off.However, I recommend taking the public ferries. Unless you speak and read Thai you will have only a hazy idea of where you are especially if you're like me who had not even prepared by getting the relevant map. I was using a 2 year old Lonely Planet guide with pretty inadequate maps. But it does have the huge advantage of being a splendid adventure.This is because there are different types of boats plying up and down and they follow different itineraries; it would all be much more prosaic if every boat stopped at every pier. But that would be thoroughly European and dull.I got on at Phra Arthit on a boat going south. There was nowhere to buy a ticket. Eventually a lady on the boat sidled up and for 19 baht I was legal. How far this ticket would take me was a complete mystery. This was the time to relax and admire the amazing sights and sounds of the river running through this fascinating city. I had an appointment to make and so I got off at Sri Phraya (I think) and waited to hop on the next northbound ferry.This is where I got slightly caught out. My northbound ferry did not stop at Phra Arthit, where I got on and wanted to return. In fact it stopped at Thewet which was 2 stops north of where I wanted. I walked back to my accommodation which was a fair step; what I should have done was to have taken the next southbound ferry to correct my error. I'll know next time.This is the cheapest and best entertainment and a wonderful way to take in the sights. Don't be be put off by not understanding what's happening, you'll soon get the hang of it, appreciate a break from haggling over prices and you'll get to meet lots of lovely and helpful locals.

we recommend it. The river as such is not so special, but if you combine it with a long boat ride and the various Wats and the Floating market (make sure to check when it is one and which one!) then this is a good day's outing!

Chao Phraya - Serene at all times. From our hotel window, Chao Phraya seemed serene and sights were soothing no matter what time of the day. The beautiful boats gliding along the river in the evening add to the beauty... And the train like connected barges provide some special effects!

THE METROPOLIS IS HOT AND CHAOTIC BUT . . .. The majestic and beautiful CHAO PHRAYA RIVER in Bangkok is cooler and more exciting. Experience the traffic on the river. Seeing the shores with the hotels, the houses over the river, the sky scrappers and the Temples. This winding and moving river is the threshold of a huge and highly populated city that is unique on this plant, Earth.To ride the river taxis, as many clients who use this as a source to their jobs and residences. To see the fact that we are but a simple 'speck' in this population and environment. Yet, to enjoy a gather the real kindness of a people that loves life and that bring us to their society as an experience to 'learn'!As I say in my slogan - - - "UNICORN FANTASY . . . the world is a classroom . . . make your fantasies come true !!!

Good way to travel. The river is a good way of traveling and sight seeing. The boats are frequent, I think every 15mins and there are several stops along the river. From the boats you can see the various Bangkok landmarks. It's quite an experience.

Take a boat ride down the river. I highly recommend taking a tour of the river on a boat ride / cruise. It's really neat to see the tall, modern structures next to the old, colonial buildings, and eye opening to see the homes of many of Bangkok's residents. This is a great way to get a glimpse of a number of parts of the city.

Brilliant centre and opening to the whole of Bangkok. I would recommend using the water taxi a mere 14baht per person (children free) you get to see a lot of the river. We also got a long tail boat which took us around the canals to see a bit of the "real" Thailand. It was a great experience and would recommend.

Boat ride. We stayed at the Peninsula Hotel and needed to take the free boat ride across the river everyday which was fun. But on one occasion we took a water taxi back to the hotel from another destination and that was a blast.

Chao Phraya Tourist Boat. After having had the 1st experience that end up in satisfaction, then decided to pay a visit with friends whose having their 1st time to Bangkok. From departure pier in Sathorn was a nice ride ( with Blue Flagged ) tourist boat but not the Orange Flagged one, as we decided to hop on to back to Sathorn main pier to catch BTS, staff was shouting at passenger ( including my self ) just to ask not to stand at the back at the boat ( though its ok if the shout is in English ) which we all understand its not easy to find English speaking Thais, but we still doing good. Better do not expect to have a way to address your short of Discomfort feeling ( rather call it this way than a Complaint ) from their own staff, then decided to share some experience that you might get during this trip. All in all was great to back in Bangkok.

The power of Bangkok. Did you know that everyday food from far away is being transported on the river to the harbour south to be traded and exported. Everyday a team in yellow boats clean the river. I like that they take responsibility.
Very nice view. take a boat and enjoy the view. jump at several places and get back to the next boats. It's exiting and gives you a diferent view of Bangkok
Private boat ride!. Loved the private boat ride in banana boat. This was so wonderful on such a hot day and the best way to see the whole city!

Get on the rive taxi and go up and down the river. Get on a rive taxi at Saphan Taksin, buy a 14 Bhat ticket and settle down for almost a 45 min float to Nonthaburi. It is a great experience for people who dont live or used to river cities. Enjoy the sights and sounds of the life on a river! The cheapest attraction in Bangkok!

Must Go! Touristy! . I think it is a must go for tourists. An easy way to take a good exploration of Bangkok. You can also hop in and out sightseeing points to enjoy both the cruising and walking around. I feel it is a fantastic to explore the authentic sites of Bangkok, including the temple of the dawn. However be aware that boat schedule as it can be a long queue if you are in a hurry.

Dirty Dirty River !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. River filthy and almost black littered with rubbish.Hired a boat tour absolutely biggest waste of Money to see the most disgusting polluted river!!!!!!Dont waste your money!!Scared we were going to catch something from splash back of water.YUK!!

Riding a boat on this river gets boring after a few times. When I first rode a boat along this river, it was fun. But after a few times .. I started to see the bad sides of the river.First of all, it's not clean. The water is brackish. Secondly, the boats tend to get too crowded the farther you venture as it is one of the primary modes of Transport for people living in Bangkok. Lastly, there is a bad smell to the river water which you will only notice if you ride here a few times.I would still recommend riding a boat here though, just so you can experience it. But afterwards, I suggest you take the BTS. It's a much more comfortable mode of transport.

River travel. Do not be frightened to try the locals ferry travel around the river. For only 30baht you can travel for a nice day outing on the river. I usually just jump on boat get off at last stop and have lunch somewhere. Good trip to take family with little cost.

Ok. Nice to get out of the hustle and bustle of concrete Bangkok for a little while and get on the water. Took the local ferry up and down one day stopping here and there to explore,cheaper than the tourist ferry. Hired a long-tail boat for an hour to look at the backwater klongs...low tide so it was a bit scuzzy but still v interesting for the kids to see another side to the city
Great View. Cho Phraya is the best for night boat to look around the Riverside. If would like to enjoy it , please book before a day.

Different perspective . Was rather caught out, unlike me, by a tuk tuk I caught outside my rented apartment. He wanted to take me to A, B and C which is the usual but I opted for just the A and B which geographically made sense. At B was where it went wrong as he took me to the pier which I thought was the usual river bus stop but was a longtail stop where they did cruises!!!!To minimise the damage to my wallet I told them what I wanted and haggled the price down. Once on the water it reminded me of past experiences and it is a great way to see the city and river community life. He went slowly to prevent us from getting soaked.

Avoid canals tour by long tail boat. We planned to have a boat tour down the river but got intercepted by the seller of long tail boat canals tour. He advertised that we will see canals and local life. To be avoided at any cost. Polluted, stinky waters leaving a disgusting feeling. Here and there huge lizards in the mud, lots of floating plastic and the water is so dark that we had to cover faces to avoid splashed touching the skin. The most unpleasant part of our trip to Thailand. How can people inflict so much harm to nature and even bring tourists to look at that!

Dirty River. The River was very dirty indeed, and would not go back there is a rush, we had a small cruise for about 2 hours on the river, but as I advised, he river was vey dirty indeedStay away from it if you can
a must do. I love seeing cities from the water and bangkok was no exception.you must jump on a rover boat to the temples.

Nice ride down the longest river in SEA. I always go on a boat ride down the Chao Phraya when I'm at Bangkok. Even took a dinner cruise once. When i was back again this month, i was glad to get on one of the wooden boats and enjoy a ride down the river again. Familiar sights along the river but nice.
Great fun!. Took a Longtail boat ride Tour with friends. Wonderful history of Bangkok and even lovely little Thai ladies in their canoes selling food, drinks and souvenirs
fantastic river with boat life. It makes life and excitment to Bangkok all boats up and down with lights nighttime. Try find a riverside hotel or take a dinner or party cruise.

Watch it, ride a boat, use it for transport. It was very nice to sit in the park on the river bank near the Grand Palace in the evening, watching the transport boats and cruise boats pass by, the area slowly getting lit up as the sun went down. A cheap and efficient means of transport, avoiding the congested roads.

Must see and you have to do it anyways. If you're staying in old Bangkok/Banglamphu you'll need to ride the river taxi to get to the top Wats and sights anyways.
In some ways public transport on the river is the best sight you will see while in Bangkok.

So efficient to get around yet the journey is fun too. I needed to get from point A to point B so I decide to take a boat taxi. It was so INTERESTING to see everyday people (even a monk), great buildings to look at, even ideas where to stop just for fun (flower mart). Will certainly go on a river ride again

Beautiful River with Scenic Beauty.. We Travelled on the River by the Asiatique Boat Service since we were going for shopping at the Asiatique. The River is Bangkok's one of the important modes of transport ferrying passengers from one end to the other by express boat service. Private boat services by the Hotels also carry their hotel guest from one place to the other though this river.Its also one of the medium for Bangkok's Sea Food since they get most of their sea food from this river. It flows across bangkok making it quite useful for people to travel across at cheaper price. The views from this river is beautiful with tall buildings across the area and we captured beautiful sunset as well.You should definetly travel specially while going to Asiatique rather hiring a cab or Tuk Tuk.
Nice river. We went one day trip all around the Bangkok also quit short time to visiting this river to it was so nice river view also look like clean water.
Busy!. Was nice to stay right on the river, and watch the activity all day and night sometimes. Very colourful and loud when the "cruise boats went by" Good to get around :)
Do river not canal. The river is large and choppy which I enjoyed. It was fun. I don't recommend the canal, not much to see, dirty and pushy sellers on little boats selling trinkets.

Canal to river. Took a boat ride from near Wat Pho to the river. Most of it was down a canal that was not pleasant and the boat stopped by a seller on a small boat who was relentless trying to sell trinkets. Was only on the river for a couple of minutes then scammed for 20 baht to get off the boat on a pier. I liked the river just make sure your trip is on the river and not the canals. Wasn't worth doing.
Great mode of public transport. Affordable way to travel up and down the river. Convenient stops which take you to the tourist sites like the Wat Pho (reclining Buddha) and the Grand Palace

Respite from the congestion. I love taking the boats that act like city buses up and down the river. They are inexpensive and get you out of the crazy congestion on Bangkok's streets. We prefer the regular boats over the tourist version because they run more frequently. However, they can get quite crowded at rush hour.

Mass transit on water, a different style. We caught a ferry at Saphan Takshin, a couple of BTS stations from where we stayed. Organised chaos where people, mostly tourists, still find their way. Hopping off and on several times to visit the places of interest,up to us to find our way in the absence of proper signage. To our great surprise the restaurants and shopping were not more expensive than elsewhere in Bangkok. A great experience and good break from the hustle and bustle of the city centre.
Need to take the cruise. As a tourist I think it's a must to take a boat ride on the Chao Phraya River. We just took the public boat, and it was very cheap, and still we managed to get good views.

Booking a Tour is a MUST!. The river is the heart of the city. The Klongs are the side streets. You MUST book a tour of the river/klongs/water markets. Check the tours and take whichever you can afford that interests you. Your hotel can accommodate you if you don't have a travel agent or travel agency in Bangkok. In short, take a rive/klong tour!! (It will appeal to the entire family.Late submission due to extended overseas travel April-July
How do you review a river?. It's a river...how do you review this. It's relatively dirty. Take a boat tour...just because it's fun.

Escape the modern city and see a Bangkok from a previous era. A long boat or ferry ride in Bangkok offers a far cooler , scenic panoramic view of the city . For just a few baht you can make your way to various attractions via a ferry on the busy commercial artery of the river - the chaos of different ferry companies and wharves is part of the fun - there is always someone to advise you.A long boat tour runs at around 1500 baht - divided amongst a group provides a cheap and pleasant way to tour khlongs too narrow for major boats to navigate - a 90min tour can terminate at the Royal Palace so you can continue independently- highly recommended

Nice to have a ride there. it is good to live beside one, but you will be surprised when you have a ride in this river, there is people live inside it, but any ride will always be a quiet one, except for those who modified their small boats with a speed motor, which will be noisy and annoying for tourism

Enjoy the Hustle and Bustle. This river is the life nerve of Bangkok. So much happen here. Do yourself the favour and book a tour to go here and in the Klongs (small canals) that run along here. This is truly a sight worth seeing, especiallly the klongs will give you excitement. There rich and poor live side by side in no special order. So much life to be seen and observed here

Rice Barge trip on river. A most enjoyable trip first by long boat with guide explaining places of interest, lots of temples along river and local housing, very run down. Were taken down one of the canals quite a distance past the Kings Barges, more Temples and even saw a small crocodile sunbathing on a wooden jetty and just down from there another small crocodile virtually standing on its tail against a river pile. We eventually hopped off thre long boat and transferred to the rice barge where they had a sumptious feast of local fruits and cold drinks waiting for us, were then slowly taken back up the river to the Riverside complex where we all disembarked.

One of the most important scene of Bangkok. If you decide not to discover Bangkok from the River, you will not understand Bangkok which is still living according to the activity on it and along it.You can either use the tourist boat or the normal boat which allows you to stop regularly and to visit chinatown, indian town and main Wats as well as the Royal Palace...

How To Avoid The Confusion. There are five basic means of transportation on the Chao Phraya. A)Tourist Boats (blue): Buy an all day pass for hop on hop off at different piers for 150 baht. A one way trip on a tourist boat without a pass will cost you 40 baht. B)Chao Phraya Express: pay per ride for 14 baht regardless where you get on or off. At busier piers, tickets are sold in line while waiting or buy ticket on the boat. The ticket girls aboard boats really keep track. At most piers there are two docks. Both A) and B) board to the left hand pier. The Tourist Boat (A) is slower and costs more per trip. Chao Phraya Express (B) is faster, cheaper and more fun riding with locals and monks. Hop on whichever one you want.C) Cross river ferries: They go from your bank to the opposite bank.D) Long tail boats: or hire. As a tourist, you have to hire one to get up the few remaining klongs. Tourists never get a chance to hop on the scheduled long tailed boats that the locals use.Both C) and D) tend to leave from the smaller right hand piers.E) Hotel Ferries: All major hotels on the Thonburi side of the Chao Phraya have their own small ferries to transports their guests back and forth across the river. They all stop at Sathorn Pier to access the BTS Skytrain.

interesting way to see the city, and avoid crowds. We took a bout tour thru the Chao Phraya River -NOT a dinner cruise, would not recommend that. Just a long boat tour. It was an interesting way to see the city and also the various residential neighborhoods in the city. It was more than I expected to gain on visiting the river.

Interesting view of Bangkok living. Taking a trip on the river gives you an opportunity to see the different aspects of Bangkok living. If you get the chance take a long tail boat trip around the canals - you get to see the other side of Bangkok and might get to see some wildlife too.

Great river tour and mode of transportation! . We took a private boat to visit the Wat Pho temple and do a little sight seeing on the way! The river ride was a nice experience, but I would recommend that you haggle the price of the boat down- everything is negotiable. 😊

Nice break from the city!. Went on a river cruise to enjoy the river.
Excellent pictures to be had of all the famous tourist spots. The sun is very hot out here so we drank lots of water and tried to stay in the shade where possible.
We had lots of fun on the river. Highly recommend!

Night Tour. Best visited at night for the light show and lower levels of stench from the river. Buy the tour from hotel inclusive of transport to n from the pier at Asiatique. Don't rely too much on using the BTR n Ferry service at Takshin. It's too crowded and the wait can be frustrating, with many tourists cutting queues. Incluse dinner in the deal and plan for cold winds.

A living historic river running through Bangkok.. I have been visiting Bangkok since 2005, and six times I have stayed in hotel rooms facing the Chao Phraya River. I love watching the boats, the never ending trail of boats mainly commercial, plying their trade on the mighty river. I have travelled up to Ayutthaya, a wonderful historic city, 85 km north of Bangkok on the river in a cruise boat and seen the riverside villages, dredging equipment, stockpiles of materials and shanty towns along the river. Been like that for hundreds of years, I was told.I like watching the empty boats being easily pulled by little tug boats on the way up the river and after loading proceeding down river under tremendous load. If you look closely you can see the families on board in the living quarters, with the women cooking for the men folk as meal times approach. It's a hard life, no doubt.The river is used for irrigation, cleaning, clearing and commerce. Night time traffic in the Bangkok area is dinner cruises, as the colourfully lit cruise boats sail up and down several times each night with hundreds of passengers eating, drinking and dancing to both live and recorded music and artists, rain or shine, every night of the week.In the day time, there are many hotel ferries, public transit ferries and jet engine canoe type boats ferrying commuters from side to side and up river. Peak hours are sensational with all the boats I have mentioned, on the river at the same time.It's really worth spending some time on or near the Chao Phraya River and see the history happening before your eyes.

Must see this part of Bangkok. We always stay near family in Sukhumvit, but coming to the river is always a treat. This time we booked a hotel by the river and watched the boats from our balcony. It's a real treat and relaxing compared to the hectic city and traffic.

Nice and Relaxing. I can recommend a trip on the river in Bangkok. It is very nice and relaxing and a great way to see the city from a different point of view. The boat stops t many of the tourist spots and you can get on and off as you please.

A Taxi on The Chao Phraya is a must do during a visit to BKK. The best way to see Bangkok in the old style is taking taxi boats on the Chao Phraya and/or in the canals of Bangkok. Unfortunately the river itself is horribly dirty so that is a bit depressing. But Bangkok is pretty dirty in general so why would the river be any different.Visit Wat Arun by river. Go over to the Thon Buri side to see residential life. Hop off at Tha Athit and have a beery afternoon on Khao San Road. And if you have lots off time and money take an old converted rice barge up to Ayutthaya. Whatever plan you choose, just make sure you get out of the big malls of Phatumwan, the lady bars of Sukhumvit and the cheap beer joints of Khao San and see old BKK by river.
Chao phraya mer naam . If you are in Bangkok you simply need to take the boat trip on the Chao phraya- the canal trip will amaze you
Water Taxi. Take a water taxi on the Chao Phraya, beat the city traffic and travel with the locals. It's a great way to beat the heat and it costs about 15 baht!

Scenic cruising. It's a nice cruise easily along the long river in the center of Bangkok. You will see many temples and top quality hotels. Down along the river you will see how local live their life. At night with dinner serving along the river, quite romantic.

River that is Running Through the Heart Of Bangkok. I didn't have the time to do a full cruise but while going from Wat Pho temple to Wat Arun temple I had to cross the river by a boat and it was just a 2 minute ride.But the river is spread all across Bangkok and it's very good to watch it particularly in the night time.
Boat Ride. Experience is Awesome ...20 minutes Boat rides takes you to various place ...best way to explore Bangkok... Must Try

Avoid street traffic. I traveled a few times using the boats which frequent the many piers. It's exceptionally cheap to ride on these, and for less than 50 cents a person, you can ride as far as you like. I can't verify this price for all of the various boats, but mine was cheap and I rode it to the very last pier. Aside from being cheap, it's a bit noisy, and the river is always dirty, so don't expect a beautiful ride. Likewise, their are many ramshackle shacks along the shore and you get to view another side of life in the city.

Beautiful site and photo ops. The river is nice enough during the day, but at night it really lights up and shines. Allthe city lights reflect off the water and enchant the river. We stayed at the Chatrium River Side hotel and the views of the river at night where to die for. Asiatique has a river walk and makes for a nice strole along the river to take it all in.

very good experience!. Best option to have a nice and peaceful ride it is to take the public boats available almost from any pier, and really cheap !Be careful and do not trust private offers up from 1400 Thai bats and so, unless you want to do it. Remember you have another option.
it is nice. the river is nice and crossing it is fun but it takes quite a long time to cross plus it is boring to remain in the boat for long until and unless it is not raining.

About 15 years ago, I studied at the Asia Institute of Technology (AIT)/ Bangkok.... About 15 years ago, I studied at School of Management (SOM - one of the leading business schools in Far East) in university 'Asia Institute of Technology' (AIT)/ Bangkok, one of the leading universities in Far East.Most of my student collegues were from East Asia (40% Thai, 40% from Vietnam, and 20% international from all over the world). I travelled all over Thailand, and visited the city of Bangkok quite often.I strongly recommend you - best time is definitely not the summer (very hot, and extremely humid), but spring, fall, winter.Unfortunately, you'll see many, many people who are extremely poor, they have to beg for money to survive. There are beggars every 5 meters, and they get only very, small money into their plastic cup. At the end of the day, they have got only very few money so that they can buy a small bottle of water (after 10 (!!) hours of sitting on the ground for begging). Whenever I went into the city, I changed some money into a lot of coins to give a lot of beggars some money. Going into the city was always 'a knife into my heart' - there are extremely expensive hotels, very exclusive restaurants and shops, and there are thousands of beggars. I have never seen so many beggars in a huge city like in Bangkok. Every going into the city was very painful for my heart.- On the other hand, I strongly recommend you to visit this beautiful city and this river. You won't regret it!Every visit of a "rich Western visitor/ travelller" brings some money into the city (for the employees in hotels and restaurants, taxi and cab drivers, employees in shops, etc.

Smell Bangkok's SEWAGE. This is a review on the Chao Phraya RiVER. Let's be real. The 1st impression that any SENTiENT Westerner will get is how DiRTY the Chao Phraya River (CPR) is. CPR, get it? It's filthy. It's so neglected and unsightly that you'd be tempted to eat it with a fork (but use a spoon: you'd want to get every drop)(American joke). I like to sit at the front of buses and trains and boats to see where i'm going but on the CPR what you see will come splashing onto you and your face and your body and you might want to wear a HAZ MAT suit. Anyway, it's an experience and it gives you a vantage point of say Wat Arun that no other could. But, hey, even the hardy Thais don't swim in CPR.
sunset at the river. find a good spot facing wat arun and sit down to watch boats drive past at sunset. one of the best things to do in bangkok
Well maintained river. Well maintained river and a good river transportation. Nice view of Bangkok city from the river, even better at night time.

Nice evening spent by the river :). Had taken the 8-10pm slot. Did the booking through email and the concerned called me a day before to confirm my booking and pickup time. The cruise was very good, though the skyline of Bangkok is not as charming as Dubai Marina.. But on the overall had good time with good thai food..

Do take a boat ride on the river of Kings!. Do arrange to take a cruise on this river, and go as far as nonthaburi and across to thonburi. In the evening, indulge in one of the dinner cruises... if not for the food which is mediocre at best... go for the breath-taking sights of the buildings on both sides of the river
Tour of the Canals. Great trip in a longboat. So interesting to see life around the canal system connected to the river. You can take 1,2 or 3.5 hour tours. So much more interesting than I thought!
Dirty river. Great to have river cruises in the middle of the city. But very dirty river, please beware of the touching the water.
Best an night for the lights. We went on a river cruise out of the main terminal. a little crowded to board though once on had a great night.

Beautiful very busy and historic river. A must see boat trip either by river taxi or long boat or better yet an evening dinner cruise.
Historic palace and temples lit up at night.
Excellent eating places on both sides of the river. excellent dinner cruises.
huge but smelly. nice view from the shore . big river . but the smell of the stink is a bit put off though the water is bluish
amazing. must do this. had dinner. fun but non indians will not like cruise because indians came and started some rowdy music and even more rowdy dance. great buffet and wonderful experience

An experience not to be missed.. A ferry boat ride on the orange express boat is a must along this busy fast flowing river. The cost between any of the piers is 14 baht which is a matter of pence, very cheap but a great experience.

By boat to Nonthaburi. I took the river boat from the Sathorn Bridge to Nonthaburi which cost 28 Baht return. Nonthaburi is a fairly basic market town, no particular visitor appeal, but the boat ride is an interesting way to see the river and life on the banks.Most visitors are herded onto the tourist boats at Sathorn Bridge. Local commuter transport has an orange flag.

Great river boat ride for temple visits. We visited the Grand palace & some temples via river boat. A boat ride along this river reveals a lot about the city. It's past & present. Views of Wat Arun and other temples were good. Best way to reach Grand palace & Wat Pho.

Lifeline Of Bangkok. This river is the Life line of Bangkok the reason being it interconnects the entire BKK through a host of canals in which the boats run carrying passengers from one part of BKK to another. There are 5 types of boats that can be used for ferrying oneself. However keep in mind that there can be quite a rush and you might need to stand in line during rush hours.Also along the river side there are quite a number of hotels, temples and restaurant. One can also have a dinner over the various boats which run in the evening also known as Dinner cruise boats. Once the sun sets down the trip in one of the boats in the river is quite good with the wind hitting your face. I would recommend it a must visit experience.
Wonderful Experience. if you are in Bangkok you need to take a trip on the river and feed the fish, my children loved it we had a blast and highly recommend it
Lovely Dinner Cruise on Chao Phraya River. Did a lovely dinner cruise on the Chao Phraya River which gave us a magical experience of the sights along the river.

River boating for lazy people. If you have nothing to do around grand palace or you cant walk far, chao phraya river boating is a good option. You can just sit and relax while the boat brings you to see bangkok old town houses and villages.

Not a great River. Only the wider part of the river is good it get smelly and filthy in many parts. Nothing much exciting except taking trip to view all the things on the banks of the river. even thats not worth it.

Awesome. We enjoyed with boat rides along Chao Phraya River down to Grand Palace or somewhere around just about 100 Bath also we enjoyed the view of tall buildings plus another great memory is they allowed to feed cat fish.

Most convenient way to see Bangkok. Take the plunge, get to the river and use it to visit key sights of Bangkok. So easy to use and cheap. 26 baht together from one port to another. Using the ferries to cross only costs 3 baht. Avoid the traffic is my recommendation.
best way to travel the city. just hop on one of those long boats and enjoy a city tour on the river.you may even use it as hop on hop off and loose the crazy traffic.
River cruise to see the sights. Recommend the tourist boat as a good way to see the sights in Bangkok - you can hop on and off and get good views from the river.

Fantastic riverside view. Night view of this area is better than a day view. In this area located many luxury hotels, restaurants and pubs. There people can enjoy Recreation, business-like atmosphere in the city.

Provide good alternative mean of transport during rush hour. There are many attractions a long the river like Wat Arun pagoda, Asiatique/Calypso, etc...
Getting from one place to another is very cheap, about 3 THB/person to get across the river. To move along, the fare is between 10 to 20 baht depending on distance.
must do. you have to get on one of the boats and go up and down the river during the day and then repeat it at night as the views are nice.

Memorable River Cruise in Chao Phraya. We had a boat cruise in this river in January this year.Tourism is a big. Business in Thailand and they have devloped it accordingly. .The river Chao Phraya is long and broad enough for big boats to sail around. .Evening river cruise is the best time.Large double decker boats packed with tourists slowly move from one starting point and return to the same point after cruising for about 2 hours. Buffet Dinner is served while the boats cruise.Boat Companies arrange entertainment programmes for the tourists.Local singers sing and dance.Tourists not only enjoy but join in singing and dancing to enliven the atmosphere.Tourists in groups enjoy the most.While enjoying the dinner, songs etc they should see the landmarks of Bangkok, grand hotel's Buddhist temples, important buildings etc located on both banks of the river.Tourists can enjoy fresh air and get a panoramic view of the city from the upper deck.Privacy seekers can have their dinner & drinks at the upper deck as well.All enjoy the river cruise which lives an unforgetable imprint in their mind.Excellent arrangements made by the tourism authority.

A Better Way to See Bangkok. I caught the tour boat to Khaosan road from Saphan Taksin which is about 40Thb. The trip takes about 30 minutes which is a lot cheaper & quicker than taxi, however if you take a regular boat it is cheaper still & it does without the terrible noise of the guide speaking into a microphone.
Wow very fast boat!. Haha... The boat sail over chao phraya river has big machine. So u can feel the speed across the distance and seeing thailand.Excited experince!

Don't miss it. Take a boat and just watch the river banks for a special view of Bangkok. It costs 20B. Can travel as far as you like. Get into the suburbs. Get off, look around and get the boat back. Boats run until 8pm

Just a river cruise. Had a normal river cruise along the Chao Phraya river after a full day tour in Ayutthaya. To me it was just a normal cruise nothing fancy. You can see most of the temple from the cruise but nothing special.

Good trip with great access to Grand Palace. Really good boat trips for sight seeing using this river. Boats go regularly from the various piers dotted along the river. I stayed more in the centre of town but found it easy to get to the river via the Sky Train (BTS). If you get off at Saphan Taksin you literally walk down the station steps straight into the pier. You can get the Grand Palace from here and the giant gold Buddha and the sleeping Buddha at the various Wat's. Wat Phra Kaew near the Grand Palace which regarded as the most sacred Buddhist temple in Thailand is accessible via the river too.

Nice ride on the boats. I used to take a ride on a boat from a port near Khao San road to Asiatique riverfront stop (last stop). The ride was amazing and was dead cheap (just around 15 bhat per ride).

Worth a boat ride. Went on a boat ride up the river and through the canals, which was fascinating to see how the canal houses were built.Fed the fish along the way, which was interesting to see how many fish there are in the canal.Not sure if we paid 'overs' for the trip for 1 hour was $72AUD. Compared to other things seemed expensive, but worth it.

The river that gets you to various attractions. You can purchase boat tickets to get you to attractions along the river or across. We bought a one day pass from Chao Phraya Tourist Boat which costs 150Baht per person. The river doesn't really smells though its kinda dirty and full of rubbish.

Quintessential Bangkok. You get to see a different side of Bangkok from the river. We caught a klong ferry and it rocketed along compared to road travel. You also get to see peoples houses and businesses in a way you would not from the street.
Rough river. We enjoyed our 1 hour cruise on the river in a long boat. The river is very rough but we did go on quiet canals as well. It's a good alternative way to see the city.
Heart of the town, but very dirty.. Heart of the town, but very dirty.The curl is very beautiful, and suitable for chillin'.But the water itself is extremely dirty.Just want to cry for river.

Long boat ride. We took a long boat ride on our private tour booked through Asia World Tours Traveled along klong canal as well. River bustling with many boats taking tourists around. Water a little bumpy until getting to canals but really enjoyed. Long boat reminded me of a big canoe/gondola somewhat. Flowers at front of boats for good luck.

It's great to get on and go right up with river. This is a great trip, get up early and take the boat all the way up the river there is a little island called Kret which is worth a visit but you will need directions in Thai and even then it can be a challange.

Riverside view. It's a wonderful way of experience the city from the riverside. We took a long tail boat along the river and into the klongs, and experienced the life of the Thai in the small klongs. Another world, than the chaotic part of Bangkok. Further more we used the waterboat as transportatio on the river and had a fantastic view of the city from the riverside.

Different way to get around and see sights. . It's worth it to take a cruise or fast long tail boat or night cruise with dinner on this river. Both are fun and Not that expensive. Night cruises are good as you see the sights all lit up and it looks great. Or take a trip to china town or many other place just for experience.

Long boat Klong (canal) tours are a good way to see old Bangkok.. Dirty water, but fun to feed catfish, see alligators, and understand the important role the river played in former days -- water taxis. People still live along the canals which serve as bathrooms, wash tubs, and more.

Not as smelly as the canals. The smaller canals I saw in Bangkok were an unnatural pale grey color and had a sewer tinge to its smell. The bigger, main river was more natural looking and less odorless (but odor there was).

Chao Praya River the heart of Bangkok. Visiting Bangkok will be complete if you across this river. Find the nearest pier/station and choose your destination, and enjoy the trip. You will see many high buildings during your trip.
Very clean. Thailand has so much activities for you to enjoy, the people is supper supper friendly. They will go extra mile to assist you.

Lovely to Cruise at Night!. I have taken two dinner cruises at night on the river and they were both nice. The river reflects the lights along its banks from the hotels, temples, and the Grand Palce. There are bridges to cruise beneath that are also lit up at night. It allows you to see the city from a different perspective.

Fun on the river. Took a long tail boat with family on the river. It's an interesting journey weaving through the canals, and seeing how some people live. My young children enjoyed it! It's a must! Buy the boat driver a beer from the sellers in small canoes, it helps them make a living, it won't hurt you.

Amzaing ride, from Bangkok to Nanthaburi. Took a ride from Bangkok, from 1st stop on boat to the last one which is in Nanthaburi, another province/city of Thailand. It was amazing ride, extremely cheap and you get to see all of BKK and you end up in a place to see a different kind of place than Bangkok so it was worth it.
cruise dinner . it was my first cruise dinner in my life and it was too good...music food and crowd.. everything was good... i enjoyed alot...

River Taxi Makes Good Tour Boat. It is actually called Chao Praya Tourist Boat....but it is a river taxi. Many locals use it in the same way as a bus line...the legend at the stops is even set up like a bus stop, showing the different lines and where they go and stop. That said..it is a great way to tour the riverfront and get on and off at will if you purchase an all day ticket at a cost of 150 baht. The best place to turn around however, is the stop between the two bridges near Khao San and of course, the last stop at the other end...anywhere further upriver from the bridges becomes somewhat suburban and less scenic. Well worth the effort.
Disgusting . This river is disgusting hahaha! The color is yellow brown. I dont get why this river become one of the tourist spot

Useful when visiting tourist spotz. A very busy river because they use it for transporting products but it's also very useful especially when visiting tourist spots. Boat tickets are cheap. Asking the people at the ticket booth for some info and directions can be a bit tricky because they don't speak English.

Take a trip down the canals. Loved our tour down the river and through all the river canals seeing the houses and how people live and how the houses are still standing is all so mind blowing. I loved every moment.

Alternative transport in Bangkok. It is a good opportunity for you to feel the ferry boat along Chao Praya river. They have several boat flag, like blue for tourist boat that cost you THB 40 one way and in the boat will have the tour guide explaining about all building beside of Chao Praya river. Also they have Orange flag boat for public which is cost cheaper than Blue Flag. Arround THB 13 one way

1 hour non-stop tour recommended. Two of us were taken in a long boat up and down the river and round the canals of Bangkok for an hour. As well as seeing the contrast between the skyscrapers of today and the monuments of yesteryear we also saw the diversity of how people both rich and poor live in this sprawling and unforgiving metropolis. The highlight however, was seeing a whole family of four -five foot long Monitor Lizards lying about on the canal side. These creatures are breathtaking. We bartered down to 1,000 Baht for the whole trip. It was well worth the money.

Take a Break in Bangkok. Chao Praya River divides the city of Bangkok. For the locals it is important lane to move from place to place and for the tourist it is a perfect break between shopping, good way the see the city from other point of view but a must see sight also.More expensive but of course more individual way to make a tour are the long tail boats. I prefer ferries by which you can go up or down along the river with local people, jump of on an pier near something interesting and then move on by just a few coins.
Long boat river/canal ride. Fascinating overview of Bangkok. A must see/do. The sights, sounds and smells, simply awesome. Paid 2000 for 3 people, good value I thought. Floating market a must see

Must do. The river is lovely and great tourist attraction it self but also passes through various tourist attractions.There are markets on river banks with eateries at all piers and well maintained.Also you can cruise in budget.
