More touristy than ever. Tourist boats outnumbering the actual transports crossing the river may make the area less authentic than it actually is. The cruise can take you up and down the river, the long boat with faster speed, but to get the real experience take the old dock and pay 5 baht crossing the river from Grand Palace to Wat Arun among all the locals in a wet market.

River dinner cruise. The food was a buffet with a good variety and it was above average. The entertainment was varied from folk dancing to contemporary music by a band. It rained and we all had to go below deck. The view was interesting having been to the Grand Palace and some other places before. There were a variety of boats on the water from tugs, to personal, to other dinner and party boats.

Very nice . Chao phraya river is wonderful opportunity to see the calm side of Bangkok. It is huge and lots of boat go on it all the time. If you are staying in one of the river side hotels they will provide you with the boat to reach the bts . Otherwise you can book a tour. We booked an evening tour with Thai dance performance and dinner on board. The food for vegetarian food was ok, nothing very special but the dance, the cruise and the evening setting sun over all was very nice. You must do it at least once. Asiatique is also approachable and it is a nice place to be . All these things can be combined and be made into one evening outing.

Just take a public boat, take easy, and enjoy it. Don't go at rush hour.. If you go to Bangkok, you can skip any point even Grand Palace as me as well, but you can skip this river. Because it is really enjoyable and you don't need to spend money or big money! Buy a cheap public ticket and you can have fun no matter you get off the boat or just look. I love it

One not to miss. You haven't been to Bangkok if you haven't taken a boat cruise or ferry on the Chao Phraya. Not all of it is nice, and some of the sightings are quite run down, but then again this is Bangkok, and the contrasts make it more interesting.
a must do. you have to do the river...just make sure your boat driver is switched on.. we had a collision with another boat that almost saw us swimming in this swamp...

Chao Phraya River is long. There are many places you can reach via the Chao Phraya river. you can go to the Grand Palace. Asiatique, Chinatown and even to outskirts of Bangkok. Just remember to take the right color ferry and you can find surprises. But personally, the Chao Phraya river is kind of polluted and dirty, therefore, I avoid sitting at seats where the river waters can reach my face. In fact, many Thais will cover their face when traveling on Chao Phraya River.

good for traveling and sight seeing. An easy and convenient way to travel around Bangkok and do some sightseeing at the same time. Some boats will have a guide on board who will between stops explain a little bit about the various temples and buildings you will come across.

Sit Back and Relax. The ferry ride in Chao Phraya river is definitely different from western culture traffic in the highways. Love the ferry rides. Make sure to catch the Orange flag ferry, it takes you to all the Temple stops for 14 bhat per ride. The Express blue ferry charges 40bhat per ride. The orange flag ferry will be packed during rush hour 9am and 5pm since locals take the ferry too but any other time it should be fine and with enough sitting spaces. Enjoy the relaxing, ferry ride and soak in Enchanting Bangkok.

cruising in Chao Phraya River. Cruising chao Phraya River is one of the best experience ever we had.Me and my wife enjoyed each moment and we took so many snaps .Also uploaded on the facebook.Travelling in the river is always my passion when ever we visit any cities.Thus we can absorb the culture of the past and the present.This is a must see experience we paid 1000 THB for 2 and 100 THB tip for the driver.

Great view of the city line next to the river at nights!. One of the best way to travel to multiple tourist destinations like the emerald buddha, wat arun, the grand place, and lots of awesome restaurants next to the river. I highly suggest taking the BTS to the Sapan Taksin exit where you can take a very short walk to the dock. There they have tourist all day pass for 150b which includes a map with all the stops and destinations you can take. Super cool way to travel as its much cooler with a great view.

A "must do" when in Bangkok. We always have a trip along this vibrant working river when we are in Bangkok. It is interesting to see how this is a vital artery for Thailand and Bangkok and provides an important aspect of the integrated transport around the City. We use the tourist express boat which travels the river from 9am onwards and at a cost of 190 baht a ticket you get a commentary (in English) on the sights and different parts of the city. You can get on and off as you please. The boat also links to different BTS stations and allows for easy access to the main temples and tourist sights in Bangkok. A definite "must do" experience.

Nice boat ride. Hop on a water taxi and ride the entire way down and back....Just stay on and enjoy the ride....It is very cheap to do. It cost more on the tourist boat but they do describe things along the way......however the water taxi goes farther up the river so just enjoy the view......Nice way to spend an hour or two for very cheap.

The river itself seems to be the life line of Bangkok. As there are many boats crossing either taking tourists here and there or on a river cruise..Inspiring to see the skyscrapers in the horizon on this gray rainy day. Is very wide and not sure how long it is.

river cruise . This river runs near the asiatique river front where you can take a dinner cruise for about 700 baht which includes a welcome drink. the river offers some of the great views if travelled by cruise

mixture of old and new from the hustle and bustle to quieter locations. catch the standard commuter ferry to Nonthaburi - takes less than an hour. Good value at local fare rates. See how folks live on and around the river. Take in a riverside Thai meal at Nonthaburi.

Cheap activity. We travelled down this river to do some sight seeing unfortunately you can't see a great deal and the river is a little dirty. However it's cheap enough £3 for the whole day to get off and on and different stops and have a look around in different areas.
River Tour. The side rivers/canals were a fascinating look at how well to do to poor live in Bangkok. You just go up to some of the piers to to negotiate a price for a ride.
Dinner by the river. Love to eat by the river - can go by sky train (Sapan Taksin BTS' station) to the Chao Praya river with varieties of shopping and eating in the evening.

Best seen by boat. Take a tour or hire a small boat with friends, be careful to barter when hiring one as the first price is never what they expect you to pay. If it's too pricey or if as happened to us a taxi driver drops you off at the pier telling you the streets are too busy then be prepared to walk away, they do call you back with a new and much lower price. That all being said,mew paid half what they asked originally and the long slow ride along the river was one of the highlights of our trip.

Nice for a sunset cruise. We took a sunset dinner cruise. Very nice ride, excellent food and great views of the city. A very nice way to see the city from a totally different point of view. Very enjoyable and an incredible experience. Totally recommended
River Dinner Cruise!. Do opt for a dinner cruise along Chao Phraya River in the evening for the views of the temples and the cool breeze with good buffet dinner!

Always Interesting. Always plenty of action. Barges and boats going in all directions. Some fascinating near misses. Also large protected fish in the stretches near temples. Not to mention the unseen but notorious giant sting rays. Worth while doing a river tour. Good value for money, with food, drinks, and bread to feed the fish thrown in.

Respite from frenetic city. Take a cruise up the river and see Bangkok from a different view. Tired feet and aching muscles - visit one of the boats and take a trip up and down the river. 1 hour to the northern-most pier. Hop on and hop off. Inexpensive.

Traffic alternative.. after sitting in traffic for 90 minutes to get to our lunch destination- we were surprised we had to cross the river by boat for a company lunch- after some deliberations we convinced our hosts to hire a boat to get to Shangrila hotel and a 90 minute trip became 20! a good alternative to roads and the river is not as dirty as most- an excellent alternative transport especially if on leisure..

Best way to get around the city!. This is a great way to see the city and get around town. Most parts of the city are accessible from the river and can see the many beautiful Wats the Grand Palace and many other sites from here!

Jump on the Water Tax-Busi for an Inexpensive Ride. We enjoyed riding up and down the Chao Phraya River twice, once on an inexpensive water taxi-bus that the locals use. It stopped often and was packed with people. But it was cheap and fun. On another day we did a private tour with two other couples. It was short, expensive and the driver was sort of rude.

Open My Mind. Took a private boat from one of the many boat hiring points along the Chao Phrayo to get into the canal and then back to the main river. It costs 400 baht per person, and we're four. On the main in the late afternoon, one can sight the glittering of the gold lined roofs of the Grand Palace. Modern buildings give way to houses on stilts once entering the canal. There are houses that are well constructed and one can believe they belong to the wealthy folks as well poorer segment of society. One will meet many other tourists on similar boats along the canal. The boatmen are careful and do slow down along bends as well as when boats are approaching from the opposite. You won't want the black brackish water to hit your face! It can be a relaxing ride if you are not concerned about some filth along the canal.

Mesmerizing !. Love this place, where the old and the new meet in harmony. Something so peaceful to just sit and watch the river life for hours... I boated on it, bicycled next to it, and had drinks in a cafe sitting on it - I miss it :)

River boat trip. After chatting to local lecturer in English, he took us to the pier and organised a boat trip along the Chao Phraya River and we took in the little nooks and crannies where local people live on the waters edge and saw some water lizards. Fantastic experience and well worth doing.

Little dirty.. Little dirty.It's a dirty river and sometimes little smelly but we made a small river fairy ride it is a nice way to see the city from the lake and the shores but i just made it because it was free I would not pay too much for it.

Better than the streets!. My husband and I are enjoying a nice river view from our hotel room, but also the awesome ferry service to anywhere on the river you need to go! It's a pretty filthy river, so don't fall in, but it definitely beats sitting in traffic!

night cruise. great to do the dinner cruise..all companies have excellent food and floor shows..The sights are interesting...Many Wats are floodlit.....sometimes a fireworks display is an added bonus..

another way to get around bangkok city without traffic. enjoy this river with the boat that you can choose..first one the luxury one..with boat that looks good and special to tourist the ticket including the map and directions of the river and pier.. the second choice is the simple boat with many local and very cheap ticket..only the bad news is.. many directions still in thai language, hard to understand but you can simple ask.. or use google map to make sure you didn't get lost. the boat staff use helmet for they safety.. and even you see there's a long standing que there, don't worry.. the boat is big and enough for every one.. and so many boat.. don't worry you don't get one..enjoy the bangkok without traffic
it's a river. it's a dirty looking river, very choppy, very crowded. It does let you avoid the Bangkok traffic, though. Also gives you a glimpse into real life in bagnkok if you take the side canals.

A chance to see a different way of life. Our group did a tour on the river and it was a highlight for most of us. It was a way to see a different way of life and some of the different sides of Bangkok. I've done this before but I so enjoyed taking people on this river who had never been before. Zipping up and down the canals and watching their faces as they took it all in.

Tourist Ferry is a bargain, not a trap!. We rode the tourist ferry as part of a longer, all day guided tour. Our great tour guide Opal recommended this and I can see why - dirt cheap, fast COOL and scenic way to get around the city - relax during the ride and avoid the crazy Bangkok traffic - I MUCH preferred this mode of transport to the smelly and hot tuk-tuks. You get to see all the sights from the river and enjoy the local vibe - not just tourists but locals take the Ferry.. if you see something interesting - just get off and catch another ferry later... a good bargain and lots of fun,.

River boat and restaurants.. We were in Bangkok several times before to visit family members, and we had hard time with BKK traffic. We did some thing different this time. We got into the orange flag river boat, and enjoyed the excitement of BKK. We stopped at several restaurants along the trendy riverside malls, even connect to BTS, the electric mass transit of BKK. Convenient, cheap, and best time we ever had in BKK.

Take the Tourist Ferry. There are two types of ferries on the river - the local passenger ferries and the tourist ferries. We got tickets on both, and our first trip was on the tourist ferry where we were able to sit out on the front of the boat, enjoy the breeze and also a nice commentary of what it was we were going past. On the way back we took a normal passenger ferry which was filled with locals and was packed to the rafters. People just kept on squishing up more and more in order to be able to fit more paying customers. Not a nice experience in the 30+ degree heat and humidty! But a nice river flowing through the city, and good access to many of the popular sites.

1-hour canal tour on a Long-tail boat. I don't know what the price of this tour should be; we paid 1000 baht for 3 persons, 'bargained' down from 1200 baht. The tout accepted with such alacrity, I'm sure he would have sold to us for much less. Nevertheless, it was worth the money as we had a great time. The tour took us from Sathorn Pier, through the canals or khlong, where we were fascinated by the buildings along the banks or built over the canal. The tour ended at Tha Tien Pier, from which we took an orange public ferry to Sathorn for 13 baht per person. A great way to spend the morning.

Lots of Water!. Whether just standing on the banks watching giant catfish roll around, or taking a river taxi to the Royal Palace, you'll be impressed with how much water there is. The river is lined with temples, restaurants, and rough teak shantys. Riding in a boat, you'll see schools of fish, water snakes, rats, loads of trash, and the occasional bloated dog carcass, but you came to Thailand for an exotic adventure, right? Well, this is exotic! And the river taxis are the best way to get to River Tree House, which is the best Thai restaurant in the world, and is in the northern suburb of Bangkok, Nonthaburi.

Dont get ripped off!. The taxi boats are an amazing and unbelievably cheap way of getting down the river (about 20B per person). Dont get conned into Long Boats at up to 4000B per person! With the stops were better signposted on the streets!

passenger boat very cheap and ideal for budget travelling. on a budget so got the passenger ferry up the river it was 14 Thai Baht each way and you get to see lots along the way. there are multiple stops on each side it is the perfect way to travel.
Favorite river! . Great and fun experience to get along the river bank/view wirh long tailed boat roaming around and seeing the people real way of life.

Long Tail Boat Ride. We took a ride up the river and through a khlong. It was interesting, but the driver didn't speak English and we really didn't know what we were looking at. I feel like we overpaid for what we got, but we did experience it. Make sure you bargain, almost every price in Bangkok is negotiable.Make sure you buy bread to feed the fish. This was an exciting way to get from the hua lomphong station down to the Grand Palace area and only involved a cheap 40 baht tuk tuk ride to the pier.

Not bad but can be expensive!. A good way to spend a few hours. You really get a feel for Bangkok life. Be wary of the boat tours that want to take you through the canals etc...they are a rip off and expensive...1200 baht per person etc.

Bumpy boat ride!. Highly recommend to take a 1 day pass which costs 150 baht directly from the counter.This way you can hop in and out at any piers throughout the whole day and walk about.The ride in itself is nice as when the tides get higher the boat rocks more ;)

water channel for Bangkok. A better way to explore traditional bangkok than roads, major attractions are across the river but you have to go to land to witness them. you can go and see floating market through it, much faster and convinient way

Chao Praya River, Bangkok. The Chao Praya River (The Grand Duke River) is not exactly a remarkable destination in itself, but the river defines the city of Bangkok. Originally it flowed far to the west. The capital of the old kingdom was Thonburi, but it was moved to the eastern side after Burmese invasion as it was safer to defend. Transport in the city relies on a interconnected network of ferries that navigate the river and the canals in the city. The best of the city will probably not be seen taking a ferry or a cruise down the river, but it is an interesting experience nonetheless.

A good way to see the BKK Skyline. You can either take an upmarket cruise or just use the hop on-hop off ferry. Obviously the latter is much cheaper,but also busier especially at rush hours, which tend to be longer in BKK than many cities
Choose a hotel on the river. The Chao Phraya is the cup of activity in Bangkok. Grab a water taxi and take in the sites up and down the river.

Good for travelling but dirty water from Bangkok drains. This is good for transportation there r several kind of boats for tourist and regular comuters and u can visit most of the tourist attractions with the help of these boats which is quite cheap. But dont hire the long boats which take u through small canals because it is quite expensive and the water is very very dirty. In fact all dirty water from all over Bangkok
Busy. The life blood of Bangkok.... very busy but very interesting at the same time.Had a short river cruise and used it to to visit the mandarin oriental
not much exciting. not much exciting to visit, if you have been to venice it is same canal that connects places, it has a huge connection to various tourist sites.

Amazing. Just went from Nontabury to Wat Po. It took 45 minutes so had a good look at the old houses on the riverside and the brand new Sky scrapers. The old and the new. At 14 Baht one way it was more than wirth the money. Saw barges full of sand that had been dredged from up river being taken out to the mouth of the river. Plenty of fish all the way. May have been cat fish I don't know.

Efficient way to get around. Took the ferry for 40 baht one way. You can purchase a day pass for 180 baht but if you don't plan on making at least 5 trips on the ferry, why bother? Can take the BTS to Saphan Taksin station and can get onto the ferry from there. Efficient way to reach the sights (Wat Pho, Grand Palace, Backpacker district) and fun to see different structures along the way. Typically we get motion sickness but this ride was smooth. Be aware of what stop you want to get off at as the ferry doesn't stop for long before it takes off again (stand in the back before the next stop you want to get off at).

Love site seeing on the water. Take time out of your vacation and do the boat tour on this river. it is worth it. You can visit so many places in one day like china town, old city, buddhas and so much more. My suggestion is to leave Asiatique for last because you can have dinner there after a long day of boat travel.

The heart of Bangkok. The Venice of the East has many canals but the grandest of them all is the Chao Praya River.It carries people both locals and tourists. Consider using a local boat and pay 14 Baht and see how the locals travel. You will see just as much as on a tour!The river carries bulky goods often with 3 or 4 barges linked together.Ride on it but don't swim in it and certainly don't drink it!

Great to cruise down. I didn't take a cruise just the wafer taxi and I loved seeing everything from the water. It wasn't too dirty and the boats were stable so I took it a couple times just to cruise along.

The centre of attraction. . This must be the centre of attraction here in Bangkok city.There are shuttles that bring you from one side of the river to another and river tours abound with some including dinner with their cruise.You probably can get to any part of Bangkok on the other side but have to make sure it's the right pier.
Nice. This river have beautiful view specially in night. I visit in night through cruise. I had a nice dinner with beautiful view of the city.
Cruise the Chao Phraya. I recommend a cruise on the river as an alternative way to visit the city. Great spots along the river and an interesting Thai Venice feel in a the anal section.

Convenient way to visit attractions by the river . Convenient and cheap way to avoid traffic jams and visit attractions near the river Only 14 baht per trip Go for the boat with orange flag and pay on the boat! The ferry don't stop for long so Be ready to get off before ferry reaches your stop or you might miss your stop Gets crowded during peak hours

Tourist boat. This is an absolute must. The boat stops at all the major tourists sites and definitely a better way to travel then the BTS or skytrain or taxi. You can get on and off at any of the stops for 150THB. If you do not want to wait for the next tourist boat you can board any of the boats but be aware that it will stop at every stop not just the tourists attractions. That is not such a bad thing as we went one stop further and were so glad we did as on the pier there is a fish feed frenzy. Just literally thousands of fish come up to the jetty and you can buy a bag of large bread pieces and apparently this has been happening for years so the fish just come and wait to be fed. Quite amazing to watch.

An Easier Way to Navigate Bangkok. The streets of Bangkok are teeming with activity nearly 24/7. Between the cars, the buses, the taxis, and the motorcycles, walking in Bangkok is nearly impossible. Crossing many intersections is often a life-threatening proposition! An easier way to get around the city is to take a water taxi on the Chao Phraya River which runs 'behind' the city. It's cheap and they run often. There are many centrally located piers from which you can hop on these taxis. The river itself is filthy but scenic.

Chao phraya princess is great for Indians. If you are an Indian then choose Only chao phraya Princess river cruise as offer great Indian food with Veg n non veg options n with indian songs music also. Great experience
Jump on a boat tour!. Boat tours along the river and its canals are a great way to see a different perspective of both sides of the city and its living areas.

Water was not clean. The river had good night view, but the water was dirty and smelled bad. We tried Express Boat, it was interesting and cheap. Would recommend it if you have enough time in Bangkok.

This river is something very unique. We had the opportunity to ride a public boat on our way to see the Grand Palace and the other temples near by. I was surprised how many people commute using the river as their primary way of transportation. I loved seeing the tall modern hotels from the river. I also enjoyed feeling the wind on my face as we moved from pier to pier and just observing the different people on the boat going about their business. Definitely one of the highlights for me was cruising the river. It was so much fun!

Commuter Boat Ride. As part of getting to know BK I added to my list of activities a ride on a commuter boat with locals during "rush hour". As I like boats/the water, it was a lot of fun. Have already taken a Long-Tail Boat ride on the klongs (canals)-another fun trip!

A fine river. A highlight for me every time to BKK is to ride the river taxis (20 Bot).Great views, and a welcome breeze, and enjoy the whistling and roar of the engines as the boat docks and departs each stop. Hiring a long tail or other boat can be fun, but the pricing is a bit extortionate.

Dirty river with a great boat taxi system. This river is dirty and smelly. Giant barges get dragged by cute little tugboats all day long. This river would be an eyeball sore if it weren't for the fact that boat taxi and shuttle services frequent the river, and are by far the cheapest and quickest way to get around Bangkok. Learn the boat taxi system and you will bounce around Bangkok quickly and peacefully while taxi's and tuk-tuks are stuck in frustrating traffic. The river is your friend!
Nice river trip. We went on one of the bigger boats for an hour long trip getting off in china town. It was nice passing all the long boats and seeing various river traffic.
What a tour !. Great dinner cruise.Neatly arranged tables and great food.The area was great with live bands.A little crowded that day but a new experinec. bangkok skyline was awesome.

Great cruise. We took a cruise along the river to visit the temples and the grand palace. It is great not only because o the temples but also beacuse you get a completely different view of this huge city. Do not miss the chance of taking a cruise if you visit the Bangkok.

Bangkok: a river runs through it. Lovely place to watch boats or make a boat tour yourself. If you're staying in the old city (Ko Ratanakosin), you can take the Chao Phraya River Express to the Central Pier where you can op on the BTS at Saphan Taksin station. When it's hot, the Chao Phraya River offers some coolness. By standing near the water, that is. I would not recommend swimming!
White Orchid Curise. This is an Awesome experience and White Orchid cruise is the best with THB 900. Which is included Hotel Pick and drop. Nice Dinner with Musical engagement

Don't just believe. I did my homework and was ready to take the orange water taxi service to Wat Mahatat as it is really cheap at flat rate of THB 15/pax . I took the BTS to Saphan Taksin station and walked 5 mins to the pier. There were 2 jettys, one for tourist at Thb 300/pax and the local jetty to your left. The guy selling the tourist tickets was trying hard to sell his tickets and when I asked him where were the orange taxis , he said it is a very long wait of 1 HR as it was a Sunday and there will be many stops. His boat service is express. Don't be fooled by his lies. I went over to the other jetty which was just adjacent but a little hidden. There were a lot of locals and some well informed tourists waiting for the water taxis. In less than 10 mins, the water taxis arrived. By the time , my water taxi left, the salesman's so called express water taxi had not even arrived. I enjoyed the local orange service as I had the chance to visit several piers along the way and saw some lovely sights. Go for the orange water taxis .

Taxi boats are a good deal. Find the taxi service on the river - it is a good way to get places or just to sit and watch the river traffic. It is cheap and easy to get on and off when ever you want. Nice way to get to Royal Palace.

Connecting the CITY. It helps to connect different part with the help of boats . It is fun for traveller and it is very cheap which makes it affordable for every one . Please check the time limit which is 7pm @ Last boat from the information i got from locals .

another view of Bangkok. Great to run away from bangkok traffic, don't see the colour of the water.. just feel the fresh air of Bangkok river. you can choose the usual boat and the luxury one to travel around. Make sure you get the right pier, there's a tuktuk scam that make you to rent a personal boat with high price with a regular service, so awful...

Beautiful architectural views. The views of old and new, make going down the Chao Phraya River an excellent choice for a couple hours. There are river taxis, private boats and river tours you can take. It is well worth it, many shops, hotels and restaurants along the river. My kids loved it! Some of the hotels have their own riverboat, free for use, make sure to check.

Stick to the regular boats. Many of Bangkok's best hotels are on the river, and if you are near a boat stop it makes getting round the city much easier. Some of the hotels have their own shuttle boats to take you to a stop or near to a Skytrain station. There are tourist boats but there is no need to use one, the regular boats provide a cheap and reliable service. A good trip is to take a boat all the way to the northern terminus; get off and have a beer or a snack, them get a boat back. The dinner boats which run in the evening cater for all tastes, the clientele are mainly Asian. Not sure of their hygiene standards. Most of the riverside hotels utilise their frontage, usually having a restaurant or bar by the water.

Amazing. To view the River you gotta get the Chao Phraya Tourist Boat. You can get a 1 day river pass for 150 Thai Baht and use the boats from 0930 - 1730 as much as you like. Definitely worth it.Easy to follow free guide (when you purchase a day pass). You can embark/disembark at Phra Arthit Pier - Wang Lang Pier - Maharaj Pier - The Tien Peir - Pak Klong Talad Pier - Ratcha-wongse Pier - Si Phraya Pier - Oriental Pier and Central Pier.The piers are set up within walking distance to some amazing tourist spots. The Grand Palace and Wat Phra Kaew (Emerald Bhudda is also here), Chinatown, Flower market, Museum of Siam, Wat Arun and Khao San Road to name just a few.Definitely recommend using the boats to see all there is to see on the Choa Phraya River.
Very Expensive Trip by Snake Boat. The boats travels through a Highly polluted canal to the Chao Phraya River.On the way you can see old buildings and new constructed buildings.

River with good transport network. Other cities should learn how a river and its network of canals can be used effectively for a good local as well as inter city network of transportation. Chao Paraya river is a gift of god to the city of Bangkok. Not ver clean though.

Chao Phraya Princess Dinner cruise. Great experience and great service. Booked for a couple and they come and pick you up from your hotel. The river cruise is for about 2Hrs with International buffet and music.

Used the ferry to see it.. We brought a day pass and hopped on/off at various attractions.It was a public holiday so there were lots of Thai as well as overseas tourists. Staff at the docks were helpful if approached.

Did I go to the wrong river?. I must have gone to a different river to some of the people posting on here because what I found was smelly, dirty and filled with rubbish. The boats, although a lifeline for the locals and cheap, are overcrowded and noisy. The only thing worse was the lack of air conditioning and the amount of rubbish washed up from the brown waters. I would not go again if I could help it.
It is good option to do. Not the cleanest one but nice views you can catch. I recommend around sunset time. Here Bangkok is hot so better to afternoon.

Boat transits. This is a nice way to all of the high rise buildings and the water markets of Bangkok. An experience never to forget as this type of experience cannot be found in any South African city or town.

Dinner cruise delight!. We booked a dinner cruise with one of the companies that offer this service on the Chao Praya River. What a wonderful evening cruising up and down the river for 2 hours taking in the sites and sounds, the smells and the gentle breeze to offset the humidity. We cruised the river on the "Grand Pearl" and enjoyed a 5 course meal while enjoying the live entertainment and at the same time seeing the Grand Palace from the river at night, all lit up. We passed under the spectacular new Rama VIII bridge and took in all the sights of the city skyline at night from the vantage point of the river. Of course there are quite a few other boats on the river, many decorated and lit up making it almost feel like a fantasy cruise. Great evening! Wonderful memory! Highly recommend it.

a great way to see the city. This has to be a great way to see many of Bangkok's landmarks .Take a long tail boat or a ferry to see the most of the city from the river.It is easy to get on and off the ferries and not expensive,the staff are very friendly on the ferries and will point out most of the main points for you,it is a great way to get great photos of most of the temples from the river

"The best river to see and view". The view from riverbank so increcible and awesome for nature lover. The boat services are good and have many pier and easy to reach there. Value for your money and recommend you to come Bangkok!!!!

Great way to travel around the city. We used Chao Phraya Express as our main mode of transportation while sightseeing in Bangkok. Inexpensive, pretty efficient, no traffic, connects you with all the main tourist sites.River itself is quiet fascinating with incredible amount of tourist boats, dinner cruises, long tail boats, even occasional cargo boats. Stay in the hotel on the river like Sheraton Royal Orchid for hustle free transport.
Chao Phraya river cruise experence!. Its my suggestion to visitors to take a ride on or before Sunset for beat views of Chao Phraya River.

A lifeline for locals. I travelled the river for a short distance and I must say I was pretty impressed with its network. Many foreigners including locals use this route as its cheapest. Its cramped during peak hours.
Quite and Serene. enjoy morning and evening walks if your hotel is nearby.View of this river is relaxing from hotels..
Fun on the river!. We took a boat on the river and traveled back and forth to Temples and more! It was so much fun! The river was so busy and quite amazing. Don't miss this fun!

Use the water taxi boat from taksin bridge 100Baht. The best way to view the river is to get the BTS to Taksin bridge then get the boat from Taksin bridge up to Khao san road then you will see the full river for 100 Baht cheaper than any "tour". If you go before 11 am the water taxi is free, to get workers off the road. See photos there is a map of the river boat and its stops.Beware of a friendly guy dressed smartly hanging around at the boat stop, trying to get people involved in the infamous Bangkok gem scam- google it and you will see how it works.
An enjoyable afternoon cruising the river. Lots to see on a float down this river! Makes for a relaxing afternoon in an otherwise CRAZY and chaotic city!

Awesome. We stayed opposite Wat Arun (Sunset Temple). At a small boutique hotel " Arun Residence". Their bar looked straight across the river at Wat Arun....oooh yeah Baby ... Buzz of an ancient view ...chilling on G and T with the wife....oooh yeah....The river boats go up and down the river....there are regular stops....start at the BTS Station "Thaksin Bridge". We spent three days on the river; the Grand Palace, Markets, old architecture, modern hotels and cool boutiques. We wandered ate and enjoyed the feel and ambience of this historical river. Research the river stops on Uncle Google, the river will enchant you and change your view of Bangkok forever.

dinner cruise with white Orchid . booked a dinner cruise from trip advisor one person around 1500 baht for 2.5 hours (inclusive dinner with live band and cabaret show, hotel pick up and drop off) . overall what to expect is the environment and dinner on cruise. the scenery at night is full of lights especially on the temple area. good for romantic date, anniversary dinner

Take the Riverside Cruise service. . An Aussie, a Vietnamese, and I picked the Riverside Cruise service that is available at the Sheraton Riverside Pier.
We cruised all the way up river and enjoyed the sunset from the boat with a couple of beers.
It was worth every moment!

Try it you will enjoy the trip. As part of our tour with Urban Adventures we had a long tail boat ride on the river and through the canals.
The ride was a blast and the river amazingly busy with working craft and tour boats.
You need to be reasonably agile to get on and off the boats

A very busy hardworking traffic way. At any given time there is always a multitude of boat traffic on this river, boats, ferries, tugs travelling up and down, then the hotel guest boats constantly criss crossing...its an entertainment just watching the manoeuvres. The hotel guest boats provide an insight to the river traffic, but you may like to travel as a local and use a river ferry to travel to the various points of interest, Grand Palace, Chinatown etc. Cheap, regular schedule and a great way too get the feel for Bangkok.
Hangover location. You can not visit Bangkok and not see the river, life starts there!!! buy a tiket in a waterbus and go around! feed fish and enjoy a drink in the river

Fantastic ride on a boat. Although it was a motor boat, it was fashioned Thai style and it was a long trip. We were a big group travelling to a small jetty-restaurant and this boat ride was well worth it. Especially if taken in the late evening when the sky is just turning dark with all the lights and views of interesting housing along the banks. Really enjoyed it
world class dinner cruise. Great Dinner cruise on the river Chaophraya where you will get variety of food be it Indian or any international Cuisine.

Overated. The river is very much famed on travel blogs and sites taking into account the dinner cruise that operate on it. While I chose to give the dinner cruise a miss altogether other opinions that suggest travel by the river for the experience are highly flawed. The river is very dirty and the boats are very crowded.

Touristic area but hopefully they improve the conditions of most piers. This river is connected to most tourist spots and hotels and restaurants where you can enjoy but as you can see, most of the piers condition are bad and not clean.Sometimes I wonder on what basis can they know that a certain boat is already over loaded because i doubt that these boats have a way of knowing the total weight. This is for safety reasons for all passengers. Most of the time the boats are full and you will be lucky if you ever get a seat

Bangkok's life giver. When my mother visited Bangkok 45 years ago, she went everywhere that was to be seen and did everything that she needed to do by boat. Today it is hard, for the tourist, between a market and a mall to see the life of Bangkok in the tiny and large interconnected channels and the impact that still has in the city.Our guide took us to a private ride through the channels. The houses backing to it, the place where the old floating market was, the impossible to count different temples that have well taken care docks for the visitors, the fish, the plants....Don't miss it!

Cheap, travel as the local!. This is the best and cheapest way to travel around Bangkok Old City. You get on a ferry and stop between places without having to go through traffic jams. Most locals also prefer to travel this way. So, just do what the local do to get the best bang of your money!
its the main river. Its the most important river in Bangkok. There are a lot of different boats. You can take them from downtown til the temples.

Funny hours at Chao Phraya River with Cruises Tour.... We took cruise tour for evening time at 20:00.. Its 2 hrs tour on the River and good to see Bangkok Riverside evening time.. Cruise tour with open buffet dinner and live performance... We spent good time
nothing to see. avoid trips in private boats as they are ripoffs. nothing interesting on the mail canal, just a way to get places.

FILTHY BUT GOOD WAY TO SEE BANGKOK. The river is filthy with trash and god knows what else they have thrown in it. I did see a clean up boat with two people trying to net trash but it is really sad to see the natives throwing trash in it. Great way to get to all the tourist attractions or just to view the buildings along the river.. I wouldn't let the spray from the wake hit my face, eyes, or nose if I were you, as you may wind up sick. That is how bad it is. The tourist boat is faster but cost more at 150 baht per day ($4.21) unlimited travel. Much cheaper to take a public taxi boat and pay per trip at about 39 cents per trip one way. boat. It takes awhile to see each attraction so generally better to use the public boat and pay as you go.

Nice and interesting but very very VERY dirty!. The view at the river is really nice and the small cruise was interesting with the various and very different buildings at its banks. But it is so unbelievably, disgusting dirty, if you look in it. It is brown and we saw garbage, clothes, feces, even a really big dead snake.

Nice experience. If you plan to see the river you must see the old town. It's outstanding that a lot of house are still there. And feeding the fish is quite an experience, huge fish and very colorful. Definitely recommend.
Cruising. I think this is a must thing to do.. Buffet dinner was heaps, and i love the entertainment on board.

Be careful ! . If you decide to do a boat tour I suggest that you stay on the Chao Phraya river. Maybe a night cruise with dinner. Be careful if you go on a tour going in the canals. There is not much to see. Poor people houses living in questionable conditions compare to the modern city. The water is very poluted and the smell is not pleasant, especially when the temperature is 38c. The main river is interesting and the sky line is very nice. Stay there.

Loved it. I travelled with my family. My kids really enjoyed it. Food is good. Photos are costly. But I purchased it coz it came well. Lower deck glasses are very blur, so i couldn't able to view it. All together it was nice. Please play some Tamil songs too.

A cool way to see the city. On my last few times in Bangkok I have been using the Chao Phraya river to see the city....and its so convenient, easy to use and quick! Besides of course the thrill of having the cool wind in your face and the spray from the water creating delightful patterns alongside is an added bonus!I would usually take one of the river boats from the Sathorn pier. Each boat has either a yellow/orange/blue or green flag on it which tells you where its going to stop. There is usually a map of the river route on display somewhere on the pier and it would be good to check that first so that you know for sure that the boat you take will stop on the pier you want! The orange flag boats stop at most piers, I think. Tickets are about 15 bhat and can be bought on the boat itself.Using the river boats I could visit Wat Arun, Wat Po, the Grand Palace,the flower market,China Town, Pahurat, Oriental pier, Asiatique and many other places. The river itself is beautiful with so many kinds of vessels plying on it...there are large barges and cruise ships as well as small fishing boats, long tail boats, the river express boats and of course the various ferries which criss cross the river. Loved the river.....

A city for a river and a river for a city. Whichever way u put it the importance of each other cannot be summed up. Chaophraya would have been incomplete without Bangkok and vice versa. It's amazing how a city has grown up around a river and the same city has made it look amazing. With dazzling heights around it, dazzling bridges on it and the city has utilised all of its banks to perfection. The transportation on the river is perfect and enviable. Chaophraya and Thais have a deep rooted love. And why not. It's impossible to sum up Chaophraya, there r so many things to do on it and so many ways to use it. It is not really a "Thing to do". It has to be celebrated. I suggest, come to Chaophraya some day, not just Bangkok.

If you can overlook the filth it's amazing. Yesterday I traveled up and down the Chao Phraya river for at least two hours. I had read some reviews here prior and was ready for the smell and the amount of rubbish and if you can look past that.... it's a great way to see alot of Bangkok. I, like others, boarded at the Central Terminal which is reached from skytrain Taksin station. Previous reviews listed a day trip ticket on the blue boats as costing 120baht, yesterday it was 150baht so I decided to skip that one and use the orange boats. At 14 baht per ride I didn't think I would be getting on and off ten times to justify the blue boat. In the end it was three rides so I came out well ahead.My first stop from the Central Terminal was the Grand Palace area. Very easy to spot, I don't even know the name of the stop (there are two you can use, one before and one after) but the Palace is easily visible and you just get off at the next stop. Didn't actually end up going to the palace, but I did see the reclining Buddha.... pretty cool and absolutely no crowds (a nice peaceful few hours, NOTE feet are still undergoing renovation). I got back on the boat and headed all the way to the end. The scenery is great, wooden houses almost falling in the river, garrishley coloured houses next door and highrises behind. Throw in numerous temples and Buddha statues and well... there is plenty to see! After reaching the end, I got off the boat, bought some candied peanuts and got on the next boat departing. On my way back I had the opportunity to get up close and personal with the giant catfish. THEY ARE ENORMOUS!! and there seems to be thousands if not tens of thousands of them boiling below the surface and coming up for bread thrown in. All in all I can highly recommend a bit of river cruising. It's chilled out, it's a great way to be amused by the chaos of the river and it's cheap! Oh and it's a bit cooler on the river too.

See the river- one of best activities in Bangkok. Taking a ride down the river is one of the absolutely best activities for sight seeing in Bangkok. You do not need to go all the way to the floating market or any other tourist attractions. We paid 1200 baht for a one hour boat ride up and down the river. It was perfect for the kids. It held their interest and was well worth it. They boat operator tried to charge 3000 baht for one hour, probably because it was low season. When I let him know I had visited Thailand many times and know better, the price became 1200. Be warned also about the floating merchants that paddle out to your long boat. They are friendly, but will charge you 300 baht for one beer. Bring your camera, a bottle of water and make sure you use the bathroom beforehand, then go for a ride on the river. It is very, very interesting. Just make sure them weather forecast is favorable.

Definitely the best way to see Bangkok. We bought a one day river pass on the Chao Phraya Tourist boat for 150B (about £3) There are about 9 stops that you can hop on and off to see over 30 of the main sights located along the river including the Grand Palace, Wat Pho, The Temple of Dawn, the flower market and the Royal Barge Museum. It's a lovely cool way to get about and if you get tired feet you needn't get off at all. And best of all there's a toilet on board! I'd definitely recommend it, especially if you only have a couple of days in Bangkok.
Nice way to cool down. When you are hot this is a great way to cool off. Take one of the river taxis from Sapan Taxing up the river to the Grand Palace or Kaosan Road.

a worthwhile visit for tourists. It used to be a vital transportation route for the locals; and is still widely used by locals to access riverside destination. The river boat between pier 1 and 15 is very popular for tourists alike, and you can try out the longtail boat as well, or join one of the dinner cruises which sail along the river.
Nice. It is o.k if you wanna travel a little in the water and to see some buildings It will be best in the evening cuz of the lights but in general it is o.k not that exciting

Nice boat ride . I would suggest others to try the canal tour by orange boat. Very cheaper and nice. We got down at saphin taskin station by sky train and just down the station was the ferry station. We took the orange boat and got down at N9 station. And saw emerald buddha- and went to wat pho and after finishing wat pho we took the orange boat again and reached the station.it costs only 15 baht for a person. It very cheaper. We need to wait for fifteen to twenty minutes for the boat. We enjoyed the boat ride and had a nice river view of Bangkok
Good view and god take care. Looks great from the boat as a river view.. the river side looks alive with restaurant and bar. We can see that they take care the river also have police patrol.

Special Place. There is something quite amazing about this dirty river. It's not massively wide but there is such a variety of things happening here. I always stay at the mandarin Oriental which is one of its great attractions and as a result use the river taxis to travel around the old town and the hotel boat to get to the Sky Train Station at Taksin Bridge. All of the main temples such as Wat Pho, Royal Palace and Wat Arun are on the river along with Pak Lo market and numerous other attractions. It's really worth hiring a long boat and going into the canal system to see how the working people of Bangkok really live.

GOOD FOR A RIDE. The river seems to be a bit well maintained now then since my last visit. If you are visiting Bangkok then do take a boat ride along the river, all the major historical attractions are along the riverside and it's also very cheap.

Not ride it. The River May be a good way to transferência to one point to another but it is extremelly confusing to use the Ferry service and i couldnt get much attention from any of the employees. Plus the River is very poluted

Dirty. We had a great tour guide who was very sweet. The boat was a typical Asian river-type boat that can be found across south east Asia. Our boat was a bit more quiet than most as the engine was not exposed (those type are very loud). The people we saw along the river were very pleasant and happy ..waiving to us and cheering as we drove the 1.5 journey. The river is extremely dirty, filled with trash, and when other boats would pass us quickly, there would be an awful stench from the bottom of the river..there was trash in or along most of the river..it doesn't provide a thorough tour of the city, but def provides exposure to some poorer neighborhoods around Bangkok..the best part was we saw many water minotaur, which is a cross between an alligator and a Komodo dragon

It's starting to look cleaner. Travelled on a river transport boat yesterday and it was a pleasant experience. Last time I was close to The Chao Phraya River was in 2005 and from my hotel room I could see that it was being used for a rubbish dumping ground. Yesterday's experience was pleasurable, extremely interesting. On my next visit to Bangkok, I would not hesitate to involve myself more with the famous river.

Must do thing in Bangkok. I have been in Bangkok many times and I never get tired of a boat trip at Chao Phraya River and the klongs. You need minimum two hours to cruise around and make a stop at one of the local restaurants for an ice coffee. When you are here you can make a stop to see the Royal boats. It is interesting to see and cost only 100 bath. We paid 2500 bath for our own boat (6 adult and 1 child) but the price is the same no matter how many you are. We paid 200 bath to the boat man for 1/2 hour extra.

Awesome cruise by Princess Chao Phraya. We took Princess Chao Phraya cruise in the evning and it was approximately a 2 hour activity. Lot of dance and music with Indian food served. It was an awesome experience and a must to visit with the family. Nice view of bangkok as well.

Enjoy the Ride. First, we crossed the river after we went from Wat Phra Kaew (Emerald Buddha) to Wat Arun (Temple of Dawn). In the morning, the view is just so-so. At night, the view is spectacular! We were having a dinner cruise (not a fine dining, just a dinner buffet) while we were crossing the river for 2 hrs. The atmosphere was very nice. And after we had finished our dinner, the MC invited us to the dance floor, and played some dance music from each of the guests country.

RIVER CRUISE. Must do to check out all of the city at night. It's a treat for the eyes to check out all the massive hotels and skyscrapers lit up as well as temples and grand palaces that dot either side of the river banks. Make sure the boat is a big one so you get an elevated view.
Nice trip. Don't expect for a clear water River but it's can take you around Bangkok it's a way of transportation and a very good experience

Best way to get around Bangkok. If you don't want to experience being stuck in a horrible Bangkok traffic jam then the Chao Phraya River is your way to go. The ferry boats travelling back and forth along the river cuts so much travel time and makes it easier to explore the tourist destinations around the city. Riding their commuter boats (not the tourist boats which costs way higher than other lines) make you feel like a local. It can get crazy in crowded ferry terminals but it's easy to learn their river boat system and navigate your way as you go. It's fairly cheap at TBT14 one way per person.
Water is dirty, at night is calm. Nothing great to see. Water is dirty and not very clean. At night is very peaceful and would recommend just chilling at night along the river.

Excellent transport. We decided to try the river rather than more Bangkok traffic. Worked perfectly. My wife was concerned about the chop but the boat was very stable and she had no trouble with motion sickness. Easy to get on and off, many of the sites are just along the river. Quick connection to the BTS too. Others have commented mom the day pass which I would use next time touring Bangkok.

Really fun - grab one of the cheap river taxis. Avoid the overpriced tourist tours – instead hop on one of the river taxis/express boats (each boat has a different coloured flag, and in each of the stops you'll find an information board telling you which colours stop at which places). It can seem confusing at first, but that's half the fun.On the majority of the boats you will pay when you're on board, so don't worry if you can't find anywhere to pay beforehand at your particular stop.Saphan Taksin BTS Skytrain station is a very easy destination to aim for if you're staying in the city – you can hop on the express boat here which gives you a great overview of the river and can drop you off up the river at Tha Tien, which is the closest for Wat Pho and Wat Arun temples.
night river cruise. We went on a night river cruise on one of the excursion yachts, lovely buffet meal and entertainment, the lights and sights on the river at night are stunning

Lovely. The river transport system is free and reliable as well as such a lovely way to get around. The river however is polluted and is also of course a working river. All the barges being pulled by quaint little tug boats was entertains to watch. I believe 45 minutes up from the Anatara hotel one hits the rural areas. Would love to do that trip one day.

Buy the Chao Phraya One-Day Pass!. Go upstream or downstream for a whole day with the Chao Phraya One-Day Pass. Definitely a good value for money of you're planning on temple hopping and then a few shopping.You can go temple hopping in the morning. There are lots of temples that you can go to using the Chao Phraya express. the One-day pass ticket comes with a guided map of when and where to get off to see what temples. My suggested route would be Wat Pho -> Wat Arun -> Grand Palace for temples. Then at around 4PM you can go straight to Asiatique for a little bit of shopping and end the day at Khao San for food and more shopping

Must do. Get an all day pass and take a day circling bangkok on the chao praya river. Interesting perspective of bangkok and watching how bangkok uses the river to get around. We use a boat to travel up to nonthaburi. There are many tourist spots to stop at along the way. I regret never trying an evening dinner cruise.

Amazing City View if you take a river Tour. The river making the life line of Bangkok offers and amazing and welcoming cool essence to the fellow travelers.My advise must take a boat ride and you/ll really feel relaxed especially after sunset.

Cheap way to view the city. Taking a boat on the Chao Phraya was a great way to see the mix of Buddhist temples and modern skyscrapers. It was also a wonderful medley of people watching with Buddhist monks, students, tourists, and workers.

Cheap ride up and down the river. Great way to see some nice places... take the BTS SKYTRAIN to the river and hop on the ferry kind of boat. .. super cheap and it stops at loads of places including the grand palace

A must "ride" in Bangkok. A very good way to discover the city while traveling almost hassle free between tourist sites is to use the bus boats. It's not very fast, even though it can be faster than hailing a taxi during rush hours, but allows to go the Thai way and admire nice buildings on its banks. And it's so cheap.

Expected more grandeur..... Taking a boat ride with the local line (orange flag) is cheap and you dont know where you will end up because they dont call out the station. However, i still liked the break in between walking in the heat. Ride the boat and catch your breath. You dont really see much of the Grand palace but you see Wat Arun. We accidentally took the ride to the last stop which is some kind of little suburb or town neat Bangkok where they also sell cheap clothes.
Good for a short boat trip.. Good for a short boat trip on a hot and humid afternoon. Or you can easily combine it with a visit of Wat Arun.

Great Way to See the City. If you can take a tour boat of the river boat by the sky train or at any point along the river and get some great shots of the city from the boat and this is stunning and a must as it is inexpensive and a great way to get the lay of where the main tourist attractions are
Fabulous. My wife and I were there on may 17th, It was really scenic, the cruise was perfect and we had dinner there. It was really nice and memorial. I recommend it to every one.
Great old city tour. If you want a hassle free tour of the old city, do not miss the boat tour. The boat tour offers views of colonial buildings such as the customs office and old bank building.

Skip the tourist boat. For about 20 BHT, you can boat up the river and see the sights as long as you have your map and guide book with you. Take the sky train to Taksin station and board the "express boat " Near Wat Arun you can take a ferry across for a mere 3 BHT
Excellent Cruise Dinner. It's a very good Cruise Dinner. The cruise is very neat and clean. I liked the dinner menu -Excellent. Specially the sea food menu.The music was also very good.
sight city. relaxing time over the river taking photos and see the river pass over the city such as great time !!

River cruise with dinner on board- party time. A fun place to visit , taking river cruise and dinner with good live music. Real party time combined with relaxation of soft sailing river cruise; nice experience furnished with pleasant memories. Must take one whenever visiting bangkok.

Best wat to get to old town but watch for scams. Really good and cheap way to get to old city but please make sure you don't let some locals to fool you and take one of this small boats as they are very expensive and they will rip you of. Take the public boat from one of the BTS stations near river which you can hop on and of - best way to get around most top attractions.

Real Bangkok!. A trip on the river really gives one an idea of the importance of this river to Bangkok.It can be a tug pulling up to 4 barges filled with metal bars, sand or who knows. Maybe a gaudy tourist boat full of gawping visitors. Always the speedy ferry boats with their distinctive flags of blue, orange, etc distinguishing from which piers they pick up. And then of course the long-tail boats with huge wake shaking everything up as they speed along this highway. In between all this are the local cross river ferries weaving their way from side to side.But it's not only on the river but beside it that one can experience true Bangkok. From Chinatown, try walking down the little side streets & passages to discover hidden temples, shrines & statues overlooking the river.Take one of the cross river ferries to escape from the tourists & wander through a typical street market, discovering fruits you've never seen before. Try Thai specialities like dipping warm, soft bread into smooth, green cream, actually delicious, especially when accompanied with a freshly-squeezed iced lemon juice!That's true Bangkok!!
Nice to take a longboat. Take a longboat and they can show you the floating market. That is if you're willing to getup early in the morning. They can take you to some wat's and other nice places.

Cheap River Trip. Rather than take a tourist boat just jump on one of the many "River Taxis" which travel up and down the river all day long during daylight hours, the colour of the flag on the boat denotes the destination and there is usually a board in each boat station which will explain this or look on their website.It is a very cheap way to get up and down the river with a trip from Taksin terminal to Khaosan Road area costing only 13 Baht and taking 30 minutes.It is also more refreshing being on the water and a good way to see or visit many of the temples and smart riverside plazas and hotels.

Different view of Bangkok and great way to discover places. I personally like it a lot! Especially to go further away from a central Bangkok and discover new hidden places!Also, the view on Bangkok and people's life by the river is very interesting.If you are in Bangkok, this is a must have to do and experience;)
Good View. It is not that geart but yes, we had gone to temples via Chao phraya river, found that journey was more than average.

Riverside. We stayed at a river side hotel. The river is like a busy road loads of boats going up and down. The water buses are a great traffic free way to get around the city. We did a day and night cruise along the river both of which were stunning. You can see all the bigs sites as you go down river as well as many temples.

Bankok Grand Palace. We took the River Ferry from central pier to the Grand Palace (about eight stops). This is a good way to see what is around ; China town, The Mandarin Oriental Hotel, the Grand Palace etc. You can pay for your ticket at the pier and get the ferry as many times as you like.

Fast transport from Wat Pho to Taksin. I paid 40baht as opposed to the smaller and faster 14 baht boats. But still some good views. However the signage was lacking. You queue up than pay an the boat. Still easy fast way to get to the S line.

Good views of the city. Use the tourist riverboat, which is cheap and provides good links to the main sites. An all day ticket only costs approx £3.You can also take a long boat and we paid £10 for a one hour trip around the back canals to see a different angle of Bangkok.

Beutiful night view of the most important Thai river. The most important river of Thailand that has origin from 4 small rivers : Ping , Wang , Yom and Nan. It's pass through from central region of Thailand to Bangkok. Most beutiful sunset scene that you can have dinner beside river or you can see sparking light of sky and stars from having dinner on the river cruise.

Beautiful boat tour. We hired a boat for ourselves (6persons) and had relaxing boats tour. Most interesting are the little side channels of the Chao Phraya River. You can see many Thai houses built over the water and the local kids are waiving to you.

Loud speaker guy but enjoyable boat ride. We took the river boat city transit to go from bts to grand temple. There is a 'tour guide' with a microphone chatting away about nothing... Which was loud and annoying except for when he told us about passing points of interest, historic facts and stories. The river is beautiful, definitely a nice way to see the city and big temples!

A great way how to travel around Bangkok. Catching a boat on the Chao Phraya River is a great way, how to travel around Bangkok, especially during the hot days in April and May. With the public boat you can visit a lot of places for around 10 baht. Or just jump on the boat, let yourself cool down with the fresh river breeze and watch the busy city life from a bit of a distance. You can also hire a private boat for around 1000 baht per hour to take you around the canals of Bangkok.

Life of the capital. The running capital Bangkok take a break at the river. And in modern time also the way this river serves the perpose is commendable. Transport, beauty, and life this river is the backbone of the city.
Old and New. So many shiny new buildings, but th real charm are the classic hotels and old timber boats still plying the river trade.

Good value. There are two different ferry companies The local ferry you pay on board -14 batt for one stop or six stopsThe tourist ferry you pay at the kiosk - 40 batt ! Again this gist is for one stop or if you want to go 6 stops. There are stops all along the way to china town, Siam centre, river village etc where you can jump off and exploreThe price of the two different ferry's is the cost for staying on one end to the other of the river or for each stop We used the boat trip initially (1000 batt for two people) then tried the tourist boat to get information and the next day used the local 14 batt boat. Choose which ferry you want or the Thai people might choose for you.

Worth it for the breeze alone!. There are rivers within cities which blow you away. This one is okay, and worth it if you just want to get a little cooler for a few minutes. The boats are safe, reliable and cheap. From Taksin Bridge to Wat Pho for just 14B/person (children free). Also a good way to sight see cheaply by taking the ride from north to south or vice versa. WARNING: You will see lots of boat operator telling you to 'walk this way', or 'where are you going?, You must buy ticket'. They sound like public transport officials. THEY ARE NOT! Just say 'public transport' and they will leave you alone. Don't bother with the cheap looking 150B all-day travel plan.

Interesting way to travel and cheap..... Most historical monuments or points of interest can be access by boat though the Chao Phraya River. My girlfriend and I purchased a day pass (Baht 150).. it is a very inexpensive way to travel and the boats stop very often.
Dinner cruise. Had a Dinner cruise of 1000 BHT . the views are great which highlights the incredible contrasts of Bangkok from Million dollar mansions to small wooden houses
Nice to relax. After the insane palace visit we took the boat up and back down the river. This was lovely but it took about 1 and 1/2 hours so get off sooner if u want a shorter ride.

Great evening. definitely worth the visit. Was lovely to see all the temples etc. The bots passing and the lit up temples are a different perspective of Bangkok. It was a nice way to rest after walking all over.
Feeling the breeze in the hot weather. Give you a sense of luxury when you have to catch a shuttle boat staffed with uniform to your hotel.

Great Boat ride to view Bongkok from the River, Thailand!. The ride start in one side of the River and takes you all around the city of Bangkok, Thailand. Magnificent view with the trees, flowers and artistic colorful cabanas along the way. you definitely will enjoy this cool ride after been around the city with the temperatures around 90F to 100F. Fun ride!
Better at night time !. If you want to visit, best to do at night time on a river cruise. Certainly not during daytime, the river has nothing to see.

Nice time pass. If u went with families with friends with decent numbers u'll definitely enjoy the river cruise here. The river is quite not good to see in daylight, but once u get into the cruise by evening it seems nice to spend quality time with your group :-)

Bangkok from the River. A unique way to see an interesting side of Bangkok: either hustle through the numerous, often congested ferries of commuting locals (colourful and really cheap); or take the less bustling (usually) tourist boats (with semi-comprehensible recitation commentaries); or hire your own small long-tailed motor boat and speed around; or take one of the many organised Chayo Phraya boat tours which include an on-board meal, past plush hotels, wats and monasteries, churches, fish-feeding frenzies, floating marketeers, grime and pollution, and an array of faces of Thai river life.

Lovely views of the city . Definitely take a river boat it's another aspect to the city. Ty to stop off at a bar or river over looking the river. We visited two temples by the river and watched the sunset from one of the roof top bars
great experience. Jump on and off at any pier. Whether you are visiting temples or dining out, shopping or just killing time.I like to get off at less popular piers and go exploring.

Boat trip . We hired a boat ( just two of us so if you can try to gather bigger group) and it was a memorable trip. Had to brace ourselves at times as the speed was quote has high but it only made it better. Outstanding very views of the old and modern Bangkok.Canal houses... Fish feeding etc
different view on bangkok. just take one of the express boats on chao praya river. costs 15 thai baht and you can go all the way. beautiful view of bangkok. and no traffic jam.
Pleasant experience. Had a dinner at the cruise for 1000 baht. Os a little experience considering the quality of food but the river experience and music made it worthwhile.

Relaxing cruise.. We took a cruise on the river on a boat with a smorgasbord meal and entertainment one night. The temple lights at night were beautiful to look at. It was a really enjoyable evening and interesting to see all the other lit up boats cruising by. We only managed a brief sit next to the river on one day and wish we could have spent longer as there was lots of fish action and some amazing looking barges cruising down the river.

Fantastic Experience. Did a dinner cruise on the Chao Phraya. There are a few to choose from. Great night time scenery of the city and the food was perfect with live performers. Very romantic for a couple or date night. For the money it was a great experience.
Heavenly experiences. Thailand is a modern society and the scrupulously clean sky train is symbolic of Bangcock who are very polite unless you are carrying drugs

Different ends of the socioeconomic spectrum. Board one of the many boats that do the hour trip up & back along the river. It was hard to sometimes make sense of the beautiful temples, shiny hotels & function areas & then just a few meters away, the desperation of poverty & ruins. The houses on the water are either in very good order or the absolute polar opposite. For me, to see such a broad spectrum was at times difficult to digest. Such an interesting ride if you get the chance. Some amazing architecture, incredibly intricate. There are even fish along the way that will come to the surface for a free feed! Haha, everything is for sale in Thailand! Everything has a price. There are quite a few cruises that go up the river that include lunch etc etc. Do make sure you check the prices before agreeing to the trip! Good luck!

The Legendary Chao Phraya River. The Legendary Chao Phraya River is being surrounded by historic architecture like Wat Arun and the Royal Palace. It is also surrounded by world class hotels and the iconic Asiatique Riverfront. It is the city's holy river and bring livelihood to many locals. A river that you cannot miss when you are in Bangkok.

Bustling activities by the Chao Phraya River aka "The Venice of the East". The urban Chao Phraya River remains evocative with bustling activities on both sides of the river. It's not surprising as tens of thousand of people utilize the ferry services on a daily basis. The muddy water may look like there are no ecosystems in it but it's still filled with fishes and maybe some hidden treasures as far back as during the Ayutthaya era.The most busy pier would be at the Sathorn Pier where you'll get 5 local boat lines operated by the Chao Phraya Express Boat Service (Check out the schedule in the photo below). To get to the pier, just disembark at BTS Saphan Taksin and walk towards Exit 2. There will be a sign showing you the direction to those express boats. If you are free for some shopping and dining, there's also the free boat shuttle to Asiatique - The Riverfront.

Nothing much to see in this river!. This is my 1st visit to this famous river in BKK but rather disappointed especially in the night as there is nothing to see on buildings. River both sides nothing much too but we need to travel on the boat to Asiatique..

Easiest way to do temple visit. The river is not a typical nature river where water is clear and people can swim. The river is mainly use for transport. A good way to travel from Saphan Taksin to different temples in the city (temple of dawn, reclinimg buddha, and the Grand Palace). Other shopping areas are also accessoble from this river. Though the water is not clear, the river is generally clean

The river is clean. Chao Phraya river at night is so wonderful. It provides the Bangkok City Lights.
There are several cruise sailing across the river.
heart of Thailand. love getting on the river, get on the river boat at tapsin snakim and jump on and off 250 bhat for the whole day.

A "cruise" in the river is mandatory.. We took one of such cruises that made a round trip also through side canals. You get to look and feel the reality of life on "the side roads" though both the river and such canals are very dirty and, in some parts, quite smelly.

River runs through the city. Depening on where you are, the river looks different. But it is the biggest river which runs through the city.
There are many places to visit and experience along the river.

Interesting . We used the orange/blue flag transit boats to travel up and down the river (originating out of the Taksin BTS station). There are maps available and the boats runs every 20 mins or so. Cheap. Dirt cheap. It's a great way to take a look at Bangkok "from the water" without dealing with the tourist express boat sales etc .....The last time I was in Bangkok was about 8 years ago and the river is significantly cleaner than it used to be.It was worth adding to our trip and tour of Bangkok - just to get a slightly different view of the city and life by the river.

Badly maintained Piers. The Chao Phraya is one of the busiest water-transport lines in Thailand, and it get busier when the hotel provide private tours for their guests. Unfortunately the water is still dirty and even though it's not producing bad smell it reduced it's value as a tourist attraction.The Piers are not well maintained. Sometimes to get to the piers the visitors must enter a crowded street with almost no visible direction sign to nearby Interresting/Important Places.

Fantastic views of the city. Took friends (including young kids) on the river. Didn't take the longboat as it seemed restrictive with respect to mobility - also some guy was trying to sell it to me for a higher price and I got irritated. Took the regular boat and it was fabulous as we could sit on seats when warranted and most of the time we spent on the prow of the boat enjoying the breeze. Views are great and round trip is one hour.

We love the River. When we are staying in Bangkok, we always opt for hotels on the Chao Phraya River. With the many boats and barges constantly going up and down, it's fascinating to watch. It's brown! and not what could be called beautiful in the traditional sense, but huge healthy fish abound and there's so much activity, it's wonderful. Breakfast beside the river is a must, and many international hotels line the riverside, with their own beautiful traditional Thai boats ferrying guests to local destinations. Water Taxis are plentiful and of course there are also the 'long tails' if you are feeling adventurous and want to take one for a private tour of the Klongs. (Often the hotels will have their preferred 'long tail' drivers, although these will be at a higher price compared to dealing direct. It must be noted though, that the hotel endorsed tours will be safe and reputable.) Bangkok is a wonderful, colourful adventure every time we go and hopping on boats on the the Chao Phraya River only adds to the experience.
Boat tour. We booked this trip ourself while walking by the rice, they wanted 3000 baht but eventually settled on 2000 baht. Good your.
Memorable. Nice place to hang out and chill. A memorable place. Try the motorcycle taxi too!When you're here, take the free shutter boat to Asiatique.
Fun filled sailing in river into ferry. This is an enjoyable ride of flowing water from heart of the city.it can a transit into ferry from one place to other or fun in cruise in evening hours

A cool breeze. We did this river cruise as part of a larger tour which included the palace and the reclining Buddha.it was a welcome relief to hop on a boat after the heat we experienced at the palace.we zoomed down the canal with a lovely breeze to cool us off.very interesting to see our Thai people live on these canals.

A day trip good idea ,a night trip better idea. i have took this trip with a french couple,around 2 pm.overall it was a good trip it was nice to see people living at the river edges in old houses you can find many mosques,churches and temples along the way.i would recommend to do a night trip instead of day.

Must cruise here !!. We took an evening cruise, and it was a lifetime experience. Beautiful building alongside river, and you also see the Grand Palace, Wat Arun etc while following the ChaoPhraya river. Cruise offer good food.

CHAO PHRAYA RIVER TOURIST BOATS. For only 150baht per day, catch a sky train to Central Pier and explore the sights at 8 different piers on a hop-on-hop-off basis on a fleet of boats. The Grand Palace, temples, shrines, museums, restaurants, shopping markets are all within easy walking distances, with the tourist booklet, provided with your ticket, giving explicit instructions how to walk to each destination.

Perhaps the most endearing memory of Bangkok would be an evening Express Boat trip on the legendary Chao Piya. Every time we have gone to Bangkok, which is over a dozen times in so many years, we always take the river trip on the Chao Piya, One can take the BTS to Taksin Bridge and from there walk to the Taksin Pier and get aboard any EXPRESS Boat. Perhaps the best run is between Taksin and Wat Pho / Grand Palace stops.
