Not only this is the cheapest, fastest, freshest and enjoyable way to travel, the photo ops, the original non touristy feel, authenticity of fellow travellers and charming thai smiles makes it a very memorable day out.BUT don't bother going for the expensive PRIVATE BOATS just stick with the public ones.

What a great way to spend an afternoon. Take a private boat from the Saphan Taxin Pier. Do not buy a ticket at the BTS station! Go down to the pier. They have great tours, very reasonable and you get to see the OLD Bangkok.
This river is impressive. Great views of the middle of the city, and also a quick way to get to your destination, if you are going to somewhere close to the river.

Quickest way to get places. Travelling by long tail boat is the quickest way ti get round bangkok. We had to travel 7 miles to get to the centre and in a taxi it took nearly and hour. If you take a boat make sure you barter with them!

Enjoyed. Me and my husband enjoyed the ferry we went to the temples through this . They have dinner cruises as well We went to most of the stations and went to shopping places like China town . The ticket prices are reasonable there is public ferry and private ones too
LOVELY RIVER SIDE. Bringing excitement and fantastic experiences in this river tours. Dinner on passenger boats, 1 to 3,4 hours journeys on boats in this river is really interesting.

Dirty but Lively. Its a very big river in the midlle of the city, very nice for boat rides. Although is very dirty its seems that is hosting very much fish and other water animals. (the bigest lizard ever) But the excursion to see floathing market and the houses next to canals is mandatory.

Chao Phraya cruise . It'll be fulfilled if spend a cool night having meal on the cruise then immerse yourself in the breezing wind of Bangkok night. The routine lasts for 2 hours including meal time. There are both day and night cruises however it'll be more dreamlike in the evening.

A step back in time.. A step back in time.
Amazing to see the boats and life as it was centuries ago. Not much has changed other than the hustle and bustle of modern life

Calm and convenient . This river has a great view from your hotel rooms and all the shuttle boats helps travelers fight the bangkok traffic and the heat. The wind helps you cool down and great restaurants and shops all along the river.

A must to see. You will enjoy the scenery of the busy river a lot of people on boats going up and down the river very exciting you get good food along the river side a lot of hotel around the area verry interesting

It's a must do!. Busy, chaotic, rather nerve racking at times but great fun. Go on one of the water taxis for a great experience at very little expense. We also hired a private water taxi and went over to the other side of the city for a trip around the canals. We hired the taxi for an hour which was quite enough for us, but if you want to get off and visit some of the temples then expect to take a couple of hours at least. A good experience and I would recommend it.

Chayo Praya River which connects bangkok. If u are In Bangkok u will have a look of this river which connects easily Bussiness of Bangkoks two ends .riverside has many restaurants Hotels but Wheel is One Attraction .There are Boats and cruises which explore the river more beautifully
simple and nice. The view is not really great, but it can be nice to take the boat and look around. Also close to every single Pier, you might find nice restaurant and shops
Grand ol River. Full of life, beautiful views. Sometimes you get that weird river smell but overall peaceful. Can never grow tired of this river.

Great cultural river. Without this river, Bangkok is not as it is. From enormous bridges to small fisherman's boats. A must do is the water taxi. Just enter like you do on train or bus. Pay on the boat a nominal fee. Extremely enjoyable, while visiting palaces, or markets or just to be on river.
River trip ......... There are piers along the river where you can purchase tickets, very helpful with some lovely views......
peek to the local city life style. Gives quite a peek to the local and how they have been living on the river banks. The manoeuvre of the boat man in the narrow lanes was amazing

Scenic, no traffic jams, filthy. How do you review a river? Well I've used the tourist express boat, and taken a cruise from up North back down into the city and the river offers unimpeded travel and great views. It highlights the incredible contrast of Bangkok sometimes displaying million dollar mansions immediately next door to wooden hovels.But if you're getting sprayed keep your mouth closed and if you ever fish anything alive out of it don't eat it. If you fall in pray you don't have any cuts on your body.

Take a boat and go visit Temple. Doing a cruise on Chao Phraya river in order to go visit some temple.. Wonderful momentOnly bad thing... comment and explanation are done in Thai linguage. Nothing in English or other linguages.

Great way to travel around. Go by the canal speed boat down the Chao Phraya River and you will see everything from giant Monitor Lizards living under neather peoples houses to the boat sellers, selling you all sorts of things from food to souveniers.We stayed in the Shangri La which is on the river and it was easy for us to get a boat to go to the Temples, excellent way to avoid the traffic.

Experience in itself.. Travelled from central pier to pier 8 to visit Wat Pho. River taxis are a breeze. Always take boat which is for public and charges 14 bhats. They are cheaper, frequent and faster. Cruising and watching life on the shores is an experience in itself. It is cheaper and time saving to travel in river taxis. River Chopraya in itself is spell binding.

Nice view of Thai life while going down the river. Part of a tour I took included a boat ride, with lunch, down the Chao Phraya River. It was a nice way to spend the day, on the water, and it was nice to see Thai life from the perspective of the river. I'd recommend this to everyone.

Chao Phraya River Journey. Bangkok city is famous with her clean and wellbuilt riverside/canal. The big river in Bangkok is Chao Phraya. You can rent a boat nearby the port river.. and it was not so expensive.. You can see and enjoy the beauty of Bangkok, Grand Royal Palace and Bangkok bridge, etc., from the boat. And in certain banks of the river/canal, you can buy food to feed the fish inside the river.. available floating store food fish there..
Beautiful and calm. It's a wide, fast-flowing river, full of various types of boats and barges. Wonderful to sit and watch it go by, but also to travel upon it

Don't go by tourist boat.... ...use the cheapest option 'express boat' and check out the city of Bangkok by boat from north to south/ south to north. Use the boats with orange flag.
Advice: Do not stand in the entrance/ exit area. Especially not in rush hour.

Our hotel overlooked this busy river.. Our hotel overlooked this busy river and we watched party boats and floating restaurants going up and down it all night . This convinced us we needed to travel on it so we opted for a water taxi the next day.I really enjoyed it and photograph many of the historical waterside buildings.

Ultimate peek to the city. The best way to get around major attractions is to travel by river boats and it would just takes mind away from the hustling of the city rush. The boat ride just summarizes the majestic city.
Great views. A boat trip is a must down this river. They will take you passed lots of temples and down to see the houses on stilts where the locals live. The city views are also great.

Certainly worth the time, but try to have a guided tour. We had a very pleasant hour on the large river bisecting Bangkok. Our one regret was not having a tour guide, but we used an excellent map to follow our progress up the river, along a tributary and then back to base.From the river you will see a number of important sites, such as Wat Arun and the King's Palace (no photos permitted), and some of the international hotels recently built or being developed. The trip shows how the old properties sit side-by-side with the new, modern skyscrapers.All told, a couple of very pleasant hours.The

Up the Canals. Just go down the Public Wharf & go up the canals by longboat.Haggled a price for myself for 1 hour did not want another tourist with me. it will cost you anywhere from 800 -1500 Baht. depending how good you are. Brought the driver a beer it all counts.

it is good for lunch as well.... I went here for lunch in November for OYW conference. Amazing experience...Food quality, scenic view, everything is really great..The whole arrangement was really nice and worth falling for...It is indeed good experience

Inexpensive way to spend a few hours viewing some of the city from the river. This is the water taxi Sathon Road, Taksin Bridge, Charoen Krung Road and Chao Phraya River Take the Silom Line to Sathon Taksin and as you leave the station walk down to the pier, turn left for the taxi.Their are other boat trips available and its up to you but the taxi is only 18 baht from one end to the other about 1 hour depending on how many people on board.No tourist type talking but many sights to see along the way, Many wats and houses as well as the hotels that scatter the river bank

City of Angels' watery highway. Bankok -- the City of Angels -- depends on the the Chao Phraya River that runs through it. The river is both highway and lifeline. You can go for a cruise if you like. The King also takes his royal barge down he river on special occasions. One thing is for surer, if you are holidaying in Bangkok, you can't avoid the Chao Phraya River. It might be muddy, but it's useful..

Great way to see Bangkok. I only had one day in Bangkok for sightseeing and the Chao Phraya Express Boat was a great way of getting to know the city. For 300 bhats, you could hop on and off multiple locations all day. I was visiting in April and the heat can be unbearable and limit your "excursions" however.

Busy but a great way to get around Bangkok . The river boat service was typical of Bamgkok madness with people shouting out orders and packed boats. We got a day ticket for 150B and it was great for going to and from the temples and markets. It's also nice to see what's on the other side of the river. The breeze on the water was a welcome relief from the heat.
Sanet Schoeman. A trip on the riverboats is something every visitor to Bangkok should experience. The river is the traveler's gateway to all the wonderful sights that Bangkok has to offer.

Impressive as always. When I was young, I used to travel by Rue Hang Yao (a long motor commuting boat) to get to my secondary school at Satree Wat Rakhang School on the side of Chao Phraya River. We got out from Bangkok Noi Canal near the former Southern Railway Station (Now, a museum) and crossed the River to Tha Maharaj. I always felt small being in the middle of the River. And sure, sometimes I got wet from head to toe because of waves from other boats. This feeling still lingers in my mind when I visited there again last April. Despites modernization along both sides, the Chao Phraya River is still a stunning scene to see and feel. And boat ride across the River from Tha Phrajan to Tha Wang Lang still brings back the memory of my youth, and I still feel small being in the middle of the immense Chao Phraya River.

Great mode of transportation. It's a great way to get to the Grand Palace and the Temple of the Emerald Buddha. I will highly recommend it. It's fun and inexpensive way to see some parts of Bangkok. You can purchase a daily pass and see other attractions, e.g. The Flower Market

It was alright. Well, the river itself is not that amazing. The ferries tend to get crowded in busy hours (especially at around noon) and you will not have a lot to see in both sides of the river. If you are planning to visit sites like Wat Pho then this river ride is worthy. Otherwise, you can avoid it too. It is definitely cheap though. From one side of the river to the other side for only 14 baht. Crazy!

Not a nice experience.... WE were at a conference in Bangkok, followed with a city tour and cruise on the Chao Phraya River. It was not the best experience as the waterway had lots of garbage where many "large" fishes (believe they are carps) eating away. The waterway had foul smell...It did not really generate much of an appetite as there was a buffet dinner served on board of the cruise. All I can say is "Been there done that". No further comments

A sight to see. This is one of the best views of Bangkok's river line but please do not be conned into a trip costing 1000 Baht per person! You may be told that the taxi/tuk tuk is only 20 Baht but this is a scam by the people who run it! Go down to the various piers and barter your price to as low as 300 Baht! Also remember that if you are going from the Silom end of town to the grand Palace, to ensure that they understand that you are alighting there otherwise you will end up back where you started: There is also a 20 Baht "landing fee" ha ha ha - they have thought of it all !!!
Fabulous views from the River. Take a longboat down the River along the klongs. It's a great experience and fun to see the local people along the river.

Sightseeing for 14 bath. The best way to see the river, with a public boat that is almost free. For 14 bath each way it will take you far up the river. Just hop off where you want and take the next one back. Also great on a very hot day in Bangkok. Beware of the tourist boat that cost ten times more. Take the orange flagged boat and avoid the blue.

Long Boat Ride! Fun!!. Went to catch a ferry to the temples , and engaged in a conversation with a lady about a long boat ride through the canals to the Taling Chan Floating market and further to the temples. After a bit of negotiation we settled on 1200 baht for 1.5 hour tour. What a great choice! The canals were amazing and the floating market was exactly how I pictured it. This is the same market Anthong Boursain ate grilled snakehead fish. So I did the same. Delicious! The tour was colorful and interesting as the houses along the canal were either magnificent or somewhat dilapidated. Really a cool insight into life in Bangkok on the waterways. Highly recommend this for anyone wanting to travel inside of old Bangkok.
Beautiful river. A very beautiful river divides Bangkok and used to transportation also in the evening river cruise programme is very famous

Travel on the river very exciting !. The river is very busy - unlike the Thames for example it is used as a major thoroughfare, so everything from longtail boats whizzing by to huge barges trundling along pulled by a couple of pilot boats. Getting on and off both private and public transport boats is a challenge in itself, as the river is quite choppy. You can organise a trip in a longtail boat (with much bargaining !) starting at any river pier and travelling into the canal system where people live right alongside the river in stilted houses. Your boat will stop in a designated spot where there are stalls selling street food and places to sit and eat. This is NOT the floating market though. You have to go by car to get there - about 80km

ROTARY DIST 3262 BANDHAN. Unforgettable moments &Dinner in the cruz.Mouth watering delicious food &drinks &to add there is stage with music for rocking dance .The 2hrs dinner in moving Cruz was most enjoyable.

See the real Bangkok from the river. A sightseeing trip on the Chao Phraya, haggled down from 1200 baht to 400 (!) from the main pier. Was quite interesting to see the contrast between the huge commercial shipping on the main river and the narrow klongs which housed old rundown shacks alongside opulent temples. Another plus is when you disembark you can wander into Chinatown with its hectic hot crowded markets.
Peter. Dinner night trip at Chaopaya river is so cool. We can see history on side of river. In winter season is great dinner on the boat .Perfect of the grand palace is on the way.
Looks best at night.... Like most of Bangkok, the river looks much better from dusk onwards than it does during the bright light of day. Definitely recommend riverside apertivo at one of the hotels.
Good ride with views . A must visit in evening to witness temple of dawn ,wat arun beauty ! Also you can go to different night markets

Evening Dinner Cruise on the River. Evening cruises give you a great view of the lights of the city. The cruises vary depending on the type of clients they are aiming for. Ours had good food. Music a bit loud, but the service was very good. The views were why we were out there and they were fantastic.

Negotiate with the vendor. We had our first trip on the boat. Took a taxi to the wharf. They offered us a bot for our party of 4 and a price. We did NOT accept the price on offer and pretended to walk away with our taxi driver. We asked him to stay to help with the negotiating. They reduced the price. Happy days! Anyway, the visit around the canals for 1.5 hrs was awesome. Got a good understanding of the canals. Is a crappy version of a canal tour of Venice (very crappy version). A must see. Bit noisy. Bit smelly. But a must do.

Loved my river trips!. This is a great experience, do not waste your money on the tourist boat get on one of the local ones with the orange flag, they are so cheap and great fun! I went as far North on one as far as it goes to Nonathapuri where there is a superb Thai market, it took an hour to get there and cost 14 Baht. It was really interesting to see the sights on the river bank and how much quieter it is North of the Royal Palace stop. I used the boats several times and just loved it. We also hired a Swallow tail boat for 2 hrs as a treat to go around the canals, make sure you barter with the guide and take some beers with you to drink. It was really great to do.

Upgrade ticket. I bought a ticket for Chaopraya river cruise with an agency before 2days. I can't remember which cruise I chose but they upgrade my ticket at the gate to more superb type of cruise named"wonderful pearl cruise". Amazing scenery along river at night!
Of course, the show, Khon Thai traditional dance or Ramayana, is also fantastic ever.

Nice to see. I think it is a must do in Bangkok.. With the boat you pay about 2500 bath for the 2 hours tour, we chose to go to see the floating market and the flower market over there. It was not so special, but from the river you see Bangkok city from another perspective: real houses in the riverside, markets, temples and the landscape from here are very nice.

Amazing Afternoon..... My husband and I spent the afternoon traveling down the CP River. Making a few stops at small temples and markets. Wow what an eye opener. People living on the river in very substandard housing, think most Westerners are quite gobsmacked by the contrast of living conditions to our own. Travelling always makes me feel so very blessed of my home and community.But it was a fantastic afternoon, so many great views of the Golden Palace and city.Our guide stopped at one point near a small temple, we hopped off to see and when we boarded again he fed the fish from the side of the boat. Hundreds of them came to the surface.

A must see . Do take a boat cruise. It's very interesting and I even saw two sleeping kimono dragons by the riverside. A bit smelly in places but very very interesting. As long as you don't mind the smells it's fantastic
Beautiful views. Our main home from home now is the Hilton Millennium hotel, from the 31st floor the views are magnificent. A must to travel on a boat on the river and visit numerous locations.

Lazy ride up the river. The express boats are frequent and stop at many of the piers along the river ideal for Bangkoks attractionsYou can see a lot of the temples rom the river and it gives you an idea of where you want to beIt's a ten minute walk to Asiatique I would recommend this hotel
Disappointed with the amount of pollution in the water.. I found that the river was a dark and brackish color, with garbage and pollution floating in the water. The ride upriver was interesting.
Fantastic tour . Chao Phraya River is one of the best attractions in Bangkok. From Chao Phraya, you can go to other spots like Wat Po, Wat Arun etc. Don't miss Chao Phraya if you are in Bangkok!

A must do in Bangkok. I had only one day to spend in Bangkok and unfortunately I thought I could not get a chance to a river trip. By amazing luck outside Wat Arun we found a one hour boat ride and I'm so glad!!! We got a chance to catch a glimpse of the old Bangkok, with its houses on stilts and spirit houses guarding the homes... It was simply amazing, loved every bit of it.
Great spot to people watch. Nice spot to grab some street food and watch people and the boats on the river. It's nice in the mornings to take a walk and grab some food along the way.

A must do in Bangkok. Another awesome way to explore Bangkok and to skip the traffic. The fare is really cheap although it might get crowded during the rush hour. You can see the different temples, beautiful hotels by the river and how the locals live.

River views great - but avoid cruises. Went on river cruise with Pearl Cruises - rip off pricing and no crowd control (Thai issue everywhere). Adequate fodd but drinks overpriced. Many rude noisey Chinese tourists - had to demand "boss' move them twice. Paid for top deck table next to rails, and Chinese tourists from cheap seats kept standing/sitting on rails right in front of our table. Views fantastic but Thais must learn to stop obnoxious chinese tourists . Paid cruise not recommended - take public taxi with polite Thais and enjoy the great views.
Authentic Bangkok. If you take the river cruise you can see authentic Bangkok riverside life with all those ruined houses and flow market.. It was interesting

Take the orange flag public boat!. If you have more time than money, taking the orange flag boat is a great way to see the river. The orange flag boats (yes, you can recognize them by orange flags :-)) are normal local public boats and they stop almost at every pier along the river. Sometimes they sell tickets on the piers, sometimes directly on the boat.The price is extremely low, usually 15 baht for the ride (sometimes even 14 baht and I have no clue why...) and it doesn't matter how far you go.So basically you can be on the boat more than hour one way (from Taksin to Nonthaburi) for this price and there is hardly anything in Bangkok that can compare with this...

White Orchid River Cruise. Please contact Ms. Aey for a river cruise/dinner deal, LINE LoverTravel. She can offer you a 50% discount voucher instead of 1500 THB on a walk in Rate its only 800 THB per pax. Please be there at least an hour before boarding. Just dont hesitate to mingle at the River City boardwalk so you can also see the other cruises. From Saphan Taksin can either take a Tuk Tuk to bring you to River City or take the ferry service.
Boat ride is awesome and thrilling.. You can enjoy the ride after vising Wat Arun and feel the beauty of Bangkok.The different boats have different speed on so as thrill.

Finally Attention is Being Paid. Bangkok must be the last Asian City starting to realize what an asset this river is to both the city and the visiting tourists. Gradually more attractions, restaurants and prime real estate start crowding at the river. It is a real opportunity (look at Singapore, Hong Kong, Sydney) that be developed in sustainable way - go city planners do the right thing!

Ride on the River. I am very apprehensive about going on a boat ride on the rivers in Bangkok but i was so suprised with this outing . It didnt smell at all and we saw how the people live in their homes on the river . Very interesting an i would recommend this

Interesting river trip. We took a private longtail boat for an hour. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Bangkok. It gives you a good idea about how Thai people live and the view of Wat Arun is stunning at sunset.

A disappointed cruise down the river. We were looking forward to an enjoyable cruise along the Chao Praya river with beautiful scenery along both banks but there is practically nothing much to see except for the part when it passed the Grand Palace.It was designed more like a boat trip where food and on board entertainment to entertain the crowd. However, we could get better food in the restaurant and better entertainment elsewhere. Consequently both the price and time wasted is not worth the value.Also all boat cruise Operators have their departure very close to each other and cause unnecessary jams as all 3-4 Operators use the same pier.Not recommended and truly overrated.

Take the public ferry and not the longtails. I used the useful ferry to get up and down the Chao Phraya River its very easy to use, just hop on and off where ever you like and its so cheap. Its like 25 baht one way. Make sure to get on at the right pier though as some piers can scam you and charge up to 2000 baht for a trip on the river.

1 hour longboat ride = 35 minutes. We grabbed a tuk-tuk from our hotel in Bangkok to Saphan Taksin pier because we wanted to look at the different options for a cruise or boat ride along the river. However, the tuk-tuk driver didn't take us there. Instead he dumped us at a small and fairly isolated shack somewhere along the river that looked more like a private residence. A large burly man came out and said that we needed to pay him 2000 baht for an hours ride and that we needed to hurry up and pay him because his tour guide was not going to wait.We went along with it because we did want a cruise along the river and it was our first day in Bangkok and we didn't know much better. They then insisted that we all buy drinks as well as loaves of bread to feed the fish. We didn't really mind as they weren't expensive. Anyhow, the boat driver didn't speak to us all trip even though it was just the 4 of us on the longtail boat. He didn't speak any English and so as a result he didn't point out anything to us along the river - we just tried to guess. Even though we had paid for the hour, the 'tour' lasted only 35 minutes. The driver hurriedly unloaded us at the grand palace wharf -fortunately after a few minutes of stumbling around we were able to work out which wharf we were at.The ride itself was fine and a great way to see Bangkok. Glad we did it but I would still be inclined to try and find a more reputable operator, as we had hoped to by originally insisting on going to Saphan Taksin.
Great . Take a cruise down the river it's a great day out. It's also a great way to navigate the city. Iv been asked to say more because I hadn't used my 100 characters.

Be aware that long tail boats can be expensive. During our trip through Bangkok you have to make also a trip on the river. But exactly here is where specialized people take advantage of tourists, and charge up to double and more from them if they don't discuss and deal with them.Also they tend to take you to places that you really don't want to see. Stop at little (probabyl family) boats that try to sell you all kind or crap and way overprized. And when you deny all of that the boat captain takes you in a quick tour back to your starting point or agreed destination.Just not recommendable.If you really want to enjoy the river, with all the beauties around it, just take the boats that the locals take. Besides that they cost less that 1/10th of the longtails, you stop at most of the interesting points.

Interesting transportation. Somehow we got lost even though we followed their map. Lots of friendly people around to point the way. Interesting way to get around town and recommended if visiting the temples nearby. Not that clean or pretty looking but it works.

The best place for a dinner cruise... People use this river as a transport medium to avoid high traffic in the city specially in the morning and evening. for tourists, traveling along the river would give breathtaking views over some famous temples like wat arun. Some luxury hotels along the river side facilitates unlimited free rides for their guests on chao praya. my favorite is the dinner cruise which is a popular attraction for both tourists and locals.

Best place to relax and calm those nerves . So we went looking for the temple of dawn and someone asked to go to the river front and take the ferry ride. Oh, what a calmness it brought about. We were there around 5 and it was a lovely ride on the ferry. Felt so calm and relaxed...

Take a public express boat trip to Nonthaburi in the public holidays. My favourite river trip is taking my young son during a week day public holiday on the express boat from Saphan Taksin Pier (next to the BTS) all the way to Nonthaburi and sitting at the front close to the boat captain. It's far less crowded that during the week days. Get the orange flag boat which is THB 15 all the way, takes about an hour and a half. It stops at the main piers which is part of the fun. Then at Nonthaburi go for a walk about, snacks & drinks and then do the reverse trip back to Saphan Taksin Pier. Or stop off on the way back at one of the sites you liked on the way up. Great restaurants along the riverside to visit as well.There are other commuter boats during rush hour and the working week, also Tourist Boats (blue flag) but they don't go to Nonthaburi and more expensive. My favourite as stated is the orange flag boat.Also at Saphan Taksin Pier you can get the "free" hotel boats to all the major riverside 5 star hotels and cross over between them and go and have a walkabout and a drink.

See the waterways Bangkok was built on- for 40 baht!. The best way to see real Bangkok. I enjoyed traveling through neighborhoods that weren't crowded with tourists along the stops on the orange line (look for orange boats) Very inexpensive way to travel to Wat Pho.

Teeming with catfish and nice way to see the riverside. We took 2 river boats. One across from Wat Arun to Wat Po. Another from the Fortress N13 to N3 (close to our hostel).A number of piers were shut/destroyed. So be careful you ask before boarding where is best to get off.

Regrettably dirty and very bad smelling, extremely polluted. I felt very sad for this river which could be one of the best rivers in the world. it divides Bangkok into two halves but it is extremely polluted and I almost cried seeing the litter and the pollutants in the water...it made me really angry because it could be the best water canal in Asia!
River Cruise. Take an early evening cruise on the fantastic boats, have a meal,drinks and meander up and down the river.
The aorta of bangkok. Cetrainly a good way to travel from one way to another in bangkok ,chinese market , kings palace and so much more to visit on this track through bangkok

Grand River . We could view this river from our hotel balcony, huge river with a lot of activity.we saw the passengers boats that was used by tourist and locals to get around the city as traffic was a nightmare sometimes on the roads. There were large barges Going up and down the river and at night the big cruise boats packed with tourists offering shows and dinner, this river teems with life and was very much a part of the city.

An amazing way to see life on the river.. We traveled on the river via the ferry system often to visit markets and other sights. There are beautiful old temples along the river as well as the king's palace and so many other places to visit. What intrigued us were the very old homes right along the river and not too far away were very expensive buildings.....such a contrast! We stayed at the centre point silom hotel and the ferry terminal is only 4 to 5 mins walk from the hotel.

When its so hot, hop on a Ferry for a while and cool down. For only 14b you can hop on the ferry and ride for as long as you wish, or 140b for a full day hop-on hop-off with the ferry.good way to see the tourist attractions beside the river with the temples and palaces.

relaxing...... Just so relaxing....this is ineed a way to check in with Bangkok in a different light altogether! Do try it...just the way to go. I believing enjoying places like the ocals do and this is also one of such way! go for it!
The water artery of Bangkok . Take a water taxi for a few bhat and ride like a local. Don't be talked into a private long boat, use the water taxi. Save big and have a better experience.

Chao Phraya River. Travelled on the river many times. Very cheap fares on the local boat...but be careful of the touts who offer very expensive trips on their longtail boats...or the tourist boats...no need...go local.Locals and visitors alike use this service and this local boat stops at every dock along the river, so you can hop off...check out that area, and hop back on and continue down the river.Or stay on all the way down...and pay for the return trip and enjoy it all again. 1.5 hrs each way. It was 40b last time I went, each way. (Or each section if you do the hop on, hop off trips.)

cool east experience ... Lots of interesting things to see along the river and o it. I'd splash out on a private tour boat and have someone organise or guide you to some different places along the khlongs as well as the main river itself.
Cheapest local transport. Chao Phraya River is a perfect and the cheapest way to explore Bangkok. Take the tourist boad and garound the city to visit best tourist destinations in Bangkok.

Filthy disgusting water passage. Great to travel along on a ferry for the sites and experience but just disgustingly polluted and smelly. The Thai people really seem to have close to zero regard for the environment.. Clean it up I won't eat any seafood in your city till you do!

Great place to watch the world go by. Chao Phraya River also known as The River of Kings carries you past palaces, hotels (make sure to visit The Oriental), churches, temples, markets and ancient canals. It's like being in a movie set - spectacular!

Bangkok waterway or sewer. The river is huge with alot of traffick on it and very dirty you dont want to get a splash in the face as it more than likely has H/palore in it and could infect your intestine for mounths maybe years as my wife has found out not to say she got it from that but she got it somewhere there.

Yuck. I took an hour long river cruise. It started with the dock guy quoting me double the price that I eventually agreed to pay. The river is dirty and has zero scenic interest. The boat took us to some guy selling over priced water out of his boat and the guy was insistent that we buy beer for the 2 boat guys. Not recommended!

Great way to relax on the river. Either river taxi or sitting on the lounge on one of the river side hotel, is one great way to relax in Bangkok. Also, there are 3-4 companies runs dinner cruise on the river and it's definitely one of the great cruise to take for the evening. They will pick you up for your hotel to the cruse and drop you off after. Great food and time.. Guaranteed.

Sit back and relax - camera zoom and observe. So if you are going out on one of those long banana-like river boat cruises, then keep in mind that you are there to relax and observe. The boat's man just cruises, with his truck engine strapped onto a wooden dug-out boat. If you stick out your arm you could touch the water. Expect a bit of water spray to either cool you down or annoy you. The boats man / driver could not explain where we were or wat was up ahead. Expect plenty of gorgeous temples (whatts) to see. You might stop along side a woman trading some touristy gifs from her own boat, you could do a barge water transfer. Ask the boats man/ driver to stop if you find a local river restaurant, and try something from the local menu, smile and nod and pay, end enjoy the scrumptious food. Everything is prepared fresh. A must DO! Take some amazing photographs. See how Thai people actually live.See a couple of birds and comoro dragons on the river itself. Experience the fish farms and river farming. stop at a local market or a orchard farm. But most of all, sit back and relax. A cool trip whether it rains or sun shines...

Perfect small break from the noisy streets of Bangkok. Chao Phraya River goes through whole Bangkok.You can jump on the Express Boat which is a perfect way to explore river and admire wonders on the both sides of it, from modern hotels to the traditional Thai houses.It is definitely not a way of spending whole day, but for sure you can relax and enjoy this trip for good 30 minutes.Not something you must to do while in Bangkok, but definitely worth if you got a chance.

Great experience!. This is one of the most pleasant surprises we hound in Bangkok. The cheapest way to enjoy the city and reach so many attractions. I am sure that travelers of any age will love the boat ride.

Fun and Exciting. Cruising on the Chao Phraya is a fun and exciting way to get some different and great views of Bangkok. There are many different hotels and restaurants located right on the river with nice cool breezes.

nice experience. Cruise on this river is a must visit tourist to do list.
Not so clean river - not so great but must visit.
You get to see almost all of Bangkok main tourist life along the river.
Kids enjoy this ride must go if going with kids

Scenic river. This is the main river of Bangkok and some of the major attractions of the city can be viewed by taking a cruise on this river. There are some impressive bridges built across this river as well. A dinner cruise on this river is a great way to relax and unwind.

A must trip at nightime to see all of the temples and buildings lit up. We made the trip up and down the river in daylight and by night. The main new bridge span is lit and quite impressive. The neon at night and the lights on the temples brings things in a different perspective than when traveling the river during the day.

Scenic way to travel. Our hotel was located on the riverside and we were fascinated at the constant traffic using the river. There were water buses, small boats being used as taxis, floating restaurants/nightclubs and also barges carrying in goods and taking out rubbish. We used the river bus as transport when we visited the Grand Palace area. We bought a day ticket which meant we could use the river buses as often as we liked during the day. So, on the return journey, we chose to make a couple more stops and we visited the flower market and China town which are also located near the river. The different stops and different colour flagged boats are a little confusing to start with. To help there are maps at the quayside stops and in the boat which detail where each boat stops and the points of interest located there. If we had had more time it would have been nice to use the boats just as a scenic trip as there were plenty of views and photo opportunities. If you are in a hurry or have to be somewhere at a specific time then bear in mind that this is not the quickest way to travel around Bangkok and allow extra time. It is, however, probably still quicker than braving the traffic jammed streets in a taxi and far more enjoyable.

Take a ride on the Express boat - disover daily thai life. Ever since I come to Bangkok, the first thing I do is to go to Saphan Taksin and take a ride on the Express Boat going north. When I am on that, I know I am "home" again.

Filthy but good. The boats on the river are a cheap transportation around bkk plus you get to see a lot of the city from the boat. I have skinny dipped in this river on Christmas day, which is a nice drunken group experience. But beware of all the trash and the currents. Make sure you do it in a safe spot.Don't get scammed by the people at the docks. You can usually pay on the boats.
Nice experience. One can use it as a means of transportation also. One can buy a day pass and hop off or hop on wherever one intends to. This is advisable if start in the morning.

Thrilling cruise. You might it difficult at first to understand what's going on but there are enough tourists who have done enough research to guide you on the required stops. Getting around by boats are very cheap so this is a must experience and despite the heat during the day, it makes for an enjoyable ride. Evenings are exceptional and makes for great shots of the city!

Great views from riverside restaurant. Seeing so many people travelling up and down the river was amazing. Had a meal at a riverside restaurant..maybe a little expensive but only depending on what you have and the staff were so welcoming and friendly. Worth paying the extra for the views alone and took some great photos. Will definately return and take a boat trip next time.

Another way of transport . In Bangkok Chao Phra yatin river also iused for transportation. It cheap and very convenient as there is no traffic jam (use local boat.. Other wise on the ticket counter always fools you that local boat service is closed / very slow etc. and end up with higher tickets. Local boat transport charges are like 10 baht to 30 baht. But if you get fool then you will end up paying 100 Baht!!. For river crossing charges are just 3 baht!!.

Great way to get around. The sights and sounds are marvellous, take some bread and feed the catfish.
Can be polluted though, so take some wipes!!!

Lively river of Bangkok. Chao phraya river ride s a must for anyone visiting Bangkok.... You can witness some of the stunning views of the city temples, pagodas, buildings, bridges, the cheapest way is to travel by chao phraya express boat boarding at any one of the pier , I boarded boat at Ratchawongse pier and travelled to Tah Chang pier...It's a convenient way of transportation in Bangkok to cross the river and reach other side of the bank...and river also serves a main purpose of inland transportation of goods and vegetables and groceries... And also main source of livelihood...as I travelled I enjoyed the views of the city wat Arun temple.. It's cheaper and faster too....I would suggest that one must take a trip ride in Chao Phraya river...river cruise with dinner buffet s also available by private tour boat cruise operators..with prior booking..

A So so experience. Nothing special when we go to Chao Praya River..The dirty,the smelly...Not good at all...And i have impression,the touris if want to go to Wat Arun is more easily to go there by bus,not by ship...

Local Ferry ride and no tourists. We caught a local ferry from the BTS station and went up the river as far as we could. We had to change ferries at one stage. At the end of the ferry ride, which took about an hour, we ended up at a local village. We had lunch and then walked around the village. We didn't see any other tourists. Everyone was very helpful and it was a very enjoyable day. The return fare pp was inexpensive. Lunch was also cheap.

Central to Bangkok, but it is a river!. We use ferries to cross the river, and have also used the express boat to get between Nonthaburi and Bangkok. The river is fairly clean, at least upstream, where it has a rich fish population, which no doubt also feeds many. As we have experienced, it is to be respected due to annual rising water levels and flooding. You cannot visit Bangkok without coming into contact with the river simply because so many temples, palaces and other sights are located on it's banks.
Rice barge. Did a rice barge trip. excellent value and very interesting. A lovely afternoon Plenty of shade on the boat and a guide provided.
Lunch on a cruise boat. 3 hour cruise along this river with lunch on board, very relaxing and appreciative of the breeze to keep the heat down !
way of transport. Thai people are getting the maximum use of this river as a mode of transport. you can visit most of the attraction by boat and avoid all the traffic on road
It's a river. Fine for getting the ferry but no great sights and quite dirtyNot much else to say other than don't fall in

Countless Ways to Enjoy the River. The Chao Phraya is the main waterway in Thailand, rising in Nakhon Sawan Province, from where it flows nearly 400 km, through Bangkok, to the Gulf of Thailand in Samut Sakhon Province.Historically, the Chao Phraya is very much a "working" river, used for transportation, trade and commerce, fishing, and irrigation of rice padi.But for tourists it offers many delights.I first came to Thailand in 1969 and took a small boat trip to the local floating market, which back them was still authentic, with traders eagerly plying their small boats around the klongs (canals) offering their produce for sale. Today tourists are still offered a trip to the floating market, but it is a pale imitation of what it used to be, and is only kept alive by the artificiality of the tourist trade.Again in 1973 I was stationed in Bangkok with the Thai Army and, courtesy of some Thai generals, enjoyed a day long trip on a luxury cruiser up the Chao Phraya to the ancient royal capital of Ayutthaya. Such cruises are still available commercially, and provide an insight into both the river and the riverine communities along the banks, with a visit to the ruins of Ayutthaya thrown in for good measure.Another interesting trip on the river is to catch a ferry across to Koh Kret, about 20 km upsteam from Bangkok. This small island in the middle of the river has been home to a Mon community since the 18th Century when they fled persecution in Burma and were given sanctuary in Siam. They still maintain their old ways and traditions, and if you visit, you must try some of the Mon food which is offered for sale at stalls and small restaurants.If you don't want to go on the river itself, there are many bridges in Bangkok which provide viewpoints of this interesting waterway, including Rama VII Bridge to the north and, seven bridges later, Rama IX Bridge in the south.Currently there are plans afoot by the Bangkok Metropolitan Administration and the Thai Ministry of the Interior to build a public promenade along both sides of the river, running from Rama VII Bridge seven kilometers downstream to Phra Pin Klao Bridge. But that is something for the future.

The best way to get around. I like to stay in the Samsen Road area of Bangkok, near Khao San road, but away from the madness. Then if I need to go into the centre, it's a short walk to Phra Atit Pier where you can catch the river boat to Thaksin Bridge. There is a whole colour-coded system: fast boats, which only stop at some of the piers, and slower boats, and then a couple of ferry type boats that shuttle back and forth between two piers on opposite sides of the river.It's a great way to get to some of the most beautiful temples (Wat Arun, Wat Pho, etc) and just to see a slice of Bangkok life. And it's not expensive.There are also special tourist boats, but no real need to take one of those unless you want to.
river drive. can enjoy river drive on small boats, river and canel waters are very dirty but not giving bad odur....children can enjoy....i dont know why safety belts are not used during 1 hour trip.

Cruising with an awe. I book a cruise which provided with meals, the meals are awesome, the cruise are clean and it doesn't even feel like you're in a boat, it's like in a 5star hotel, the upper deck served meals and scenery! I like it better at night, since all the lighting will came up, and the pretty silhoutte and golden temples around the river will look amazing. its either you came with a family or your plus one, this experience will gives you such an unforgettable night.

Polluted but good for watching a Silom area skyline. The river as such isn't clean or maintained, however, one might take a free ride from BTS Saphan Taksin to Asiatique or have a River Cruise for Dinner or pay a nominal amount for commuting with travel boats.
Water taxi!!. If you go on the river use the water taxi rather than a tour. The water taxi works out to be around £2 each and you can use it all day.

travel alternative. Bangkok traffic jams can be horrendous so we explored an alternative way of getting around. On our second stay we rented an apartment further up the river and decided to take the ferry boats which provide a great regular service. one other alternative is to live a little more dangerously and take a "long boat". These bots have what looks like a large diesel engine mounted at the rear with a very long drive shaft connected to it and a propeller attached.. With a roar we are off at what seemed like great speed, and it was. Exciting ... yes. Dangerous ... well a little but we never saw and accidents and it sure is a very quick way to get around and avoid the Bangkok traffic.. many of the temples in Bangkok can be visited this way. Cheap and fast. Just do it.

Great way to get around, and see the sights!. We took a river "tourist boat" mostly to beat the unbearable heat of the day (we were there in April, the hottest month, and we had a a HOT week!).Gorgeous river (OK, yes, it's dirty... but it's still a great river!).River boats are a great way to get around and see a lot of sights. Just be careful and make sure you're getting a ticket to the right boat(s), and make sure your ticket is good for getting BACK as well.Take the boats up and down the river, enjoy seeing the history, as well as the modern commerce.

Breath taking views of Bangkok. we bought a daily river boat ticket and travelled down the river to the main temple area. The sights are breath taking, the river itself is a bit dirty but the mix off old and new boats are impressive
shake the ferry. if you want to move in a safe and nice way, take the ferry that runs along the river, a great experience for 1 €.....

Dinner cruise De Luxe. First, the entertainment was superb. Then the food was overload especially we were very hungry by the time we went on board. But all the same, my palate was overjoyed by the whole menu. My diet has been destroyed and my pants are already bursting.The staff is friendly too and accomodating.I will definitely come back with my family soon.

Convenience and beautiful. We have now decided to stay at the Taksin bridge/Central Pier area on the Chao Phraya river next time we come to Bangkok. We selected our apartment on the 29th floor on the Thon Buri side of the river and have found it to be very convenient. You can grab a ferry to basically anywhere you want to go it is convenient for catching Tuk Tuk's and taxis to go further into the city. I think the only thing that I haven't enjoyed and found to be not great waste Longtail boat rides through the canals, which was very expensive and relatively short. You do need to bargain hard when dealing with the Touts who sell the long boat rides.Again this is the to place to stay for convenience and beauty.

The only way to commute. I so love this river, yes, its dirty but what a magical journey at night with the passing boats and their flashing lights. I fell in love with this river when I first travelled on it 40 years ago. When I worked in Bangkok I would commute by boat to avoid the traffic jams. I am a huge fan of Bangkok and one of the main reasons is the river. I am in Thailand often and would never consider not taking many trips up and down and back and forth on the Chao Phraya.

Used for unlimited day transport. Fabulous way to get around the city. Cheap and easy to orientate. 300 bat for day ticket. access to temples and grand Palace. Views of city and river traffic both traditional and modern. River amazingly alive with fish, plenty to see
Scenic river. Busy scenic waterway. Convenient mode of travel to many historical sightseeing spots like the Grand Palace.

Mesmerizing . River has breathtaking views in the night. We took a private boat and it was really beyond our expectations. The one hour trip made our day to fullest. A must try if you wana see Bangkok while floating. Go for it.
Enjoy the atmosphere. Nothing to do much. Just take a boat trip down the river. See the Life with old and modern style building, temples and The Royal Grand Palace. That's happy far enough.

Soothing. Every tourist that comes in Bangkok should take a boat trip on this river. It is very nice, and offers great views. The ferry is 40 bht no matter where you want to go and a private boat is between(700-1000bht depending on how many persons are in it). Don't forget to negociate and don't spend more 1000bht/person/hour. It is not worth it.

Good Place to spend an evening!. We took tourist ferry ride . Ride was fine but little expensive than the local ride. You can have good views of buildings and temples from the . Sunset was spectacular. Its better to leave the boat near the King's Palace. Roam around that area and return to boat . We took public boat on our way back and it was over crowded.
Worth experiencing!. Took a ferry trip with the family - a really cheap but memorable experience! Make sure you know where you're going as it gets very confusing at the busier stops.

Take a boat, or two. You will end up seeing this river flow through Bangkok at various times. Be sure to avail yourself of a boat ride/boat taxi at any time of the day, as it is lovely to see Bangkok from the water. There are numerous night dinner cruises also, which are popular.

Nice views but confusing boat routes.. The boat operators are a little rude and they confuse you when you ask what kind of route they are taking. You are told one thing and the boat does another. Investigate properly before jumping on one.

Great, but bumpy ride. We took one of the small boats for about 1.5 hours. My friend got a little sick because it is a very bumpy ride. There will be a lot of boats in the river, causing a lot of waves. But, it's a good way to see Bagkok. Although it's a cool experience, I wouldn't call it a must-see.

Take a water taxi!. or ferry or long boat or whatever you can find! you get to see so much by water and the views are beautiful, sad and interesting all at the same time. our 'ferry' (?) was busy like a new York subway, but so fun!

Mad max meets river boat. Amazing hot rod engines run the water, many will take you from the hotel dock into the quaint village via canal, excellent gear head geek out time on these hand made marine engines modified from trucks

Best place to relax in Bangkok. We always stay at the Peninsula Hotel to enjoy the river location. Breakfast at the river, pool with river view. Nice bar at the river and wonderful views from all the rooms. The scenery by day and especially by night is magical.
ferry service. The river seems normal but quite peaceful, and it's quite convenient to take a ferry to place you like to go when it's extremely jammed on Friday afternoon.

Family Trip to Thailand - Traveling on Chao Phraya River. We used the river transportation boats to get around sites near the river. It is amazing to see how many boats use the river to transport tourists. I highly recommend utilizing the boats to travel to sites within walking distance to the river. It was a lot of fun to travel by boat up and down the river. Very inexpensive way to get around.
Day ticket . We had a good day up and down the river off and on the boats on different stops ,we had a day ticket and it was a good price to pay for the day

Stay near the river and make use of it for transport . The river is a brilliant way to get around and avoid the traffic, you can get the sky train and then pick up river boats to various places and for 150 baht per person you can get an all day ticket to get on and off at the places of interest. There are also a number of river evening cruises it's meals to choose from. It's a working river so there is a lot gong on and it's a good way to get a feel of the city.

Wonderful scene along the river !!!. If you want to see wonderful scene with very cheap price, you must take a bus boat at Saphan Taksin pier. It costs only under 20~30 baht. You will enjoy for one or more hour on the boat. Wat arun, palace, many beautiful hotels, ...Of course, the water is not definitely clean, but no problem to enjoy view !

Great way to visit the temples and palace. With a little research, we took the train to Saphan Taksin on the BTS Silom line and jumped off for a ferry, the tourist lines are more expensive or go for the public transport line.m. The boat journey is lovely, you see a lot of views, sites, buildings as you head north and jump off where you want. We jumped off at the reclining budha, had a day out seeing the sites and jumped back on south at the palace stop. However, going to was nice and quiet, coming back was incredibly busy. I like to travel by all modes of public transport when travelling, the river boat was nice. A good experience. Good views. Worth while.

Worth a trip. We bought a tourist day pass for 150baht, where you can ride blue and orange flagged ferries unlimited for the day. It is definitely an eye opener to how Bangkok uses its river. At times it was quite beautiful as you can occasionally see amazing temples and fascinating old Ramshackle homes along the river edge. But the pollution and rubbish is just overpowering at times. For it to be an accepted practice to throw your rubbish into the river is just sad. We rode the ferry from end to end and got off a few times to explore. There are some lovely little side markets and great photo opportunities.
Woth a visit.. There are lovely sights to see from the river, but don't bother woth the dinner cruises. It is beautiful at night but the dinner cruises is really a rip-off.

The lady wearing a cat shirt told us she was taking us to see the floating market . . .. We saw some cool sites. But after a super long (and overpriced) boat ride that took us down the Chao Phraya River and then winded us all around the ancillary canals, we finally arrived at the "floating market". Nope. It was a lady paddling a boat full of things you can order from Oriental Trading. The board ride continues. We had a pretty good view of Wat Arun. When we saw the Grand Palace, we decided we were done with our boat ride so we got off at Ta Change Pier.
Must do cruise. Must do a river cruise whilst in Bangkok. A bustling working river with hotels, restaurants, temples etc along the riverfront.

Do not miss...!!. If you are in Bangkok, and exploring the city, do not miss to explore it from this river.You can go for a boat tour to view the amazing scenes and views of Bangkok from the river.This riverside experience will be memorable for sure...Do not miss....
Floating quality. Just take the boat and enjoy Bangkok, just for a few bath , you see the on both sides of the rivier amazing views .From tempels to skyscrapers, boatpeople and barges.
River Boat. The river has cleaned up greatly from our last visit 30 years ago. Worth taking a river boat or river taxi. Some amazing buildings!!

River. Its nice to take a boat for the whole day - 150 bat (40 bat single ticket). With the whole day ticket you can go out and on different station, its really nice to have some relax on boat after walking around.
Must visit . There are many piers along the river. Price is good for boat rides. Markets and temples many are near the river. Best to go before noon. Less hot.

breath taking. Chao Phraya is the longest river in Bangkok. Most ancient temples and ancient Palaces are built along the river. Looking at the sites along on each side of the river is mesmerizing especially at night.

klong tours. it is great to go on a tour of the small canals in a long boat and see the local way of life on the waters edge, if it was anywhere is Aust they would develop it into a profit making venture, I love the Bangkok way of life on the water

Bangkok heartbeat. Dirty, smelly, busy and polluted but the absolute heartbeat of the city.
Hire a boat and cruise through the klongs to see the everyday Bangkok away from the traffic. Always something happening
buy yourself an all day ferry pass and go explore. the river is a great way to explore bangkok , ferry stops at all the major attractions , we jumped on and off all day

Authentic bangkok without all the health and safety extreme!. Hopping on and off the express river boats on the river is cheap quick and easy.
15 baht takes you on an exciting glimpse into the thai way of river life.
Check it out,you won't be disappointed.

Ole man river..... Maybe the best feature of Bangkok, an ever changing vista of rice barges, river taxis, pleasure craft, long-tail boats and on Saturday night the biggest loudest disco cruises witnessed anywhere.

Long Tail Boat Trip. Last Saturday we booked a private long tailed boat (Thai speedboat!) to do a tour of the main landmarks along the Chao Phraya river and then across to the Floating Market. Fantastic and very enjoyable experience! So as you know reading this, the Chao Phraya is the main river running North-South through Bangkok and the multiple transport options from speed boats to river taxis are a great way to get around. Our charter took us (at some speed!) to all the main sites and then we stopped at the Floating Market to explore and have lunch. After lunch we toured some of the smaller rivers before the 'driver' dropped us off at the hotel. Highly recommend if you want a chilled out day to see the sites but also parts of Bangkok less travelled. Super!

Good to Ferry along . It's good to go along the river. It has some good views and we went along the river to visit the palace and Buddha Temples. Great views of Wat Arun and sailing is fun with kids along.
quick crossing. The ferry takes you to the other side quickly which is handy and very cheap. There are also a few market stalls with food and gift ideas and very cheap.

Longtail Boat Ride and Canal Tour. We took a longtail boat ride on the Chao Phraya River and into the canals of Thon Burl river and really enjoyed seeing the skyscraper apartments, hotels, shopping centers - mixed in with temples and even individual homes. It was a great way to experience Bangkok. Going through the locks and into the canals of Thon Burl was extremely interesting to see the variety of homes and at least a dozen different temples (one in every neighborhood) along the canals.

Tourist boat down the river did not disappoint. It may seem trite but this is truly the best way to get from the skytrain to the reclining Buddha and, if you absolutely must go and fight the tourists, the grand Palace. It was also a lovely experience to tour the river and see the city from a different perspective. Be sure to pull a titanic "king of the world" and go stand at the bow of the ship. It's a once-in-a-lifetime you won't forget

Feel the serenity. Starting at any one of the piers, it is so peaceful and lovely to take a boat on the river. Even if you do not have a destination in mind, there are plenty of different attractions that you are able to stop at, such as the palace, reclining Buddha, Nonthaburi Fresh food market or Wat Arun temple. Im sure there are more, but I can't think of them right now. Also, if you are wanting to catch the BTS from the river, it has a pier right by the Saphan Taksin BTS.

Fun and cheap! . An easy way to schlepp up & down the river to Wat Arun, The Grand Palace, Khao San Road, Pak Klong Talad flower market & other areas that are more easily accessed from the river than the rail network. Get the orange flag boat for better value, only 14 baht per trip as opposed to 40 baht for the blue flag tourist boat, although the orange flag boats are a little less frequent than the blue flag boats.
Nice pulse. Chao Phrayha river is a Nice vein running thru Bangkok, easy to get a boat to get to see places in the surrounding area. Nice breeze on a hot day in Bangkok.
River cruze. We visited for a river Cruz dinner. It was a nice ride in the river with a good view of Bangkok. Dinner was also very good. One time visit is reccomended.

Polluted and chaotic but somehow charming. This is not the seine or the Thames, it is typically asian and as such it is a very crowded polluted river. Still, a tourist can still enjoy this river as it is a cool scene to watch.
Very Good Experience. Was there with family. Nice food, nice views, entertaining.Its buffet style, we took little to try on the food. Disappointed when there is not much left for our second servings.

Main river that goes through Bangkok. We stayed at a hotel along this river and it was really nice. There are several boats that operate during the day that take people from place to place along the river and it is the best mode of transportation. If you are staying in a hotel along the river, definitely request a riverview room on a high floor. We stayed at the Shangri La and got such a room. There was just something so peaceful about just sitting there in the morning and watching the river.

Noisy and fast. The major problem with the long tail boat tour along the river is that they go way too fast to enjoy what you are seeing or to take a good photo. Maybe a private boat would work but we were part of a tour.
Polluted River. Not a great river with lots of country boat.Local guides always insists for a boat ride but not worth

Heart of bangkok. Chao phraya river is the heart of bangkok. You can take a tour at the price of 150 thb by tourust boat. If you have tight budget, you can explore it with a minimum cost by take a public boat. Of u arrive at saphan thaksin bts station,walk down the elevator and go a head. You will see many tourist que for the ticket. But, dont go there because it will charge you extra for tourist. You see on the left side and keep walk until you see the pier. You only need to pay 10 times cheaper. There also boat schedule signboard there. But there river is very dirty. Local throw rubbish and didnt take care of the river (if you are at the right time, you will see local throw food waste into the river). So avoid touch the water
Great sightseeing. We did a night boat cruise on this river and it's breathtaking to see the different places lit up , pleasant way to spend an evening drinking in the atmosphere.

Rita and Shirley, UK. Travelled several times on this river. Initially a bit complicated trying to work out how to buy a ticket and get on the right ferry. It's a very busy place but once on lovely views. It stops at most of the 'piers' which are numbered, so you need to know where you are going and count the stops! On our second time of using someone was announcing the stops, but not on our first!

Excellent. You have got to go on this river and take the local river boat taxi, only 14 Bht for the one way trip to Khao San road from the sky train station at the south of the river. Best trip during my visit to Bangkok and you see everything.

Very affordable n easy. It has cheap and easy boat transport to most of the temples in bangkok like wat photo,grand palace,wat a run etc.per ride they charge 3-5 baht and if you plan to travel to all d places then u can take the tourist boat also which is for 140 baht for unlimited rides.

Truely Royal. Have no idea what Bangkok would be like without the Chao Phraya! All the major attractions - Wat Pho, Wat Arun, Grand Palace - are located on the bank of this river, called the River of the Kings. Life of the locals revolve around this river. You can shop in the floating market, goods are transported through this river, and obviously several dinner cruise are run here for the tourists. I have special fondness for the Dinner Cruise, but to take a ride on the Long Tail Boat is equally fascinating. To buy a One Day Pass for Tourists @ B 150 is a nice idea if you want to visit the palace and the temples.

Recommended Transportation. Nice view but sometimes we can smell the river quite stinky but thats not so bad.You can go to any temples by the boat, for single trip it cost 45THB and return trip it cost 150THB (you can visit all temples without pay the boat ticket anymore)The boat still in operation until 7 p.m
Summer Holidays. recommended to enjoy a Boat River ride which is one of the public transport system in Bangkok. Fares are also reasonable
Hire a Private Long Tail Boat. We hired a private Long Tail boat to take us from the Emerald Temple to the Mandarin Oriental, far better than using a taxi!

Exciting fast ride in a longtail boat. I took a Ukraine business friend on the weekend. The boat could hold around 16 people but only 4 of us in it. Unfortunately the weather became a bit wet and the river too rough but we enjoyed most of the trip through the Klongs etc

Good to experience but waits can be long.. Commuting on the river by boat is a common transport option in Bangkok. The boats may be dated and the sights not always interesting but it is one thing I wanted to experience. The wait can, however, be long at certain times and the waiting stations do not always have adequate comfortable seating. It is, however, a very cheap mode of transport in Bangkok. Prepare to stand when you get on the boat as it can often be crowded during peak hours or when you are coming from busy tourist attractions.

Late evening Cruise. Well nothing special about the river and the ferry rides, but it's pretty amazing to have a view along the river banks crossing through bangkok!PS: Cruise dinner in the evening is amazing along with Asiatic mall on one end of the river.Apart from that it's simple ride with some good restaurants and Monuments to see.
Good transport. I only used the ferry to travel around. No traffic jam with easy reach most of the sight seeing.The ride is unbelieverable cheap.

Great mode of transportation and way to see Thailand!. Good points- Great mode of transportation (to avoid crowded and congested streets) -Great viewBad point- not advisable for people who are very prone to seasick
Great night out. Our family went out on a cruise with some friends we caught up with in Bangkok to cruise this river and enjoy the view fine food and cold beer.
Take a water taxi ride. must do in Bangkok take a water taxi ride, not blue tourist boat, orange flag boat 15 baht very cheap, ride along river see a different view of things.

An essential when visiting Bangkok. The Chao Praya river is the very lifeblood of the city - a trip on it is just essential. If you haven't been before, take a long-tailed boat and visit the Royal Barge collection and return via the klongs. If you're a regular, then take a ferry. My own preference is for the Express ferry. It's always great fun and bustling with people - locals, independent visitors, monks and schoolkids. A great mix. Take some loose change to pay your fare...

Take a long tail. We travelled on the river using a number of different boats. The tourist boat offers an affordable one day ticket which allows you to hop on and off as much as you want. But the best experience was a long tail trip. If you go to Thailand pier (just south of the Royal orchid Sheraton) you can negotiate a good deal. We got a trip to Wat Arun and then down the side rivers for four people for only 2,000 baht. This trip would have cost more than that per person of arranged through our hotel
Take the long tail boat from Sathorn Taksin. Private ride along the river and canals taking 1.5 hours in total, so not too long and well suited to young kids. A great way to see a lot of Bangkok.

An interesting rice barge tour. My two daughters and I did a rice barge tour on the Chao Phraya River which included an array of lovely tropical fruits. We saw some interesting sights on each side of the river both very old homes and also very modern buildings. We stopped at one stage to feed bread to the catfish.

Wonderful view towards bangkok. We can see from the standpoint bangkok and other atmosphere. Many things can be seen on the Bankok from the river. Not all wonderful. Because many residents Bankok everyday things we see. The river was not very clean. The surroundings were passed clean enough.

Good Attraction and Good Place to Hang Out. This river, although a little on the dirty side (would not recommend swimming by any means) was a good place for tourists to travel with. The river has many boats that take you all over the city of bangkok. Easy to use, easy to ride, and gives you a great view of the city.
channel tour. took the channel tour which included the floating market for 30 minutes. money well spent instead of the crowded taxi.

Boat Trip with public boats just 15 bath or so. To avoid trafic in Banngkok not only Tourists alos Bangkokians use the fast boats to get e.g. from Riverfront to China town. See all the piers, fine mansions, small privet houses, the Oriental or other legendary Bangkok Hotels. Be careful, not to get into the water, it's insane: If a soup in a restaurant isn't OK, Thais tell you it's "Chao Praya" this says all what it means.. but water is not stinking at all.

Not clean water, but an experience. I initially thought, "what were we thinking?!"But it turned out to be an experience.The water is really choppy and really really dirty. But the boat ride is enjoyable as you get a good view of houses, restaurants etc on the side of the river.(My opinion is that you'd die before you drown if you fall into the water)It's very dirty & polluted water. And completely unthinkable that there is families living right there on the water. We stopped to feed bread to the fish. It was a feast for them.Doesn't take long for a round trip, or maybe I just lost count of time as I was enjoying looking at the houses, other boats & fish.

Good way to commute between sites. This is a nice way to commute to see the major tourist sites and is a relaxed trip with some nice views. You can't see most of the major sites from the river, but it does give you a good idea of what Bangkok is like - a juxtaposition of rich and poor, delapidated and new.

Use the Express Boats. An interesting busy river. We used the Express Boats as often as possible to travel to the various sites of interest. Tickets only cost 14 bahts. Extremely good value. Buy them on board if no ticket kiosk. Can get very busy though, but you get a lovely breeze to cool down.

Take a narrow long tail boat trip.. Mixture of sights from modern skylines to temples and shacks. Strongly advise taking a long tail boat from Sathorn Taksin pier. You can agree a price and tailor the trip you want. It takes you along the river and then along the different canals to really see Bangkok life.
The View Bar & Restaurant. Very nice ambiance for family, couples etc. Very windy with nice music.One of the best authentic food.

Dinner cruise on the Chao Phraya River. Booked through our hotel so not sure what company it was but pretty much they are all the same I think as people from various hotels got picked up and dropped off at the same place for the cruise. The food isn't great but overall its a decent experience. The staff are all very nice and the performers are okay. - Don't expect to it to be a refined experience and if you are on a tight budget - skip the cruise entirely and find another way to visit the river. The river itself is lovely especially in the evening.
Good time. The good times in bangkok.We really liked the Chao Phraya River in the evening.it 's very beautiful view and relaxed for our

River Tour is something fun to do. Be sure to take a tuk tuk and ask your driver about the river tour. The ride is exhilarating and you get to see parts of the city and neighborhoods you would miss otherwise. Be sure to negotiate the price of the tour

take a boat. there are boats like river bus which looks that belongs to municipality ,
however , they stop in different stations ,
some of the important attractions of Bangkok are located beside of this river , such as
jewelry museum and different palaces and temples , and you can get access to them by taking these boats in this river

water time. Have yourself a fun day on the river, get yourself an all day any boat tichet which is so cheap and spend your day getting on and off at different points have an hours walk about get back on and repeat all day
Long Tail Boat. Very enjoyable and most picturesque way to get to see the way the local, the well to do and the ordinary people live along the canals.

Take a boat tour!. I've visited Bangkok twice, and both times done a boat tour on the river. First time was a dinner cruise, second time was a private long tail boat. It is a great way to see some of the sights of Bangkok from a more interesting perspective. Highly recommend!

Interesting River Trip. Water taxis can be very full at times and viewing can be limited so we opted for a private long-tail boat ride along the river and the canals (klangs). This is a very busy working river, long boats with tourist mix with locals transportation, cargo boats and river taxis and the life and buildings that you will see on the way are interesting because they are so varied. This is a big river and can get a little choppy but the air generated is very much welcomed during the hot day but don't forget to apply sun lotion before you go!

Good transportation. The river has been used as a means of transportation for daily purposes.i find travelling on it a easy way to get to the destination quickly,no traffic.tickets can be bought at pier stations.

Must see but still too dirty!. When you visit Bangkok you have to have a look at the riverfront and ideally take a tour with the express boats to see Bangkok from a unique perspective. However, prepare yourself for some dirty water with lots of trash in it :/

Take a boat ride !. This river goes right through Bangkok and is a very important waterway for Thailand. You can use it to reach variuos attractions such as the Royal Palace. Take the special tourist boat or (better) the express boat.
Experience Bangkok from Chao Phraya River. Get a longtailboat wiith driver, use an hour or two, to discover and experience the city from a river perspective. It's interesting and gives good value.
A must see. Well worth a visit for great views of the city. The blue tourist boat is 40bhat to any stop and it's well worth going from Sathorn up to stop N13 for Khoa San Road.

Noisy busy but a must to see the sites. The river is full of boats if a shapes sizes and colours conveying everything for modern Bangkok. The tourist boats and the water taxis jostle for position at the jettys and no sooner has the boat come along side everyone is off and on in a flash. The noise and smell is fantastic and a lot of the temples and sites and sky scrapers of the city can be seen from the river. A great experience. Buy the day ticket for 150 bat and this allows you unlimited travel till 4am on the day of purchase. The river is banging 24 hrs a day!!

Brilliant, cheap, numerous options.... Jumped on this day after day, a bit of a rush getting on and off but it's ace. Cheap as chips and everything is easily accessible wherever you choose to disembark and explore.

Great sights. What a lovely afternoon spent on a public boat stopping at various destinations on the way Great food and souvenir shops, lovely people, and so calming watching all the boats along the river.Great temples to see and explore.The Chao Pryha river has it all and is the centre of life for Bangkok people

Cruisy way to get to Bangkoks attractions. Cruising along the Chao Phraya river is a good way to mve through the city of Bangkok. We got on board at Saphin Taskin pier.The skytrain stops here & after exiting the Skytrain, you walk staright to the pier. The cost of an all day ticket is 150 THB each. We travelled along the river & the stops are announced but sometimes they are a bit hard to hear. Just keep an eye out for the stop you need to get off on. There are four different routes and each one have a different of amount of stops. We got off at Mahala. Getting on & off the boat is relitivly easy but wait for the boat to stop moving first.
