Boat ride on the river . Hired a boat for an hour long ride on the river. The Thai govt seems to have made a lot of effort to make the river an attraction with success. Largely clean and not smelly at all. Was able to get into the interiors to get a feel of real Bangkok. Certainly worth the 1000 baht.

The lifeblood of Bangkok. Take a trip on one of the many barges or boats that take people up and down the river, to such destinations as Wat Arun or the ferris wheel. As a tourist visiting Bangkok, you should at least travel on Chao Phraya once!

A great way to see the City. Whether by public river taxi (highly recommended) or private hire boat (bargain hard!), the river is a great place from which to see some of the City's famous landmarks. If you happen to be in BKK on New Year's Eve it is the best place from which to see the fireworks.

Great way to get around Bangkok . As we only had 3 days in Bangkok we wanted to see as much as possible. We got to Chao Phraya central pier and got the 1 day ticket which was really cheap! We stopped at most of he piers to get off and have a look at what was in the area! It was a great way to see Bangkok and get around really easily!

Sunset at Chao Phraya. Believe me, watching sunset at another great river (Chao Phraya) of Asia is really something wonderful for me.I can spend whole evening waiting for sunset & clicking away hoping to get a perfect shot. Chao Phraya River is almost a life line to Thais in the olden days, and till now it still plays an important roles although other mode of transportations and exchanges had been evolved much along River of Chao Phraya.

Part of a proper Bangkok experience. Cruising down Chao Phraya river is definitely a part of a proper Bangkok experience. You won't have a full appreciation of the city without acknowledging the worth of it's river. Although Chao Phraya seems rather dirty and at times smelly, it is a great way of connecting with the palaces and temples in the old city. Just take a ferry from Saphan Taksin BTS station and you're there in no time, whilst admiring some of the views, like riverside hotels and Wat Arun. Don't use the private boats though, they're far too expensive.

Easy Pezy River Trip . For around USD 7 you really cannot go wrong. All day to travel on the cooling water. Definitely take the tourist option, as the express becomes the sardine express at the day's end.All the important landmarks are covered, and you can decide where and when you wish to get on and off. The best and easiest way too see BKK.

Not the cleanest, but offers great views. Not the leanest of rivers however a trip on a long tail boat will offer a great scenic ride. The long tail boats can take you along the small canals off the river to get a glimpse of the local life along the water, however badly impoverished. There are several temples off there and people can be observed fishing ,swimming and hanging laundry.Also along the main stretch of this river a free ferry boat can be taken to Asiatique , a complex of stores and restaurants that offer nightlife along the river, along with a giant Carousel and some smaller rides. A night ride on this free 10 minute ferry also provides a great evening view of the city skyline along this river.

Very nice, but avoid Rush Hour!. My family booked the tourist ferry (1 day pass) to get to Grand Palace and we didn't regret it. It was a good way to see the sites along Chao Phraya River as the ferry had an English-speaking guide who explains some of the sites. After Grand Palace to Saphin Taksin, we rode one of the other non-tourist ferries and decided to ride till the end of the route. On the way back, we got caught in Rush Hour (about 5 pm) and the ferry became really hot and crowded!!! Avoid the rush hour!!!

fasted way to move around in bangkok. fastest way to move around make sure they don't sell yu a longboat ticket before you board, the tickets you have to buy onboard, lots of locals there, nice vieuw of the city

Cleanish and nice views . Traveling along the river in some capacity is a must while in Bangkok. There are several options to take a ride, all with varying prices. I recommend taking the local express boats because they're cheaper and you see exactly the same thing. The river is pretty clean for being in a big city and there's no funky smell like other rivers can get.

TOURIST FERRY. Good way to see Bangkok tourist ferry leaves from Saphin Taksin wharf all day 40 baht single trip 150 baht all day trip on and off as often as you want till about 10pm,goes to Kings Palace, Wat Arun, Kaosan rd and a few more places to explore, some people prefer the 15baht boat but it can get very crowded and I'd rather pay the extra money

You Must do a boat ride down the river. Once you get off the main river and into the canals it is fascinating to see all the many and varied types of accommodation and there various states of disrepair.
Kids loved it. Boat, water, speed, working river - what's not to like. Excellent for both kids and adults - and it cooled us down in hot and dusty BKK
Evening dinner. Beautiful view of city with good performance and at lucrative price... Starts at 7pm ends at around 9pm.. Food is not recommended for vegetarians
Fun. Great way to explore. Hop on and off. Much quicker than the grid locked roads and some great places to explore when you hop off.

Take a private longboat tour!. Someone recommended to us a private longboat tour and it was so worth it - it was about 1.5 hours and $2100 THB for the two of us. We grabbed a couple of cold beers and got our camera ready. Great way to see some of the city from a different vantage point and it drops you off right by the Temple of the Reclining Buddha.

Popular location. River side cruise or dinner and drink by the Bangkok River Side City feels like a good escape from the busy streets of Bangkok. Its a way of getting yourself out of the jammed on the busy city.

A different way to see the city..... A good way to see a different side of Bangkok but the river is choppy & busy so no good for those who have any issues with boats or sea sickness!For us it was fun & a change from travelling by road.Some great places to see & a different lifestyle to observe.Make sure you haggle seriously with boat prices if you travel independently....some unscrupulous boat owners/drivers out there in the same way as you watch yourself with tuk tuk & taxi drivers.
Take a free ferry ride to see Bangkok. Take a ferry at one of the Piers to ride on a segment of the River and view the diverse beauty of Bangkok.

Murky River. Worth a quick run up from South to North dropping off in the north. The blue tourist line @ 70BHT is quite good. Go onto the front deck for best views. Commentary is in thai english and not brill.

River of Kings. Bangkok was founded on the (Thonburi) bank of the Chao Praya River and it always was a central component of Bangkok. The main historical monuments : The Royal Palace compound, Wat Arun, Wat Pho, and so many others are all along the river. But it is also a living place; a sizable proportion of Bangkokians live at or near the river. It is also where the best hotels of Bangkok (and some of the best in the world) are located (The Oriental, Peninsula, Hilton, Sheraton, etc.) Also many good restauranta and places of significant interest. Bangkok is a mess as far as traffic is concerned. Fortunately, the river traffic is (so far, at least) running much better. So a tourist can come to Saphan Taksin and take many of the boats that ply the river. This is an attraction in itself, but is also a smart way to visit historical Bangkok.

Good to see the "back alleys" on the river. Took a river boat around the river, which included entering and exiting a lock. The boat had to be negotiated with the driver starting at 1500 thb and was eventually settled at 800 thb. The trip had no information presented. We stopped at a fish feeding area, where the owners charge for bread to feed the fish. A single woman in a canoe glided out into the middle of the river for which we stopped again. She tried to convince us that she was a true representation of the famous floating market outside Bangkok. No sale as everything was western prices. The houses built on stilts were interesting. If you have a high speed camera, you will get some good photos. Phone camera shots all resulted in blurry pics. Completing the boat trip we exited the boat an a charge of 20 thb to use the jetty. sad good trip, but be sure to barter hard.

beautiful view, many exciting sites to see. We stayed in a condo on the Chao Pyraya River, it was beautiful. Looking at the river during the day or night was great. Lots of things to do, places to eat, dance, tour. Many restaurants have boat dinner cruises up and down the river, very special. Getting across the river from one side to the other is easy, we usually took the ferry boat across, about 2 min travel time.
Fun boat trip. Paid kind of the guys in the pier 2000bht for our own tailboat. ( 8 people). Good trip to see life on the river. The journey takes around 1 1/2 which we did at around 5pm.

Such a nifty way to get around. I regularly visit friends in Nonthaburi, for the price of a 5 minute taxi I get a lovely 2 hour boat trip in the sun with a great view. Such a relaxing way to travel. Just careful your boat doesn't explode.......

The river view provides a unique perspective of Bangkok. During my visit to Bangkok, I enjoyed a 1 1/2 hour private boat ride, which allowed me to take in quite a bit of the Chao Phraya River as well as several connected canals. There are a lot of Temples to see including Wat Arun, Temple of Dawn. I even took in the Holy Rosary Church, a distinctive sight in this predominantly Buddhist country. A unique experience was making a stop where the captain obtained some bread for me to throw out to the fish for good luck. The fish were voracious and ate every bit of the rolls that I tossed them! Images of the King and Queen were also featured prominently at points along the river.It was also interesting to see some of the connected canals. I particularly enjoyed seeing a huge lizard that was lounging along the water. On a hot day in Bangkok, it was nice to be on the water!I highly recommend hiring a small boat to enjoy the river. A reputable captain will be able to provide interesting insights into sites along the river and really enhance your trip along this special river in Bangkok.

Escape from the traffic plus you could enjoy the view. Very interesting experience. It's just like a bus that travel through the water. While in the boat, you can enjoy the surrounding view. The minus is language barrier with the crews. Just tell them where you want to go, they will tell you the fare. It's as cheap as the BTS.

Now that was a river. We stayed on the 15th floor of the Royal Orchid Sheraton Hotel which gave us a grandstand view of the river.We used the people's river boats as they were cheaper and better than the tourist ones. The river took us everywhere!The cross river ferries were even cheaper, 5tb for the two of us.We thought that the biggest con was those tours around the smaller canals, the tuk tuk drivers were always trying to get you to take one, it was very annoying indeed. A real adventure!
Dirty. The river is quite dirty as compared to rest of the water views in Thailand. Only the night time cruises are worth going otherwise it stinks.

Great way to travel. While in Bangkok, I should think that everyone goes on the river at some point. It really is a great way to get around, see some sights from the ferry, and cool down a bit from the breeze while moving. If nothing else, just go for a short ride - you're bound to enjoy it.

love Chao Phraya River. What I enjoy most about this river is taking a private boat ride from Saphan Taksin BTS station and cruising the river for an hour. I loved doing that when I began coming to Bangkok for the first time. Also, I enjoy the dinner cruises at night when you can observe all the luxury hotels and the temples lit up at night. What I don't enjoy about the river are the mass commuter boats which are usually cramped and have multiple stops which takes you forever to get to where you want to go. Besides this detail, Chao Phraya River is a must see for anyone visiting Bangkok whether it be day or night.

The Ganges of Bangkok, Excellent for ferry commute. Accessing the Chao Phraya river is easier done than said. The Exit No.2 of Saphan Taksin BTS Skytrain station opens up bang in front of the Sathorn pier on Chao Phraya river. The Sathorn pier has several ferries of different color flags, which could all become confusing for a 1st timer. Would recommend to avail the Tourist boat service, available for 150 THB for a day trip. The tourist boat has one guide explaining the places of attraction at a particular pier (Jetty) and is helpful. If you want to take a single hop ride, it costs 40 THB on this tourist boat. We visited Wat Pho and Wat Arun by availing the Tourist boat.Commuting on Chao Phraya river is best to catch some fresh air in Bangkok. Get there during the day itself to catch a glimpse of Bangkok from the river. Must try.

Great to get out on the river & see how big it is & how close you are to homes!!. Apart from a very scary time to get on & off the boat & no lifejackets evident we enjoyed the trip down the river & into some of the smaller canals where we got up close & personal with homes, temples & schools

Hire a small private boat!. Help a local out and hire a small private boat! Just take the sky train to Mo Chit and then walk along the river and negotiate a little for the 1-1.5 hour tour around the river ways. Awesome!

The Asian Venice. Out trip to Bangkok coincided with droves of tourists who were noisy and pushy. If you ignored them Bangkok was picture perfect. We hired a private boat for an hours trip on the Cho phraya river. Unfortunately the river is not too clean and not much effort has gone into keeping the route scenic. However it is still a must do for the peek that it offers into the day to day lives of the Thais who live along the river. The boat was in average condition and life jackets were provided though it was not compulsory to wear them. We went several temples and the boatman made no effort to point them out to us. He did stop the boat to point out 3 of the most gorgeous monitor lizards sunning themselves, and for an elderly lady pedaling soft drinks a la floating market. We got off at Wat Pho at the end of our trip. Nothing great about the boat and the boatman but the trip was indeed lovely and makes one wonder at the potential of developing it further.

Boat party on Chao Phraya river. If you have never visited Chao Phraya river, you have never been to Thailand. The river is gorgeous at night. If you have sometimes to spend in Bangkok, try the river cruise to see Bangkok with less traffic. You can see Bangkok 's old city and some key landmarks.

Longtail and commuter boats are cool, but water is very dirty. We took both the longtail and the commuter boats in the river – the longtail boats through the Thonburi Canals are really worth a trip and look into a very old, residential part of town. However, we got splashed by the river water many times, and it was very dirty and brown.
amazing!. locals use chao raya river like a road!! you can use boats to visit a ot of places in bangkok, like wat pho, grand palace, wat arrun, chinatown etc

Great way to see the city . If you are staying in Bangkok just shortly, like 2-3 days, going for a boat ride might be the best way to see more of the city, that normally would take you few days to visit. Also it is convinieron as you can go my sky train directly to boat pear (just ask your hotel to tell you name of the station) and jump in one of the boats that will take you for 30-80 BHT to Buda temple or Grand Palace. Price depends of the company and number of stations, but still even if you pay 80,it is still cheap versus taxis and similar. It is easy to get around and they will say each time name of station as well as few other intresting facts (at least boat I used did).

A corridor of fresh air in hot and humid Bangkok . I like to take the ferries, boat buses and long tail boats to visit the western klongs. There is always a current of fresh air, welcome! I like to sit at one of the many little kitchens by the river and look at the traffic on the water.

Short walk from Saphan Taksin station. If you like you using the BTS. There is a station a short walk from the Silom line Saphan Taksin station. It is easier and cheaper just to buy a day pass, just in case you need to use the boats more than once. I thought it was easier to take the train here, then ride the boats to the Wat Pho area instead of taking a taxi.It make take a little longer but I found the ride more enjoyable and less stressful. You can always use the MTS (subway system) if you are next to those stations.

Take a ride and view city. . This is a very long river. It is the Mississippi of Thailand. For a very low fair you can hop on river taxi and ride for quite some time. Locals and tourists use this as a mode of transportation. I think it is a must do. Safe for families too but keep the kids grounded. Use this to go up or down river to a temple or 2. Have coins ready for the fare. Just board at your stop. An attendant will shake a Pringles type can as your cue to pay up.
Do a water taxi or boat. You can do the water taxi at the least but take a boat ride up the side canals to see the way the canal people live. Stop to feed the palace fish.

Fascinating, Working Waterway. A must-visit, even if it means taking a tourist boat. Not sure if the long tailed boats still operate (only saw the river at night on this visit) but that would be my recommended way of seeing the river and what's on the banks.

Cheap and easy when you find a pier! . Took a boat from Wat pho to central pier. Was very cheap (36baht for 2). Hard to find how to get to a pier. Had to walk through a mini market area (looked like a dead end). Signage helps you work out which boat to get but not how much it will be. Helpful pier man told you when it was the right boat for you if you told him where you needed to go. The pier opposite way pho is also the pier for the ferry to take you to the other side of the river (Wat Arun) for 3 baht.

A must see (kind of). Taking a river taxi on the Chao Phraya is pretty much essential to experiencing Bangkok. It's still a main throughfare for rice barges and office workers who work near the river's edge or take other transportation once ashore. Innumerable structures of varying importance all along the route. Day tickets can be the best deal - get on and get off at will, including the Royal Palace.

Get a boat ride and cruise the river. My family had the chance to rent a boat and cruise the river at morning. Although i would reccomend coming here at night as you could see the skyline with beautiful lights along the wat arun temple

Excellent way of communication. Very useful to view Grand Palace, Phra Kew, Wat Pho and Wat Arun. Take orange flag ferry over chao phraya river for say around 14-15 baht per head. There are several River Cruises ove this river in the evening which are mesmerizing.

Dinner cruise at night . Booked to go on a dinner cruise on the river, the boat was small and not packed but also it was not buffet style but order before you get on. Seeing Bangkok at night on the river with so much lit up is truly spectacular and I would throughly recommend it and the price was reasonable for a lot of food and drinks

Watch the World of Bangkok Goes-by. The Chao Phraya River or a grandeur way 'the River of Kings' is many things to different people. Many local Thais and even tourists are using the river as a route for transportation. Many heavy cargos are being shipped down stream from upcountry to Bangkok. There are many canals linking with the river which offer unique sightseeing into rural life along the canal. However the best to observe the Chao Phraya River is to find a front row seat at a riverside hotel and watch the life along the river. It is fascinating and wonderful sight.

Nice ride. The ferry boat ride not only offers transportation and a fair commute, yet it's an interesting journey to explore that part of Bangkok from its river banks. You can enjoy every single aspect: tall modern buildings, posh palaces and the squalid run down huts inside the water ! Nice experience overall!
Take a boat ride. The Chao Praya river is the heart of Bangkok and any visit is incomplete without a boat ride on the river. Take the orange flagged express boat for an authentic view from the river.

Kazi Fazlul Kabir. A river that means many. All 5 star hotel surrounding, many good design bridges. Navy head quarter, Golden temple, palace of king and many more. Neat and clean water.5 star standard River cruise through many ships with very discipline way fill your mood with joy.

Bustling River. A very busy little river, quite dirty too. Was part of the Bangkok experience for us though, but it's nothing to rave about. Taking the 'Local's Ferry' (orange flag) helped get us from point A to point B at a third of the price of the 'Tourist Ferry' (blue flag) but it was interesting to see all the other little longboats and tug boats etc working away in the river too.

Slipping back in time. Apart from being a an important highway for many Bangkok residents on their daily commute, the river is has its own life. Taking one of the long-tail boats trips, even if only for an hour will open up a whole new city to you. A city as it was decades ago living within the new high rise Bangkok.Be sure to take your camera as this is a Bangkok that people never see on the news and travel brochures. From the houses no longer level as some of their supports have sunk more than others, to the young kids leaping from those houses into their playground the river itself. I have taken a river trip 7 or 8 times now when I find a spare moment during my visits to Bangkok and never get bored with. Certainly a must do if visiting Bangkok.
Best way of transport through Bangkok. Used it several times to visit interesting places in Bangkok. No traffic jams and always a fresh wind.
Must do. Great way to see Bangkok Sights river taxi is frequent and you can get off and on at malls restaurants and temples.
convenience boat. the river has boat transfer that is very convenience to go to kaosan area from charoengkrung.can take bus but had traffic jam so should take boat with out rain day.

Sorry, not an attraction? . Okay, I admit. We got off the MRT and what looked like and sounded like a nice tuktuk driver offered to take us to the boats for 50 baht. We said no but decided to go back. Mistake 1. We were then taken to a boat place and they tried to do us for 3000 baht, we haggled down to 2000 baht for 2 to ride in a boat that splashed us with the dirty water of the river. Mistake 2.They did take you near various sites but you didn't have a clue what they were and to be honest, from the boats it's not a great view. They also took you to a laughable floating market with an old lady selling tat from her dinghy. As a last gasp when no one was buying her rubbish, she asks you to buy a drink for the person driving your boat, everyone declined and then the driver hands the old lady a whole load of drinks, clearly previously scammed tourists!!! Finally it was a ride over to a pier near Wat Pho where they charged us 5 baht per person to disembark. Mistake 3. Wish I had read the reviews here first. I can't help but feel there are a lot of tourist traps in Bangkok. Be wary. It's a costly mistake.

Take a longtail boat!. Many ways to enjoy the Chao Phraya. You can take a longtail boat across the river and tour the many canals there. An hour or two hour trip is quite pleasant. You see the canalside homes and life and pass several lovely wats. In the evening I suggest one of the many dinner cruises. We didn't want the huge, glitzy, band playing ships so opted for a converted rice barge cruise...small group and very quiet but same view as the big ships.

Short canal trip. Done a long boat short ride and to be honest that was long enough on this boat. Seats very low down and we stopped at a floating market and was virtually forced into buying something to get the guy to move on. Went up canals the bigger boats can't do and that's when you see the real Bangkok with shanty style houses etc

Not a RIver you want to swim in ;). Chao Phraya is the drainage from Bangkok...most of the waste water goes into the ChaoPhraya RIver and lots of chemicals from nearby leather factories which colour leather for everything, from couches to expensive sportscars. However, if you are in Bangkok, A River Tour is a must! ... dont book a fixed tour with a tour operator, there are plenty of places where the Taxiboats stop, its a genious public transport system and you ofen much faster as if you would have used a street. Bangkok (Krungthep, like the Thais calling it) was once called the Venice of the East and I remember times when most of the big roads in Bangkok like Silom or Sukhumvit had large channels for boats... There are still channels running behind Sukhumvit, just ask a local for the next Klong (Channel)

Boat Trip. This is a must see itinerary in Bankok.I have done this many times over the years.It has been getting busier every year,but is still cheap and easy to get around the city by water.Plenty of Temples to see or stop over and visit.
Dinner cruise. Had a lovely 2 hour evening dinner cruise along the river. Sights very different in the evening all lit up

Boat Ride on Chao Phraya River. A great day on the river can be had buy catching one of the local commuter boats from Central Pier, catch the BTS to Saphan Taksin from there it is a short walk down to the pier. Catch any of the boats. A trip all the way up the river to Wat Klongkret is about an 45minutes and the cost is around 20bhat each way. You can get off have a look around the Wat then catch the boat back again. Great way to experience the river.
just so so. it is the second time we take Chao Phraya Tourist Boat. A lot of scenic spots along the way. the boat is fast, while the river is not clean.

Long Tail Boat. There are many ways to travel on the river through Bangkok. Ferries, dinner cruises etc all of which are great but everyone should try the Long Tail service. Takes about 20 people is a long narrow boat power but huge diesel engine with very long drive shaft to the propeller. Difficult to get in and out of the boat but a blast when they let rip. Huge rooster tails and expert drivers make it a real experience. Thb 100 for a one way trip.
Unique and excellent way to see south side of Bangkok.. A must to do in Bangkok. Very fun, cheap and interesting way to see a part of Bangkok. Very easy to get to from the BTR.
Haven't seen Bangkok unless . . .. You've visited the Chao Phraya River. Take the tour during the day or, even better, take a dinner cruise at night. You won't regret it.

The backbone of Bangkok. Chao Phraya river is the backbone of Bangkok and also touches the places which are the delight of Bangkok. Siding on both sides of the river, apart from the amazing cruises and parties, you have the temples, the palace, China town, Khao San road (the amazing), and many other attractions that are a must. Just a walk over the bridges and on the sides of the river is a pleasing activity for one to do.
Mighty river. We like just to seat down at Chao praya bank and observe river life...or to take river boat and explore Bangkok from river side.
Chao phraya river. Plenty of nice scenery pleasant trip in the boat plenty of stop offs nice clean river also floating markets available
Love for the boat ride. Love the idea of taking a boat. Feels like we are heading to another island but actually we are still around that area.

Avoid it. This river is foul looking. I made the same mistake as the last by letting a taximan brng me to a boat. It cost me. They bring you side channel where you are prey to hawkers. If woubwant to go across it find a public crossing point. The smell of diesel is overpowering. There is even a landing fee if you go on a private trip.

Chao Phraya River cruise. Took the river cruise on the Chao Phraya Princess. Great experience to see the sights of Bangkok at night, the well lit temples and monuments, while enjoying a meal and a drink with singing and dancing on the upper deck!

Cool public transportation . Take the orange public boat from Pra Athit #13 to China Town #7 or Wat PO #8. Don't believe touts who say they aren't running. No need for guide or long tail boat. Just get the public boat

Regular. Even after many years of short visits to the big city, I still get a buzz from taking the public ferry up or down the river. Although my main purpose is commuting easily from one area to another, I will always make a point of taking visiting guests on the ferry for the experience and view.

Great. This was a really nice and cheap way to travel around Bangkok. The guide on the boat also talks you through your surroundings as you travel down the river and explains clearly what each stop is best for e.g. Wat Pho, Grand Palace

Very cool sights!. We took the public boat with orange flag for 15 bhat pp. We got on at Sathorn Pier and went to the Palace. Very reasonable way to travel and we saw so much from the boat! Lots of fun.
A river and Klong tour is a must when visiting Bangkok.. Spending a few hours on the river and the Klongs is a well worth excursion for any tourist visiting Bangok.
Greet and love it. Hi my friend chao phraya river very good night tour. I have dream hight in boat. My place very good. Food very dilishes and singerr very hipe. I love this tour .

Fun!. If you go to Thailand you have to go on the traditional boat! We took 1 hour trip around the river and we enjoyed it so much! We saw how locals live near the river and even met a woman who sells bits and bobs for tourists and she was so lovely that we had to buy from her :) it is must do when you go to Bangkok,interesting to see how river provides people.

Bangkok's Birthplace. This river is what helped Bangkok become the new Capitol of Thailand, taking over for the old Capitol of Ahyuttah ...The river flows into the Gulf of Thailand in a very convenient location for commerce , and travel.

Very cheap travel. I stayed in a hotel very close to the ferry terminal on the river.The fare cost is 13B no matter how many stops you travel (approx 26p uk)You can stay on the express ferry for approx 80mins before it reaches the other end of the terminus. It travels by many interesting sights/ sites.Try not to use during rush hour to get the best seating place. Easy to hop on and off and you can buy day tickets for the tourist ferry but this will cost you more than the express ferry. I personally used it to visit Koa (sp) San road get off at N13 pier. Took me back to my youth :-)

Be wary of different ticket prices for boats. i wish i had read a previous review on what tickets to purchase for the boats. We were charged 40 baht and a lady did talk on a microphone and you couldn't understand a word. We got off to visit the grand palace, then trying to get back we were told it was 14baht and you pay on the boat. They kept saying 5 mins..but we waited in the sun for about half an hour and then a boat came, a few people got off and a few managed to jump on as it started to pull away. Very overcrowded and no life jackets. We finally managed to get back to Centrepoint but it took a long time and they were trying to fit as many people as they could. The river wasn't that exciting to look at to be honest.

Great way to see Bangkok but buy the right ticket. There is the blue service which 40B one way or 150B all day which stops off at all the piers with some pretty ordinary commentating. Alternatively take the orange service for 15B and just ride the river and enjoy the sights (and smells!).You can get off at the Grand Palace, Reclining Buddha, opposite Wat Arun (extra 3B to cross), Chinatown and the Flower market.You can catch the BTS Express from pier one.Thanks for the vote if you found this helpful.
Want some free typhoid?. Cruise the river on a fast boat with water splashing on your face! Try to ignore all of the pipes spewing raw sewage into the water.

what an experience!. The first time we went up the river we went on the tourist boat and got off at the flower markets. The second time we went on the locals boats that was great fun, we went right to the end of the river to the Clock Tower and got off went to the shops fed the fish then got back on again. It cost about £3 each. we loved the scenery! although quite noisy with the whistles that the Boat assistants blew every time people got on and off it was great fun being on board.

River and canals. We paid about 1000 THB and took a long tail boat along the river and the canals. It was great to see the temples, hotels, restaurants and other boats coming and going. But the canals were the best part - a different life away from the bustling city and river. Definitely recommend exploring the canals and seeing the variety of housing, gardens, shops, everyday activities. Also crowding into the lock at the end and finally coming out into the river again. We didn't want to stop along the way, just wanted to take in the views.

A local taxi boat. We caught a local taxi boat to take us up 1 hour up the river. This way is very cheap and you get to see sights. We got off at places to look around then bought ticket back. Highly recommend.

I enjoyed it . We used the river to get from the Hilton to Mango Tree On The River in Phranakorn. Our ride was a choppy and splashy one. Getting to the same place by road taxi, however, would have taken us at least two hours. Instead, it took us 10 minutes.

Fun Way to Spend Time. An inexpensive way to spend time and see the many sights from the water. Go to any pier, buy a cheap ticket and travel to any pier, get off, shop, eat, get back on another ferry to return to your hotel or keep going ! Just remember the ferries do stop running early evening but if you start early in the day it can be a really fun way to see Bangkok.

Yeeeeeehah . Love the Chao Phraya river well worth a trip in a long tail boat...exploring the canals is always good. Evening dinner cruises are fantastic ..seems cooler too.a must do in bkk I usually use the dock next to the grand palace

Fantastic . What a great experience, so many things to see wether you take a longtail boat or express boat, the sights and smells of Bkk at its most interesting.
Express boat 14 baht, so cheap and you can travel as far as it goes or get off at any one of its ports also.g the way.

Watch it boat tickets scam!!!!. When you coming to saphan taksin pier there are 2 LINES!!!!!The number 1 line:The counter and the workers will try to sale you the 40 baht ticket for so called "tour boat"(a thai lady talking in a microphone during the sail you want understand a word)The number 2 line:It's cost only 14 baht but the won't tell you about it unless you ask.Sometime you pay at the boat so the collector try to charge me 40 instead of 14 but than I realize he is not given me a ticket just taken the money.when I asked for ticket I realized its 14 baht and I asked for my change,SCAMMER.IT'S NOT coincidence that the prices are 14 and 40 watch it!!!!

A must in Bangkok, but be prepared for dirty and rough water. The Chao Praya River is a must in Bangkok - there are many different ways of seeing it - a dinner cruise, a long tail boat or simply a local boat for 13 baht. No matter how you do it be really prepared for rough waters.

Awesome view. Travelling by boat in the river gives us a great view of the citys main.attractions and places which we cannot visit because of heavy rush.Best is to take the orange boat costing u only 13THB at night so wr can see the lighted plsces etc.

Chao paraya cruise. The cruise organised by Chao paraya cruise is good.They cater to Indian culinary tastes and the food served is very good. especially vegetarian food is not a big problem.The ship is well maintained and the route offers all beautiful views of the banks of bangcock.it's worth the effort to go for a cruise on Chao paraya

Fantastic way to get around Bangkok. Very frequent (until sunset at least) boats, fast, fun and cheap. Not only is this an efficient way of getting to many interesting points in the city but also fun!
Enjoy the Riverside view. Take the express boat taxi! It's a cheap way to get around and you will enjoy a free complementary river sightseeing tour. Offers a nice alternative view of the city
Lovely experience. I was on a dinner cruise at d chao phraya river and it was lovely..the views are great and so was d food.

A good transportation mode. Taking the ferry with the orange flag which cost 13 Baht for each ride regardless of the distance travelled was a very good way to go from one place to another. You cannot get lost using it as it will bring you back to BTS Saphan Taksin and you can take the skytrain back to where you came from.The Mae Nam Chao Praya River is obviously intended to be a mode of travel rather than a touristy clean river to "behold", like some of the rivers in other parts of the world. The touristy part of it is that most of the people I saw travelling on ferries up and down were tourists.I suppose the locals know how to get from one place to another using short cuts on land, or by bus, which we did not know.
Skip the boat tour. Skip the boat tour on the river, there's nothing much to see except for dirty water and a few pretty houses, not worth to spend money on

Interesting trip. An interesting trip along the river side canals. It is nice to do in the mornings so you have a chance to see most of the daily living. During the hot hours you can enjoy the breeze. Very recommended.

The great tour by boat. Chao Phraya is the heart river in Bangkok. For sightseeing around the river, take a boat in the day time. You will see all temples and view of Bangkok's. Worth trip in Bangkok.

Chao Praya River. This is the river that flows through Bangkok and gives it wáters to the sea nearby. Bangkok is built on its delta and there are many Canals and bridges around the city to pass from one place to the other.
This river has its own transport, you can travel by the river which has stations along the city.
Great fun. We took a private long boat on the river and absolutely loved it and the canal network. I wish we also hadn't done so by night as I hear this is a highlight of a Bangkok stay.
Lunch by the river. Lovely to sit and watch all the boats go by carrying various loads with the beautiful temples in the background

Great way to see the sights. Can be crowded, especially between Central Pier and N9 (for the Grand Palace) but a run up to N30 on the orange flag express boat must be the best value boat trip on the planet at 14 Baht for just about an hour trip. Get off at N30, walk south along the river to the small Chinese Temple, then back a few metres for a cold drink overlooking the river on a floating platform restaurant. Once refreshed, back again, past many of the sights to central, but this time with a good seat as you will start from the quiet end of the route.
Longtail cruise. Not bad, could not understand the tour guide, very heavy accent, just kept nodding my head. Some highlights, alligators, kids swimming.

Nice . Riding on the river is fun, but make sure you have sunscreen lotion, water and something to cover yourself to not get sunburned. It costs only 13 baht the orange one and you can see lots of buildings.

Good way to see Bangkok. The Chao Phraya River runs through the heart of Bangkok. There are many temples to be seen along its shoreline. It is a great way to travel to visit areas of interest in the city as well. Get yourself a long tail boat to take you where you want to go, or just cruise the river and take in the sights and scenes of life along the river. Fares are cheap.
A great way to see BKK. Traveling on the river is a great way to see BKK and to get tto places that might be a long and warm bussride away, such as Chinatown and Khao San Road
River view. Have taken a river tour both by day and night and must say I prefer the night visit. The golden temples and palaces and tall buildings are just amazing in the night with all the lights.
Great Way To Get About in Bangkok. For your first time use this service as it explains what you get to see at each stop. After that use Public Water Taxis they are less than half price for each trip

Cheap boats, definitely just hop on one and enjoy. From Saphan Taksin to Tha Chang, it was only 13 bht and the ride was great, lots to see. It really is such a busy river. If you have time, take one boat up the famous bridge, we were not able to go there due to time constriants. But if you have some to spare, the boat fare is easy on the pocket and the view easy on the eyes :)

Best way to get around and fun viewing. I always choose a hotel on the river so I can use one of the riverboat transport options. Most riverside hotels offer free river shuttle boats that can be used by anyone. The river mall and Asiatique also offer free boats. There are public river boats with many stops and a tourist version with more limited stops but with narration of the attractions along the way.

what makes bangkok bangkok. this river shows you what bangkok is all about. the best way to go around the river is by getting on the public boat. its like a tour of bangkok where you can see the industry, people, water transport, temples and its au natural!

Worth a little boat ride. A boat ride either across or down the Chao Phraya should form an essential part of any visit to Bangkok. Its a good way to check out the old and new architecture of the city and, depending on how fast your boat is travelling, can provide some relief from the stifling heat of the city. It's also the best way to cross to see Wat Arun. The river itself is quite polluted and extremely busy so not very photogenic but still a good way to soak up the atmosphere of life in Bangkok.

Interesting. Take either the water taxi up and down the river or rent a private taxi boat similar to the 007 movie scene and enjoy the speed as well as going into the little off lets from the main river.

Long boat on the River and Canals!. We arranged through our hotel to take a long boat (motorized) for an hour and half tour of the Chao Phraya River and its many canals. A must do! The river itself is bustling and fun, but it is the canals behind the river, with the residential homes, temples and markets that show the true feel of Bangkok!
Get the bus!. The water buses are really regular and the orang bus stops at most stops and is cheap enough to get on and travel up and down the river - perfect way to see the sights.

Over the river. Take the public ferry from the pier near the royal palace and head north. For just THB13 you will take a long journey over the river. You will get a different and interesting view of the city. You will also enjoy a close encounter with thai people on their everyday lifestyle. On the way back disembark near chinatown and the day tour is complete.

Riverside scenery. A tour on public or private boats is very pleasant, enjoy the arun temple, lights and the many restaurants along the river, asiatique night market or take a free shuttle boat to hotels on the river.

River of Kings. Travelling up and down the river is easy and affordable, you can get an all day pass, which allows you to hope on and off the ferries as you please, so much to see and the ferries stop at all the tourists spots, including China Town.You can also arrange a tour in a long tail boat along the river and through the various canals that stops at a waterside market place.I also recommend an evening dinner cruise, the Chao Phraya river is spectacular at night.

A great riverboat ride. I suggest if you want to see how people on the river live, then take a river boat cruise in a long boat. You get taken down the various lane ways of the canals and see some amazing sights, beautiful houses as some which look like they are going to fall over any moment. All of this adds to the rich tapestry that is thailand.

Gem of a way to experience Bangkok culture. I took the ferry to nip across the river to visit a museum ,these ferries are as much a part of Bangkok as the black cab is to London . There are large boats acting as main line routers along the river then smaller ones nipping across the other side and even long tails boats. The pace of boats comings and going may seem frantic as people prepare to board and disembark . Engines roar as the helmsman deftly nudges the boat against the landing area whilst being guided by a shipmate by way of coded pips and blows from his chattery whistle. A fascinating and fun way to experience Bangkok life.

Amazing ride for a perfect romantic dinner. The river has many cruise options by many operators catering to food and entertainment requirements for people from different parts of the world. It also has motor boat ride, and ferry rides. The dinner cruise is one good option to spend evening with your loved ones. It has food, drinks (on payment), music and dance on the floor. A memorable dinner option

A Pleasant Boat Trip. We took a tuk tuk to one of the piers on the waterfront and picked up a private boat to take us on an hour and a half trip up the river and into the canal. Lots of things to see including temples. We paid about 2,400Bht for the two of us which I thought was pretty expensive but we still enjoyed the experience and I suppose its one of those 'must do's' when in Bangkok.

The Bangkok River. We have just booked to go back and of course we are staying at the one and only Shangila hotel in Bangkok. Take my word for it do not stay anywhere else!My wife is so in love with this brown river that you expect hippos to appear from that I booked a river side room. She has asked to repeat all the river trips and is totally in love with the fact we can get to the night market for our nightly restaurant trips. Free from the hotel by the way! Use the river, it's great for entertainment and just getting around.

Lots to see. East to go along the river to get to the various well known landmarks. You can pay on the boats and it is a cheap way of travel. The boats can get very full and you have to squeeze on so check which stops you need to get off at. The stops are all numbered but prepare the one before you want to work your way to the exit point.Get a map that shows all the stops for the spot you want.There are several different coloured flag boats. The blue one is the tourist boat more expensive and does not stop at al the stops. The orange one seems the more popular.
Take a ferry to beat the traffic. We took a ferry to beat the traffic. It is a nice way to see the cityscape from a different vantage point. You can take the ferry to the reclining Buddha.
Boat trip. It was a great experience to go thru the canals and see the living of regular Thai people. Later we came to the river which is a major shipping route. Very good and fun experience.
A must for all tourists. Best advice if you don't want to go on a night cruise for dinner is to use the public waters boats very cheap and will take you to see the various sites.
Get a boat. We went on a ferry as alternate transport. We loved all the sites we got to see along the way. Well worth doing it
A very clean but narrow river. The river is pretty clean and is a slightly narrow river. A good dinner cruise on the river is a really entertaining and relaxing thing to do in Bangkok.

Polluted, but pretty views.. The water constantly had trash and muck floating in it, but it is also used commercially. We took a longtail boat tour of some of the canals which was highly worthwhile. Waterfront property takes on a different meaning here! We even saw a Komodo dragon sunning itself on the banks of one of the canals. The canals have a series of locks to raise up and allow passage to different canals. Fascinating to be in one!
James Bond boats!. Brilliant hour or so's trip. Very interesting sights on the river of boats, people and buildings. We arranged this through our guide. Would definitely recommend.

Nice way to get around Bangkok. This river is agreed way to get around the city. For 40 baht you can get all the way from Up near Khao San road down to the southernmost stop. Cheap and easy to use. Do not let some tourist boat company sell you a tour of the river. Go up north to the northernmost stop and get a canal tour from there.

Long boats on the river. Take plenty of suntan lotion.You will be whisked at speeds down the Klongs as they are called in Thailand . They stop every so often and you can g are shops along the river to buy souvenirs . There is a snake farm also

boat taxi. if you are close to it , must use ! cool , calm , time to look around on both side , cheap many stop from top to bottom only 40 baht .great to go for example from wat poh to china town and then from china town to asiatique huge market made in former warehouse

Interesting. A great sight seeing tour of Bangkok , we got the river taxi from Central pier and travelled north for about an hour , the best sight seeing tour of Bangkok in my eyes , so relaxing and so cheap

A great way to spend an afternoon. A great way to see the sights and meet the ordinary folk of Bangkok - just go down to the river at the bottom of Silom Road (by Sky Train station) and get a ticket all the way to the end - not the express - cost is THB 28 for 2 people (1 way) - bit of a crush - but get to the front of the ferry boat and get a seat and take photos on the way up - you have to get off and onto another ferry boat to come down - very enjoyable

The wet beating heart of Bangkok!!. I could start saying that the 2 hours long tail boat tour on the river can be pricey but at the end of the journey you will be rewarded with the view of what really this city hides between its canals and klongs, you can take the one hour tour but only takes you on the main river and a couple of canals right outside the main route, the 2 hours is more deeply into how local people deals with river everyday, definitely worth it, gives a different perception of the city itself.

The hub of Bangkok. Very very busy but a lifeline for the city. Inexpensive to travel there are a variety of boats I have seen no where else. Barges run up and down day and night with pleasure/ dinner cruises in the evening with everything else in between. Diesel fumes pollute the air but that is Bangkok. A must do!

Very cherishing. It is my first day in bangkok with only half day left, we went to Wat arun temple,At evening this river ride is very special, you get see the bangkok on the boat..We took 30 mins ride, I really enjoyed it. Wide river, tall buildings just beside the river.I recommend it during evening hours

Do it on a public boat, not tourist boat.. Tickets are very cheap and you can get off whenever you like, even go to the end of the line. Great views od everyday life on the river in Bangkok for a very cheap price.

Do take the tourist ticket for atleast a day. This is really amazing and takes you to almost all the top tourist spots of the Bangkok like Grand Palace, Wat Arun, China Town (Whole sale market), Asiatique, Maharaja Pier, Kao Shan Road (Really very cheap and good shopping location)At first my wife was planning to skip it but once we went, she said she would had missed it. I would recommend everyone to atleast take a tourist ticket and start as early as possible and try to land in every pier, you will not regret

You haven't seen Bangkok if you haven't seen the river!. Taking either the express tourist boat or the cheap hop on hop off local ferry is such fun and takes in views of all the places of interest along the river. It's a great way to get the true atmospher of Bangkok, and you can hop aloof where the fancy takes you. A must do!

Snake around the City. This mighty river goes a long way to offer you all types of activities and views! Transiting on it is often easier and faster than by land, and with the adjoining klongs nthen even more places to reach.

Your gateway to Siam's history. Some of Thailand's most famous historical sites are located on the Chao Praya River in Bangkok. Examples are the Grand Palace/Temple of the Emerald Buddha, Wat Arun, and the Temple of the Reclining Buddha.Bangkok is notorious for terrible traffic, but traveling via the river will let you avoid that.BEWARE OF SCAMS. Public transportation on the river only costs 13 - 100 BAHT. Get a water taxi. Avoid scammers who try getting you to pay high prices for a tour of the river. Taxis will take you to all the places you want to go.

Rice barge Cruise. Two hour cruise. First hour through canals , second hour on Chao Phaya river with multi fruit, juice and local whiskey added. (30%). A bit touristie but sometimes you have to do it. Canals interesting with locals living
Dangerous. Filthy, keep your mouth covered if taking a boat trip, no health and safety rules here. \Literally pushed on and off boats as fast as possible with no care for personal safety
Fun. If you have the opportunity, just take a water ferry on the river. It is an easy way to get around, super cheap, and interesting. If I remember right it is 5thb per person

Longboat. A longboat trip on the river is funny. The floating market stop is nice if you enjoy local food.
The Wat Arun temple was boring (maybe because they were restoring it and it was covered by construction activity)

Interesting views. This is a must do...riding one of the taildragon boats down the river and into a canal. It's an experience of sights from modern to very old along the river. You can see the city's skyline, temples, newer homes and some that were built many years ago on stilts, and a few ladies selling their goods in their boats. one place we stopped at where we bought loaves of bread to feed these huge fishes surrounding our boat, this was to symbolize good luck.

The watery heart of Bangkok. The Chao Phraya runs through the heart of Bangkok, and passes many of the most famous sights - including the Grand Palace and the Temple of the Dawn (Wat Arun). If you're visiting Bangkok, its highly recommended to take a longtail boat along the river and canal network - you'll see a whole different side of the city.

Nature in the city. Love the sunset views on the river and the river taxi city views. Going down the river gives you the opportunity to see Bangkok from a different angle and I'd really recommend it. Lots of locals also travel up and down the river to get from work to home and so on
Great. Went on a river Cruise for a tour and a meal for my wife's birthday , fantastic food and entertainment . We went with the Chaophraya Cruise company .
Busy. Travel via water taxi to different attractions. It can be very busy, make sure you are aware of your stops.

The coronary artery of Bangkok. The Choa Praya River is great for many reasons, yes it is dirty, but you're not going to drink it or swim in it. It's like a great highway through the center of Bangkok. It's one of the best was to see the city, day or night for so little money 10-30 THB for a river boat. I's also a great way to cool off on a hot day riding up or down the river. You see the whole gamut of buildings, from simple broken down shacks to majestic skyscrapers, working barge boats to colorful long tail speed boats. A must for any visitor.

Don't take the tourist ferry. Not worth it.. Don't take the tourist ferry if possible. Just take the normal ferry, it has higher frequency and is cheaper. The pier is a very very messy place. No clear signs of where to queue for what ferry. Tons of tourists.. just take the ferry once to experience it is enough. Won't be taking it again on my next visit.
Easy transportation. We took a boat down the river to get from A to B, which is a quick easy cheap way to travel however there isn't much to see along the river
Great fun. Took a dragon boat out for an hour to see the canals. Driver was great, we got a good price and the views were stunning. We went late afternoon when it was cooler

Vibrant and a welcome gust of fresh air. The quickest way to travel in BKK.
Jump on the cheap and regular ferries and get lost in Chinatown or old town Bangkok. Hopefully the riverside development won't ruin this special place.
Surely one of the finest rivers in the world?

River was rough water was dirty. First time visited Bangkok and chao praya right very is a must visit river for Bangkok city of river. Feel slightly I save with the the vocal taxi that transport you from pier to pier. The river was rough on the surface current and dirty in the water. Just be beep are that the water may splash on you. But it is a good experience for tryout trip.Will suggest to try on the river cruise at night, which comes with large cruise which might be more safer.

Get thee to the river. The river is a good vantage point to see temples at night lit up and the river is a contrast to the bustle of the Bts of the day. We are still slated to hit Asiatique and the Thai version of the London eye to get the full river experience later this week but I would try to make it to the river at least once. It is a working river more Mississippi river than scenic but I liked seeing barges bring pulled and lit up river cruise boats.
Smart way to tour all the city . Not clear water , but good idea to tour the city in short time , you may witness good locations and temples around and have an idea about the city

The city view in the evening from the river is awesome. Definitely worth a trip over the ferry of a personal long boat ride through the river in the evening. Some ferries are free (Asiatique Riverside market ferry), some are run by the local agencies and very reasonable and some places you can get the hi speed boat rides, which are fun to ride along. They start their prices at 800BH per person and can come down to around 400-500BH if one tries to negotiate and there are more number of passengers. Enjoy the ride !

Busy River. We Had A Reasonably Shortish trip on the River of Kings,On a Biggish boat that plys from Saphan Taksin Pier up the river to the Grand Palace approx 15 Minutes for 30 Baht =60 English Pence,This strech of the Chao Praya is quite busy,An enjoyable trip just for the breeze alone.................
Great alternative to traffic jams. Take the Chao Praya Express to get from place to place. We also visited Asiatique via our hotel's boat. It's lovely to watch the boats at night, many are lit up.
Nice to do, convenient. Take the tourist boat day pass for 150 Bath. You can hope on and off along the river and visit Bangkok this way. Very nice and better than long tail boats.

Take a boat ride along the river!. I thoroughly enjoyed taking the public boat along Chao Phraya river- also a great way to see many of the sites of Bangkok which you can't access by public transport easily. These include Wat Arun and Wat Pho. The tourist boat is more expensive but covers all the attractions in a day pass, otherwise you can take the public boats and pay on board.

Wonderful Views. We took a private tour cruise down the river and it was a very pleasant experience. As an amateur photographer there are a lot of photo ops as your cruising down the river, very interesting and worth while if you have time to spare.

dirty swamp water. been down this river twice now and survived.went on the locl taxi service and surprised it didnt sink under the weight of people on board if your health and safety concious you will be in for a shock. also been across river to the klongs on a long tail boat first time 2015 was great but this year we had the most miserable boatman in thailand what a utter t**t totally spoiled the trip bossing us around and we are paying for the priveledge.still spent his tip on a nice cool singha when we got back.all in all how does anything live in this water ???
Icon of the Thai capital city. Interesting to compare it to Seine river like in Paris.More interesting to be nearby at the end of the afternoon and for the evening.A must do...
Loy Nava Dinner Cruise. Our second visit to Bangkok and our second visit to Loy Nova - great views excellent food and service

Nice views but water is dirty. We had a sightseeing boat trip. The boat itself was a cute wooden boat that had allot of charme. The views are beautifull and you will see allot of historical sites. The boat does allot of stops so i guess it also serves as some kind of water bus so it is a wasy way to go around Bangkok. There was a guide on the boat who explains allot about the sites history wich is a free bonus. Only downside would be the amount of trash floating around. Thailand should consider cleaning it some time.

Crossing The River. I was crossing the river from Wat Arun to a restaurant on Ta Chang pier...the water was soo chocolate and cannot see the golden fish that our guide promote. the wave from other boat also make the long boat not steady..cannot see the royal boat at that time, but we able to see what that the river was major river for public transportation in Bangkok
Nice Evening Activity. If you have time you should go for Chao Phraya River cruise. It is a nice experience. You will enjoy the ride.

Easy way to get up & down Bangkok. The river has several taxis , the Blue flag boat is oriented towards tourists  ( & charges extra for it but covers fewer piers ( ? )  while the Orange flag runs 7 days a week to the N30 / far north pier & S3 / farthest south .The web page info says 15 Baht but every time I give them 15 ,They give me change ! ? ! Also , the Taksin / central pier connects to the SkyTrain which runs inland .Info from a website Orange lineThe orange line runs from Nonthaburi N30 to Wat Rajsingkorn S3. Service is daily several times per hour from 6 am until 7 pm. One way fare is 15 Thai Baht.Tourist boat, blue lineThe blue flag tourist boat runs from Sathorn to Phra Arthit. Service is daily every 30 minutes from 9.30 am until 5.30 pm. One way tickets are 40 Baht. A one day pass valid for an unlimited number of rides is 150 Baht.

Worth an afternoon. We got an afternoon pass on one of the river ferries and stopped off and checked out the different neighbourhoods, then boarded the ferry for another stop. The river is busy and dirty but lots to see along the way.

A River of Knowledge, History and Interest.. An excellent & alternative way to see Bangkok from another angle. Best to hire a longboat with boatman for 2 hours & pay extra to see all, rather than go on a boat with a hundred others for half an hour & see very little. So much to see & learn from the riverside, a great contrast to the hustle, bustle & mayhem of the Bangkok streets.

The river around BKK. Chao Praya is the river that across Bangkok and its looks very nice! We had a fabulous dinner in a small romantic boat around the river!!
It was everything perfect!! Very romantic for our special evening!
Highly recommend

A wonderful day trip sightseeing. It's good to see beautiful sceneries and views along the Chao Phraya River. There are different landmarks such as temples, bridges and history of Thai people. Its fun to enjoy day out by express boat.

Simply amazing!!!. Travel through the river was amazing!! I did it during day and also in a candle dinner cruise at night and both were amazing. Perfect to make pictures of all the beautiful places of the city plus the service of the ships was so good in terms of organization, food and others. You can use formal dress at evening if wanted. I totally recommend it.

Unique experience. Take the BTS to Saphan Taksin. Go down the steps to the waterfront and there are many longtail boats for rent. We paid 600 baht(4 people on our own boat) for an hour long tour of the river and the canals. If you have ever seen the Bond film "The Man With The Golden Gun" you will feel like you are re-living the boat chase scene. The river and canals are pretty polluted, but it is fascinating to see the way people along the canals live.
Dirty river but nice way to travel. The Chao Phraya river boats are very economical and fast way to travel to many places to visit in Bangkok.

Take the hop on - hop off ferry. The hop on hop off ferry is a perfect way to enjoy the ride on the river and travel local style. Lovely views of houses at the river side and a perfect way to see eg China town, the Golden budha, the Royal Palace, Wat Pho and Wat Arun.
Fun. Taking the river taxis is a fun way to travel, does not include traffic jams, links into the sky-train service and brings Bangkok alive....

CHEAP TRANSPORT Solution while touring Bangkok!. Traveling solo has its perks. After visiting the Grand Palace, I decided to walk back to my hotel located in Khaosan Road using another way. It was difficult to cross the very busy intersections so I kept wAlking looking for a safer crossroad.This is how I happened to see the piers or docks of the River. I chose the cheapest one, charging only 13 thai baht per ride. I was able to visit 3 places such as China Town, Wat Pho,and another pier along the river. Got to see how the locals use the river for their transportation - cheap, no traffic, no pollution!

Best way to travel from south to north in Bangkok. The river itself it's not very interesting, it's actually used as a transport meaning in Bangkok. An otherwise long trip from south to Wat Pho takes only 20 minutes. Otherwise a cruise on the river is not very interesting, giving the fact that most attractions are out of sight (excepting Wat Arun which in under rehabilitation and it's not interesting now either)
River in the heart of the city.. Enjoy the cool breeze of the river that goes through the city. This river facilitates the movement of goods and people.
Something to see for sure.... Just get ready for some spray. It is very choppy because of all the boat traffic. Still a good place for some great pictures.
Cruising the canals. Took a boat through the canals of Bangkok, definitely the highlight of my city tour. Very pleasant experience, worth every penny.
Charming . Charming river with a good example of Asian rivers. Lots of interesting things to see such as the skyline and the floating market as well as the temple where you can feed the fish. :)
A Must Do. While in BKK you have to take a river taxi or two and peruse the Chao Phraya. Inexpensive and fun, great activity on hot or rainy days.
A busy transport route.. Worth going on a river boat cruise in a long tail boat for the experience. Can be expensive, but gives a good insight into Bangkok. And the canals off the river.

It was an amazing ride!. It was indeed an amazing tour along the Chao Phraya River. Though boats are almost full specially during the midday I can see it was safe and the tour guides were good too and helpful.

A day In Bangkok. Let's do the local ways to explore. I LOVE BANGKOK!!Frequently tourists always keep asking me, " what can we do in BKK within One day.I'd say.. Let's make Chaopraya river boat trip whithin two days.For me, i'd recommend two days for this Boat Trip. Why????Cuz the there are two exotic routing-Day 1: from Tha thewet, or Tha Pha-are-Thit till WAT SING KHORN.. the your walking trip will starting from "Charoen krung road" It's a old business area of BKK in the past the visit Asiatic.-Day 2: Tha thewet to the end of staton Nonthaburi Pier.It's a Big Local market whic fresh food from the garden, fish-chicken .. etc.Hight light of thid is Sam-lor.A kinds of transportation taxi in here.What you can do here is...See local market, try a local food and bring them to chill on the sitting place on the river side, try sam-lor ( bicycle taxi with three- wheels)Have some nice photos for the old style build.** closed by there is Koh-Ket ** (** Thais call "Tha" for Pier or port)Then your journey will starting from HERE.(If you have about 1-hrs. For this

Local Ferry. The local ferry offer unlimited all day hop on and off for 150 Bhatt. Can't beat that price. Take the ferry & stay on it for a full circle & then decide where you want to get off. Definitely better than sitting in traffic jam.

Must Enjoy Lovely River Cruise ride. Must Enjoy Lovely River Cruise ride - a must do activity for any traveler to Bangkok... specially in the evening, you can witness the grand lighting experience and also can enjoy the lovely Thai food on board!!
cheap transportation. I love the boat! this cheap transportation will safe your money when you are in Bangkok and take you to every par of the city.

Long long long river. Chaopraya is known as the longest river in Asia. the view was very nice while accros the river. Temples, ancient building, government office, and the famous bridge can be seen along the river cruising.

Nice. The river is a lovely place to look at and very efficient to use as a mode of transport around Bangkok. Many of Bangkoks biggest tourist sights are on the river. Some nice restaurants with views of the river can be found too. Try Asiatique area

They make you feel like Bond. Long tail boat means that propeller has a very long axis and many people remember that kind of boats from the time when Jame Bond was seeking for The Man with the Golden Gun. Even without that charm, view from the river is attractive enough not to avoid the experience.

Different experience of River in Bangkok. Take a private long tail boat and apart from the main tourist attractions on the main river ask them to go into the or side canals. You get to go into the smaller canals and it's a superb experience. It's a bit of the old Bangkok and quite unforgettable. You can see how the families live their lives and an insight into the calmer atmosphere of Bangkok. You can seen many of the sights from the water (Wat Arun) and others are just a short stroll from the river (Grand Palace). It's amazing to watch the little ferries, which cross the river from one side to the other. There are also boats offering dinner cruises. I can highly recommend that you do this once. Only one thing is bad that small canal have very bad and dirty smell.
Relaxing experience. Although it starts out bustling & hectic , a little into the ride & things start becoming natural & calmIt's well worth taking a ride on one of the slow moving boats
Nice boat ride. Signed up a hotel desk for a 2-hour boat ride (incl. refreshments and beverages) for 1500 baht (about $42) including hotel pickup and drop off. Enjoyed it.

A Great way to travel around Bangkok. This is great. But don't take the tourist boat, rather travel with the locals on the flagged boats. You have great views of the city and take time out to go to the end of the line at Nonthaburi (about 45 minutes journey). It's well worth it and so cheap. I think we paid 15Thb
nice view from the boat. decent skyline, some buildings getting constructed. Not sure how they look at night but cannot compete with Hong Kong or Singapore skyline.
lovely time to chill out. hotel had a small boat taking you from the Anatara to the sky train. on return journey towels handed out....bliss

More than a river. Chao phraya is also a very good and convenient transport possibility in Bangkok. The best way to find at least 3 top cultural and sacral places, Wat Pho, Wat Arun, and the grand palace. Just take the orange boat, and Wat pho and grand palace are at the same side of the river. You'll find Wat Arun (Temple of down) is just opposite side of Wat Pho. Orange line is cheaper than the boat of tourist, but also less crowded and more symphatic. You also can travel up to the end of the town or just until the Kro Kret Island, or just to Nothaburi, where you'll find a very good market with some nice food stalls. You 'll find several types of boats, orange flag is the best to use. Take a boat also in the evening, very nice to see the lights of this fantastic town. Even if you are only for 2 days here, don't miss the river.

The off shoots of the main river. Take a private long tail boat ( not as expensive as you might imagine) and apart from the main tourist attractions on the main river ask them to go into the klongs or side canals. From here you can see how the families live their lives and an insight into the calmer atmosphere of Bangkok. Some memorable movies have shot chase scenes here.Ask for a long tail with a big engine to get the authentic experience ! Although the prices seem to be the same for each operator your hotel concierge can get you a boat and possibly you can share the costs with other hotel guests.

hub of activity. There is so much activity that runs along this river. the orange flag tourist boats offer a commentary (English difficult to understand at times) but gives you a idea of each stop and you can view the riverside temples. Long boats are of interest with 4 cylinder turbo diesel engines, can be a rip off to tourists to ride but well worth the experience to try one. Barges are brought through by tug boats an incredible sight . I loved the activity of the Chao Phraya river, our hotel over looked this river and although the water didn't look the cleanest , the sights amazing. At night the river cruise boats belt out their music and are lit up spectacularly a lovely sight.
Best river in Bangkok. This is the best river in Bangkok. If you are in Bangkok and want or need to see a river, or to use one for purposes of boat travel, i heartily recommend the Cho Phraya.

Superb experience and a must do in Bangkok. I have done the Chao Phraya river trips many times and it doesn't matter how many times I do them, they are always a clear high pointThere are 2 types: 1) The standard commuter boats 2) Private rentalThe standard commuter boats are very very cheap. Go down to The Oriental Pier (by Oriental Hotel at the end of Silom Rd) and take the commuter boat to Nonthaburi, it's only 24 Baht something one-way and you will hardly have to wait longer than 20 minutes for one. Avoid rush hour when people go to work or finish their jobs of course, best is to go in the morning after rush hour and make it more than a half day tripThe trip takes an hour or so and you get to see the whole Chao Phraya River, once in Nonthaburi, have lunch and take another boat back again. It's really interesting and absolutely amazing how much you get to see for so little money. The commuter boats stay on the big river and does not go into the smaller canalsThe private boats: They are also very interesting but of course much much more expensive. Watch out for that they negotiate the price for two people before the trip and then claim it's a misunderstanding and wants pay for each personYou get to go into the smaller canals and it's a superb experience, it really really is. It's a bit of the old Bangkok and quite unforgettable. Although expensive, I can highly recommend that you do this once

Nice place to spend an evening.. Spent an evening at the Chao Phraya riverfront. It has a small garden & a long stretch of steps & a few benches facing the river. Can relax looking at the sun going down & watching the boats moving about in the river.

Take the Chao Phraya Express boat to.......anywhere!. You simply can't go to Bangkok and not travel on the river! The express boats are a great way of getting around the city if your hotel is close to the river. You can seen many of the sights from the water (Wat Arun) and others are just a short stroll from the river (Grand Palace). It's amazing to watch the little ferries, which cross the river from one side to the other, dodging the bigger express boats going up and downstream, and the huge commercial barges transporting their cargoes. There are also boats offering dinner cruises, although I've read mixed reviews on these.

Comfort enough as one of the transportations. This is one of the alternatives transportation that Bangkok had. Seek for the orange flag, its a local boat and cost more cheaper than the blue flag. Its quiet comfortable while we are on board, so will recommended using it accros the Chao Phraya river

The best way to see Bangkok. You can quickly lkearn the key boat stops. Our hotel was at Boat Stop #16. Most of the tourist activitiy is at Boat stop #9. From there it is a quick walk to the Palace, the canal trips, the orchid farms and more. Learn to use the boats - they are very inexpensive ($.30 pp USD) and lots of fun to ride.
Ride in a long tail boat!. We did a long tail boat ride & visited a floating market. It was a fun & interesting activity. We would recommend it.

Quick view of the city by the river. The big boat is nice and clean, takes u alongside nice areas that have 5 star hotels, and other nice places.Is cheap (40 Bhat one way) and quick.U could stand on the deck and enjoy nice breeze.

Riverside view of Bangkok. Both express boats and tourist boats are excellent value for getting around main sites in Bangkok. make sure you know which pier to get off for the sites you want to visit. They are generally a short 5-10 min walk away. Cheaper than taxi or tuktuk
Great views from Shangri-La Hotel. Very busy and interesting river, with many hotel boats and long tail boats. Great people watching area
An Interesting and Cool Way to See the City. Bangkok can be quite hot, and it's almost always cooler on the river. If you're tired of walking and/or hot taxis, take a ride on the river.

River Cruise back from Ayuttaya, enjoying the sights of the river. A busy artery through Bangkok, with lovely river sights and allways something to see. Cruised the river one afternoon, from Ayuttaya, and another evening took the Ferry twice across the river. The scenery takes on a completely different perspective at night time.

Don't get the rip off tourist boats . Forget the rip off long tail boats with the tiresome negotiation of price for foreigners - just get one of the local ferries. Even the chao praya express boat at 40 baht a single is good value.

bangkok city view . if u at bangkok is a must go place, u get full city view and d beet of it us u get t enjoy it in a boat, better go at night, not b4 6:30 cz d bangkok towers are closed by that time, and its pretty convenient just by d sapham taksim bts train station and d boat make sure t pay it inside just 13baht but u can get tourist boat not sure how much is it but d experience is quite d same.

Relaxation Travel boat. The easy way to travel around ancient Bangkok city by Boat. Only 15 Bath per person for express boat (Orange flag) and 40 Bath per person for tourist boat (Blue flag).I connected with Chao Phraya express boat at Sathorn Pier located in area of Saphan Taksin BTS Station.You can get off at pier no. 5 for going to China Town , Pier no.9 for Wat Pho, Pier no.13 for Khao San road.At the evening you can take the boat to Asiatique the river front (night market) at Sathorn Pier for Free!!

A ROMANTIC EVENING in Chao Phraya with live Convert. it was a chance to be there in a Moonlit night at Chao Phraya River on 21 February 2016. Live Music, good food, romantic weather .dance, everything was there. it could be a amazing exoerience for the Honeymoon couple.

A Trip to Bangkok is not Complete Unless You Dine on or By the River. The Chao Phrya River is a major part of Bangkok Culture. It is busy with traffic commercial and tourist. It is fun to take a river boat tour, a dinner cruise or just enjoy a drink as the barges and boats float by.
Adventure and Fun. Visited on a rainy windy day, it was a real adventure in a boat. The boat experience was awesome and you can view the skyscrapers around it.
