Good way to get a different perspective on Bangkok. Took a boat tour up the river with my family. Was nice because it was much cooler out over the water than when we were out in the city. Good panorama of the city and the some of the big sights. Definitely worth the $ (after negotiating) and a couple hours.

Ok, but watch out!. Went for river tour from Soy Charoen Krung 32. From the start you have to watch out for the price requested. First they offer you a 1,5 hour round trip for 4.000 Bhat / 2 persons. Where they take you side channel to various shops. As the get commision if you purchase something.Second offer was 1 hour / 3000 Bhat/ 2 persons. I negotiated to 1200 Bhat / 2 persons. Which I am sure was still too much. Except this issue the boat tour is ok. 1 hour is moore than enough. We got off next to the Wat Phra Kaew.

Great mode of transportation to other tourist spots of BKK. I always travel via Chao Phraya river boats when I go to BKK. You can see some of the attractions as well while cruising this river. If you're a tourist, this is really a necessity because most of the temples are accessible through the river.

Get a ship and sail!. I love to see the towns or cities from the river. This is another side of the city. Bangkok has good "ship traffic", than catch a ship on the pier and enjoy the sailing. At the city center there are lots of tourists, than it is better, if you start from the Thiewes Pier, or more outside and end near Asiatiq shopping mall. At Asiatic there is a free shuttle ship to the Central Pier, than you can ship with this way too.It is a cheap (as bus) and fast (more fast than bus) way of trawelling in Bangkok.

The liveline of Bangkok. There are so many chanses of having a great time on and around the River. Just walking down from China Town visiting all the Chineese Temples, sitting at the shores, eating, drinking or taking a boat and going along the River is fantastic.
Tranquil. . We went here through a Wat Yannawa on Makha Bucha Day at night. The view was amazing and the vibe coming from the temple was beautiful.
Great value on the Express boats!!. Buy a ticked for 150 Baht which allows you to get on and off the boats all day as you please. This is worth every penny!!

River boats. Fantastic way to get around Bangkok. All a bit chaotic,we were paying 13baht a trip on the boat, but you can buy a day ticket from the Central pier I think. Great fun - have to be nimble to jump on and off. Very crowded.

River Chao Phraya.. This bustling river runs right through Bangkok and provides a vital source of travel and commuting for thousands of passengers and schoolchildren every day. Restaurant boats ply up and down especially in the evening, providing a magical spectacle as they bob around on the waves, only to scurry off to their destinations once the last passenger has boarded. Various klongs or canals branch off this mighty river, and barges are seen valiantly struggling against the tide with up to 4 heavily laden barges in tow, attached by a strong steel cable.

Better been there at night. You can see all important destinations of the city while sitting on a boat acrossing the river. I guess it looks greater at night. Not much to see in the daytime. The riverside cafe looks good though, will come back one day.
Interesting river. Do a cruise up this river and you will see all walks of life. Educational and interesting, everything the way it is no cosmetic cover up.

Joy ride. A Place which cant be missed while in Bangkok , A speed boat which is traditional is a must ride , this boats take you for a joy ride which can last for as long as 6 hours , visiting various temples along the route , and passing various bangkok skylines , a must visit while in Bangkok

Good way to see the locals. Took a trip to the Grand Palace which included a trip on the canals by long tail boat. Not quite Amsterdam or Venice but a good way to see how some of the locals live. Some of the houses appear to be defying gravity and look as if they will sink into the river at any time. Fascinating journey and well worth enduring the uncomfortable seating of the boat.

Great way to sightsee. We had a private boat from pier 2 for 1 hour, cost 2000 bht (£40) What a fantastic way to see so much, our driver slowed down in all the relevant places for photo opportunity and although didn't speak English we were able to recognise via maps what was what etc, we went off up the canal which was great to see local living and houses on stilts. Finally we dropped off on the Koh San Rd for an evenings experience. Highly recommend paying the extra for a private tour.

Pay on the boat. When taking the ferry boat dont pay until you are in line or actually on the boat. Pay the lady walking around shaking a silver canister. There are 2 ferry boats, one for tourists and one public. The public boats have orange, green, and yellow flags...tourist boats have blue flags. They are the same boats, except price for blue flag is 2x the public ones.

Different City View. I actually did a Ayutthaya tour. We went by van up and then took a river boat back down to Bangkok. The Chao Phraya River portion of the trip was quite nice. My particular tour included a nice lunch while cruising down the river. This gave me a different view of the city that can only be seen from the river plus there are many nice temples for photographs along the way.
See the Chao Phraya at Night!. Take a dinner cruise on one of the dozens of large flat boats! The food and music is entertaining and you see all the highlights along the river.
Boat trip. We went for the boat trip cruise at night, it was interesting with lots of nice landmarks to see along the way.

very busy river. we took a hour cruise down the river and i was surprised at how many sights there was to see. there is plenty of traffic on it barges and river taxis but also many temples. it was worth the trip

Nice boat experience. My husband and I took a boat for ourselves (500b/person) with our personal guide and it was a nice relaxing experience.The noise of the boat preventing the guide to speak t it was a refreshing change to the rest of the day. We could just sit, relax and enjoy the scenery.You will see some very poor areas and right next to it some huge villa worth millions.You will be able to stop and buy bread to feed the cat fish from the river. It was an experience, as there are so many of them!Do not feed them too close to your boat or they will fight for the bread and get you wet!Overall a nice 45mins ride but maybe not a must do.

a gret way to view the Thai way of life. Although I live in Bangkok, I still enjoy on occasion a trip up the Chao Phraya to the Grand Palace and beyond to Ayudhaya and back. So many interesting places to see, the Temple of the Dawn, The place where the Royal Barges are kept, the way of life along the river banks. Unless you are very brave, best not to take a long tail boat as bumpy and travelling very fast. The various ferries or water taxis are usefully safer.To see the rice barges laden down low in the water on their way to the port and then standing tall on the way back up river. This is a whole world in itself. An added bonus is to have a drink around 5.30 on the terrace of the Oriental Hotel (better during the cooler months) and watch the sun go down. An unique experience.

Cheap for sight seeing and transportation . For just 40baht you get to go to your next stop and see the places along the river, there is a guide who explains the history of some of the buildings and what some of the place are. The river is quite dirty but doesn't smell. This makes for great pictures and view. Great mode of transport if you are trying to get to China town or the Grand Palace or some restaurants along that strip.
Great way to get around!. Our hotel was on the river and it was so nice to take a water taxi on the river to see all of the important sights. Much better than taking a tuk-tuk everywhere!

Method of transport more than an attraction. It's nice to visit the river but when you arrive you are approached by touts trying to sell you tours.It's very busy.I chose to jump on the hop on hop off Chao phraya express boat which is a great way to get to other areas of interest.

"Dirty Old River...". I think the song goes, dirty old River got to keep rollin' - that pretty much sums it up. The week we were there they found several body parts floating down the river and police were investigating.You have to go on it, but heaven help you if you ever went in it. Try taking the local boats, not the tourist boat. Only 14 baht, often jammed packed, dangerous to get on and off but a hell of a lot of fun. Get a map they go to all the spots the tourist boats charge you a lot for! Look for the flags.

Buy a trip on the river it is worth learning about the importance of the river ways and canals in Bangkok. I did serval different kinds of trips on the this river. It is the Amin river in Bangkok and therefore important for the locals and business to transport and support their way of life. The rivers and canals are as important as the road system. Great to travel during the day and excellent to do buy night.

Take to the river and canals!. We bought a private tour that included river, canal and river. It was magnificent and in particular the canal part of the trip. We had a whole boat to ourselves and if you could do that or share with friends the experience may be similar to ours! We were in control and enjoiyed every bit of it! The only thing we did wrong was not to get the boat to bring us back to the starting point near our hotel! We thought that getting the trip to end at the Gran Palace pier by lunch time was going to kill two birds with one stone! No! We were there in the end without transport to get back to our hotel and there is no metro or sky train near by! We were left to the mercy of exploiting taxis!

nice experience. funny day at the chao phraya river!!! we took a boat ang traver around bangkok, really funny!!! the driver was so friendly, finally the first that was a good guy!!!we stopend at wat arun, beautiful temple near the river!!! i recomend this trip if u been in BKK

View of the City. The Chao Phraya River is the largest river in Thailand. It flows through Bangkok and then into the Gulf of Thailand. Many people take the public boat taxi that runs along the Chaophraya river to travel across town to avoid Bangkok's heavy traffic. Some tourists rent the long tail boats to travel the Chao Phraya River to visit major temples and tourist attractions. You might want to try the public boat taxi if you are adventurous and is on a budget. It is cheaper than taking the sky train. A bit of a warning... the water is not very clean but it is quite safe (avoid the rush hours) and the breeze is good.

Great views at night. Finally after being a long term expat I got around to doing a night cruise along the river, and what a pleasant suprise it was to see spectacular landscape, buildings and temples all lit up, I'm thinking the night cruise would be great for both first time visitors and repeat visitors alike

cruise on chao phraya river. Went on an evening tour cruise along the river, which included dinner aboard the Chao Phraya princess. Many sights to see along the river & the buffet dinner was pretty good. Cruise goes for about 2 hours. We booked the cruise through our hotel.

A relaxing spin on the river. We took the water taxi to the Grand Palace and other temples It's a cheap easy way to travel and they have a guide onboard explaining all the various buildings and there functions, as the boat passes by. We also took a private longtail boat down the river allowing us to go through the smaller canals. Well worth the money but avoid the tourist traps like the snake farm. Just say No!
Trip by boat. One of the amazing activities we have done in Bangkok, it was very interesting for refreshing , the view was excellent , it cost us around 25 dollar for one hour

Boat to Grand Palace. Honestly, if we were at a hotel on the river this seems like a good way to get around. After studying up on river travel, we still took the tourist boat for 40 baht each (one way) from Saphorn Thaksin.Am I disappointed that I didnt stick to the plan to go cheap and local... meh, not really. Not for the first time on these boats. Plus the younger kids rode free.Here's a helpful site: lovethaimaak.com/thai-tips/bangkok-water-transportation-the-way-to-travel-in-thailand/

Hire a boat and see the river and the canals. Also take a dinner cruise on the river.. We really enjoyed an afternoon ride on one of the small fast boats (do not know the name) that take you on an exciting ride on both the river and the adjoining canals. The dinner cruise is not as good, although the river is beautiful at night.

Ride the River- best AC going!. Costs you 13 B to ride the ferry. Getting on and off is an experience- loud bustle and movement. And then you are on a great trip seeing Bangkok by water. Lots of stops to hop on, hop on and it will get you to the sky train/metro should you desire. Worth just riding from where you start to where you stop and then going back to where you started.
Boat tastic. This waterway is fun. Either take a public ferry or private taxi boat to view the sights of downtown Bangkok. Many temples line the river, which makes for an interesting boat ride.

breathtaking views. A must try while in Bangkok. Cool breeze with gushing sound of water along with spectacular night view , this is a must to do. Book a dinner cruise and make sure you sit on the upper deck to enjoy the cruise

Organised chaos. This is the most fantastic river to watch, it's much better than tv, We viewed it fron the Shanghai la hotel, and sat for over an hour mesmerised by all the river traffic and the near misses and the speed of the small boats, I loved it not sure I would want to travel on it every day tho ,

View of Bangkok along the river. Taxi driver took us to a dock with tourists and we hopped on a small boat and enjoyed a trip along the river. Views of historical temples along the river and new condos and businesses. A nice way to see the area. Boat is typical tourists price about $20.

great river on sunset. I never thought this river could be this big and beautiful. I saw many ships crossing over this river .. and I tried to go the pier near the Wat Pho temple. It cost me about 11 Baht to travel from Wat Pho to Pier nearby Asiatique location. On Asiatique wait till the sunset and you can see the beuaty of this river.

Best way of getting around. An all day pass for 150 bahts is all you need to visit most of the attractions of Bangkok. The boat express is a good alternative for the travelers and avoids the terrible traffic on the roads. There are multiple attractions along the river banks or just a short to moderate walks from the various piers.A travel guide comes free with the all day pass and is a handy tool to navigate one's way. The service is on from early morning from Sathorn pier up to Maharaja pier right up to evening. The best thing is that Sathorn pier is conveniently close to Saphan Takshin MTS station.

Bought the "all day ticket" big ripoff!. Nice ride up the river with a guide, although her english was easy to understand... but at least she tried and the boat had room for everyone to seat and move around... but on the way back, I thought we were going to sink, too many people on the boat, the personnel rude and screaming, yelling at everyone to move t the end of the boat to load way too many people etc, NOT RECOMMEND!

Cheap River Trip. Rather than take a tourist boat just jump on one of the many "River Taxis" which travel up and down the river all day long during daylight hours, the colour of the flag on the boat denotes the destination and there is usually a board in each boat station which will explain this or look on their website.It is a very cheap way to get up and down the river with a trip from Taksin terminal to Khaosan Road area costing only 13 Baht and taking 30 minutes.It is also more refreshing being on the water and a good way to see or visit many of the temples and smart riverside plazas and hotels.

A brilliant blend of the old and new. The Chao Phraya river is a huge river which flows through Bangkok into the Gulf of Thailand. I loved taking any form of transport through the river which gave you a sense of the real Bangok. Crossed the river multiple times to Wat Arun. I honestly think Wat Arun looks more grand from the river than close by. Visit the fishing market's close to the river as well. The alleys next to the parking bay's lead you into a lovely surprises. One of my favorite parts of Bangkok.

Just Make Sure You Don't Fall in!. We dont recommend this because its clear that the government doesnt really bother about cleanup. As a result, the sewage smell is pretty strong and partner and myself were struggling to breath throughout. We had to go on the river only because we needed to take a ferry to the Flower market. Otherwise we would have given it a miss. Most people were as afraid as us of having water splashed on their faces and so, had their backs turned for most of the time. Its quite tragic as there's tourism potential here if done properly. But it seems like its not a priority and we only hope its not leaving tourist with a permanent bad impression in what is otherwise a beautiful city.

Don't Miss It. As a former resident and frequent visitor of/to Bangkok, I feel that you can't really get to know the city if you don't spend some time on the river. It's the historic heart of the city -- arguably of the country -- and many of the capital's most interesting and historic sites are on it or near it. The tourist boats are user-friendly and it's much faster to travel by water than by road. Some of the river dinner cruises are good value, too.

The hub of Bangkok. What's not to love about this mighty brown river that wends it way through the city? It provides transport to countless Thais every day going to and from home, it ferries people across the river, it carries large barges toting all manner of goods, and it's still home to many people whose wooden dwellings are still standing after years and years. You can hop on a ferry and travel up and down for miles and miles. The ferries with orange flags come by every 10 minutes and they cost only a few baht. If you see something interesting, hop off and explore. Then get back on again. The kids will love the novelty of being on a boat. Just be sure to keep your mouth closed if you sit on the outer seats as the boat waves can get quite high, and before you know it you've got a mouthful of dirty water! That said, it's much more relaxing that sitting in a cab stuck in traffic for hours. Just be sure to get off before peak hour or you will be jammed in like sardines with all the commuters going home.There are more and more complexes with restaurants and bars appearing on the river banks now, which makes it easier to find a nice spot to park yourself for a few hours.At night time it's great to sit and soak in all the lights along the river, and smile at the massive disco karaoke boats that are constantly passing. The River City complex has a number of good bars and restaurants, and there are also other complexes further up the river towards the Khao San Rd area. I haven't tried these as they are fairly new and I didn't get the chance on my last trip.You can also choose any one of the 5 star hotels on the river and enjoy a drink al fresco or in one of their bars. Hotels line both sides of the river and they have their own boats that will ferry you across for no fee. There's also the Asiatique complex up river, which has a special ferry that will take you there from the Saphan Taksin pier.The river by day is interesting once you get past the murky colour, but at night time it really does come to life and you see it in all its finery. If you're ever in Bangkok for the Loy Kratong festival in November, the river is the best place to be to see all the boats, fireworks and people out floating their kratongs in the water. You have to book well ahead though as this is one of the most popular events of the year.

Chao phraya river cruise. we booked a chao phraya princess river cruise. Since we booked from India, we were put into a cruise where the buffet dinner was entirely based on indian cuisine. My suggestion to the Indians who can live without Indian food that go for other cuisines because the indian food taste is not good. All the songs and dg was indianized, however I would have preferred if it was thai. I visited thailand to experience thai culture and not Indian. Hence I did not like the cruise much.

The Heart of the city.. This is a very busy river. There are long tail boats speeding up and down the river. There are ferry boats and restaurant boats. The Royal Palace complex is on the river. There are Temples and restaurants all along the river. The Chao Phraya Tourist Boat runs frequently. It costs 40 B each way (about $1.10). The traffic on the roads is terrible. It is much better to use the river for transportation if possible.

Everything revolves around it. It is a wide river, very much alive with the many vessels that navigate on it all day long. The water is exactly pretty, but it is a good way to get to places in a city were traffic is a nightmare
Crazy river. Wild river with huge ammount of boats floating up and down. Good river trams. Pay attention to tram prices: native guys like to sell it for higher price than it really costs.

Dirty river, but useful for commutting. Chao Phraya river offers excellent connectivity in Bangkok beating the notorious traffic by express boat service. However, the water is so polluted and should be beware of even touching it.

Easy to get ripped off!. Simply put, be very aware of tuk tuk drivers selling the river tour via friends. It was our first day and we hadn't got an idea of cost yet and ended up spending nearly £70 being driven up the river, through the canals, bombarded by floating market sellers and the nearly capsized. Good to see the expanse of Bangkok and to gain a perspective but feel an actual guided tour may have been more informative and enjoyable. Typical tourist trap!
So very dirty. Very very dirty, but has a well organised boat transport system. The best is to use even the channels to quickly get you to other places.

Take the ordinary river bus. A visit to Bangkok wouldn't be complete without whizzing a few times up and down the Chao Phraya. These days, tourists are directed towards the more expensive, guided tourist boats. Wait to one side and hop on and off the ordinary river bus - unlike the tourist river buses, you pay for the tickets on board the boat.

The River of Kings!. The water isn't clean, so don't drink from it, but the views, and the number of excellent restaurants along its banks makes a trip to the river a must. Take a trip on the public taxi boat for about 40 baht (skip the tourist boat). On a sunny day it is magnificent.
Average River. Nothing special about Chao Phraya river.A little dirty, rubbish floats on the surface. Though its good mean of transportation to get around.(Bangkok traffic)

Cool way to see the city!. Easy to get the tourist boat. A day ticket allows you to get on and off . There are about 10 piers it stops at. Each pier has sights and markets that are of interest. Lots of tourists on the boat.
A lovely river. We stayed at a hotel right on this river and it is really a fun river to watch. Lots of things happening here.

Fast Ferries. We used the local ferry boats to get up and down the river and found it to be timely and efficient as well as interesting to mic with the locals. Along the way the many Buddhist Temples and houses with a back drop of sky rise office buildings give a good insight into life in Bangkok.

Mixing with the locals. We enjoyed our trip down the Chao Phraya River.We caught an orange flag boat from the main pier for an hours journey .It was a very cheap mode of travel and showed us how the locals go about their daily lives.
use the river for travel!. we love the river taxis and ferries in BKK. this is a great way to see many lovely sights, and a fun way to get around!
A must visit in Bangkok. A boat ride was memorable , long beautiful river with buddhist temples all along the sides and tiny houses of those living at the coast

Chao Praya River, Bangkok. A 'must do' in Bangkok. You can get the 'long boats' near the Grand Palace (much cheaper than buying a trip from your hotel) but try to bargain. Can cost about 700baht. The boats are very long, very thin and have a car engine with a very, very long propeller sticking out. And they go quite fast!! Take some bread with you to feed the fish, when they take you up a side canal (klong). Be prepared to get a bit wet! And take sun protection with you as there is not a lot of room to hide from the sun on the boat. And tie your possession down or hang on to them, as they can get blown away.

Filthy river with brown water but great means of transportation in Bangkok toAvoid traffic. The river is pretty filthy in terms of cleanliness. However the boats provide a pretty economical and faster mode of transportation to reach places along the sides of the river. The boats speed rashly and are usually overcrowded. The river is a good way to explore many tourist spots and quite a few landmark hotels
Must visit. Excellent food. Excellent service. very romantic ambience with live music. Your partner will love it. Must visit

Take a canal tour - must have in Bangkok. This was my second time in Bangkok, the first being 17 years ago. And one thing that didn't change a bit since was the canal tour. Don't take the organized tour, take some friends with you and get the longtail for yourself. Negotiate the rate (we got it for THB 1000 for three people and one hour trip) and enjoy old canals, floating shops (beer served there too) and outwordly experience.Of course there is a regular tourist ferry in the river too - good (and cheaper) alternative to crowded streets and noisy tuk-tuks.

Be aware of swindlers. I do not know what is the cheapest option for travelling on the river. I paid 100 BHT per person. (Taking the boat from Saphan Taksin peer) But we were also offered the trip for 1.800 BHT per person. They tried to convince us that "normally" it costs 3.000 per person! Nothing special, the water is dirty, but you can see some skyscrapers from the river and so on. We used this way of transport to reach the Palace.
A must do in Bangkok. Hope on a local boat for a 1 hour ride up the river and then just connect with a return boat. A great way to see a different side of Bangkok!
Great Boat ride. this is a wonderful boat ride that takes in a lot of great views from the boat deck; wonderful city views, lush green trees and great food on the boat..great trip

It's just a river. It is interesting watching the long tail boatts and barges ply the river. Some nice views as well, particularly of Wat Arun. We sat and had coffee while watching the world go by. Nice, butit still is just a river.

Cruising Along Chao Phraya River At Affordable Fares. The best way to do sightseeing along the Chao Phraya River without paying exorbitant prices is to take the Chao Phraya Tourist Boat originating at the pier besides the Taksin BTS Station.Tickets costs BHT 40 per person one way.As the boat makes several stops along the river,there is a Baht 150 ticket that enables you to unlimited hop ons and off along the journey for the day.The operating timings for the Chao Phraya Tourist Boat is daily 9.30am till 5.30 pm.Tickets can be purchased at the ticketing booth at the pier or for those making one way trip payment can made on board the boat.A plus point travelling on the boat is that there is a guide giving a narration of all the places of interest along the Chao Phraya River.Narration is in English and some Thai only
dirty river but beautifull view over the city. boat rides are good organized and although the river color looks very firty you get very nice sideviews of bangkok
River boats very convenient . I would not want to fall into this river! It looks horribly filthy. The express boats are fast, cheap and convenient to see the wats.

INSIGHT OF THAI LIFE. Taking a "long-tail boat" excursion on the Chao Phraya river and surrounding klongs is a good way to escape from the city traffic as well as a refreshing experience enabling visitors to have a glance at Bangkokians day to day life and housing along the canals.Make sure to negaciate hard with the boats operators as not only the try to overcharge, but also sell the trips on a duration basis which is systematically shortened in fact.
Largest River in Town. Its a good experience indeed we took the ride from Tha Chang pier closest to Grand Palace. we heading to the last pit stop which is Nonthaburi.

There's Always Ladyboys!. We had been waiting to board the cruise about 45 minutes and after boarding the ladyboys' show started. The food is ok with buffet style with western and local dishes.However, the weather is showering and we didn't enjoy much on the river views. The ladyboys are hot.... though.
Mesmerizing . I loved watching the different boats on the Chao Phraya River. I would recommend trying to have dinner at least one night on the banks of the river. Very romantic and beautiful.

access. From central pier at Taksin Saphon sky train station you can access lots of interesting sites without the need for taxis and traffic congestion. Also ror 13 bhat you can travel the full length of the river.

Excellent base. Knowing that Bangkok is huge I was a little worried about getting lost. Staying on the river made it easy to navigate the city. Plus the boats and buildings are lit up at night making it beautiful.

Great way to travel to various sites along the river. Much more efficient than sitting in traffic. Catching a river boat is a fun way to see the sity from the river and have a great vantage point. It's inexpensive, you can buy a day trip ticket for unlimited boardings and disembarking or single trip tickets depending on the type of day you have planned. Great way to make your way towards the Grand Palace, Chinatown, and other points such as Khao San road area. You also get a nice breeze travleing along the river which is refereshing on some of those very hot days. The river boat will take you to places where the BTS and MRT do not go which is a huge benefit. Take the BTS train to the Sathorn Pier stattion and byut your ticket there. Yoy can also hop on the boat at any of the stops aling the river and buy tickets there or pay on board. Just pay attention to when oyur stop is coming up because the boats do not stop for very long So it's quick on and quick off..If you are delayed getting off the boat you may miss your stop (that happened to me once).
Chao river. Cruising along the river is great. Either in a long tail boat or any one of the many ferries. Much to see. Ferries can be crowded as many locals do use them. but are very cheap.

AMAZING. Took the Chao Phraya Express Ferry Boat from Kiak Kai pier to Tha Thien. Once in a lifetime experience! Going down the river lets you see Bangkok from another perspective. Also the wind in my hair and the spray on my face was amazing.
Family vacation. Phyra River passes thru'center of Bankok showing Right and Left side very good views of Tall buildings,temples and offcourse never forgetful Cruize which runs in the river.
We love the orange express boat. This is a great way to travel Bangkok from the river! No traffic and you get very far for 13 Baht....it is less crowded in thr morning.

Boring river. This boatrides along Chaopraya is not so good. River is dirty and there is no nice stops, like u might expect. For example som nice restaurants along the way, information is poor also. Where to embark, what is the fee? Etc.

Easy way to get a Bamgkok overview. The Chao Phraya river allows a good overview of many of Bangkok's attractions.The tourist express hop on hop off is the closest to its bus equivalent in other cities

great way to view sights. get your tickets from the pier alongside many of the hop on hop off stops along the river, buy a full days pass for about £3 it's great value. stops at many of the main sights where you can get off and visit, then back on the boat to go to the next one.

Good spare time. Take a fast boat, passes through the small cannals of the river, go to places to see shows like the "cobra show" see a man dealing with nagas bare handed, a zoo and the way people in Bangcoc uses the river as public transport and also as a blessed resource.

Chao Phraya River is Bangkok itself. Bangkok is a large capital city of the kingdom of Thailand with
population of more than 12 million, which also called "the city of
water" being developped around the bank of Chao Phraya River.
Therefore, this river itself is Bangkok and we can meet the life
style of Thai people living with this great river.

A great way to see the city. With traffic being so heavy in the city, boats and the Skytrain and the best way to travel. The river offers evening boat trips with meals and entertainment, but also taxi boats to get to hotels or attractions such as the night market.

River taxi is defo the best way to travel in Bangkok. The water taxi is a fun way to travel around Bangkok. It's cheep and cheerful and you can have multiple hop on hop off's on the one ticket. Defo the easiest way to get to Wat Arun Temple

Enjoyable and relaxing Travel. We traveled by water taxi on the Chao Phraya River after visiting Reclining Buddha. It is quick, relaxing, clean and a good way to visit different sections of the city. It is also very affordable!

do the river!!. the heart of BKK, a boat ride is a must to see the life of the city, buy a day pass and hop on and off at all the main sites. Easy to hop on and off the boats although you do have to be careful as the boats can be busy and you need to be relatively mobile,
Rode water taxi to Wat Arun temple. Fun to take in views while cruising on river in water taxi or cruise up the river. Great views along river and can take cruise to ancient city Ayutthaya.

Non stop action on this river!. Stayed at the Sheraton Royal Orchid on the river and we are glad we did. You can take a ferry taxi boat, to lots of places of interest in the City from our hotel. A warning, these ferry taxi boats are crowded, so prepare to get squished, but they are cheap! Party boats, that travel along the river at night, are a show in lights of all colors. You can also see the city life pass by from many bars and restaurants along the shore line. The Pier stops are numbered and easy to jump on a ferry taxi boat and jump off at any stop. The ferry taxi boats have colored flags of yellow and orange etc. that indicate what stops they make. There are also work boats of all kinds and many workers use the taxi boats to go to work and come home, as well, you can also hire a taxi boat all to yourself. The river is indeed an important center of life for Bangkok

The must do in bangkok is river tour. Stay at decor do hostel and have 5 minutes walk to Taksin bridge pier take a ferry cross The chao phraya river to The shangrila hotel pier.You can take a speed passenger-boat which run along the river and have a real Thai life sight seeing. The boat run north pass many well know hotel such as The oriental ,The peninsula, The Sheraton,The Hilton and China town The flower market pier,The grand palace pier and near khow sarn road pier heading to Nontaburi provice .And on south line there are The asiatique (tourist shopping arcade) Krung Thep bridge and heading to Samut pakarn province end of the river at gulf of Thailand.
Chao Phraya River. My hotel was on the Chao Phraya River and it was fun watching all the various boats sailing up and down it. Quite a sight.

A great way to visit bangkok . An excellent way to travel and visit bangkok and its tourist atractions. There are several options from the normal crowded boats that travel along the river to the tourist boats that cost 2x but offer an explanation in english or the private charter. A beautiful way to do some sightseing

Great way to get around. We used the river everyday. Most of the journeys cost around 12 baht each. We visited all the Wats along the river, Chinatown, Kao San Road and used it first thing in the morning to get across to Thonburi railway to get the train for Kanchaburi (Bridge over the River Kwai). It's cheap and speedy. A great way to get around Bangkok.

Scary fun!. Got on a smaller boat, 3 people 1200 baht for an hour. The current was extreme and water slashed a bit in the boat.. There is not much to see on the boat nor the river itself! Definitely not for smaller kids as you spend most of the trip holding on, as the boat jumps on the rivers current..

The rudest people work at these ferry stations!!!!!!!!. The river itself is cool because of the idea that you can take ferries rather than buses or cabs. In theory. BUT, the people than work at these ferry stations are the RUDEST people! They yell at you, rush you, won't answer anything, guide you to the wrong stations on purpose, and laugh in your face! We took the ferry from Wat Rakrong Pier a couple times to the Chan Pier. The Chan peir in central and is where you can rent a tour or hightail commuter boat. The staff here is crazy! They whistle loud in your ear and yell at you! They even ripped us off a couple times. They stir you away from what you're looking for to what they want you to buy (tours and boats). Its shocking that in such a busy tourist location, they would be so unfriendly and scamming. Without the tourism, they would have no money! Anyway, bad experiences. I would just use the Chan Pier to exit out to the palace and thats it! Dot use it for tours or to commute to other piers. It is pure chaos!
Good for hangout and river cruising.. Very good place for weekend hangout and luxury river cruising. Many multinational restaurant are surrounding the bank of river.

A Means of Travel. The Chao Phraya River carves right through the heart of Bangkok with many water ways snaking throughout the city. It wasn't too many decades past in which this was the primary means of transportation for this city. Public ferry boats still regularly make their way up the river (approx .30-.50 USD) making an interesting means for vistors to see the importance of this river and this means of travel. In rush hour, it is a good way to get around and avoid the gridlock. Another interesting way to see these waterways is by long tail boat. They take you through the side channels and neighborhoods and you can see a way and time that is nearly past for these homes and businesses on the river.
Great way to see Regular Bangkok. While not the most luxurious, if you want to experience with a young family what the "real" bangkok looks like, this is a great way to do it.

BUZZ.. Love this river. Its the heart of the city and can sit at a riverside bar for hrs just watching weird and wonderful things just cruise by. Some great tours based around here and take a long tail boat for a cruise.

Great Way to view the Culture and lifeblood of Bangkok. Our first day our bus broke down on the way to pick us up so they took us on a boat up the river to the Emerald Buddha. We saw much more that we would have seen on the bus and got an education on the culture and how this river is really the lifeblood of the nation with all that is transported on it.
A must when in Bangkok.. Using the river taxis is a great way to see Bangkok and an excellent alternative to get from A to B instead of the Tuk Tuks or taxis.

Good to see the city. I went on a long trip up the river to see what you can of Bangkok by boat. Don't get a tour, just get a ticket to the furthest stop away and then get one back. Far cheaper and without all the tourists.
Lovely. Love Rivers so it's no suprise I enjoyed seeing this place. So many beautiful stretches. And Distributaries throughout bangkok
A river that is a highway. Such an amazing experience. Transportation up and down the river just as if you are getting on a bus - packed in and full of people from all over the world.

Nice. I stayed at Royal Orchids Sheraton hotel, it was beautuful view Chao Phraya from my bedroom specially at night. My husband and I decided to have a few day exploring the different stops and so enjoyable. We will visit Bangkok again, such interesting place to have fun

Take the River Express Boat for a Cheap Tour. Head down to the river from Khao San Road through some very cool street markets to the Phra Ahrit boat pier. Take the Chao Phraya Express Boat and get off past the Grand Palace near Wat Pho. Take a water taxi across the river to Wat Arun for 3 Baht. Head back over the river and stop for a beer and a bite on the riverside before visiting Wat Pho. Take the Express Boat back to the Amulet Market or walk up the street Th Maha Rat next to the river to the Amulet Market. Then head back to the riverside for water taxi back to Khoa San. Each trip is only 30Baht.
fresh wind. We took the boat and see this river. The view isn't too charming or expressive but the fresh wind is refreshing. It is not a bad idea to travel along the river if you have time.

I like float market by boats.. It was one of the so interesting things by float market. Locals coming to sale sovuniers on the boat. Also took a photo and to see around city view. all was nice and unforgettable memory to me. I love the local people follow the river to sale handmade things, so interesting to me.

Interesting view of life on the river.. My wife and I took a 2 hour long tailed boat tour around the klongs and found the strange contrasts between the standards of housing to be fascinating,.Temples,luxury houses and wooden sheds all side by side with each other.A great experience that we didn't have time to do when we had visited Bangkok twice before.
Travel on the river. There are many water ferries/taxis. Easy way to get up and down the river. we also did a night river cruise including dinner on an old style rice boat. Fantastic.
Another mean of transportation. Is the only mean to go to asiatheque. Most people took river cruise but not so much to see around the river. Skip this if possible and opt for bts or tuk tuk
Great experience. A great way to see the city from a different perspective. Very cheap just taking the regular commuter public boat. Always a cool breeze on a hot day.
It is a nice rivier. Water can be running fast. and if you are at the pier it is fun to see how the boats are traveling. But also, not recommended for swimming, the water is not very clean.

Breakfast at the Oriental. The finest hotel in Bangkok. Everything about the Oriental Hotel is 5 Star. If you decide to stay on the riverside or it'll you have business on this side of town then be sure to stop by the Oriental Hotel for a lovely meal. If you decide to stay here than even better for you. It is pricey but worth it.

Nice! . We rented a long tail boat just beside Sheraton hotel. We had to bargain very long and hard... He took uses round the river and in to the smaller klongs. We passed family houses, fed fishes and had a very nice time. It lasted for proximity two hours.

Fun couple of hours. Took the orange flagged boat from the pier at the end of the sky train line. 26 baht each for over two hours up and down the river. No annoying narrative from a tour guide. Past lots of temples and the palace. Can get on and off as you please. Very relaxing

The Heart of Bangkok. You must spend some time on the river, experience the water taxiis, and visit sites that can only be accessed by water. There are public boats, tourist boats and cruises. Get on a public boat at least once to appreciate how important the river is for the economy and transportation in Bangkok.

Take the tourist boat up the rivr. We took the tourist boat up for 150 Bhat each which is cheap, there are lots of places to stop and explore within a couple of km of the boat stop. Also lots of cafes & restaurants line the river and offer great views.

quick way to travel per boat. fun to travel per boat in a quick way.you may get little watersplashes but its warm here so you wont even notice.during peak hours it can be very busy.Watch your step when u get on a boat.
Nice dinner by the river. Enjoyed very much our dinner cruise ,Bangkok is beautiful by night ,Food was delicious and service was very good too
Great views. Take a quick and cheap boat ride along the river for 40baht under a pound. Lots to see along the way and great for some breeze!

The River that weaves through Thailand. This river extends through quite an extent of Thailand (approx 400km) and is both a major mode of transportation and a tourist attraction. It is the main artery of Thailand. Take a river cruise and enjoy the night skyline of Bangkok and Thai cuisine. All important tourist sites along the shoreline are lit up in the night. During the day, one can do boat cruises down the river and some of the canals and one will notice how polluted the river is. Certain areas are like an overflowing sewerage tank. Certain stretches of the river are beautiful with many expensive hotels situated along the bank. The river sleeps at night and roars to life during the day.

Love, love, love.. If you're a water person, the boats are obviously a must. Take the tourist boat (Chao Phraya Tourist Boat; 40 baht) once for the commentary, and then after that you can simply take the normal boats. If you like being on the water, get a day pass (150 baht) and just zip around on various boats. On the web, search for "Chao Phraya Express Boats, Bangkok" to find info on the different boats.

Don't fall into the river!. Filthy river running next to the top resorts in Bangkok.Shuttles service from major hotels, i.e. Peninsula, Mandarin Oriental, but nothing special, especially during the day.

Must allocate a full day .... So many attraction along with river side...There is a 150bhat full day pass of tourist boat ...U can ride as many time U want to ... Just hopping one stop to another...A booklet provided with the tkt for reference ...with details... Attraction of the every piers(stop) ...

The heart of the city. Take the public boat that has many stops along the river. Stop at the stops of interest and then get back on and go to the next stop! It's much easier to get around on the river than the road!!!

Great way to spend 2 refreshing hours on the river. Take the BTS to Taksim bridge.Under the bridge you could either join a group on a sightseeing or simply hire your own Longtail boat and go out where you want. 2000 bath gives you 2 hours of river time regardless if you are single or got 6 mates with you.If you don't know where to go, the Skipper will get you around various canals etc.

Boatride! Do it! Do it!. Some kind of boat ride gives you a whole new perspective on Bangkok. Fun and relaxing. This is how everything used to move in Bangkok. Keep your eye out for the endangered Water Monitor Lizards!

Easy to get around . Maps are misleading . Try walk around if your able. Different colours of boats choice of 3 orange is cheapest 13 but boat is packed . Blue is expensive 40 for one trip it is less crowded and a tour guide on board to advise when to get off

Get a big boat!. This river is choppy - even on the calmest of days - so whatever your mode of transport along the Chao Phraya, make sure it's large, or expect to get splashed and potentially sea sick. Our group got of the former, but not the latter (cast iron stomachs). The river itself is dirty, flanked by enormous skyscrapers and occasional factories, so isn't really a natural wonder to behold. That said, lurking in the river (and neighbouring Klongs) are gigantic monitor lizards. These things aren't quite as big as Komodo Dragons, but big enough to have people screaming. I'd recommend a trip along a Klong, of only to see these creatures swimming and sunning themselves.

one of the best trips. i had a chance to be boating on the rivers and channels of BKK it s just absolutely superb every tourist should try it . You can also ask the driver to stop at some temples. Watch for Waran the big lizards

Artery of Bangkok. It flows thru Bangkok and offers you the opportunity to go to the small channels of Bangkok to see the real natural life of the river. I can take you cross the city and to the floating markets for example. 3hrs boat trip with a stopover at the floating markets

Great boat ride. Very nice to sit in boat riding to see what people living at river bank
Many places fo good food after riding namely from local food - western and fresh river fish
Nice tour

Charming lunch. After visiting the Grand Palace I ate lunch at a nice little restaurant directly by the river (name only in Thai). The food was authentic and it was big fun watching the ships pass by.

River cruise. Well worth the time taken for this river cruise. We did 2 stops, one on water where we fed the Eagles. And another to visit a Bhuddist temple here. Plenty of souvenirs to buy at the temple too. If you have the time, this is worth it.

The best place in Bangkok. Just loved it. For me this is the most beautiful place in whole city. Breathtaking view when sunset. Absolutely gorgeous sunset over Wat Arun. It was one of my bucket list to witness this. I stated with Saphan Taskin pier and hopped in to a boat which was heading up. I got down at Pak Khlong Talat flower market and had a look at amazing colors of flowers at there. From there, took another boat up and cross the river to Wat Arun. Gorgeous gorgeous. You got to see the sunset there. Picturesque

Relaxing and insightful - worth it. We went on a hour and half cruise in a small wooden boat which felt like it would break but was amazing to be in and it felt traditional. We were taken in the canals past people's houses and on the main river and saw the sunset. It was nice to see it all without an audio description
Take the long-tail boat trip. Travel like Bond on a long-tail boat and see the parts of Bangkok you cant see by road. Thrilling and exciting and a must!

Last night in Bangkok . The river is around about a 20 min walk for those that like to walk or you can easily jump on a Tuk Tuk, the flower market is a must see as also the night market as well lots of the usual market items.

A must . Take a boat ride over the Chao Praya river. The best way to visit Wat Pho, Grand Palace and Wat Arun. Also, you can get to see the many firsts of Bangkok like the first Bank, the first luxury hotel and many more. Also, an access to Chinatown in Bangkok.

Different Perspective of the City. Took the dinner cruise and saw the temples we visited in the day from the river view, they looked so different from the water and in the night light. Gives a totally different perspective and feel, calm and soothing vs hustle and bustle if you were on street level.

Fantastic biews od old Bangkok and surrounds. Take a private long tail boat hire, and explore the canals and residents of those living along the riversides, the poor areas but real Bangkok. See floating shops, crocodiles, snakes, and speed along this amazing river. Look out for the oldest Temple along the river

Asian Venice. The river itself is a very dirty river and I really think that the government should place budget to clean it. This said, I've enjoyed the river taxi so much, that we almost used it exclusively to go everywhere, and the scenes are beautiful. It is used by the public as it is the cheapest transportation (14 bahts).
River Taxi, plus to Asiatique boat ride.. Amazing view during the night, very clean river and odorless. Can go lots of place is like a train transit but in a river.

Great way to see the contrasts of part of Bangkok. Ours was a tourist boat, but it was a great trip. Going through the locks into part of the canal system was an experience! I am still convinced you couldn't get that many boats in that lock, but they did. Lots of different types of housing, may temples, the fish feeding was a surprise, I didn't think they could live in the water!

good way to see the river life of Bangkok. We had one one way trip on the river and one return trip. Both were pleasurable, but the first was more stressful than the second because we couldn't get off at the pier we wanted because of overcrowding and we couldn't get off in time. However overall good service, value for money and a great way to travel .

The liquid highway!. Our room at the Riva Surya overlooked the Chao Phraya River and we have seldom seen a river with so much traffic. Barges full of sand, diner cruise boats, water taxis and tourist boats plying the waters day and night. Find yourself a longtail boat and go for a tour, you won't be disappointed.

Water World. Took a tour on a bout by Chao Phraya river so fantastic. The boat was too fast and actually we did not enjoy the scenery and river bank. Difficult for me to take pictures. The water flow probably the cause of the boat has to go fast. We saw fishes in front of one temple. When the boat start slowing down then we can have perfect shot for the Royal palace from the river.

Chao Phraya River. I love to take the riverbusses. You can buy oneday ticket for 150 Baht and be on the river the whole day.They stop at all the tourist places - Grand Palace- Wat Pho - Wat Arun and also some shopping áreas. Really good.

River taxi ride. It was a great experience taking the river taxi, both the one the locals use, and the faster tourist boats. Great way to see the sights without the traffic. The locals will often help you with directions too, if you ask nicely.

James Bond Set River. Nice river to visit. You can rent a James Bond boat also here with fast speed boat. If want to relax you can use a normal boat + feeding fish with bread (local said if the white color fish spotted you can become lucky)

Nice tour on the River Phraya.. There are tourist boats with guide on the river. But I can recommend the ordinary ferryboats. They are very cheap and make many more stops. They also drives higher up on the river. You pay on board. 13 bath single tour. I took a trip to the terminal station. You come to a nice place. Shopping is much cheaper there than in central Bangkok. On the way along the river there is many beautiful sights to see with many temples.

Get on the tourist boat for a quick view of Bangkok.. We have been to Bangkok a number of times but finally broke town and took the river cruise. We visited the highlight attractions and Temples during a full day layover with this tourist boat cruise.
a real eye opener. useful way to travel if you take public boat, very busy but a good experience, very cheap. Used it twice in 4 day stay.

Runs through the heart of Bangkok. Arrived via BTS at saphan taskin station. A short stroll to the peir and boats. I would highly recommend the tourist boat which although has restricted stops has a very competitive 100 Baht day ticket. Up and down the river is a minimum 2 hours and you can hop on and off the to see the many attractions.The river is a working one and it's nice to go down their on a hot day and watch life.

A must to take a boat trip on this river. A must to take a boat trip on this river. A good way to see and move around in Bangkok. Public boat single ticket for around 13 Baht, tourist boat for 40 baht, but with information in english.
Fun Day. We purchased River Pass for 150 THB and had access to the boat all day. It was a little complicated to figure out which boat was going where at first.

Exciting River View. The river is a great way to see Bangkok especially the nightlife.Use the Hop-on, Hop -off water "taxi" for tourists to explore the city.Use the Blue Flag ship.The red Flag ship staff is very unprofessional and rude.Buy a day pass (±170 Bath) and utilise it the whole day.China town is a must see/must do even at night.The BTM stop at the pier so it is hustle free.On your way stop at Pier 21 shopping mall the food is great and not to expensive as well.

You look at the water. Nice at sunset. I took in the Chao Phraya river at sunset at Asiatique. Didnt actually go on a riverboat. I think that the pier at Asiatique is well good enough to appreciate the river.

Lovely river with great options to avoid the traffic jams. The river itself feels a bit dirty and stinky, but otherwise you should give it a go. There are plenty of options to jump on the express boat. It is a cheap, but great option, to avoid the killing traffic jams on the road. We saved hours and been able to visit all popular Watts just by moving on the river :D

Best for exploring old bangkok. You can get the boatexpress or ferry to different destinations like Grand Palace, Wat Arun, China MArket, Khau San, Asiatique river front. Traffic free. Usually have long waiting queue. 20-40 Baht per person, depending upon your destination.
away from traffic. chao phraya is the main attarction in bangkok. love the speed boat but you can always opt for tour boats which are much cheaper and slow so that you can see the surroundings.

Life along the river.... This river is one of the most important rivers in Thailand, as it passes though Bangkok. If you have a chance when you are visiting here just take a boat trip to see the life and sights along this river.

Waste of time . We went to this boat tour as part of a tour after visiting couple of temples. I thought it was a little bit of a time waste being on that boat. Not a lot to see around, VERY dirty water around you. It was cold and then started raining. It might be better and a little refreshing on a hot day, but I just thought it would be better to spend that time seeing another temple than being in that boat.

Hotel Room Overlooking the River. Such a busy and interesting river. Barges, small boats, motor boats, hotels' courtesy boats, long-tailed boats, cargo boats tied together the length of a football pitch - fascinating.

Get the express boat!. Perfect way to see Bangkok's temples, palaces, and Chinatown. Very easy access, hop on and off. The boats get a little crazy at busy stops and you'll need to be a little assertive to get off.

Nice trip to do. Use one the different boats on chao praya river is a must to do.The Thaïs use them a lot,itscheap, its fast and you have a good overview. You can reach easly the old city and just walking in these streets.I love it
Nice. but the water is a bit dirty. It was a nice experience but I enjoyed it better when I wasn't looking at the water. There was a lot of rubbish floating around.
Exciting and bumpy . You must let yourself go when traveling this river. It can be very choppy, noisy, pungent and exciting all at once. Good viewing of many major sites. Especially good at night.
A must do in bangkok. Really nice to do early morning, Forget the tourist attraction and go deep into the klongs to see the life
Awesome. We had dinner on the cruise and its one time experience do get the tickets for the same and visit this...must have in your itenary.

Long Boat rides. I enjoyed most methods of transport on this river but the long boat rides that you hire (negotiating our own price) go through canals as well as along the river are great if you are time poor

Main river. The Chao Phraya is a major river in Thailand, with its low alluvial plain forming the centre of the country. It flows through Bangkok and then into the Gulf of Thailand.In the district of Bangkok, the water in the river muddy and very dirty, with a lot of debris and branches from trees.The movement of boats and river trams resembles the movement of cars on the Brooklyn Bridge at rush hour.Moving along the river on one of these boats, you know, that really Bangkok city of contrasts
big river. this river is very wide and around it is nice views, we went for a little boat ride across the river, was good.
Old Bangkok on the River. Travel through time with interesting temples and attractions along the Chao Phraya River is a must visit in Bangkok, Thailand.

Bangkok highway. It's truly the most circulated route I have seen. And the most efficient. Either for pleasure, for work or just to get around, it's extremely used and popular among thai people.Check out some food places or shops in various stations, they are really interesting to see. Plus, the food prepared on the spot tastes pretty good.

What A terrific city. Despite the beautiful city of Bangkok, Chao Phraya river really got polluted and sadly government is doing very little things to clean the river. However you can see many beautiful things by taking ferry around the river.

Holiday . Great way to get about the city. This can be by tourist boat and/ or long boat we enjoyed both trips.The tourist boat is 150baht per person per day and drops you of at all the tourist sites down the river. For the 150baht a map and a leaflet with information about each area is provided

Great views of the city.. Took a longtail boat ride through the canals and onto the river. Got on at the Grand Palace and had them drop me off down river at the Sheraton, which is near the BTS sky train, as no train service in and around the Grand Palace. Great way to see the city from the river. By your ticket from the ticket office near the Grand Palace and not from street vendors.

Oops. Having stayed just by the river ,I view the river as a must to get around you can get a water taxi ,tourist ferry and day trips so it is really handy given the traffic in Bangkok is mostly gridlocked ,Why did I entitle this review oops basically the very river they call the river of the Kings is very polluted and needs a really good cleanup , plastic ,wood etc all drifts by on a trip and you begin to wish they would clean it up and educate all tourists included in how to look after their river of the Kings
Easy way to get around and sone great sights. You have to experience a water taxi up the river. Best way to take in some fantastic sights and get to the Buddha Statues and Temples.

A very pleasent morning,beats walking.. Well there are many ferry terminals so it depends where you are the price varies. You go under 6 bridges and view a lot of river travellers. The palace is beautiful. At most of the terminals there is food and drinks ,I suggest you get some for the trip, as it can get very hot.

Great views and a splendid way to spend a day. Hop on any ferry t see temples and palaces, you can even go as far as Koh Kret a small island in the river with some good Thai restaurants and souvenirs different from the usual rubbish
cheap mode of transport. The Chao Phraya River is a great mode of transport. River taxis are a cheap way to get to some destinations (wat arun, wang land, siriraj, etc.

River of the Kings. You have not really gone to Bangkok if you have not tried doing the Chao Phraya River cruise, either on a dinner tour package or a simple boat ride. A must to-do thing in BKK. It must be in your travel itinerary.

Nice river, terrible ferry operation . The river looked quite beautiful from the areas we could see it, so we decided to go to one of the many "ferry terminals" to go for a cruise. Tired out from exploring the market we just wanted to hop on board a boat which could take us on a slow round trip around the river. On arrival at the ferry terminal we were told we had to buy the multi-pass to hop off and on when we wanted. After letting them know we didn't want to hop off and we just wanted to cruise with the ferry, we were still told we needed to get an expensive multi pass instead of a single ride ticket.We passed on the whole boat ride because of the ridiculousness of the ferry operation. I would advise hiring your own boat if just looking for a simple cruise on the river.Also, the river itself is quite dirty and may be a disappointing sight of you're a nature lover.

A river runs through it.... The Chao Phraya river is like Sydney Harbour to Sydney. It does not have that extraordinary beauty of Sydney Harbour but Bangkok would be a very different place without the river. You can still see the traditional Thai river life style of locals as you cruise on the many public ferries that course the river. There are still a number of klongs (canals ) that run off the river to homes and businesses. The "Venice of the east" was probably an apt name before the car took over and many canals were filled in.The ferries provide mass transport for many thousands of commuters and tourists daily. It's a great way to escape the traffic and visit some of the city's attractions such as Wat Arun. Just watching and listening to the ferry masters and conductors maneuver their craft into the many stops is worth seeing itself.
Some great views from the river. We took a boat ride on the river going to the Royal Palace. Some great views of the city. Easy way to get to the Royal Palace.

Coming from Africa it is a lot of water!!. The river is very wide, and coming from a continent where drought is often a reality and wide rivers are not commonly seen, the Chao Phraya was quite impressive to me. It was terrible to see that people live under the bridges of the river and that poverty in Thailand is just as big a reality as in Africa. All the buildings next to the river was impressive, it must be a beautiful picture at night.

The highlight of Bangkok. You need to go for a boattrip on the river, either by a rented boat (longtail), the ferry og a restaurant boat. I actually recommend all of these, as they are so different and will show you different sides of Bangkok.

Go by boat. You have to travel by boat when you are in Bangkok it's a must and great way to see the city from the river. Travel on the big river but also on the small ones that go closer in the city. It's cheap and fast.

Nice river city view but dirty water. The Chao Phraya River is heart of Bangkok. Nice river city view but dirty water. To see how beautiful Chao Phraya River you should go to the bridges to cross this river. Or you can do more extreme just take the boats that is cheaper to pay.

River cruise and fire work display. Evening river cruise
Well worth booking.
We booked on day and were collected by your van
Evening meal and entertainment with buffet.
Throughly enjoyable !
Many different companies to choose to book with

Hop on, Hop Off...Easy. We stayed at the Chatrium Hotel, right on the Chao Phraya River and were treated to fantastic views of Bangkok from our balcony. The river is a great place to get around with the water taxi as it takes you to stations and attractions with ease. We bought a day pass ticket and used it to hop on and hop off throughout the day and went to visit different places. You can use it for dinner cruises which is another way to see Bangkok.

My favourite tourist thing to do. Take the BTS down to Taksin station and then either hire a long tail boat (make sure you negotiate the price) or the tourist boat up to the grand palace. An epic experience

We've been Had. I think the overall experience for this tour could of been great but we unfortunately were hoaxed. A tuk tuk that was claiming to take us to the Grand Palace stopped by the river to "show" us the scene. We were then approached by an aggressive tour guide asking for 1200 baht each to see the river, we were brand new to the city, naive and Bargained down to 1000 baht per person. Definitely should not be paying more then 250 a person for this. Pretty dismal scenery that is repeated over 40min. I would recommend only do this w a large group.
Never boring.. Take the Express Boat for a 30" trip to see the River side of life in Bangkok. The fare is only 13Bht.

Princess Dinner cruise . The river is famous because there are daily cruise boats offering dinner onboard. The journey begins with you being taken to the boat pier. Beautifully clad Thai maidens stand a side with you and take photos to sell later for 200THB, the dinner cruise cost about $20 and offers upper deck or lower air on seating, an excellently spread buffet meal with live entertainment, the cruise takes about 2 hours and by the time you enjoy your meal and stretch your legs to view the scenic sides of the river with some nice views the cruise boat return to the pier ending its journey, good evening activity, keep your appetite good and drinks onboard are expensive and you can not take your drinks onboard, enjoy the dinner cruise and Bangkok river

A FACINATING EXPERIENCE. This was really a facinating experience and a "must do" for all tourists visiting Bangkok.The cruise is really very enjoyable and the food sumptuous. The scenery is wonderful with all the buildings lit up. The MC was also very good, she sang very well and got everyone on the dance floor.

Join locals on water taxi along river. Take Sky rail to Saphan Taksin go to Central Pier below on Chao Phraya chose whiere you want to head or discuss with ticket office go to end then do a return. Need to be quick getting on/off. For sky rail for less hassle buy a Rabbit Card. Just tap at turnstiles beats buying tickets for individual trips. Saves time and money

Stunning and very convenient way to visit many attractions!. We got a day pass and hopped on and off at various locations. Be careful, though, you need to be quick to hop on and off, so this is not a good way to get around if you're not rather fit... Otherwise, it's a great and VERY interesting way to get around in Bangkok!

Beware. We paid 2500 THB for a 2-hour tour. They said, we will have 20-min each in Grand Palace and Wat Arun. Another couple was with us in the boat and to our surprise they were only charged 2000 THB. Though this we happened, we just really didn't bother ourselves. When we reached the Wat Arun, they were charging us a 30 THB landing fee which was never discussed in the beginning with the boat tour company. The couple was so mad. They don't want to pay. We just bargain with them that we will pay 30 THB for 4 persons. The lady who was collecting money agreed. So we moved on. We enter the area with the couple. When we are about to enter the gate of Wat Arun, they asked us again to pay for 50 THB. This time we didn't bargain nor pay. We just took photos from outside and continued the river tour.
Bangkok River. Fun to take public taxis on the river even though very crowded. The river is quite dirty and trafficked. The views are quite interesting though.

Just perfect for a traveler!. As we started our journey to Bangkok, we decided to take a river boat to go around the best landmarks of the city and we did not regret a bit of it. We juggled everything just to land on the best stations and made sure to ride it for the entire day, and we did it! We just rode from the last station going to Asiatique and had an amazing sunset experience.

Wacky boat ride. The river is masive every Klong has something different going on in it.Women wash clothes in it ,Children swim and bathe in it we just skimmed across in a long tailed boat passing many different cultures, A real good spend for the time we had.

Great fun for one hour. I hired a long boat from pier at shangra-laa hotel 900 baht for a boat for up to six peopleThe boat driver was very friendly and we really enjoyed the views from the river by long boatWell worth the trip and good value for money
Amazing views. Another form if transportation. If you love water. Travel on the Chao Phraya River make sure you take it to the end. At night the views are amazing. Loved travelling on it.
Is it a tourist site?. I do not think it is attractive because there is nothing to see. Just a normal river or perhaps I have seen so much more nicer lake, rivers in the Asia :)
Choose the thai boat, not the turist one. If you know where to get off choose the thai boat (red) and not the tourist one (blue) is cheapest (13 thb) and there are no tourist (almost)

A curiosity. The river is a different world on its own.Cruising boats, shuttles but also and above all small embarkations for the local people, to transport people or carry food and various stuff for sale on the floating market.A very animated life on the river, full of colors, noise, smells and sometimes ugly vision of the local pollution.It is worth seeing it once.
brilliant . fab to get about Instead of being stuck in traffic.. Get to see all the riverside whilst being cooled down by the breeze . A definite must
Take a cruise before you leave. Seeing Bangkok by water is essential if you are to have an appreciation of the city. The skyline especially at night if you take a cruise is amazing.

It is not river but sea entered in Bangkok. Chao Phraya River is very famous attraction of Bangkok. It is life line of Bangkok. A lot oc material transportation happens through the river. Not only this but it offers Cheapest source of public transport.I visited river first time during Ganesh Festival. River is surrounded by good sceneries, good hotel, huge bridges, Asiatech Mall. It is learnt that there is a big New Year Celebration very year. I will go there in 2016. Also Wat Fo Wat Arun are on both sides of river.It is not a big river but a beautiful sea.

Don't leave Bangkok without a trip on the river. We travelled up and down the river several times while we were in Bangkok but I highly recommend a trip in a long boat up the river and through 'old Bangkok' . It cost seven of us 1800 baht for a two hour trip. We went through the klongs and had to wait for the locks to fill so we could go further. A lady in a handmade canoe came to us offering drinks and souvenirs for sale.The sights along the canals were amazing and our guide stopped several times for photo opportunities, including huge water monitors the size of a crocodile!This trip was a highlight of our stay in Bangkok
Ho Hum. Is ok, not a big deal. Cheap tickets and crowded boats. A bit better at night. Maybe the private boats are better
Simply amazing. Many different kind of boats to take to the other piers or just take a tour of what the river offers. Many buildings surrounding and beautiful views. Amazing services on board.

Easy way to get to the main sights. We took the Chao Phraya Tourist Ferry day tour to see the main sights as it is a cheap and easy link to the main places at your own pace. The fumes at the back of the boat were bad, especially in the heat but we enjoyed the sights and the easy travel. I would recommend for those looking for a more budget experience of Bangkok and a fun day out.
Fresh and clean. We visited this river while going to the wat arun. So nice river. Clean. Less traffic. And the fee to cross the river is so cheap.

River boat trip. We took a river trip here. We were taken to popular sites along the riverside. Taking in Bangkok from the river. Seeing the royal palace and various buddiest temples along the river. We were then taken to feed cat fish on a canal nearby.This was outside a temple. We also were taken to an area where vendors brought boats to sell things.You can buy beers,soft drinks, trinkets and all sorts of things from boats. Very cheap goods but can become a little overwhelming as you are soon surrounded by boats selling things. You have to quickly learn to say no.They do listen and move on.It's not to be missed well worth time to get there and very relaxing time.
nice way to see the city. Very nice way to move around. No traffic. Only 150 bht ticket for the whole day. You can travel as much as you want in a 1 day for that price.

There is nothing special about this river. So other than looking at water or the convenience of river boats, this river is just dirty water with loads of mosquitos. If you like looking at rivers then go.
River cruise. Me and husband go river cruise boat tour. is very nice for see view of Bangkok and have dinner and music.

Venice of the east.... It's bit oversold but worth every penny. You can take cruise or a shorter one hour boat ride along the canals. It's around 1000baht for having complete boat to yourself. The scenery keeps on surprising you. You might also come across a stray boat selling souvenirs. Getting a drink for your boat guy is regarded as good gesture. The route is dotted with places of interest. You also get to soak in the unique Thai architecture along with the humdrum of regular life. There are safety vests on the boat. On request, your boat guy can give you an adrenalin rushing experience by converting the boat ride into a boat race.
The Beauty of Bangkok. I personally feel Chao Phraya River is the heart of Bangkok.It adds to the beauty of the City and the ferry ride to office is quite a nice stress buster

Best and cheapset way to see Bangkok life. Take a public ferry from Thaksin Bridge BTS stop and ride to Nonthaburi and back for a few pence. Get on and off at most main sights along the river or ride to the end of the route and back to see a slice of Bangkok life. Sometimes noisy and crowded but excellent views from the seats on the side or stand at the back and watch people hopping on and off. Excellent photo opportunities. See the big famous hotels, China Town, the Palace, temples, shopping areas and markets, etc, etc.

Huge swirl of energy. Not the prettiest of rivers. Very much a working river. The best place to see it is on the river. Not only do you get to see how the real Thai's live- washing in the river cleaning their clothes in the river, you can also see how much this river is essential to the people for their life. Transport and industry. You can get on and off at different stops and see so many food stalls and markets.

Commercial exploitation denegrates this splendid river. There is much competition for the tourist's dollar with this attraction. Up close, most of the river is quite polluted. Boatmasters seem disconnected from the clientele they serve. Bangkok tourist authorities could learn from the customercare and charm Venetian gondoliers typically offer. The ride in the long and narrow boat is, at times, very rough. Our criticism was that the boat driver was unskilledin guiding or interpreting the experience. It's likely best to hire a professional guide, at additional cost, to make the most of the river experience. cost

Local ferry a must!. We used the local ferry to go up the river to the palace. Bought the ticket on the river stop and jumped on board with every other man and his dog!!! Cheap and Crazy and jam packed but an experience. Also took a a private longboat we hired up the khlongs or canals which was a must for tourists.

Not for the feint hearted. We bought the 150bt all day river use.Great value and we made the most of it.You can use any boat with a flag but we stuck to the tourist boat.Tip:Start and buy your ticket, then you can use any boat with flag all day long.We travelled from pier 1 to 13 thereby seeing all attractions before stopping off at each pier on way back to see temples and palaces.Boats are regular.But:Be aware that getting on and off these very busy boats is something to be negotiated with extreme caution.Boat stops at pier for less than three or four minutes to allow up to hundred on and off.All the time the boat sways perilously against jetty.No staff to help. Easy to slip into river.So if you have any mobility issues think very carefully before going on the river boats.Other than the getting on and off, great value and a nice way to see the city's attractions.

Good way to travel. I took the express ride from Sathorn Pier to Phra Arthit Pier. Not much to see on the way but if you are by the window, it's breezy and you get to see some of the old and new buildings and temples along the river. Also, a good way to skip the roads.

Must go. Definitely a place people should visit in Bangkok. Most attractions locates on riverside and you can visit through public or tourist boat.
