Interesting to travel a city by river ferry. No need to take a paid tour for this river. However def recommend using river ferries to navigate the city. Quick and you get to experience different views!

Fantastic at night . I went there for sit on the boats with other tourism that is great and have tour leader for discussion very good I have there so many time I really love it Thanks for beautiful place

Good Option to travel. If you want to travel to any places near the river you should take a boat. Its fast, its cheap and you can see a lot of nice places. There is always a station just on one side of the river. But u can get a ferry for 3 baht to the other side.

Great Views. Took a ferry to grand palace and a second time to Asiatique. Great way to see the city. During the ferry, there was a guide teaching us a little bit of history about the monuments we were passing by. bunch of fish jumping in and out the water. they looked like tilapias, that was a lot fun. Can get really crowded during rush hour. but overall had a great experience.

Take the tourist boat. To see more of the city and its attractions, we took a day ticket on the tourist boat on the river. You can hop on and off and see the real streets of Bangkok at your stops. Travelling by boat gives you a different perspective of the city and its people.
Nice river but not brilliant. The river is a real centre point for Bangkok but could be so much more, needs a single focal point and more development to make it really memorable

Bussle and great cheap eats. Right beside the Wat Po to Wat Arun ferry there's a small riverside café with great food and views across the river. The manic activity of river traffic is interesting, and the fare across to Wat Arun is a meagre 2 Baht. BY comparison the Wat Arun side of the river is manicured and serene.
Refreshing. Take a boat trip after visiting the Grand Palace up to Central pier , Sathorn for BTS. Cheap fare ,14 bahts only. Take the orange line from stop near Gran Palace
Busy. Loved staying right on the river. I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else. Noisy but fun and always busy.

River cruising. We purchased an all day pass on the tourist ferry which enabled us to hop on and off and travel up and down the river along the ferry route for the day disembarking at various interesting temples and sights. watching the water taxis and cargo barges being towed by tug boats up and down the river is also great to see

May be the best way to explore Bangkok. "First time in my life I have seen the real Bangkok", - said my friend who went to canal tour first time in his life after 20 years of travelling to Thai. It is really amazing tour to see real historical part of Capital.

Always Buzzing with Activity. The Chao Phraya is always an interesting place to visit at the weekend - easy to take the BTS to Saphan tasking station and then one of the many boats going up and down the river, including to/from the hotels if you are going there for a meal or drinks.

Brilliant. Great service to use and get around.make sure u pay the right person though as easy to get caught by private operators wanting to push u into trips u dont want.shud only cost 14 baht per trip or 150 unlimited day ticket.

A 'must do' in Bangkok. Buy a tourist pass and spend the day travelling up and down the river; a great deal at 150 Baht. You can get on and off at the different stops along the river, a super way to see many of the sights.
brown ~ chocolate. when i went there on August 2014, the color of the river is brown. So unfortunate, many tourist coming there but we can not see a clean river
Good for transport. It is a good and cheap way of transport. The boat ride is great. There are lots of options for boats with different rates.
Different facet of the city. River is quiet polluted but it provides beautiful view of city by boat. Boat is fast and cheaper route to travel around especially for Grand palace and emerald Buddha.

Good introduction to river life in Bangkok. Although a bit long, and may be boring in some parts, this tour gave me a glimpse of river life in Bangkok. This city has been a favorite for many years, but this is my first going on the river cruise. Those who want to take a closer look at Bangkok's fondness for the river would find this fascinating. Some scenes may not be for everyone though, as it shows the good and some ugly parts that may not appeal to all.

Transportation and Views. This is a must do, especially if you are adventuresome. Very inexpensive, but confusing. Many tourists are knowledgeable and speak english, don't be afraid to ask for advice. Lots of options for Boats and many departure ports. We loved the Longtails. The views are spectacular and the contrast between the modern and ancient is dramatic. It truly is a grand waterway and a significant mode of transportation. It is messy and polluted but try to look beyond that and picture how Bangkok grew up along the river.

Choose your ride carefully. I get the most out of river trip by hiring a long boat for myself & family & following the small klongs off the main river, stopping at an interesting place for a meal, & generally a relaxing & stopping at points of interest.

Fascinating. My brother and I stayed in a two bedroom apartment overlooking the river. We spent much of our time simply sitting on our balcony watching the amazing variety of river traffic and enjoying the beautiful sunsets over the river.The river is a major source of transport and many different types of boats ply their trade along the river. We were particularly intrigued by the huge barges that were pulled slowly by the tugs up and down the river.The local ferries are a very cheap source of transport for visiting many of the major tourist sights, and though they sometimes look quite chaotic, they work very efficiently.The river at night is quite magical with the reflections of the lights, and the numerous gaily lit restaurant boats travelling along the river. Travelling along the river is a unique experience as the traveller will see many very humble wooden or corrugated iron shanties on stilts, alongside modern buildings and even golden temples.

Anantara Riverside Hotel's boat service. Anantara offers a boat service to their guests which takes 15 minutes from the hotel to the Saphan Taksin station. There are vendors selling clothing, hats, eats and drinks near the entrance to the BTS skytrain. The boat also takes guests to the evening Asiatique Markets. The ride along the river is made more enjoyable by the excellent staff from Anantara Riverside. A great way to travel and take in the sights.
great place to be on boat. evening. i have been on a boat during evening dinner time. its a good whether in thia river. wind is good. no noise. they played jess music with sacsophone too!

Good for transportation. Go to the pier close to bts station Saphan taksin, then you can get access to a lot of places, e.g. Hotels, asiatique, restaurants. No traffic jam there and most of the boats are free of charge.The cruise at night is very relaxing and breezy.However, the water is very dirty.

Where there is water, there is life.A must for all travelers to Bangkok.. Chao Phraya river is beaming with activity.Ferries, Snake boats, Express boats, cruises and tourist boats.Both the banks are lined with famous Hotel sky scrappers.Vibrant life is visible on the banks.Cruise/boat ride at twilight/night is a must.Boat service fares very cheap.Highest is tourist boat ,40 THB only.
Mighty Chao Phraya. Chao Phraya is the highway of Bangkok, just with a slower pace. The river is used for everything from transporting goods to people

Excellent boat trip. Take the local for a few baht. It stops on both sides of the river. I
Ike the o take it to the end unles I have stuff to do else where. Lots of great River life

Alternative Transportation. Some may say it's river cruise, while we merely use it to reach grand palace. The water was not clear, just like regular city river. However aside of some water plants, no significant garbage sighted.
River of Life. Chao Phraya River is One of the most significant river in Thailand.Along the river you can see the life style of typical Thai.

The Venice of the Orient . I loved staying at the Chatrium and being able to watch the activity on this river.There is always something going on whether it be tugs, hotel shuttles, ferries or the long tailed speed boats.I preferred to avoid the traffic and traveled to most of the famous temples by boat.This was easy and super cheap only 14 baht one way on the public ferry. Simply hop on board one heading in the right direction and pay for the ticket on board.Be sure to check the maps at the pier so you know which pier you need to exit because there are no announcements on board.You can also use the tourist boat which is 150 baht flat rate for unlimited daily travel or 40 baht each way. This boat does give commentary about what to access at each pier but only stops if someone wants to get on or off. Pier 8 is the main one for the Grand Palace and Wat Arun.I also went for a 1 hour trip through the canals on the long tailed speed boats. This was exhilarating when they went fast but was great too going slow and seeing monitor lizards basking in the sun and getting into the back canals where the locals live.This so reminded me of Venice but instead of a gondolier it was on a crazy speed boat.Some places are regulated speed boat places and they charge a little more.I got mine from the dock at pier 8. As I am a solo traveller I told them I wanted to wait for others to come and join me to share the cost. We ended up with 5 of us and only costing 500 baht an hour.This ricer seems to be the soul of Bangkok and I really feel you are missing out if you don't give river travel a try.
Nice cruising experience.. Most advised attraction of Thailand, they wel-come you on board with their traditional way, you'll love this memorable cruising since it gives a pleasant experience.

An interesting and restful way to see Bangkok. Take a water taxi boat and travel the length of the river for a pittance of the price asked by people offering 'water trips'. You also have the advantage of getting on and off when it suits you.

Pleasant evening.. You have to visit at least once. But don't ecpect much of it. Belonges to tourist entertaining. Point of making money on tourists. Very nice idea to have dinner on the boat and see the sightseeing the same time. But!!! Too short time for adventure. You wait for the waiter to come for 15 minutes, after 15 minutes more to bring You the bottle of wine to make your dinner special (wine is never cheap in Asia). Hopefully You had chance to take the food from the buffet table. If don't stay the line You have risk to stay without food or look at and imagine what could stay on this plate before... If You are lucky it is already half of Your jorney and You see the waiter coming to take money from You and clean the table. And You don't have to wait him anymore. And You drink Your wine like a bottle of water in desert thinking WHY??? The same situation with a foto. Nobody even ask if You need it.

NIce boat tour of many key downtownBangkok attactions. Took the tour boat on the Chao Phraya River and had the opportunity to see many attractions from the water. Great experience, guide spoke many languages easily and spoke well in all languages. So, people could understand what they were looking at.

River Boat taxi. Get a different view of Bangkok from taking a river boat taxi up and down the river to special locations. You see local resident going to work and business people getting around. It takes you away from the traffic of the city too.

A great way to see a unique slice of life in Bangkok.. The river is a very important part of Bangkok life and is worth taking a trip on. Missing this is missing a big part of Bangkok. There are a variety of different boats with different prices and stopping at different places. All the prices are very reasonably priced. You can get rides for 40 baht or less for one way rides or get tickets for unlimited riding and getting on or off as you wish. It is a great way to see the life of the city on the river and the different grand temples along the way as well as old and new buildings. You can get off and shop at different places on the river, or have a coffee or a relaxed meal overlooking the river. A nice way to see a different aspect of life in Bangkok and it's skyline.

Take a trip down the river to discover Bangkok!. A great way to see Bangkok is to get a boat ride down the river. It is very cheap and you can just jump on. We got the boat from Sathon to the pier to see the temple of the reclining Buddha (wat pho). We went when the sun was setting and it was really nice. Just to warm you, the river is very dirty, and around Sathon there are lots of stray cats and dogs and homeless people. You can experience how the locals live seeing them by the river, and also see lots of sights including China town and various temples.

Nice trip. Nice experience of traveling on the river.Worth the effort if your staying near the river is to take a tour of the Chao Phraya River that runs through the heart of Bangkok..it is chance to try another public transportation with ferry boats and water taxis .
Riverside life. by public boat, 15 bahts is cheap. you can see a life at riverside. can see the temple , grand palace .

Nice Experience. was a very great experience visiting chao phraya cruise... can still be organised in a better manner for boarding and exit... many indians have seperate cruise... the food buffet is excellent and nice view during the cruise trip...
River tour - beware of scam!. Over priced and nothing to see apart from a few buildings from afar. Paid 600 baht for an hour of boat tour seeing NOTHING!
Nice view for river side dinner. There are many riverside restaurants that you can see Chao Phraya river and also enjoy the food in Bangkok

Take a trip along the river. Worth the effort if your staying near the river is to take a tour of the Chao Phraya River that runs through the heart of Bangkok. Get a different perspective of the city and venture along some of the Khlongs to see how life use to be when Bangkok was known as the Venice of the east...

Travel. The experience of traveling on the river is an absolute must. There are numerous river taxis to board and easy to use and you can access areas of interest for all the family. Crossing the river is also easy. Dont be afraid to use this method. There is always someone there for advice if needed.

The Heart of the City!. We like to stay at one of the hotels directly on the river. There is public transportation with ferry boats and water taxis and you have access to many great sights. Don`t miss a dinner cruise at night!

Central Artery of Bangkok. A must-do event is a cruise/ferry-ride on the Chao Phraya river. Cheapest way is to take the public ferry, easiest point of access is via Sathorn pier (connects to Saphan Taksin BTS stop) or free ferry ride to Asiatique (usually very long Qs). There are also numerous privately operated dinner cruises on offer.The river is a hive of activity during the day but all private cruises only operate at night. Most affordable dinner cruise is the one operated by The Riverside Hotel.Frankly, theres nothing much to see at night on the river except for the magnificent Wat Arun all lighted up like a diamond. Asiatique is a must-see, best to go early, before sunset, before the crowds. Theres an excellent Thai restaurant by the pier. Many other shops, eateries, fish spa, ferris wheel, to keep U entertained.My favorite river activity is to partake of afternoon tea at the Shangri-La hotel (Exit at Saphan Taksin BTS station) - enjoy the scones and tea while watching the boats go. This is living! This is (affordable, 5 star) Thailand!

MUST TAKE chaophraya BOAT TOUR - WALK BY RİVERSİDE. This river must attraction of Bangkok. Even just take single tour for 40 baht to another stop or cross river for 3 baht to see wat arun you will be charmed by this city. Do not take tours -all day 150-500 baht ! So before travelling check out for routes ; ticket is single or return and how many hours you will spend ın that station otherwise your daily ticket is not worth. We got single and under sunshine had amazing photos of local river-side thai houses, wats, towers, hotels and shopping malls like "river city". River is so muddy and full of floating plants. Even its raining these boats ara long ; one row 9 people be seated ; and a guide tells you about skyscapers, towers, wats, shopping malls around river. Tickets are green for one way and 40 baht ; ıf you found cheaper 3 baht ; you re just allow to cross the river in a boat or higher price means return but gives you to stop anywhere you want and take on again till 6 pm. Another useful tip check out last hour of boat ; you may end in a pier waiting for never-coming-boat :) actually all day ticket is just useless ; you may walk piers and ıt is fun. You will discover amazing sides of Bangkok while walking ( you must bring umbrella for sunshine !)
Key tourist attraction, some nice hotels as well. A stay in Bangkok is not complete without even a brief visit to the river where many temples, the flower market and hotels are located,.

Good for trial. This is recommended for those wanna give a try. But beware of people approached you to buy ticket as tourist. For local boat ride, it could be as cheap as baht10. However, too many tourist been direct to buy those tourist ticket as high as baht 150 per person. If you are city center, u may just take taxi or tuk tuk to travel

Must do in Bangkok. Take the tourist boat ride and be shown all the important landmarks along the way. Numerous high end hotels & temples make for a beautiful view. And should you wish, get off at your favorite stop and explore Bangkok further. Definitely a cost effective option as well.
Dinner on the cruise. Overall environment is good and well attractive but the food is just average which slightly below the average worth
Take a river boat you won't regret it. Take one of the scheduled river buses and you won't be disappointed, these are quite frequent and run both ways up and down the river.
Great riverr ride. Must do when in Bangkok is the river ride.. I did it in the past and do it for transportation on the big boats during the week.

Wide scope of city view by river, lot of express boat.. - Easy and very cheap for Chao Praya express boat along the river from Nondhaburi pier to the end.- Slow life in traditional wooden house, western life in condominium.- Beautiful royal boat, temple, along the riverside.- Don't forget to visit "Gled" island near Nondhaburi pier. (beautiful clay souvenir)- For one who like night life, there're many dinner boat trip at hotel along river side.- However, the water can look muddy in the rainy season.

Dirty and smelly. The river is very useful since it is the highway used by the boats going to other side of the island and going to Bangkok's major attractions but the river is full of garbage,the color of water is black or brown and smelly.
Beautiful Scene at Night!. We are heading to Asiatique, taking a boat to while pass along this river. at night, you can see beautiful city of Bangkok from the boat.

Worth a visit. If you are in Bangkok you should defiantly take a boat ride on the Chao praya and see the palace and big hotels from the boat. its a cheap activity especially if you are a whole family.

My number 1 favorite outing in Bangkok. Every time I go to Thailand I try to get out on the Chao Phraya River. It is the heartbeat of Bangkok and an often overlooked key element to the city and country. There is a very cheap, frequent and comfortable ferry that will take you up River for only about 25 baht (less than a dollar). Catch it under the Taksin Bridge, which is easily reached via elevated and air conditioned BTS, make sure you get on the ferry with the orange flag ( they are express and go the entire route) and ride to the end of the line. Get off, tour the market then return on the next ferry back, at your convenience.
Amazing adventure. Taking a boat trip along the river, you can hop on or hop off at your leisure, taking in many of Bangkok's tourist attractions. Excellent photo opportunities & cheap.

Do it for the experience. The river is extremely dirty and crowded. This took us to Wat Arun and several other stops which could have been accessed via cab or BTS. Do this for the experience but don't expect to be aqed

A Taste of Thailand. I went on a boat tour of the river. As we traveled down the river, it gave us a view of how many people use it for transport, commerce and their livelihood. We actually visited a crocodile farm, a temple and floating market. Even saw people bath their children and wash their dishes in this (not so desirable) water.It was amazing seeing hoe many of the people live and depend on this waterway for their very existence. It was a wonderful tour.
Perfect river for a boat trip. Perfect river for a boat trip. Especially at night. River is in the middle of very famous temples. So you can see main touristic temples during boat trip.

The aorta of Thailand. Taking a boat along Chao Phraya in Bangkok (13 THB) is both fun and time-saving to certain destinations. If you haven't tried the river boats you haven't really been to Bangkok. It is also possible to take a boat between e.g Bangkok and Auytthaya. Nice seafood and Thai food restaurants by the riverside for example in Nonthaburi. You can also take an evening time river cruise with dinner included.

Great way to catch a glimpse of Bangkok. I took this route going to Asiatique, palce where food trip and shopping destination is heaven. It's nice during the day coz you will have a better view of the city and the structures and skyscrapers.

Convenient transport to tourist sites around Bangkok. Very convenient and cheapest way of transport to famous tourist sites around Bangkok. I stayed near the Thewes Pier so it was a few minutes walk from Kaloang homestay to the boat station 15-Thewes. Quick and fun ride to share with locals.
Nice for a small cruise. Just take the local ferry between stations, its a nice way to see the city from the river and rest your feet for a while.
The view of dubai. Wow, I like it most. The water and the view of the dubai. It is the different experience in dubai, amazing.

Thai food on the water. By day it's nice to travel up and down the river to get a good view of the Bangkok skyline, but it's even better to take the trip on one of the bigger tours at night when you can also share the romantic night views and tastes of Thailland with you loved one
Cruise in Bangkok. Many visitors come in this site for a cruise in Chao river, you can homes of the poor on the water as well as luxurius homes for the local rich
Fun and quick way to travel thru Bangkok!. Fun and quick way to travel thru Bangkok! Besides waiting time it's a great way to travel along the river in Bangkok!
Relaxing on River. Nice view of Chao Phraya River and we can go everywhere by Boats and very convenient not traffic jam just buy round tickets

a must if in Bangkok. i dont think a trip to Bangkok would be complete if you didnt take a boat down the river and thro the canals. People living on top of the river, fishing and swimming in water that westerners wouldnt dip the fingers in is a humbling sight
the river that makes the difference. get on a boat tour, short or longer - a great experience and your money is good invested - it's a longtime memory

take a free ride from pier to Asiatique. take a free boat trip from pier Sahphan Taksin BTS station to Aisatique. waiting for about 10 - 15 mins to coming ferry (60 persons) capacity. quite enjoyable and mild wind blowingjust take about 15 mins to reach Asiatique. On the way, you can enjoy sightseeing on both coast.. those modern hotels and high rise building along the river front.  there are restaurants on both sides of the river (most of them closed) There is cover near the pier but not on the side of Asiatique so remember to bring umberalla for waiting on Asiatique pier if it is raining.take note on the last boat leaving Asiatique or else you can take a taxi back to your hotel.採取從碼頭Sahphan達信BTS站免費乘船前往Aisatique。等待約10 - 15分鐘到未來的渡輪（60人）的能力。非常愉快的和溫和的風勁吹只是需時約15分鐘到達汎亞風情。在路上，你既可以海岸觀光遊覽......這些現代化的酒店和沿江前高層建築。 有在河的兩邊餐廳（其中大部分關閉）附近有碼頭蓋而不是在汎亞風情的一側，記得帶上umberalla的等待汎亞風情的碼頭，如果下雨。走在最後的船離開汎亞風情筆記，否則你可以乘坐出租車回到酒店。

Only way at times to get around and a pleasure to view. The heart of Bangkok,it travels up the river,look at our your hotel room at 7am and the road bridges aref ull of traffic and i just love watching what passes up and down all day,tiny tugs pulling hugely over laden metal barges and those grest car engined long tailed boats. Must do is the riculously cheap river taxi come bus so easy to use and we always do a long tailed boats up the canals. Won't fancing my changes on surviving more than 20 seconds if i fell in the murky sewer but very pleased to travel along and view from the hotel or riverside
Dinners. Lots of places to get dinner around here and a number of them are great. Some are better then others so worth walking around a bit

See the old and new. A great way to spend a day is buying a hop on hop off boat ticket for 140bht. You can see the ever changing skyline of Bangkok and can get to see most of the main attractions with just a short walk from piers.
Water taxi anyone?. You can get a water taxi to take you anywhere up or down river . Obviously at designated locations about 1/4 mile apart.

Bangkok's bustling river. The Chao Phraya is a wonderfully busy and scenic river and shouldn't be missed on a visit to Bangkok. The Chao Phraya was instrumental in Bangkok's history and development and was a hub for trade and transport. Today you can see all sorts of boats and barges and ferries. Make sure you take the opportunity to get on the water: either by a ferry, long tailed boat trip around the klongs and river communities or on an evening dinner cruise where you can see the beautiful temples and Royal Palace lit up.

nice trip on the water. by buying a ticket to one of several ships which float on the river you can have a wonderful night,live music plus good food and lots of fun for the evening,also you can see the skyline of Bangkok and lots of its attractions from the river

Charming Chaopraya. If you want to take in some of the best and most interesting views of Bangkok, look no further than a boat trip on the River Chao Phraya. Either by river taxi (extraordinarily cheap) or by pleasure boat (for hire from tour companies or riverside 5-star hotels), a journey on the river reveals some amazing and beautiful sights, far removed from the city's heat and traffic jams. On offer are views of famous temples (Prakaew, Arun, Pho), historically interesting buildings featuring early European architecture, and day-to-day life on the river. Enjoy the river on-the-cheap by river taxi, or enjoy a more leisurely cruise on a pleasure boat, complete with lunch-time buffet or romantic evening meal. The choice is yours depending on your budget. Whatever your choice, plan for a day trip and enjoy, enjoy! Oh, and don't forget your camera.
By night, it's so breathtaking.. The most popular activity is to go on sightseeing while dining on boat along the river at night. Enjoy variety of food and show on board.

We saw a water monitor!. We took a long tail boat on our day trip. It is not the only way to do the river, our hotel had a water bus. But the long tail boat is the most exciting way to experience the river. The boats seem to defy the water. You can't understand why they don't sink as they skim the water. The drivers are so knowledgable and they guide you to the best viewpoints and features. The highlight was seeing a huge water monitor lizard as it squeezed its way into a hole under a pontoon. A lovely trip.

Fun & Relaxing Way to see Bangkok. I was pleasantly surprised by the river trip we went on when we accidently stumbled on a jetty selling tickets. It was interesting to see the city from the river & experience the canals. Water ways, & floating markets- would definitely recommend this excursion to any tourist to Bangkok!

Go with the locals. Our tour guide got us on with the locals and we paid about 20p it was fun and a great way to see some of Bangkok, we got off at the palace and wondered around the beautiful temples.
Take a boat and cruise the river. Take a boat and explore the river and especially don't leave out the canals - there you can see a bit of thailand how it was before the big shopping centres came!

The pulse of Bangkok. A river that's a way of life, a highway and a tourist route. Do look out for longtail boats whizzing along with spray rooster tail, barges and tourist routes.Use the boats with a blue flag that stop at places to see. 40bht one way or 150bht stop and drop off anywhere.....until 3:30pm.Some stops are not so easy to find again from the road as often down an alley. So when you emerge from the pier, look around for a landmark sign or advertisement that marks the alley entrance....then it's easy. Some attractions are on the other-side of the river but a whole 3bht for cross river boat...yes only three baht = a dime / 3pGet a map showing piers and main attractions.
VIEWS. A good way to see the traditional Bangkok life on the khlongs, and some of the main modern buildings from the river, avoiding the notorious traffic jams.

Sunset & The Maharaj. Take a tuk tuk to main entrance of Thammasat University where a side road lead you to Wang Lang market. The small ferry pier brings you to Tha Maharaj a lovely entertainment complex void of the toiuristy feel of the usual commercialised atmosphere of the city.Cross the river banks by ferry with your camera or smartphone and capture the golden hour of sunset. At US$ 0.09 cents a ride take as many rides to capture the temples and landmarks against a background of sunset and the beautiful blueish sky.Dinner at the Tha Maharaj with your desert at the After You Cafe (prepare for the long Q).Explore more of the river and her landmarks by water taxi which cost US$ 0.30 cents.
Night cruising. Love having dinner cruise on Chao Phraya River. They have good food and live band. I liked the scenery and the weather was perfect!

My favourite mode of transport. When we are in bangkok I like to travel by the ferry on the river or by the canal boats it's a great way to really see Bangkok and how people live and work. A trip around the khlongs is also worth the effort although these are mostly organised and less formal than jumping on the ferry.
Serene and Calm. Beautiful river , extremely strong current . Has a calming effect on the mind. A must visit when you are in bangkok.
Go take a boat and sail the river. Visiting this river was great. A must take ride on the ferry. People around have a little problem with speaking English but that wouldn't be much of a problem.
Bangkok by Sea. Take a water taxi to which ever side you are not on! It's only 3 baht to go each way, and you can explore both sides easily.

Nice experience. We visit the river by ferry. It cost 300 baht for ferry ticket ( valid all day long ) should take the ferry because you can access to most of the temples with the ferry service. It stop at every pier, there's a tourist guide in the ferry explain a little about the history of the buidling and temple you get to see along the river. Worth the visit.

Cheap and good access to flower market, Chinatown and Reclining Buddha. The tourist boat is good to hop on and off, but be careful in getting on and off they expect you nearly to jump on and off without a lot of care and attention at each stop

Another way to get around Bangkok. I think this is probably the best way to see the temples is from the Chao Phraya River. The Chao Pyraya River Express is a more Traditional mode of travel .Many sights along the river .Great Photo oportunities .Carefull of splashing by passing boats .

Hired a boat on the Chao Phraya. My friend and I hired a boat for a very reasonable cost and went to see some of the sights. It was amazing to see some of the different areas along the river, the rich, the poor and everything in between, not to mention all the restaurants, parks etc on the way. There was quite a few other boats carrying other people and they were happy to give you a wave. There were so many places to stop and walk around then you could get right back on your hired boat and keep looking. We had a fantastic time and I would definitely do it again.
Symbol of Bangkok. One of my favorite activity in Bangkok is walk along the river side or take public boat journey along the river. loved it

took the ferry instead of the cruise. we wanted to get a cruise but it didn't fit our schedule so instead the last day we took the ferry to the last stop from saphan taksin to N30,... there was a little market there,.. you could feed the fish which was the first time I saw that,... then took the same ferry back,... seemed a good way to say goodbye to the city,... not that spectacular of a view but for those of us that don't see water or ferries daily, this is fun,...
Floating market. Nice day out travelled to the market on a long boat,seeing the sights n the way.Interesting to see food being cooked n boats in front of you.Very busy

a fabulous poetry in motion on the river. its was an awesome cruising experience over the bangkok river. get it booked through an agent and do not forget to negotiate the rates and mention specifically about the cuisine you want, for Indians they serve typical indian veg and non veg food on board. they take you to a fabulous journey alogside the banks lovely hotels, bridges, temples then they make it memorable with a live singer and ultimate dance floor. Food is served as buffet and is sumptuous tasty and has varieties. A must sail .

Great cheap travel. the boat taxi's are awesome! for only 15 bath per person you can travel all the way down the river. just check before where the stations are and which colour flag you need (orange is the cheapest I think)

Relaxing on the river. Taking a local boat a few stops up the river is very pleasant. The river breeze is refreshing and I always love traveling by boat. It's a good time to be busy with your camera because you get to see a different perspective of the city when you arr on the water.

Bustling Chao Phraya River.. This wide and bustling river goes right through the centre of Bangkok and beyond, navigable as far as Ayutthaya. It is always a lively place both by day or night. River and restaurant boat cruises abound, as do small boutique ferries criss crossing from one side to the other. Powerful tugs pull up to 4 heavy barges at a time with strong extended cables. Water taxis provide a vital service and cut journey times to destinations on the other side. Some hotels provide free ferries as do various restaurants, particularly in the River City area of Bangkok.
Take a Cruise!. Take a tour down the Chao Phraya River or a community boat. You'll see the lovely city from the water & enjoy the beautiful weather.

Rough river ride. Hired a log tail speed boat for "private" one hour tour for 1000 baht, for a river and canal tour, we got caught in the lock for ten minutes of the tour then ended up having another three people join us as the other boat had run out of fuel !!!!!- all part of the fun of Bangkok

Hire a boat or a dinner cruise to feel the momentum.... Do visit in the evening around 5 - 6, you get a good view. At night not much to do. However, you can hire a boat or a dinner cruise to feel the momentum. If you take your kids, keep them always with you.

Walk along the river. We took a nice walk along the river up in the area near the Grand Palace. Plenty of restaurants along the way, and plenty of things to look at. Parts of the walkway are quite modern.

Ok but not that enthralling. The river trip we took was bartered so we had the not to ourselves. Which was nice but we didn't really get any lock knowledge and we were taken down. Backwater to be flogged cheap goods and watch fish being fed. It was interesting seeing 5*hotels near to makeshift homes - the diversity of Bangkok.The river was interesting but more functional than an attraction

Canberran's. We did both a long tail boat and evening meal. It is a busy river. And can be a bit choppy in a small boat on a windy day. Watch for landing fee's collected when you disembark long tail boats 20B.As most long tail boat driver's have limited English, they only point out the obvious land marks. Still it is worth the experience. And the trip though the canals was a good insight into living in Bangkok. Be prepared to barter for a good price, best to organise through your hotel if you are not confident to do this.
Nice cruize.. Taking a ride on the chao praya was fun going to koh kret. There isn't much traffic of boats and it's very quiet.

A Must See and Explore. Even if you're not super comfortable on boats, this is something you should experience. The boats alone are an attraction unto themselves, but using them as a taxi through Bangkok's rivers and canals is truly unique and eye-opening. It may even be too candid for some.

Muddy waters of Chao Phraya river. By accident we ended up in one of the river boats that took us for a tour around the city and we loved this experience. Make sure to keep your mouth closed during the travel couse you'll never know what can be found in the muddy waters of this river.

Chao Phraya. I was absolutly scared of these local boats on Chao phraya.You can choose from different type of boats and make a different trips around Bangkok.On some piers they would like to sell you just a ticket to tourist boats and they dont give you some informations about the other kinds of boats.

Bangkok by boat is awesome.. The river ferries are a fantastic way to not only see the city but also to get to many tourist sites. Different levels of ferries which vary in cost, where they stop and how crowded they are--all based on the color of the flag they fly. All levels a great bargain and fun way to get around.
Beautiful. A beautiful part of the city with some high class 5 star hotels and old temples. The water is a bit dirty sometimes, which could be improved.

A good way to get around Bangkok. The river is quite busy with long tail boats and scheduled water buses. It runs North South through the city and provides a handy way to get from one part of the city to another. The central station at Taksin links with the Skytrain. Many hotels with river frontage have free shuttles to Taksin. The staff are friendly but businesslike. Study a map first to plan your journey then go for it!

River Walk. If you want to visit some place where you can have dinner while witnessing the sun set or have a walk near the river then take the river boat where you can hang out at some places like Asiatique or Yodpiman.
Great way to see the sights. What a great way to see the sights from the river. So easy to access.. You can hop on and off for some of the river taxi's. A far cheaper way of touring.

Long boat on the river is a must. When you visit Bangkok, you have got to take a one to one and half hour tour on the river. It is not expensive usually about 15 dollars for two and up to 4 people. The "long Boat" as it is called takes you for a ride up the canals past the homes and shacks along the river. Kinds are swimming, jumping from the bridges and off the decks of their homes. Your “captain” will stop along the way and you can have a beer at a local back water bar…or get a bottle of water. You can also shop for a san pan hat from one of the ladies on a back canal. It is worth is if you have never been, and always enjoyable if to take someone that has never been on the back canals. Departures are from under the sky train bridge (last stop at the moment) at the river ( look for the Shang ri la hotel) … you can make your own deal and don’t usually don’t need any help. Bring small bills currency and a tip is always appreciated.

nice river tour. want to knowing the river, there are some more ways:(01) after the tour at Ayutthaya, then by ship back to bangkok(02) during the night time, have a night tour & dinner by boatbeside the river, can see so many pagodas, with the light spotting in golden color!!!it is so beautiful!!!

very beautiful at night. a really wide river. very beautiful at night. with so many boat full with lamp, and some of it with music.in the day you can see there are so many fish, you just need to feed them.

Take a ride down the river and experience Bangkok in a different manner. Would recommend travellers to Grand palace,Temple of Emerald Buddha,Wat Pho or Wat Arun to take a ride down the Chao Praya in late evening or night.can opt for any of the blue or orange flagged boats or long tail boats

Do it if are not scared of water. The canal trips given by tourist boats are over-hyped and wastage of time and money. Also people scared of water must never do this. The floating market here is expensive. However if you want to go to Grand Palace etc., then public transport boats are fast and cheap. Cruises at night offer beautiful veiws, average food and average entertainment, are very over-priced and over-hyped.

A Must in Bangkok. An absolute Must in Bangkok. Take the Sky Train to Taksin Station, from there the tourist boat (with explanantions about what is to be seen on the way or where to leave the boat for what temple or market) or the scheduled boat where you mix more with the locals. On the way back, I stopped for an hour and visited the flower market which the guide mentioned on the way up. It was well worth the stop. On the Chao Phraya River, Bangkok's really happens.

The river full of life at beautifull city of Bangkok. Chao Phraya River Bangkok. The river full of life at beautifull city of Bangkok. Lot of boats and ships. Allmost must to see and go by boat when Bangkok
Scenic views. This was a great way to cool off on a hot day. We had some nice views of the city. Interesting houses to look at along the river.

Great cultural experience. Good that you can now get around on transport on the river easily now. Wonderful to see locals doing their everyday work. So much going on in developing along the river. Must do
Nice Experience. If you are in Bangkok, try the river cruise but take the big cruise with live band and entertainment or otherwise very boring. The only enjoyment is ok buffet food on the cruise.

great vieuw. take the boat an enjoy the river and it great vieuw .
easy and cheap . i loved it .
If you tired you sit down and rest .
Had a Nice Time on Board. Enjoyable Cruise Dinner with very good buffet dinner..!!! We were charged 1000 Thai BHT per head...Not Bad!!!

Great rides.. Using the river to discover Bangkok is one of the most diversely rewarding ways to enjoy Thailand's experience. Take the Chao Phraya Express up and down for economic charge or book a river cruise with meal for a more indulgent reward. Don't forget to explore the khlongs as well in the water taxis.

Overpriced!. We took a one hour river cruise which we paid 3000 baht.
The river cruise was nice, but not worth the money, we were told it was expensive because we had the boat to ourselves.
Make sure u get the price up front and are prepared to pay premium if you just rock up and don't book ahead.
Disappointing.

a must of yo have a spare morning or afternoon.. if you have a spare morning or afternoon, go to the Taksin Bridge (BTS) and take the express ferry to Nontaburi. It cost about 20 Bto get to Nontaburi end jetty. It will go criss cross up he river (about 45 minutes) but you see the most amazing sites and the further up the river the more rural it gets. Then at the end you have to get off and just walk a bit through the markets there in Nontaburi. You will see fruits you never sen in our life and worth trying. Then get back on the ferry (ferries leaving about every 5 minutes) then just go back to the end station jetty at Taksin. best times to go is between 10 and 3 pm (non school and office finish hours. Take a piece of paper and pen then on the way up write down the jetty number where you want to get off for a bit. Then on the way back get off to see the sites and get back on (must buy a ticket to that site though, sa me if you take a bus in any city)

Take a local regular boat. take the boat to go along the river from North to south of vice versa. It is the best way to discover it.Don't take the private tourist boat, which are much more expensive, but you get the same view, but not the local flair.

Cruise in a boat . River taxis are available along the stretch of the river and are a great way to get across and experience the true taste of Bangkok. The locals take these river taxis across the river and to travel around the city. It's also a great way to escape the Bangkok jam.

Took fabulous Grand Pearl Dinner Cruise on river. Fantastic experience! One hour each way. Your cruise past Grand Palace, Watt Arun, and all the other great monument lit in gold. A band is playing, singer is singing. You get a gourmet buffet. All for around $30- same price a dinner alone would be at a good hotel. Perfect!

Alternative way to explore Bangkok. Get around by boat can be handy in Bangkok since the boats can access many touristic places such as Wat Phra Kaew, Wat Pho, Yaowarat, Asiatique, etc, but sometimes can be confusing if you get in the wrong boat, so ask the right boat before you get in. The price is reasonable and much cheaper compare to BTS, taxi or motorbike, don't forget the name of pier you want to embark/disembark.
Nice sights. Went for a river cruise to take in some of the sights from a different angle. It was quite pleasant especially to see Wat Arun temple.

Great experience. Take the boat rides between different attractions along the river. You avoid the traffic on land and get to enjoy the beauty of the river. There are rides along the river and at certain points you get rides across the river.

Dinner cruise. The first ever dinner cruise I had was with the Chao Phraya Princess. The food was good, the music very festive and the singer knew a lot of international songs. The second one I had was incomparable to the first one. There was buffet and music but it wasn't a full house. Music was sad.

Spend time on the river. Spent around 10 hours on the river, first caught the tourist boat and checked out all the stops. Used it like an on and off bus tour. Then hired a long boat to checkout the Klongs. Look out for touts, make sure you know the average hire price. Finally went on a dine and cruise tour and had a great time, loved the show even if it was a bit chitzy and the food was fine.

Fastest way to get around Bangkok. This is a fast, cheap way to get around and a great way to see the city from the water. There are many operators offering lunch and dinner cruises at reasonable prices.

Paradise at night. At first Bankok seemed not much different from Mumbai except for the cleanliness and order. But the chao phraya river cruise completely changed my perception of Bangkok. Beautifully lit city lights. Awesome food on-board and yes we enjoyed the music. Its highly recommend by me.

Can be confusing!. The river is the best way to travel through Bangkok, this way you avoid all the traffic and see the city too. The tourist boats work like a hop on hop off taxi. Some of the piers act as ferry points too, if you get on the wrong one you will feel a bit of a fool and it will cost you 3baht to get back! One thing is though, if you are getting on a bit and not so spry as you were be careful getting off and on as these boats s don't hang around!

Big River. This river is awesome. Sometimes it looks romantic and beautiful, especially in the evening when little boats and ferries go to and fro. Many restaurants and bars look out on the river. During the daytime it looks different. You see the pollution of the water and floating rubbish. During the rainperiods there is also the menacing flood. All in all an imposing sight

A must. When in Bangkok you really must take a boat trip on the river. Best (and cheapest) way is to take the day card, so you can hop on and off any boat as you please. A really perfect way to escape the hectic road transport of Bangkok only to be thrown in to the hectic waterway transport system. It is loud, smelly (diesel fumes!), crowded and overwhelming but the impression you get from this growing city is breathtaking.You will have to plan it all by yourself, expect no help at all from the personnel on the boats or on the piers, they are the rudest people you will meet in the whole of Thailand! Although there were (as always) some exceptions. If you can afford it also take a private boat to visit the Khlongs of Bangkok, here you will find peace, tranquillity and beauty.

Love the river. I enjoy my bi-monthly visits to Bangkok, and whenever possible I will take a trip on the river. From the Taksin Bridge, take a public boat to Marine Department Boat Pier and head into Chinatown, or further to Tha Tian or Na Phra Lan and the Grand Palace. I enjoy watching the river life, boats come and go.

Never waste your money on this one!!!. We were segregated at the boat jetty according to nationality and ushered on to a boat accordingly. Indian food, loud Indian music and dancing and a lot of very drunk people.No commentary on sights we passed and no Thai food.We should have at least been asked what kind of experience we were looking for. HORRIBLE!!! Waste of money!!!

Express Way. Although in the past, I have visited the klongs and markets connected to this great river, the real value is the fact that it is a marvellous way of getting away from the vehicular traffic of Bangkok. The ferries run very frequently so you don't get bored waiting. They ply from bank to bank and it is actually scenic as well as practical. It is also cooler than travelling by tuk-tuk.
Interesting river trip. After being in Asiatic you can take a boat ride, very cheap to take you around. It works like a ferry between a few ports/stations on the river phraya. A Beautiful ride.

Best way to get around . The river is still the best way to get about in my opinion, boat taxis, buses etc are very cheap. Some are free to certain places like the asiatique and there is a sky rail station at saphon taksin. All of that and it's just the most beautiful way to see the city. Many hotel will have a free boat to the sky rail which is fab however if you are like us and just relaxing one evening we have been known to hotel boat hop to go and have a look around at different river front bars etc ;)

Easier way to get to Wat Pho, Grand Palace and Wat Arun. If you wish to see the temples and you have access to the BTS skytrain, i suggest to take the ferry ride. Just alight at Saphan Taksin station and buy an unlimited day pass. They will also provide a map of the different attractions along the river with their corresponding pier names and numbers. Boat leaves every 30 minutes.

Best way to visit Bangkok. The best way ever to visit Bangkok is by using the river boats. The traffic in Bangkok is horrible so if you use the waterways you can travel a lot faster, instead of being stuck in traffic. You can reach all of the main attractions by boat.

Beautiful . Worth a visit if you never see it yet....especially at night....It is beautiful when all the boats passing by. Try not to go at noon as it is so hot under the sunlight. Evening would be ideal

STUNNING. The mixture between the best hotels of the world boardwalk, the skyline of the city and the Thai people coming and going with their work boats and the hotel's boats makes it, in my point of view, a beautifull place to visit.

best experience. it was a pleasant April evening to embark on cruise
It was a big double story cruise filled with tourists
There was loud live music along with dinner.
But couldn't enjoy bcoz of the menu
Down stairs live Indian music was playing causing thrill among the young couples
Over all a memorable trip
nice sennary all day long. sky train bring to "sapan taksin" station.from there take the public ship on the river.take the regular one and tour the city.
Nice river tour. Good river view and nice ferry dinner. although the buffet was average but good for a short river tour.
Convenient & Fun. The best way to get around the river. Such a fun way to experience local life. The express is very convenient to get around some parts of town.

Lively in-city River. Dirty tidal river. The giant lilly-like plants travels up or down the river dependng on the tides and winds. Easist to visit using the public ferry. Get the cheap ticket, not the expensive one.

Still the best way to visit temples and other touristic places. It is still the best and sometimes the only way to get to temples and touristic places but it seems (and smells) Chao Phraya is getting stinkier every year... No wonder : it is so polluted and so much Bangkok's sewage flows into it people are even afraid of being sprinkled by droplets when tourist boats get speed or other boats pass near by. Chao Phraya needs a major cleaning, sanitation and ecological revamp but few believe the Thai and Bangkok government have the political will to do so.
Mark Robinson . Great artery of the city.Easy to get on at the "Central" pier just below Taksin BTS station.Take a free shuttle at night to Asiatique for entertainment and great cuisine choices.
Wonderful. An awesome view and and lifetime experience at cruise at chao phraya river cruise...unforgettable evening ...

The river is beautiful in the evening time. Very nice view from top of one of the building scattered around it. I visited one of the hotel and went up to the bar and stay there in the evening watching the various tourist boats decorated with so many lights.. so beautiful.. next time if i ever come again I will try to get on the boat :)
The Life of Bangkok. One of very busy River on both side and is in your daily needs if you want to go to the other side you need to pass through the river

The sights are amazing. You cannot visit Bangkok without taking a longboat down the river. The sights are amazing, the houses on stilts, some of which look like they could fall into the river at any minute. Keep an eye out for the dragon lizards in the river. A great experience.

The ferry experience. I had swore that I would experience all the types of transports when in Thailand and yes I did. Except for the tuktuks. The ferries on Chao Phraya river give you excellent experience. They are not very costly and whooshing through the river is a great feeling in itself.

Scenic. We used our hotel shuttle boat to get into and out of the centre of Bangkok, as well as catching the local tourist boat. A bit more pre-planning on our part might have helped! The only other transport we used were the Tuk Tuks.

Very interesting and busy on both sides of the river.. How do you rate a river? I road the express boat from end to end. It took about 2 hours round trip. There is so much to see. Construction, transportation, monks, toursit, school kids, employees, and temples.

A Must To Do Thing in Bangkok !. A must "To Do thing " while in Bangkok, the Saphan Taksin Pier is accessible by the BTS Skytrain. You could take the 150 baht Tourist boat which stops only at major tourist attractions for a one day pass or you could take a 20 baht Orange Flag boat and hop off at an attraction of your choice (recommended) and have a feel of the local way as well. A No of major tourist attractions like temples are connected by boat on Chao Phraya River. A Not to miss trip even when on a short visit to the city !

Bangkok trip. Very nice view especially in the night when you go out on the cruise having dinner enroute. Good view of the surrounding tall buildings. Nice place to be with family and friends whenever you visit Bangkok.
Quick and Cheap. The Chao Phraya river has taxi boats which can take you around to different stops. The river isn't choppy and is fun to see all the great sights along the water.

it was very amazing to see the beautiful Buildings on the bank of river from the River cruise.. anyone travelling to Bangkok must take this cruise. To see the rear side of the Buildings and historical places from Cruise is wonderful experience

A refreshing view in the middle of Bangkok. A great river that winds through the middle of a great city. A good place to hang out at one of the many riverside restaurants and enjoy a sunday afternoon, or take the river taxi up river to Koh Kret for a different experience.

fast way. had great time at the chaopraya river.. is the fast way to see something different stuff about bangkok... the only things that i dont like about our own trip on the river is that boat go so fast, i was a bit worried

A Pleasant Ferry Trip. I travelled on the river on a ferry from one shore to the other. The river had lots of commercial traffic with tugs pushing numerous barges filled with raw materials and goods. A skillful captain was sure required to make your voyage a safe experience
Cheapest way to go around. It's free to go to Asiatique using the boat. For other stations, it is just about 15 baht. Cheap and has a nice view while travelling.

Local boat. Take the local boats (Orange flag) for next to nothing. Don't bother with the crazy expensive tours, you see all the same stuff on the local boat. The price is super cheap and your hostel / hotel will point you in the right direction. Excellent way to get around.

Great way to see / travel around Bangkok. Get a local boat down the Chao Phraya River and you'll be very pleased you did. You will get to see the modern Bangkok directly in front of you in direct contrast with the older more traditional Bangkok behind you if you get the boat from around Khao San (Phra Arthit pier) to Tha Thien pier (opposite Wat Arun). It seems a little daunting at first but it couldn't be simpler to use. There are a few different lines to choose from (white, blue or orange if I recall correctly) we used the Orange line (the boats have orange flags on them). The reason for this is because the orange boats go to every stop, if you have a map / phone app you'll be able to see exactly where you are and know which stop to get off at. Although you do get plenty of time for this as there are big signs on the pier and they take a minute or 2 to get the boat close enough to the pier for people getting on and off. You pay on the boat to a person who comes round and you simple tell them where you are going and they charge you accordingly (the trip from Phra Arthit to Tha Thien was 28 baht per person)A helpful tip is if you have sunglasses / hat please hold on tight the ride can be slightly bumpy / windy!

A great way to see the city. A boat ride on the river is always a part of my visits to Bangkok. The most convenient and useful route is from the BTS Skytrain next to the river to the stop for the Grand Palace.It used to be easy to take the regular commuter boats for local people, but tourists are now directed to the more expensive tourist boats. A pity. The commuter boats offered a real slice of local life.The river is broad and fairly dirty. Lots of detretus from tress and plants up river, together with trash. Above, broad sweeping bridges, each with its in history pointed out by the tourist boat guides. On each side, a flat horizon punctuated by exotic roof lines, buildings secular and sacred, ancient and modern.Getting on and off is fairly easy, even for the least sure footed. There is usually somebody there to offer a steadying hand.
The Chao Praya Dinner Cruise is a Great Experience. The best way to explore the banks of the river is on the night time dinner cruise where you can see the magnificent temples on offer in Bangkok.

Picturesque . If you have the opportunity, take a river tour. We hired a local to take us on his little boat (with a corvette sized engine) down the river. The river was especially busy that day so he stopped at several shops on the river for us to peruse. Definitely worth it!

Great and cheap for sightseeing . Great views around and guide on the boat. Great to see the surrounding. One tip I was given which worked before going was not to listen to people as I was walking towards the boats, they will give you false information and point you in the wrong direction, which happened and I just walked away and found the place in the direction I was walking. Always be careful of such things.

Lot's to see along the River. This river has some very interesting site along it. Asiatique Night Market is an amazing area of warehouses with hundreds if not thousands of boutique shops selling pretty much everything. Many restaurants, dessert shops, a huge ferris wheel, shops that do nails, massages, and live shows are all to be found here. The rest of the river is surrounded by high rises, hotels, and other unique places to visit. Take a long boat ride or cross on one of the ferry's.

Great Experince. Visited Bangkok with my wife in September 2015 & went to the River Chao Phraya bank.I reached there about 7 P.M. & it was really looking great.Very good lighting arrangements.Nice shops for shopping of almost any thing & good restaurants for tasty food.Then we went for Cruise & it was awesome experience.
The best. I just love to take the River taxi and commute from one place to the next. Wish the same way to travel would be available in other big cities.

fast transportation, and cheap...... getting around Bangkok can be nightmare, by road anyway, one of the best ways to travel is by fast boat on the Chao Phraya River, you can visit many famous sights by using this method, for example, the royal palace, wat arun, sky train railway station for onward journey to great shopping malls at the Siam Centre, and Lumpini park (a must visit) for some peace and quite, and "dragons" (mon/lizards).....also if paying a visit to famous Khow San Road, get off the boat at pier 13, walk down soi rambuttri and cross road into Khow San Rd.... but be careful getting on and off the boats, they dont "hang around".....quite exciting, if your on crutches, forget it !!!!

Great way to Sightsee or to Commute.. The ferries are set up so there are 6 - 8 or more sightseeing areas can be reached along the ferry route. Some of the highlights are Wat Arun, Grand Palace, Khao San Road, plus tourist area around there, the flower market, etc. You can also use this route to connect to the BTS at Saphan Taksin station. Though sometimes bus routes get you there faster. There are also cross river ferries, that just cross the river at different spots. Overall, its a neat experience, plus beautiful at sunset, and night time, though most ferries finish running at 7 PM. CAREFUL GETTING ON AND OFF THE BOAT!

Average. Took the hop on, hop off tourist boat up and down the river. Good way to get to the Grand Palace/Wat Pho area wherethe Skytrain and metro don't run but the journey on the river is fairly forgetable. Most of the monuments are set back from the river and you get a fleeting or partial view. Wat Arun is the exception but at present its under scaffolding.

Sometimes good , sometimes bad. Take care about the reservation, some tour operator are un honnest and the previous table isn't everytime avaible, the first time in March it was very good, this time in September very bad with rservation in Pinnacle hotel

best by night. what a fantastic site to see ,none stop from 05-30 till midnight ,lots of different types of cargo boats, ferries pleasure boat of all shapes and sizes ,one of the best trips has to be into one of the many canals on the river and experience the real Bangkok

great river to visit at night. get the public boat from near sky train stop saphan taksin. the fare is very reasonable and it takes you up the river to view the amazing sights along the river. we travelled up at dusk and then got a return boat as it turned dark.

Ferry, long boat combination. Catch the hi-speed ferry to Khao San road and look to then catch the long boat along the klong back to World Square. Provides a great local insight into Bangkok and definitely something the average tourist wouldn't see.

Nice view, cheap transportation, recommended!. Chao Phraya has a busy traffic day and night. It's where express boats pass through and get you to famous attractions like the Grand Palace, asiatique or other temples. There is tourist boat and local's boat with the orange flag. We went to the Grand Palace using the Orange-flagged boat, it's far cheaper. Just like the buses, the boat will stop on ports.

Do not pass up a cruise on this river. A variety of cruises are available. 40 baht will take you from the BTS Sky Train to the Grand Palace.The river is alive with fish ( and we saw a water monitor lizard) and there is considerable traffic.
Great way to get around without traffic.. A great way to access most of the major temples in Bangkok. The river taxi is quite cheap and I would suggest going on the tourist taxi.

It is bodies of water. U go along the river and jump out of the boat, jump in again for next boat brings u a great experience w the locals. Big river but too dirty w the color of water. Dont know whether the people using the water from this river or not but so far it is a great experience and one of the famous attraction for the tourist
Boat ride that cost 18 baht. It is nice to do this for once in your life to take the boat ride one way from the starting point to the end.

Worth a morning. As well as a practical way to travel, avoiding the traffic congestion, using the tourist ferries provides a different view of Bangkok. The process of boarding and disembarking is efficient and the waiting areas are in the shade and cool enough.

FABULOUS LIFELINE. We were staying at the Millenium Hilton which is right on the Chao Phraya river. The hotel has its own boat providing free boat rides across to the ferry terminal countless times a day. From the terminal we went up and down the river visiting shopping malls and temples. The river is an excellent was to get around the city. Especially as it was so hot and humid, the boat rides were always accompanied by a lovely breeze. A bar or cafe along side the river is a great way to spend some time watching the world float by.
Good place to start your travels!. A very busy river filled with boats and ferries that transports people across the river. Several landmarks are located near this area such as Wat Pho and Wat Arun.
Once in a lifetime. Great experience catching the water buses/taxi, very cramped but delightful with the school children and locals. Cheap as chips.

Interesting!. The main river and the main live of the ancient. It connected 2 sides of river but you can take a ferry to cross. The coast surrounded by restaurants and luxury hotels also ancient temples. Boat tour is also recommended!
Fairy riding across the river. Crossing the river by fairy was confusing. Make sure you ask or see the map of where the fairy is going to stop before getting on.

The life of Bangkok. A busy river with all sorts of boats going up and down , from shuttles to leisure boats to barrages carrying materials to its destinations, many 5* hotels on its banks , a river to see and be on ,

Get off the highway for an alternative method of travel. The hub of the city takes you around many miles of waterways to new shopping centres, temples and shows you the lifestyle of those who live on the water. The v8 motors on the James Bond boats are pretty throatty too

The boat was shaking like hell. You have to try this boat trip on Chao Phraya River because it will be deeeply embedded in your memory. Nice view on both sides of the river.
The boat captain (a very young lady) was criusing the ship like as if it was a race. The waves were coming in! :-)

Sunset view. Beautiful view in different time. Sunset view is something not to be missed ! Go to Asiatique and dine with many choices, yiu can see spectacular view of the river! If time permit can do a river cruise !

Good Choice to. Cost 40 baht, for a single boat trip. You can choose to alight at any of the places of interest. There is an English speaking guide who you can check on each alighting point. There's another boat to send you to the opposite side of the bank, cost 3 baht.

fabulous area. The rivers recently been given a recent makeover and de-clutter and what a difference it's made, It's looking so much cleaner. It's full of fish, At some piers you can pellet feed them some as big as 10kg and more, So it shows how healthy the river is. Use it during the day as a hop on/off tourist sightseeing day out, or at night as a dinner cruise, But some are cheap tacky disco affairs with dreadful music, I prefer the more serene rice barges with table service and traditional Thai dancing such as the Loy Nava
Nice river of Bangkok. Temple of dawn is historical temple along Chaopraya river. A place you should have miss when visit Bangkok. Nice restaurants and bars along the river with good scenery

See the Bangkok and the Chao Phraya River like a local. Take one of the regular river boats with a day ticket and hop on and off as often as you would like. Great way to get round cheaply and quickly.

Take the local boat, unless you Klingon.. The Philippines should take its cue from Bangkok. Our own Pasig river is shamefully smelly and unutilized. Not part of everyone's lives, so nobody cares much.Anyway! Chao Phraya and the klongs that feed into it is very much a part of everyone's lives here. Much like the BTS and the MRT and the railways. For tourists, do not even take the Chao Phraya tourist boat which is 40baht from Sathorn to stop 9, Grand Palace. It's supposedly more expensive because there's an English tour guide onboard. Well, I paid that when I rode with my sister, and the tour guide spoke Klingon, I swear to you.So, take the 15 baht boat for humans, it'll take you to the same river, the same views, the same route. Good fun way to get around.

Good food & great views. A 2 hour long evening river cruise on the Chao Phraya river with Thai & international buffet dinner. Great opportunity to view the brightly illuminated Wat Arun temple & The Grand Palace. Dinner is accompanied with musical entertainment.Highly recommended.
The heart of Bangkok. The heart of Bangkok. Take a boatride on the river. Enjoy the riverview at one of the many restaurants.

Travel with tourist boat is only 40 baht. As a local, this is the first time I travel on a Chao Praya tourist boat. I took my Taiwanese friend to Wat Arun. I chose tourist boat with 40 baht fee 'coz there was a guide on the boat who could speak English and Chinese. He could show the places along the river and describe the details. It was really worth the money.
Main river of Thailand. I grew up on the Riverside and taking a boat is one of my main transportations to travel. I have to say that each year the river get dirtier.

Good way to see Bangkok. The available ferries that run on the river provide a critical artery to many of the major sites in Bangkok. The water is not particularly clean, but it is not the worst I have seen.

See the city from the water. There are lots of options for travelling on the river. We took 20 minute ferry rides up to wat pho and back. The river is a relatively calm way to move around the city, a nice break from chaotic roads. As a bonus, there was a pretty sunset on the return ferry trip.
Hop on hop off river cruise. Must do this. Excellent and very reasonable priced, you can hop on and off at various places of interest.
Don't miss it!. This might be the easiest and most comfortable way to see a very interesting and more traditional part of Bangkok, especially when your ferry leaves the main river.

River Cruise. Cruise on the Chaophraya and absorb the beautifully lit buildings ! Food, wine and music makes for the best of evening dinner aboard a cruise boat, there are many hence you can pick any of the good ones !

Backbone to visit all the important sites in Thailand. This is fantastic you can use the transport in the Chao Phraya River to travel to almost all the prime tourist places in Thailand and the ride is scenic offering you some amazing views of the city at the banks of this river. You can also hire a boat for yourself and explore the river in detail (Beware of Vendors though) I easily avoided the vendors by negotiating with my Boat Driver for a bottle of beer !!!

The real Bangkok. I speak to many tourists who have visited Bangkok and they have never been to the river. The river is spectacular and runs right thru Bangkok there are many ferries and water taxis that can take you too the many attractions for next to nothing in price. It's a great way to relax and cool of for a few hours and take in the sites of the real Bangkok .If you do some googling you will find many sites like Viator that offer dinner cruises at night at reasonable prices.

was a while ago now. Tripadvisor has requested this review. Wouldn't call it a great scenic attraction. Evening cruise is how we experienced it. Primary impressions of Bangkok come from else where. Did provide some sort of context to the place though. Good but wouldn't put it at the top of the list.

Ferry ride on the river. My wife and I have lived in Bangkok for eight months however had never been on the river until this past weekend we made a trip up the river to Ko Kret. For me just riding the ferry from Sathon to Nonburi was one of the best value tours I had taken in a long time. The trip took a little over an hour each way and cost just THB 14 per person. That's less than $2 for my wife and I!For me this was much like an open top bus tour we usually take in other cities. If you follow on the map you see where other points of interest are and can get off or plan the next trip. Ko Krett was interesting and fun but for me the ferry was the highlight.

A great way to see bangkok!. The Chao Phraya River is a fairly large and very busy river that runs thru a good portion of Bangkok making accessibility to many sights and attractions more convenient and provides a very economical transportation option. There are also many public and sometimes hidden areas along the river that offer fine photo op's, or just sit and relax watching the river traffic glide by. There are hundreds of passenger boats that ply the waters daily and the most economical tend to be the yellow flagged commuter boats on which you can travel over long stretches of the river for only dollars a day that run often thru out the day. Of course departure and arrival times are mere suggestions and schedules are changed frequently depending on demand and at peak times can be dangerously overloaded. Pay for individual trips to specific landing docks once on the boats or prior to boarding if there is no ticket stand. There is also a very economical day pass on which you can travel to your hearts content! In addition there are any number of "better equipped" tourist boats for ever increasing fees. Very large party boats also offer river trips and can offer food as well as entertainment. These are very popular at night. The river itself is constant muddy brown and it is not unusual to see large mats of water hyacinths or trash floating by. You are strongly advised not to enter the water as it can be quite polluted so also avoid being splashed while on the boats.

boat ride. we went to this place Asiatique to have dinner and on our way back,took a boat across the Cha Phraya River back to our place where we were staying.the boat was huge with good seating arrangements and had efficient attendants to take us across.since it was night time,we could see the beautiful city all lit up,the boat sailing in the cool waters of this river.will go again

Use the orange ferry boat. The river was not as busy as I expected it to be. If you want to get around in central Bangkok, use the Orange ferry. All journeys are 14 baht. It is fast end efficient. Do not confuse this ferry with the other tourist ferries. The Orange ferry is what locals use. You pay on the boat. All stops are names and a local Bangkok map will show the stops and sights so that you know where to get off. Can get crowded at peak times. The driver sits at the front and the man at the back controls it with a whistle. Never did work out the signals myself but they know what they are doing.if you want a relaxing trip up the river, take the ferry at off peak times. Plenty of photo opportunities.

Trip to Thailand for 10 folks. The only river passing through Bangkok and absolutely at the center. Good attractions around like river cruise high rise hotels and fun play for the childersn. Water transport in the river is awsome

Nice scenery in BKK. There are many tourist attraction along Chaophraya River. The best and chepest way to enjoy the river and visit most of the attraction is by boat. The public tpurist boat is start from Sapan Taksin BTS station and it cost only 150THB per peron per day. Tourist alcan hop in and hop off for many places along the river. I am a local Thai but i very much enjoy to took this ride. This activities is very fun and relaxing.
amazing river world. used the water taxi and the water bus here. you have to use the river to experience the true Bangkok. loved every minute of the river.
CHAO PHRAYA RIVER. This river is spectacular. It runs right through Bangkok, and I have seen photos of what it looked like many many years ago, and it has suffered the effects of the high population.

Bangkok river trip.. If you're in Bangkok, you have to take a trip along this busy river on a long tailed boat. It's a fabulous way to see the city from a different prospective. The boats can take up some narrow canals that the bigger cruise boats can't navigate. The views are stunning.

Ever changing working river,life blood of Bangkok.. Whether you take a river bus or water taxi, a dinner cruise or ferry you must have a trip on the river. When we first went to Bangkok many of the boats were powered by lorry engines. They are a little more modern and green now but it is still a great experience and much less polluted than it used to be.
Spend a day visiting things you can get to by water taxi.. You don't know Bangkok unless you've explored a number riverside places. The river taxis are cheap, fun, and scenic.
Suprisingly good. Awesome experience - see the sight of Bangkok from river and lots of temple and palace on one of the stops .Use the regular ferry and not more expensive tourist one.

the buzz in the river is fun to watch but be aware if you plan to use boat tours to the fishing village. The river is rather polluted and during the day specially in the morning it might get a bit smelly but nothing too overwhelming.we stayed at baan wanglang hotel by the riverside and to watch from the top floor early in the morning the frenetic river life was great fun.You have at very small intervals white boats that take people from one shore to the other for as litlle as 35 baths. There are also other boats with a orange flag on the top that for a bit more take you further ahead in the river which allows you to get a broader view of the city from the river . Bear in mind that the orange flag boats are not private tours. They are public . You can buy the tickets on board . These boats do get crowded easily , so pay attention to your belongings.However if you do want a private tour , for instance , to go to the fishing village there are plenty to choose from at each port but be very , very careful with the tour you choose. Don´t hesitate to negotiate to get a good deal and to avoid being ripped off .
