There are a number of stop offs at various piers that allows you to visit some of the more famous attractions - N5 for China Town, N8 for Wat Po & Wat Arun, N9 For Emerald Buddah & Royal Palace, There are also stops for some of the new shopping Malls e.g. N6 (1). You can also take the Tourist Ferry that acts a little like the Sightseeing Busses you see in most cities, using the Hop on/Hop off system and cost 150 Bhat or splash out on your own Long Tail boat that will speed you along the river at a rate of knots - prices dependent an on length of trip/number of people.
nice boat ride with the tourist ticket. it was a very nice ride. couldn't understand the guide much, but you don't really need her, just enjoy the views! :)

Good water transport in Bangkok. Really enjoyed the water transport in Bangkok as you had experienced heavy traffic all the way here. Easy to go to downtown and temples by this way and good scenery to view.

Great Ride and away from the bad traffic. We were staying in Shangri la hotel and we have the boat ride to other places ..... Is very convenient for us and also not caught up with the traffic. The hotel own boat were good and clean. The river is not that dirty or smell as people say about ....... I find this river fascinating and i really enjoy the cruise of 30 min to Asiatiq tourist area but I see more local than foreigners........ Hohoho I also see some narrow long speed boat as they call river taxi !! They are a bit dangerous because they really ride on high speed. Also many big barge carring sea sand or others cruise the river and the hotel boat have to wait or turn around this big and connecting long barge ...... Also they really polluted the air with dark and smelly diesel smoke out. This is the worst environment with this air pullotion ....when we inhale it ... We felt sick and loss our appetite ............
Nice view from the river. We went on a rivercruise in the afternoon and experienced the greatnes of Bangkok, and the poverty. The sunset was beautiful!

The Asian Venice. Travelling down the Chao Phraya river and going through the canals is an experience of its own, if you are staying at The Oriental, you will be able to cruise with their own vessel, if not use a long tail boat and experience Bangkok from its shores.

Breath taking views at night.. We had booked a Thai Buffet river cruise, with Viator. They collected us to and from our hotel, we were on the "White Orchid River Cruise" we had such an enjoyable evening, excellent choice of buffet food, so relaxing cruising up the river, seeing the Grand Palace by night.

exactly how it looked in the James Bond film. Pick up a boat that takes you around the cannels and along the river from one of the piers . Its about $50 US per person or take a local water taxi for a less expensive and more local feeling tour.The tourist boat takes you around areas where the locals use the river and its waterways pretty much as Venice does and its an interesting insight into a way of living that has remained unchanged for a long time

Nice boat trip. I like this kind of boat trips when guide is telling interesting stories about the objects on the embankment and doing it not in a dull manner. The most lovely thing we did - that was catfish feeding - they were sooooo huge and there were sooooo many of them in one especial place of the Chao Praya. And our guide said that when we feed animals or fish then we clean our carma, so it is very useful to do!))
Must try. A popular Bangkok attraction. The scenery on either sides of the river during the boat ride is beautiful with many temples on the way.
Relaxing way to see Bangkok. Never visit Bangkok, without traveling on the river, to see its many sights, smells and sounds :)Sit back on the boat and watch the world go by.

Pick up the boat. If you'd like to have a onshore perspective of the city, get in the boat and go from the first to the last pier. It can take for about 1h or so but it worth. You'll see the diference between poor and rich, living onshore and offshore, architecture, construction and building and so on. It never ends. Must pick up the boat. It's cheap and infinite.

Filthy River, Rough ride, not so sightful.. Avoid the small boats that may look charming from a distance, but I found to be a big rip off. It's a very uncomfortable rough ride with the filthy river water splashing on you. Designated boat to boat shopping came as a surprise and the deal was I had to buy something b/c I had money and they needed it. My driver would not drive off and the vender was aggressive as is ofter the case. The big boats are like a cattle drive of tourists.

Great food very entertaining. Check when you are booking this cruise as to the timing! We were on the 7.45 which didn't board until after 8pm. It has many boats going out and the boarding is very disorganised with lots of pushing. However once on board it was fantastic, attentive staff, great food energetic entertainment and wonderful views.

Chao Phraya Rives is ok.. I say that it's ok, because there are many places you can visit around Chao Phraya river. There are many markets and boat around it and it's the only river that goes through Bangkok. Issue is that this river is not that clean thou...

poorly organised -. The speed boats travel at speed but each time they come to a pier its a chaos .Not properly marked nor advertised ... Looks like Thailand tourism doesnt encourage outsiders to go on their own .always wants local agents to make money .. No guide gave me Yodpiman or other malls on river front ...

See Life on a River. Take a long tailed beat down this amazing river,
Explore the canals ...klongs....and see such a variety of homes along the banks. Visit the museum with the King's royal barges.
You must take a camera with you!
beautiful view. beautiful view at night with wind, what a enjoyable trip!

Don't expect much.. Been here twice, once on a solo trip and then decided to take my family along. The river spans along many of Bangkok's tourist attraction. Get the all-round pass at the Sathorn Thaksin stop, this will take you all the way up river and back to where you started. You can choose which stops you would like to visit and which to forgo. It is very convenient and is much cheaper than taking either the taxi or tuk-tuk. Some of these places are not accessible via BTS service.Other than the convenience, the river definitely fails to impress. Water is murky and somewhat filled with garbage. You will pass many other boats and some river barges. The river banks are mud filled and populated by either fancy hoteliers or dilapidated houses.Try it for the experience or the convenience!

Tail boat cruise. We took a private tail boat cruise to see the riverside living of the locals. You get to see sights of Bangkok that you wouldn't by car. Riverside shopping that locals do from food, fruit, clothing and small essentials. I recommend it if you have time.

Local feel and flavour. Decided to just take a leisurely boat trip up the river, just to take in the sights and go with the local flow. Paid the 15 baht each for a one way ticket and you could go to the end of the line (which we did), or get off anywhere in between. Caught the BTS to Saphan Taksin and just followed our noses down to Central Pier. Don't get on the tourist boat (blue flag), but ask where the line up for the orange flag boat is.We caught that one all the way to the end of the line at that time (Nonthaburi) - got off and did some shopping with the locals for a couple of hours. It's mainly locals that far up, as we only saw 2 other western couples in that whole time. The trip back down was leisurely, and took about 1 hour. Great and inexpensive way to see the Chao Phraya river and spend a day soaking up the local sights and sounds.

Great way to travel in Bangkok. The Skytrain BTS connects at Saphan Taksin ferry station where you can board the for 15 Baht for a long ride along the river. You can see life on the river and many attractions including the Grand Palace at the Tha Clang station. Also the Temple of Dawn at Tha Rachini (catch cross river ferry from here) and to Tha Phra Athit where you can access Khaosan Road (market and shopping). Best for these connection and great way to travel.

See the river Chaopraya. A good way to see the river is to travel by local express boat (not the tourist one) and sail all the way to the end, roughly one hour, for…1$ then return the same way stopping at Wat Po, a good day...

Long Tail boats for River Cruise. We took a long tail boat cruise on the river which was definitely worthwhile. They took us through the canals and it was a leisurely trip which gave you an insight into the lives of Thai people living on the river. We were told to catch the boat just outside of the tourist area and that it would be cheaper - we paid 900 Baht each and our hotel said that this was a good price as usually it can be up to 1200 Baht each for the 1 hour trip. Be aware that when they land the boat to let you off there is a 30 Baht "arrival" fee. We didn't realise this and did think that this was some sort of scam as it had never been mentioned by the boat operator but apparently it is a legitimate charge - maybe they should make it look more official.
view a different side of BKK. relaxing way to see a different side of BKK ,Take a boat & able to get on & off at different locations.
Take a river dinner cruise for great views. Enjoy the sights and sounds of BKK with an evening river dinner cruise on the river. many tour operators offer great food and views

Cheap transport. A cheap and efficient way to travel if your destinations are tourist spots near to the river. You don't have to worry about traffic fumes and traffic jams, bargaining with taxi drivers. The views along the river are not bad although the water is dirty

Enjoyable Views for a good price. The best way to see Bangkok on a budget is by jumping on and off of the boat services provided throughout the day- this allows you to see much of Bangkok and feel like you've made yourself a local for the day.

Great way to commute, spine of all attractions. You get a full day ticket for 120 bhats.All the boats are running on same route, but blue line is specially designed for tourissttsOthers are also running on the same route, so feel free to board them, but do verify once.Best route is: go to asiatique in the evening after sunset, make sure to come back before 10

a good way to get arround. very busy, lots of boats, amazing to watch.Good way to get around , use the ferry, only 150 Baht for all day, and you can hop on and off at all destinations and attractions along the river.
not worth a visit. felt disapointed having 30 mins walk from our hotel in Khaosan to the river. Nothing much to see. You 'd better go shopping or spending more time to try local food
Good way of getting around. The views on the river trip are well worth seeing. Unfortunately the river Itself is absolutely filthy, strangely enough it doesn't seem to smell

water taxi was our primary source of transportation. we loved staying at a hotel that was near the water. We enjoyed using the water taxi as our primary source of transportation. It was great fun and unique. as others have said we used the orange flag boat and it was very cheap

Great fun. Organise your own long boat at the ferry terminal- Best to employee a local guide at £30 UK per day .The boat will take you up the river and to through the canal system that you don't know exists. They will also drop you off on a island with a Wat ( temple ) is situated

It's alright.... There is a nice view going down the river but the river itself is hella dirty! Too many people also. We almost missed our stop because there were so many people on the boar that we had to squeeze our way out of it. I would rather travel by foot than through the river.

dirty. as a main river in bangkok it's understandable that it will be kinda dirty but this is really dirty you can see junk floating around the river. but on the plus side they have a few tourist boat or dinner cruise for you to enjoy the view around the river.
River and canal tour. This was a great way to spend and hour or two particularly in the heat of the day. A great way to see how the river is the life blood of the city and how people live and work

Longboat river cruise. Must do best way to see all the temples plus u get to go thru the canals and see a side of bangkok most tourits don't see . spotted iguanas and saw a lot of fruit trees lovely experience....

trip to Khao san road. Amazing boat ride along the river.When you buy a ticket for @20bht you can get use this for a whole day to access many tourist attractions along the way .You can get off and on all day.

Loved seeing the locals at home. I did the river and the canal trips.. Enjoyed the canal trip and seeing parts that I may not have normally seen by walking around the city. It was a holiday so some of the locals were home and the children swimming in the canals, fishing, boating, etc.

James Bond experience. This river runs right beside our Shanghai-la hotel, through the center of Bangkok. You can sit outside and eat dinner right beside the river in an exquisite setting, Ignore the floating vegetation moving along in the current, and take a long tail boat, James bond style, up or down river.Some of the back channels are well worth exploring and you can jump off at any of a number of spots along the river to tour temples, stroll though a riverside shopping mall, or make your way along the crowded streets.If you must get about this city, it's often much faster on the river than the gridlocked streets, but the tuk- tuks, which are 3 wheeled motorbike taxis with seating for two behind the driver, are the way to go.This river is a busy commercial waterway, so you will see strings of barges any time of the day or night, making their way along, loaded to the brim with who knows what, under the tarpaulin covers.If you stay at the exquisite Shanghai-la or the very grand Oriental hotel, both are right on the river, ask for a room facing the river so you can watch the busy vessels Heading in both directions.These hotels also have their own river shuttles that will take you to several stops along the riverside, so check their schedules and stops and take advantage of a once in a lifetime experience.

An inexpensive way to tour the river.. We purchased a all day pass (130 Bhat - about $4 US) to travel up to the Reclining Buddha and other sites. The first taxi was crowded and noisy, but after getting the hang of the situation, we were able to just ride up and down the river to pass the time on mostly vacant boats. I'm not sure, but think that your pass will allow you to ride on any boat that stops at the pier. That includes some long boats, but I don't know about the "Long tail" ones with the pivoting engine and the prop way out the back on a shaft.

After living 15 years in Bangkok the river.... still holds many secrets to be explored. So one can spend weeks travelling by ferry boat along the river and hop off different piers and keep walking along the Chao Phraya river

a nice , well maintained but beware of over priced tour operators. As we are staying in Tower club at lebua with a river view room, we had very nice view of the river from 57th floor balcony , the river looks beautiful, stunning at night with lot of lightning around.We went to jetty , but beware of the tour operators , when they see tourist they charge 10 times more then the original fare and then put u in old long tail boat for river tour with no safety at all.But if u had a nice boat and wanted to see bangkok at riverside this is the best option.
Scenic but dirty river. The scenery is good along the way but the water is dirty, it really a third world status river where there's plenty of trash in the river.

An experience of traveling on this River.... Is an experience to get on the ferry to cruise either up or down the Chao phraya river. Just get to any ferry pier along the river and tell them where do you want to go. Best to have a map (in Thai) with you to show to the locals. They will help you. Cheap and nice and quick to travel along this river.
River cruise. We did the river cruise at night. It was a good experience with alot food and music. The view of hotels and temples by the riverside was good.
Interesting. I think that the river offers a lot if you want to see Bangkok from a different view. Wat Arun is beautiful from the river. You can feed the fish to for a small fee.

Dinner in Cruise at Night. Dinner in Cruise, one of unforgetable moment in Bangkok. Very good thai food, while cuising Chao Phraya River at Night, We can see the old bangkok City at night, very beautiful

River Tour. There must have been dozens of river tour touts pestering tourists to take a river tour. We almost did it until told the price of 1200baht for tourists and 800baht for Thai nationals. So that would have been 2000baht for an hours trip on the river which is about 40gbp at todays rate. Thankfully my Thai friend took me to a nearby river taxi which cost 4baht each directly to the jetty at the Temple of Dawn. Be warned unless you really want to pay.

Busy - but organised even though it looks random!. This is a very busy river. Massive fuel barges travelling up and down. "long tail" boats speeding here and there mixed in with the up/down and cross river ferries make it fun to watch. It looks disorganised but it is not look closely and women waving flags semaphore wise are apparent. There is no speed limit and it is very choppy - all good fun. For moving up and down the city this is the way as it is more fun, quicker and cooler than going by taxi.Just be prepared to work out which boat goes where and be aware that if you are not careful you will be sidelined onto a "private boat" with a "private bill" to pay. Stick to the municipal boats.Also despite looking filthy the river teams with fish - what I wonder is wrong with the Thames in London? Just a thought.

Disgusting. I liked that we could use the ferry to get to the temples...that's it!! I'm sure that it serves many a purpose but for us, we found that it's main use seemed to be as a dumping ground for rubbish. I live in Brisbane, Australia and have nothing good to say about our river other than it looks pretty at night when you can't see what it looks like, BUT it is pristine in comparison to this one. I can't believe that the water authorities don't have a cleaning schedule. It is vile. I didn't see any fish...probably because they would need to float on the surface to be seen....and I'm sure they would be deformed anyway.
Dinner Cruise. Its a very good attraction for Dinner Cruise and must to see when in Bangkok. A very good food choice of Indian and Chinese food and the food is really tasty on board.
Take the river taxi. Cheap and convenient way to get around Bangkok, especially the area where all the temples are. If you want an even more authentic experience, take the canal taxi.

Best way to travel. Look at the map and find the closest pier to where you want to go. They are all numbered. Tell someone which pier you are headed to, so they can help you get on a boat headed in the right direction. Feel the breeze, see the sunlight on the water, watch the Wats go by. Go on a canal boat tour, too. Gets you away from the crowds.

Long wait for a 5mins ride. Its pretty confusing trying to purchase the one way fare tickets. I read from a blog that we could take the local ferry and the fare is only 15 baht but there were no instruction at the pier and we have no idea where to queue too. We decide to ask the staff at the pier and was directed to the tourists booth where the fares are 150 baht for full day ticket or 40 baht for one way. We went with the cheapest as we only want to go to Chinatown. Next came the wait, we reached the pier at 845am and were told by staff at ticket booth that ferry will arrive in 15mins time. We waited and waited, ferry only came at 930am. You can imagine the long queue of tourists trying to squeeze on the ferry. Most without seats end up standing behind. Personally i didn't enjoy the ride. Also find it a waste of time to wait 45mins for a 5min ride.

For those who like river-view. Being many times in Bangkok I always try to find a time for river trip there. Many people writing here about dirty water and etc. But i didn't pay much attention on water. Amazing view - this is my reason to do this trip.Take the boat and you will enjoy most of the beautiful temples's view in Bangkok, you will see famous Rama IX bridge and other things. I think the best time for trip is close to sunset. Everything full of lights and look amazing.

You haven't experienced Bangkok until you've been on the Chao Phraya River. Bangkok must be seen from this historic river. I was fortunate enough to take a river and canal tour and loved it! I took one of the ubiquitous long-tail boats that have a huge V8 engine on the back, and it was a blast! I was able to see so many historic places and Wats from the boat, and he dropped us right back at our hotel.
smells!. I could smell the water and colour was dark. very dirty water. I went to Asiatique through it and didnot like it at all.

nothing much to see. will avoid this tour if possible since it was just watching houses and nothing else other than feeding the catfish later on! can use this 1 1/2 time to do other site seeing. To get into the floating boat was really scary and to leave the boat the same way and it is difficult if you are short or heavy person!

Its amazing. I traveled with my girlfriend on the White Orchis cruise on the Chao Phraya River.. The ambiance was good with pretty Thai girls performing on live music and dance throughout the journey.. The food was good for the people loving to eat meat and sea foods..

Exciting day or night by ferry water taxi etc.. Great river running thru the heart of Bangkok, busy, exciting & colourful. Water taxis & ferries very cheap Bht15. Links with Sky train, always busy with locals & Tourist, can be packed, ask about colour coded flags which indicate stops. As a frequent visitor to Bangkok, I always enjoy using the water bus .

Anantara Song 3-day cruise. This was the very best way to visit the main temples and sites in and around Bangkok. Living on the boat with only 3 other couples - private guide, excellent food and you see the city and country side from the water. Loved it!

A trip down the river. This river is very busy with long tail boats, ferries, barges etc, it is also very dirty but some on the sites you take in are fantastic.
It's also a great mode of transport to get to Wat Arun,The grand Palace and Wat Pho.
it is also very cheap.

Great experience!. We had a dinner buffet cruise while celbrating my birthday. To my surprised, the cruise staffs sang a birthday song for me and gave a me bear and cake. They greeted me warmly and I really appreciate it a lot. Singers of the band was also friendly and lively. She keep on calling me to dance on the floor and have fun! My friends and I enjoyed a lot! It was a memorable birthday experience indeed! :)

Day or Night this is a must!. When I first visited Bangkok back in 1974, to me it seemed life was lived on the river. It seemed like everything happened on the river and before you knew it hours had passed and there was still so much to take in! Truly Amazing Thailand!Over the years this activity has dwindled due to multiple reasons but taking a boat to cruise the Chao Phtaya River is still a must-do while in Bangkok. Take a ride during the day and admire the the buildings that line the river then, go back, freshen up and return for dinner on the river. While you sit there enjoying the delicious Thai meals take a second look at those same buildings you admired just hours ago.Now that's an experience!

Great experience!. Although having been to Bangkok many times, a crusie on the Chao Phraya River is one thing I hadn't done. We oraganised a trip thorugh Wah Fah and were collected from our hotel on time and in a very comfortable van of which we were the ony passengers.Travelling on a long boat we cruiseded the river with commentry from a very good guide.The trip was fascinating and enjoyable. From stopping to buy drinks and souveniers from two gorgeous older thai ladies who paddled out in their boats to feeding carp with bread.The sights are amazing and something you can't do on the roads. Unbeknown to us (we didn't read all the details) we stopped half way and changed to a beautiful old wooden barge where there was a huge array of food (fruit, sticky rice etc) and an open bar which was included in the price. At the end of the cruise we were promptly into our van and returned safley to our hotel. Overall a fantastic experience which I'd do again at a very reasonable price. Not to forget, the staff were fantastic!

Bipolar river. I've been on the Chao Phraya River by boat, walked along its shores, and sat on one of its many docks and piers. It's a bipolar river. At night, it's lovely to see all the lights of the city or take one of the ferry boats to one of the 5-star hotels. On the flipside, the day shows what a city like Bangkok can do to a river. It's dirty and there's always some garbage in sight.

A 'Must Do' in Bangkok. It seems that every great city has an equally great river and Bangkok is no exception. Yes, the water is dirty, the water traffic is somewhat chaotic, and there are touts selling over-priced trips. Don't let that discourage you. Buy a 'local' ticket and ride up and down the river. My recommendation would be to avoid the long tail boats unless severely pressed for time; they're expensive and pretty much tourist-centric. Another good idea is to avoid the local boats at rush hour; they can get very crowded. Non-rush hour, we always managed to find a seat. In short, do not miss a boat ride on the Chao Phraya!
boat trip and lunch. Had morning sightseeing and lunch on riverboat return to Bangkok. Very good trip and you get a fair view of some of the attractions you might like to visit.

explore BKK by your own. Don´t buy 150 bth ticket (all day/multiple stations), if you don´t need to see every single station. Pay 40 bth one way and exit the boat wherever you want on the way. It´s not "hop on hop off" style, ticket is just for one ride. This 40 bth boat has a blue flag and has a guide. You can also use an orange flagged boat mainly used by locals (if you don´t mind the crowds) and it´s really super cheap - 15 bth/ person one way. Enjoy.

Amazing use of river and how people live around it. The boat ride itself was amazing but at times scary for those afraid of water! This is one attraction not to be missed. The tour included visit to the floating market. One should make time to have a meal there. Freshly cooked and delicious!
long tail boat. ロングテールボートを個人でチャーターして細い水路に入ってもらったりすると庶民の生活が垣間見えておもしろい。 if you charter a long tail boat, you can see normal people life along canals.

A great way to travel while in Bangkok..... Not only is this a great way to get aroundBangkok to some of the sites that are on the river, but it is also a good break from the chaos of the streets. Get a seat close to the side of the boat, keep your hands in the boat and enjoy the ride (especially the public transportation boat). They are fast, a bit crazy but well worth the experience for a dollar or less.

The river is the only way to beat the traffic. As you guys know read my reviews before I love Thailand I love everything about Thailand it is the best and the river is the way to go to beat the traffic and the Tuk tuk remember you're on vacation don't be afraid the tire river captains know their way around there are some bombs your hair will be messed up but it beats Bangkok traffic any day the week

Night cruise enjoyable. A night cruise with a Thai dinner on board is quite enjoyable. The Thai cuisine is delicious and there is a breeze on the river. There are lights on both sides of the river, but don't expect something glamours. Not really comparable to Shanghai or Budapest. Not a must-try attraction but still worth trying.

An absolute must to try!. The boat bus system in Bangkok is a scary experience, although none of the locals seem scared. The efficient system is brilliant for getting from one side of town to the other and get all the sights in at the same time... careful of the gap between the boat and the pier - don't hesitate or you will end up falling in - just make a jump for it!
Great !!!!!!. After a little while deciding which boat to get, decide to get the large boat with all day ticket of 150 baht.They were very frequent and stopped at 13 places

Wonderful experience . We bought a day pass costing 150 baht. This allows you to get on and off the piers as often as you like in one day. The trip on the boat was great and we could have just went up and down the river the whole day. Great relaxing fun outing.
Cool dinner on the river boat. Had a tremendous dinner on board of a river boat cruising at Chao Phraya River. Great food and entertainment :) what a cool way to spend the first night in Bangkok.
Floating in peace-. Is a river where water means life. Just few miles from the city you will see the jungle. I suggest the trip to Ayuttaia ( the old city) .

Very dirty water. Donn't let a drop near you. Very interesting floating houses and well worth the trip. but be careful of scammers who will charge you a fortune for a ride that should cost a few dollars

Brilliant Fun - Get a beer. This is such fun! Go on a private tour and the skipper stops to allow you to buy beer (so long as you buy him one), you can see all the little canals and how the Thais live. Was such fun, a real highlight. Be prepared to negotiate to get a good deal.

Good experience. This was the best way of getting around and the cheapest,
Buy a tourist day ticket for 150 bahts. You can get on and off as many times as you like from Central pier up river to pier 13. This covers most of main sites .

Slow ride on the river, avoid the traffic of the city. An excellent way to see the "other" side (or riverside) of the city. Modern magnificent buildings, and older buildings along the river could be viewed and appreciated. Took the "normal" boat taken by the locals, with stops. Got off a few times to explore the areas of each pier.
nice experience. liked my experience on this river... paid 100 thai bhat per person... its a good way to reach to grand palace and other attractions...
Nothing special. Just a normal asian river with many long boats and surrounded by skyscraper and local "boat" houses. There is a sort of public transporation for only 15 baht.

Great Escape from City's Traffic. Chayo Praya river provides excellent alternative to travel across the city and it also provides you with glimpse of the city skyline across its length through Bangkok. The view on both sides of the river is great. To top it all it is cheapest way to travel. One can reach tourist destinations like Chinatown, Wat Arun, Reclining Buddha, Khao san Road, etc. while enjoying ride on boats from one place to another.

Good way to avoid traffic. Grab a ferry from near Wat Pho and go in either direction. Cheap way (20-40 baht) to see a different side to the city and get to some areas e.g flower market, China town, and also to link up with sky train.

昭拍耶”在泰語的意思是“河流之母”，. 如果在曼谷停留i2晚以上建議一定要住一晚河邊兩岸的景色恰恰代表了即現代又傳統的曼谷夜遊湄南河攻略大多數遊輪的檢票時間是19：00——19:30 下麵以19:30檢票為例19:30 在River City碼頭檢票，並有歡迎儀式19:45 從River City碼頭出發。服務員帶您到指定座位，並為您準備開胃小吃和飲料，同時向您介紹在緊急情況下的安全法規。20:00 晚餐時間，豐盛的泰式自助大餐，歌手和樂隊會演奏爵士音樂21:00 自由跳舞時間！泰國歌手演唱一些歡快的歌曲（包括中文歌曲）21:45 到達River City碼頭 交通：建議乘坐計程車直達River City，或者可以在輕軌BTS Saphan Taksin站的Sathorn Pier（Central）碼頭乘坐，在Si Pharaya Pier（N3）下即可。地址：23 Trok Rongnamkhaeng，Si Phaya Pier，Yota Road，Sampantawong，Bangkok 10100，Thailand

Not to be missed. Taking a leisurely ride on the ferry up and down the river shows all the different contrasts of Bangkok. Temples, 5 Star hotels and Shanties with absolute river frontage are all a delight to see.
good pleace. nice and fun taxi just told us if we want to go to Chao Phraya Riverand get on the boat over there .

A Great way to see the City. Every time I visit Bangkok I take a trip on the Ferries. There are many options available, from the normal every stop slow trip, the Tourist Boat with selected stops and just travelling to the end of the line and back. Also I have done some fantastic Weekend Special Day Trips put on by the ferry company visiting Tourist Sites further along the river and usually packed. On the latter I have usually been one of just a few foreigner tourists, which make the trip even more interesting.

Ideal for Dinner cruise. Have seen many dinner cruise ads but unable to go in my last visit, This rives flows through many areas of bangkok so we can see it when we travel often. Look forward for an over night or dinner cruise next time.
Nicr. Lots of great restaurant boats where you can have a lovely dinner. Beware though most of these are verrrry expensive

Yok-Yor Restaurant. Brought there by a 'local' friend who lives next to this restaurant; where we had to take the ferry from Saparn Taksin BTS station to this venue. Food was pretty good but didn't know how much it costs though..
The best way to travel. the best way to travel around BKK. IT's cheap and cheerful. One hint is to travel around the river is to consider using the free hotel shuttle boat... hehehe

Be disgusted and amazed!. We ended up on a river tour by accident, and because I bartered hard we got the "Make them suffer tour experience". We were wandering around the China Town area, looking lost I guess. when a kind local asked if we needed help? I said We were looking for the "river" so put us on a Tuktuk and nec minute we were at a jetty haggling with a river tour bloke. I just wanted to take the river taxi for a look around, but no he insisted this was the best and only way to see the river. We were supposed to get to feed fish, a walk around a temple and lots of photo oops! Because I haggled him down from 2500 baht to 1200 baht I am sure he told our long tail boatman to "make them suffer"! On the water we wallowed around in the wash of a hundred other boats on the river, all the while the driver idling along not telling us a thing. After 20 minutes of idling and revving his engine randomly, we headed up a channel. The view of the abject poverty and filth in the water was eye opening. The boatman stopped near some dodgy bloke in a tiny canoe who tried to sell up some expensive useless junk and overpriced beer. He left disgruntled and we continued back to the river and were then dumped on some "private jetty" where we were charged a 20 baht exit fee. Another Bangkok rip off.
The river is Ok. Its ok to probably take a small boat ride to the Asiatique market and back. nothing great I would say ans not very clean

Nice River. We stayed at the Shangri La hotel that overlooked this river and it was beautiful at night. We also took many boats up and down the river to get from place to place. The river doesn’t smell and it fairly clean for going through such a largely populated area. Take a boat right at least once while you are in Bangkok.

Either go on a express boat or try a overnight cruise. In the old days the Thais where considered the Lords of the River - the river was absolutely essential for all life. Try to get a glimpse of the life on the river with the crowed but local ferry boats or try out a cruise for for a few nights and days.
Very cheap and funny. you should take a bread for fishTake a travel Cha Phraya. Dislike ... I liked all. May be you should rake a tadi before

What a beautiful way to see Bangkok - get on the River. The Chao Phraya River is beautiful and majestic. Traveling on the River is a fast way to get beautiful views of many of the temples and tourist sites that face the River. There are a number of options a traveler has when taking a ride on the River. In addition to the local ferries that cross the River, there are large commuter boats, dinner boats and smaller boats that will allow you to enjoy the River. While riding the River you will be amazed by the large barges transporting goods. The River runs for miles and it would be great to have the time to take a river cruise up and down the river. When in Bangkok be sure to make time for a leisurely ride on the cool and scenic Chao Phraya River.
Splendid!!. The chao Phraya river is a good attraction for the city. It has beautiful river taxi which can take you to the night market- asiatique, which is fun place.
River bus. River buses and taxis easy to use, cheap and great way to explore the sights in Bangkok. Just mind your head!!!

worth one journey!. I love being around water, and this river in the middle of the city is an awesome experience. We hired a long tail boat and roamed around the city watching all the monuments and temples alongside.

cooler. Very beautiful, except for the rubbish floating at the edges. also very interesting watching the barges travel up and down on it.and itt you stay in accommodation riverside, it is much cooler.

Great transportation. I thought it was so much fun to travel the city by boat. Our hotel was close by a pier and we hardly had to take taxi's or tuk tuks. It was only $.50 a ride. When we were hot we just got on to ride to cool off and go explore a different part of the city. The river boats do get crowded but what do you expect in such a big city!

Get the tourist (express) boat - Sathorn (skytrain). Beware the scammers trying to charge you to exit the piers, enter the piers or get you to pay 200 baht for a "private" boat, everything they do is aimed to get more money out of you by taking you to different private piers.Get the tourist boat day pass which is only 150 baht and you can hop on hop off all day, single journey is only 40baht, i think i also got a local price when i just boarded without a ticket, i was charged 20baht.

Must see attraction. A lot of things to do on this river. Take a boat to go to Khao san road - and you will be able to see a lot of nice temples. the best part is it costs only 15 baht. Get down at Saphan taksin BTS, take Pier exit & yes you are there.
Nice river. Around this river is nice relaxing area with some restaurants and lot big hotels and temple to take photo.
Superb cruise. We took the river cruise ,which took us on the river the cruise ship was good ,food was good but indian vegetarians had a problem because there were no dishes for them .had a good time

Better at Night. Try to indulge yourself with one of those Chao Phraya cruises and enjoy Bangkok at night while cruising the river, and bask on the sights of the temples with lights directed at them. It was beautiful and magical. The cruises' prices gets doubled or thrice the original price however, during New Year's Eve celebrations but other than that, this was worth a try! :)
Nice. Nice way to end your Bangkok visit. Make sure you're sitting on the upper deck!!! Theypuy us on the deck below, and we couldn't see anything and it was freezing cold- air conditioning!

Bangkok Temples and Canals Tour with Bangkok Day Tours. The long tail boat ride on the Chao Phraya River and the nearby canals was an unbelievable experience. Who could imagine car engines and shafts being used to run boats? We met a couple of floating vendors, feed bread to catfish, saw many many temples, and saw both the new and old canal structures. A must-do while in Bangkok.

Bangkok Stay. Gift took us on this river twice. Once by Longtail boat where we went into the different canals to see the houses of the local people and got a good insight into their way of life. The second was in a much smaller canoe like boat and we went through the floating market. I was a great experience to see how natives live and make their living on the water. We saw food being cooked over open grates on the boats I call punts. (I have not experienced them before) Natives were selling all manner of goods. It was exciting to be part of it.

Bangkok from the river. No need to take a private city river tour - you can experience the Chao Phraya river by the water ferries. Lots of stops and a crowded more authentic atmosphere - just watch the boatmen shout and jump off at every stop- throwing the ropes and tying up to the dock.The ferries are cheap and reliable and some hotels ( The Shangri La) have their own boats.Excellent views at night.
Great experience with the locals. Jump on (literally) or you'll be left behind for a great trip with the locals up and down the river on the public ferries. Not as slow as the guide books suggest

I enjoyed my ride on the river. I took a tour boat on the river and had a lovely time taking a lot of photos. If you wish to take the opportunity to take pictures you'll need to stand or sit near the end of the boat. It's a bit confusing and nothing was explained by the operators and we missed one of the boats, however another came along in less than 15 minutes. Despite the crowds and heat I enjoyed my water tour of the city.

Interesting, busy, dirty!. The river is a very busy thorough fare both commercially and river taxis which a good way to get around as roads are crowded and mad!Unfortunately, like most of Bangkok, river is dirty and full of rubbish.

Cant come to bangkok and not go on the river!. Very cool seeing why Bangkok is called venice of the east.Get on a boat with a tour guide to discuss what your looking at . Water isnt exactly clean but your not swimming nor drinking it so who cares. A lot to see going up and down . Try and go as early as possible like 8 am the latest to avoid lines and crowds.

Very nice to go if you visit Bangkok. At this river I been once and it was very nice I made a trip on this river with a longtail boat. It was great to do and to visit if you want to know more about the culture of the country. Becarefull at the entry of this boat there are many people there to sell you several things much to expensive and on a aggressive way and they are not so nice as they look. They tried to sell me something 10 times higher as the regular pricing in the shop. But to make a trip on this river is great to do. The boat drivers are very nice for you and do everything to make it comfortable during the trip and make a real excitement of it.

Its part of the city so see it. I don't think I'd take a special city river tour, but the water taxis are easy and inexpensive and authentic. Get a feel for the city by seeing the skyline from water level. If possible, take a trip near sunset. Some taxis are free (to a hotel or the Asiatique mall) some have a minimal fee (15-20 baht)

A funny experience.. If you are early on the boat and get a seat, there might be a fun experience to pay attention to the crue. They yell and try to move the passengers to the front of the boat or to the rear. Fun to listen to them with a fun accent. But they was also very friendly and if you need some help they was quite helpful.If you would like to go a little bit faster op the river, then you use the blue flagged boats. Use BTS to Taksim and walk to the boats. Blue flagget boats is 40 bath
a photographers dream. relaxing, meeting the old and the new, this is the third time my husband and i have been on the chao phraya river, we love it, i took lots of photos so i wouldnt forget,

all life is here !. In the UK this river would be classed as akin to the M1 ! Everything going on to fascinate you from massive garbage barges to water taxis to canoes to whole families riding on what looks like a leaky raft ! The long tail boats are everywhere but to enjoy the river you don't need to book a private water taxi as the public boats run regularly and go from one end of the river to the other. The "conductors" on these boats speak a type of English (well enough for you to ask for a particular stop) and provide some amusing entertainment.I liked looking at the water hyacynths and the fish just under our boat.

Not so clean. The river is not so clean. There are a lot of ferry taxis that tour around the river. The tour shows a few buildings on the river banks. Make sure you check out ferry fares before taking a ferry.

The Long Tail Boat Cruise. Not far from the Grand Palace is a major jetty and you can hire a Long Tail Boat to take you through the canals of BangkokThe City was once called the Venice of Asia due to the numerous canals many of which have been filled in.This is a Must Do but remember to negotiate.

A must do . A must thing to do when you are on Bangkok, just take a trip up river, stop for a drink and take a tripDown river and do the same thing. It's a nice way to see the city from the waterside.

Choppy. We used the river many times to travel from place to place, from the night market,the Grand Palace and the odd eating place from time to time.With many boats to choose from i think the only way to travel along the Chao Phraya river, was by long tail boat. Wow what a way to go fast an noisy bloody brilliant .On the down side most of the time the river is a tad choppy, so if you are of the land lubber kind then think again as you might be loosing your breakfast.
You must do it!. Whether you do a dinner cruise which is delightfull, or an exciting trip on the klongs in a long tail boat it's amazing! Stay at Royal IrchidvSheraton & enjoy

Great way to see the skyline of Bangkok. One of the most easiest ways to get on the river is by shuttle boat or boat services. On the boat, you can enjoy the great scenic views and enjoy the fresh breeze of air from the river. The dinner cruise at night enhances the experience more as you can see all the beauty in Bangkok at night.

GOOD WAY TO VISIT THE WORLD OF THE RIVER. Fun time on the river and a good way to mingle with locals and have fun doing it. very scenic, and easy to get to. great way to see the city and good way to get out of the heat, and relax from a full day

Take the local boats. i suggest going in the late afternoon when it starts to cool or near sunset time. You can take a boat up the river for less than $1.00. It takes about an hour if you go to the last stop. It is a beautiful way to see the river and temples on the way. There are different boat lines. You can always end up back at Asiatique for shopping and food. There is also a free shuttle boat to go there.
Take the boat. Great way to see the city.Hint, take the tourist boat a little more money but, worth it. You will have a seat to enjoy the ride. It's all day pass. Good way to cool off.

River taxi on this river. There a lot off forrenger don't know about the river taxi in Bangkok. There a lot of ways to go. Very cheep and beautiful. Take not the tourist taxi the will charge you much. The normal river taxi also more fast to go anywhere in Bangkok. The most of the time I stay Sukhumvit soi 1 to 24. It's a small walk to the river and from there very fast go to Phra to Nam very big markets with cheep goods. Also not far from there Phantip plaza the big Computer bulding and trade world center. From here also easy to take BTS.

Mae Nam. Chao Phrya river is the biggest river in Thailand and in Thai it is called Mae Nam or Mother of all rivers.. There are some very good day and night cruises on the river, during the day one can see the Kings palace and other main attractions along the river. The night cruise is all fun with dinner and dancing. It is worth it taking a cuise.

Local boat line for a different point of view. After a day long of wandering around attractions, it was time to head back to the hotel in Sukhumvit. Chao Phraya river was something I have not seen yet so headed to Tha Tien pier. As many others recommend, board the local orange line for several reasons. Price of 15 Baht is obviously one. Watching how the boat is kind of tied to each pier is another. Boarding and disembarking is an experience as well. Continued to Saphan Taksin to take the skytrain. Two conclusions, first this is a highly recommended ride, and second this one was way too short.

The Roadway of Bangkok. This waterway provides an excellent way of getting around Bangkok - from the many ferries that run frequently to the Hotel boats that run at very regular intervals.A very inexpensive way to get around as you enjoy the many sights as you travel up the river and through the canals.GO FOR IT !!!!!!! you would not be disappointed.
Loved how this is a main road of Bangkok.. It was great fun to take ferries zipping across the river and into the canals. You may take longboats along here.

Take a local boat ride if ok. A boat ride from central pier to the grand palace just cost you 20 baht if you dont mind you may not get a seat. It is the cheapest way to enjoy the river view. It takes about 30 mins and you can see the temple of dawn on the way there.

Great Value. The boat runs up and down the river every half hour, you can get off and on as many times during the day if you buy a ticket for 150 baht or you can buy single tickets. You get some nice views from the boat.

The river experience. Simply jump on a local (orange flag) for a few cents and take in the sights from the river .. quite an experience! .. just go with the flow and the crowd! A pleasant and cheap way to get to the Royal Palace Wat Arun and the flower market.

Fantastic way to see Bangkok. This river is always busy and the best way to see end enjoy it is to just take one of many public ferry's at a cost of 15 Baht and you can go up and down as much as you like. The ideal way is to start at the station called Saphan Taksin and end up at pier 9 where you then can go and visit either the grand Palace or the temple of the reclining Buddha. Both are sites you should visit. Just stunning.

Take a boat trip. Take the Orange flag boat from any river pier. What an experience. It's 15 baht for your one way journey and stops close to main major attractions. We used it to go to China town. Ignore any official looking person who offers advice as they are almost certainly trying to get you onto an overpriced tuk tuk trip. Just use your loaf get a map and sort yourself out

Take the local water taxi rather than the tourist boat. I took the water bus (not sure what they actually call it) from near the Rama V Bridge to the stop where you get the BTS SkyTrain. The river is not very clean, so it's not as charming as it might be. Nevertheless, it's really something worth doing. I recommend taking the local boat rather than the tourist boat. It's 1/10th the price for the same basic trip.

Go by boat for a different view of Bangkok !. We took a taxi to sathorn pier, get the Local' boat to pier 9 - Tha Chang. If you take the tourist boat it costs you 150 baht. Take the local boat (orange flag on top) for 15 baht. Same ride but heaps cheaper! We took the boat to see the great palace and back again!
Good view of Bangkok. From Wat Arun, take a ferry to go around the river. They also have river tours where you can dine in a moving boat.

Do-it yourself river trip on Chao Phraya River. Save yourself some money and hassle - do your own river tour. Go to Saphan Taksin station on overland rail (BTS). Get public ferry for only 15 baht (30 pence). Sit on ferry for as long as you like and take in the stunning scenery. Do it twice - once up river and once down river. Take a map & guidebook so that you know what you are looking at. Talk to your fellow Thai passengers, using the boat to go about their everyday life - work, shopping etc. - they are really friendly! Tip: last boat is around 19:00OR get the FREE ferry, again from Saphan Taksin to ASIATIQUE for tourist market and lots of great restaurants as well as live music - a great night out. Opens at 5pm.Asiatique ferry is to the left and the public ferry is to the right - you can pay on board for public ferry if you get on at a different stop without a ticket office.Asiatique ferry gets very busy, so eat early and leave early or you will have to queue for ages.

Fun boatride. Best enjoyed in the evening, the river is a mean of transport for the locals. We visited Asiatique the Riverfront Mall via the free shuttle boatride.The ferry services end at 8pm, so do plan your trip earlier.

An unforgettable River Cruise. Chao Phraya River flows across the city of Bangkok.We had booked a whole boat for the cruise as we were in a group booking.Nice staff and entertainment.We got to see some of the monuments of Bangkok whilst in the Cruise.Must See...superb atmosphere and excellent experience.

Swallow tail boat tour - a must-do in Bangkok. I always take friends new to Bangkok on a swallow-tail boat tour of the canals (klongs) that are off the Chao Phraya River. This time my wife and I did it again - more than ten years after our first swallow-tail boat ride together and (yikes) almost 30 years after my first! It is the best way to see the Venice of Asia. The most convenient access unless you are staying at a riverfront hotel is reached by getting off the BTS at the river at the Sathorn/Saphan Taksin station. After getting off the BTS walk towards the river where you will find someone selling tickets. Make sure you know how long you will have to wait. The river can be rough and getting on and off can be difficult if your mobility is limited. The boats tend to bounce a lot on the open river, leading to a lot of spray. DON'T open your mouth! Do keep your camera handy for that unforgettable shot of kids swimming in the water, beautiful (and not so beautiful) housing, the Grand Palace, impressive hotels and lots of tourists and many working boats and barges.
Really Nice. You have everything here culture shopping Great food and lovely drinks. From oriental mandarin to viva viva and the bars in Chinatown so much to see and do eat and drink

High speed boat ride on river Chao Phraya. The high speed boat ride on the river Chao Phraya was a surpise ride for us, since we had not planned it. Our plan was to go to tiger park, but we realised that we did not have enough time for that since it was 3-4 hrs drive one way and we had to catch a flight back to India. Then, our guide suggested this ride and we enjoyed this thorroughly. With great buildings belonging to rich people on either side, boat houses, schools, grocery and vegetables sold on the boats and a lot of fish in the river etc , this was a change. We came across a few cart wendors who were selling fish preperations. Infact they were frying the fish then and there. There were some fruit wendors too, which reminded me of our own country. Good experience.

Beauty and Business. Looking out at the river from the Peninsula hotel was a delight - actually going on the river is highly recommended - the hotel set up a great boat-taxi ride, where you can see and buy as you travel!

A glimpse of how it once was. A trip on the river is a must for any visitor to Bangkok. Okay, the water is an awful murky brown colour and sadly in places you see a lot of garbage, with an occasional funky smell thrown in. But the sights and sounds are worth it, in spots you can still see the Bangkok of yesteryear, in others the city skyline especially at sunset is just beautiful.Don't miss it.

The River of Kings. King Rama 1 named it so. It is the lifeblood of the city, and essential in so many ways. Always busy, a bustling noisy waterway that never sleeps.Every time we visit Bangkok we never tire of watching it.

A Refreshing Ride. To get some relief from the humid heat of Bangkok, a taxi or tour type ride down the river is recommended. It is the fastest way to get around the city and most of the interesting sites of the city including the reclining Buddha , the Grand Palace, the Royal hospital, the Royal Boat storage, and old historic and government buildings can be seen. Many of the hotels are also along the water front and have docks. A fun 30 minutes, well worth your money and time.

Long tail boat ride. Just like the James Bond films the boats are great fun. A choppy but fun ride on this river and then in to the surrounding canals where lots of little cabins hug the waters edge and we saw huge lizards on the edge as well. If you do the river ask before you leave about going around the canals it is so worth it.

The river is a river is a river. Took a dinner cruise to see the river - its riverbanks light up at night. Nice views but does get a little chilly. Taking some time to observe Bangkok is quite good for the soul.

Smooth sailing. Nice to go for dinner cruise at Chao Phraya River. Good international buffet spread for dinner. A lot of different people performing and singing. It's fun. Beautiful views of all the palace and temples. I would recommend this cruise.
Chao Phraya River cruise. We booked a 2 hours evening river cruise through the hotel. It was a perfect romantic outing with beautiful views of the city and romantic candle-light dinner.

This is the essence of Bangkok. I love this city & the river. Westerners sometimes turn their noses up at Bangkok because it is 'dirty'. Who are they to judge a civilisation which was thriving when westerners were still living in caves. The river is the essence, the lifeblood of this city & no visit is complete without using the long tail boats which ply the river in both directions. I have been up & down the river for as far as the boats go for literally fifty cents. What an experience. It is not to be missed

a little wet. We were told the best way to do the Grand Palace and Wat Arun were by boat so we bought an all day ticket for the tourist boat. The boat fills up quite quickly for the trip there but at the first Wat at least half disembark. The boats travel at high speed and I must admit I got quite wet especially my bottom as I ended up sat in a puddle. To be honest it all added to the fun!! I soon dried out.The service is easy to use and extremely convenient, the Chao Phraya river is an absolute must do in Bangkok, seeing the skyline from this viewpoint and the history along its banks is unmissable !!
Busy river with scenic view. Took a free ferry shuttle from Saphan Taksin BTS station to Asiatique and thoroughly enjoyed the breeze and the view.The queue gets very long in the evening.
It's a river :). It's not the cleanest river in the world but it's amazing... you can get around Bangkok so fast...and a one way ticket its just 15 bath (£0.3) Fast and refreshing.

A nice respite from the hustle and bustle of the city. We took a ride on a long boat down the river to the main terminal. My son was terrified to get on, as the long boats are quite small and you actually travel very quickly. Once on, he enjoyed the ride, but preferred to do the return trip on one of the bigger tourist boats. A lovely sunset can be seen on the river!

Great as a commute, a tour or a break from the frenzy that is Bangkok.... it does not matter what your purpose is for a visit to the Chao Phraya River, it always takes your mind off everything else for a while. I have been traveling on it for over a decade and it is one of my favourite commutes on the planet. The river taxi service is punctual, good value and safe. Many tourist attractions are easily accessible - try Asiatique if you have not been there - leave your expectations at home and you will be pleasantly surprised by something there. Trips further up or down river are particularly relaxing. It is always best to take the river in preference to taxis, if at all possible.

A GOOD WAY TO VISIT MANY LOCATIONS. When the city gets hot and noisy jump on a boat and enjoy a trip up and down the Chao Phraya river. Don't pay 1,000 baht to some tout at Central Pier, walk past them and choose the large river taxis which will take you up the river stopping at each pier right up to pier 10. For 150 baht you can get an all day ticket and get off and on as many times as you like. Many of the famous attractions like the Royal Palaces, Temple of the Rising Dawn, Flower Market, China Town, are all close to one or other of the piers. There is a English speaking tour guide giving a continuous commentary on attractions and telling you which pier to use to visit each attraction. The rivier is a little chaotic but its a nice way ti spend a few hours particularly with a break for lunch or all day if you want to visit the most populat attractions.

disappointing river. This is Thailand's main river, featured in movies, quite famous. Unfortunately it is a garbage dump...not so much in the central stream, but the tributary canals and waterways are chock full of refuse and very unpleasant odors. They need to clean it up!

excellent view for easy transport. enjoy your view when taking transport to other part of bangkok city, with chao phraya you can easily take a boat to Grand Palace or China Town. suggestions for boat take a yellow flag boat with 20 baht per trip or orange flag with 15 baht. avoid blue one because more expensive with 40 baht. dont worry about how to pay, the lady in boat will collect your money

A great way to see the city. I really enjoyed the chance to see the city from the river and learn about the history of the development of the city. I recommend the one way trip pass which will get you from one end of the river to the other, and give you a sense of the different neighborhoods along the river for a very reasonable price. Then you can decide which places you want to go back to and either do that using the boats to back track to the specific stops or go back to the beginning and buy the all day pass which allows you to hop on and off at the various stops. It is cool and refreshing on the river as compared to the rest of BKK.

Chao Phraya Express. Using the public boat service is simple and easy way to get around Bangkok. The piers are numbered with the conductors on the boats taking payment, issuing tickets and shouting out near by attractions to the piers (15 baht per trip, around 30p UK). The boats fly different colour flags the most useful being orange as this stops at all piers in the central part of Bangkok. The central pier also links directly to the skytrain for easy onward travel. It's quicker than dealing with the Bangkok traffic which can be gridlocked any time of day. As a total bonus you get free views of the wonderful city that is Bangkok. Get out there and explore.

A river of sights. Don't overlook an opportunity to enjoy the sights along the Chao Phraya River. If you arrive or depart by Cruise ship, the river offers quite a few sights not accessible by land travellers, until they come to a ferry crossing or similar.Operators of Long Tail boats zip along the river as their land based rev-head cousins do in any street. Temples and Mosques dot the river bank to catch your eye, while also you note the highway overpasses transporting cars, trucks and busses. All this without having to weave through Bangkok ltraffic

A must do in Bankok. I am still trying to work out how I feel about our river trip, while I understand that most farangs might as well walk around with 'cash cow' on their hats, that's all part of being in Thailand. Here two of us parted with £60 for our own boat for 75 minutes, the driver couldn't get the experience done quickly enough, I guess for his next fare. You do have to do this, forget about what else you can do with THB 3000 in Bangkok and enjoy. As a post script I will tick 'toilet facilities' as there were some at the pier, but not for the squeamish !

Can't miss. the river cruise is a must do!You can see all the bridges and nice buildings on the sides .Well organized cruises are available with or without dinner music n the go, and in evenings you see the lights make this city so vibrant and full with charms.In day light you see is dirty and a fair bit of traffic on it, still is nice to be around.

Sunsets at Santachaiprakhan/Fort Sumen Park are the best!. So much activity on the river with lots of ways to travel...Long tail, tourist boat, river cruise. The CP express boats (orange flags) are a great, inexpensive way to get around and see the city!
So so. Not that great a view. Just an ordinary cruise which you can get for free from pier to asiatique. Again crowded

Great fun!. We loved using the transport on the river with the locals. It was crowded and mad but great fun! Every stop was in a convenient location making it easy to hop off and on and was so cheap to use. Seeing the sights from the river was just great. We used the ferry over from The Grand Palace to The Wat Arun which was so quick and cheap! the river boats run continuously so you never have to wait long.

Great way to see the city. Forget about traffic and use the river - fantastic views - great for people watching on the boat 15b a journey and you can get quickly from Chinatown to Koh San Road to the Grand Temple etc without sitting in traffic - best way to travel

Good way to travel inBangkok. In a city where every taxi and tuk tuk driver has a scam up his sleeve, just waiting for you, this is a great way to get around and cheap. Beware if you get dropped off at a private pier where they will try to sell you a long tail boat tour up and down the river for 1000-1500 Batt. Stick with the public boat taxi. It is an experience too, lots of people, smelly engines and the boats seem to barely stop and go, so be nibble getting on and off. I found this part of the charm but others may not.

The Ferries are very cheap.. The ferries up the River are frequen and cheap (under a $1 Canadian). If you like to walk about you probably won't be on and off more than a couple of times so it's not worth buying the all Day pass or the extra cost for the tourist boat. I wouldn't bother with a long tail boat unless it's something you really want to do. They are just glorified speed boats so go very fast, get you wet and are very loud and noisy.

Good to get around. It is very comfortable to take one of the many boats (tourist boats where one doesn`t understand much from the Thai and English comments or local ferry) to get around to the sightseeings along the river. A pity that the water is dirrty and much waste swimming in it.

River trip. Took a trip on the river down through the canals on our first day in Bangkok. It was a good way to see the old part of Bangkok. We were dropped off by a tuc tuc driver to a boat which we think belonged to his friend.Even though we had the boat to ourselves we paid way too much for the trip but we didn't realise this until we checked out prices later. So beware and do your research first.

Pleasant Cruize. This beautiful river is having a lots of Hotels on both the sides and free ferry service is available to take you to the Asiatique Evening market full of Fun and Frolic. There are dinner Cruises available in the river as well.

Great way to visit many attractions. Highly desirable mode of transport. Reasonably priced at only 15THB to any stop on the river by a public boat. Worth visiting by boat The Grand Palace and Asiatic market.

Lively bustling and fantastic boats. Very nice to stay by the river for a few days and take in the vibrant atmosphere on and around this fascinating river. Sitting in the evening with a glass of wine and watching the world go bye, very relaxing.

Nice place to relax and chill. Travelled by the tradiotnal boat in the villages crossing the temples, the zoos and the local thai people selling stuff on the rover in their boats. gives nice traditional and thai feel on this trip. Surrounded by good give star hotels . The river cruise is also great and river flows with all its might through the city

Breathtaking !. I stayed at the Anantara Resort through a business trip, and we we took a dinner cruise on the Chao Phraya river at night. I would definitely recommend it, it is quite beautiful with stunning views. Very relaxing and contemplative, you see the old and the new seamlessly blended.
Must see and take a boat ride. Easy to combine with visits to Wat Arun and the Royal Palace. Great to take pictures of the colorful surroundings and many typical Thai boats that ride the river.

Chao Phraya: Romantic at Night. I was stayed at Mandarin Oriental, so the transportation was using their boat across Chao Phraya River. During the day, the view was clean with fresh air and lot of boat come and go. The wind was friendly, we can see how busy the boat driver. I went to Asiatique, therefore I got a boat at the night and it was extremely beautiful! The light from every buildings, every hotels were sparkling, glittering, made the water on the river looks like crystal. Definitely a romantic ambiance to have a short picked up using boat. The boat station also connected with skytrain, which made it easier for people to go along too.

A really nice way to get to know Bangkok. Take a tour on the Chao Phraya River and miss the traffic jams. You will have great views, it gives you a good idea how the people really live and what the town used to be like.

Go all the Way. Take the boat to the last stop. It is very scenic, you will see houses on stilts. At the last stop, we caught the next boat that came by and went to the end going in the other direction. It's a very relaxing ride.

Always worth a stroll to the river and for a quick boat ride. The river is still the heart of the city, but so many of the nice hotels are not near the river now. It is worth the time to come down and see how busy it is, or to have a sunset drink at one of the hotels. The dinner cruises are quite nice, as are the various river boat tours. Its best to book in advance and not take your chances on the quality when you arrive

Great way to see Bangkok. This is an excellent way to see Bangkok. A daily tourist pass costs 150 baht and on this pass you can get on and off off the tourist boats at your leisure all day. You can visit places like China Town, Flower Markets, Grand Palace, Wat Po, Wat Arun, etc etc along the way, and with your ticket you will get a map which indicates which pier to get off for which attraction. We always get the boat from the pier by Saphin Taksin BTS. You can also get the river hotel boats from here (which are free to and from the pier to each hotel) - and go for morning tea, afternoon tea or lunch at the different river hotels (e.g. Mandarin Oriental, Shangri-la, Hilton etc.)

Fascinating. A must do in Bangkok.. The river is a very busy place. There is lots of traffic. Rice barges, pleasure craft, longtailed boats and ferries all jostling with each other on this hectic river. Stop for a coffee or have a meal in a restaurant by the river and just enjoy the view. I just love it.

Really great way to see and smell Bangkok!. Quite confusing knowing which boat goes where but managed to use this mode of transport fairly easily and without mishap! Warning it does have a lot of diesel fumes that can make you feel a bit queasy but overall great fun and recommended!

Good way to view the city from another prospective . Went on two tours while spending time here. Just know every type of transportation driver will attempt you to take a tour. You can negotiate prices. Be aware getting into and out of boats is not easy. You have to step down into the boat and getting out you have tall steps to get out while boat is not really secured to dock. The views you see are very interesting. You will get sprayed with water.

Like in Venice, it is the best way to move in town. It is bustling of boats sailing up and down, from very long transportation barges to longtail boats running like hell, but after all it is very practical and cheap to move in town, specially when you connect to the skytrain.

And a river runs through it..... My most pleasurable activity in Bangkok was the boat dinner and ride on the Chao Phraya river; the various important landmarks of Bangkok such as the grand palace and the temples are clearly visible as the boat move along the river, even at night. Thumbs up.

Take the boat whenever you can . What a perfect way to get around Bangkok. All sorts of boats ply the river, going across, up- or downstream. Fast and slow, public or private. Beats sitting in traffic jams inhaling exhaust fumes. Not that the boats run on electricity but the open atmosphere on the river means it's relative fresh compared to the city's canyons called streets.

Pleasant trip. For me it is the most enjoyable way to go to the Grand Palace, Wat pho and Wat Arun. Take the regular boat not the tourist one. Tickets are purchased on board (12 THB). You can reach the pier by BTS Silom line.

The river smells bad. We have done the river cruise at night a few times, were you get on a beautiful boat near the Sheraton hotel .You are given a warm welcome a drink, they take your picture as a gift.The buffet is very good lots of everything shrimp fish meats salads fruit and delicious desserts. After the meal you sit on the upper desk and watch the lights of Bangkok which is really nice, while you watch the lights you have a show which is Thai folklore music and dance.The trip takes about two and half hours,You have your driver who will take you back to your hotel.We enjoyed ourselves and so will you.
Great way to travel. The river is a great way to travel and using the orange boats very cheap. You can also pick up long tail boats for a great experience rounds the clongs ....

easy and quick means of transport. you just need to make yourself with destinations and it is so easy to use. The main advantage is to reach your point quickly. Cabs are not very expensive but you can waste your time in a huge traffic jam .
Chao praya river. Always entertaining a great way to get around Bangkok using tourist boats, loads of good quality restaurants and hotels, can just sit and watch life go by very relaxing

A fact finding trip. The river trip is a fact finding one, showing you some of the houses of the have and have not as they live on the river bank.You also get to meet the river merchants who come to you with their boats to sell you their merchandise.There are nice temples on the way and you finish your trip in the most amazing one Wat Arun.

Boat Tour. I really like to go on the boat rides on this river. the sights are diverse and interesting. If you like a rough ride. But that does not take away from the sights as the operator makes many stops along the way. The boat is a basic wooden one and the seats are very hard. as I say I have ridden on these boats many times and fine them a great way to spend some time on a trip.

Dirty River, dilapidated boats. I was expecting a nice river tour ( like the one we took in Venice) but what I experienced was a very rough one starting from the disgruntled lady ticket porter to the unsafe rickety boats. The views based on brochures are way below expectations. Each station is not manned very well. We are being rushed to go down even if we had a 3-year old kid with us. I wouldn't advise this tour to my friends. Not worth trying.

Cheap outing. Get off at taksin Sky train station and hop on a ferry going down the river. Only about 14 baht and good views along the river side. Get off any where look around and take the next ferry back. I recommend going to Wat Phrao and visit the royal palace or big reclining Buddha. The restaurant at the pier serves good cheap meals. All in all. A good interesting day at little expense.

Worth seeing the city from this vantage point. This is always a fun day for visitors to Thailand. We often take people on the river because you can see parts of the city you would miss otherwise. The river is very busy and there are plenty of photos opportunities. It also feels cooler on a hot day, particularly when you pick up speed. Two options for getting around1. Public transport. People get the boat like they'd get the bus in other countries. It avoids traffic. Its very cheap (under 50 baht). Its a little challenging to navigate but people are friendly and the "boat conductor" can tell you too. 2. Hire a long tail boat. This cost of this depends on what you want and your negotiating skills but expect to pay 1000-2000 baht for a private long tail boat for 1-2 hours. This should include a tour of the khlongs (canal system) and a stop off at a Temple or two. Note: If you do option 2, there are souvenir and drink vendors who will paddle up in small boats to sell to you. A great way to grab some refreshment.

Everything including the kitchen sink!. A wonderful place, extremely busy, but somewhere you can find anything your looking for and something your not expecting! Prices are very reasonable, but you are expected to barter! You need comfortable shoes, and plenty of energy! Not happy with the pet section, I really feel sorry for the many dogs who are in cages and the terrible heat. I now avoid that section whenever we visit. Certainly on my list of things to do in Bangkok.

Taxi river, you have to try. Taking taxi river you get nice cool breeze from river and scenery of temples and old buildings, avoid traffic jam and you can connect to skytrain at Sapantasin station better try it.

You Must do this at least once when staying in Bangkok. I have done a number of cruises along the Chao Phraya River and I recommend that when staying in Bangkok, do the river cruise HOWEVER there are some considerations that need to be made. Tourist prices re those upmarket river/dinner cruises can be expensive but do it just once for the experience. Also longboat rides thorough a tourist agency at the hotel can also be expensive. I normally go to the river bank and where the longboats are moored and ask one of the driver's, how much to go 1 hr along the river. You can bargain with them to take you a few kilometres up the river. DO the longboat as it is a great experience, in a narrow wooden boat with an eight cylinder engine powering you effortlessly and very fast, through the water. Just be careful NOT to get any of the water splashing up your nose as the river is dirty, brown, smells and has, who knows what, bacteria in it. But It is a great way to get to see the locals living along the bank. The driver will take you to a floating market, where you might be lucky to find many boats or a couple, if you are not so lucky, with women wearing a sort of traditional dress and wide brim hats, selling all kinds from food to drink to local produce. Buy the driver some food or drink and he will be very grateful. It is also expected that you will buy something from the market anyway. Because I bought the driver a drink, he let me run the boat for a kilometre or so, before I became really tired trying to keep the boat and the long pole which acts as the rudder in a straight line against the current of the river. The drivers make it seem so easy to manage, IT ISNT, but great fun nevertheless. Go on give it a go!

river. atch the chao phraya express tp almost anywhere and have a good days outing. quick.easy and an adventure anydayboat trip for a songis not expensive and gets you of the congested streetsworth it
Good way to get around. Take a ferry up and down the river as a cheap way to see the sights and visit many of bkk must see attractions. Easy to use and cheap. Fell like a local

Lots of traffic, best for a night cruise.. There is an awful lot of traffic on this river, boats of every description, including ferry boats for the tourists. I recommend you take a night cruise. They have boats to take you to the palace, Wat Arun across the river, etc. The fares are reasonable, just three bhat to cross the river (one-way).

Bangkok's Lifeline.. Considering its strategic location right in the middle of a huge bustling city, it is, in my opinion, the lifeline of Bangkok.Just consider its contribution to the city's economy right from the hotels located on it to the ferry operators who take you around to the fishermen who fish for their livelihood.
