River of Life!. Lots of 5 star hotels lines this river and Temples as well. Try the Supatra River House, authentic Thai food and great ambience. Do book a dinner cruise with the Banyan Tree Bangkok, food are cooked fresh onboard. Take river taxis for a refreshing change. Visit some of the restaurants in the hotels.
A must for first time travellers. Feel the spray from a longboat and enjoy the mix of traditional and contemporary scenery along the river. Better at night with the added attraction of lights.

Speed boat. Yes the ferry is cheap, but to really experience Bangkok, jump on a longtail speedboat and head down to the island markets.. Nice run, negotiate the price before you leave.. The ferry is very agricultural but the long tails are the way to travel Chao Praya

Efficient Water taxi. Quite a few upscale hotels along the river. The main attraction is Wat Arun which is on the west side. For a nominal fee , the ferry service shuttles you along the banks of the river.

Raison d'être of Bangkok. The river passes landmarks of Bagnkok such as Wat Arun and the Grand Palace and the Emerald Buddha Temple. This is a public transport that cost under 20 Bht. The city view from the river is impressive. You will cruise underneath beautiful designed suspended bridges, behind China town You can also take the river route to Lad Mayom floating market. You can also take the orange flagged boat to Koh Kret by taking off after Nonthaburi pier (sorry I can't remember the pier's name). It's best to visit Koh Kret from Mon-Fri when the public boat operates, on weekend you have to connect with buses.

Absolutely worth it. Me, my GF and friend couple booked a longtail boat, and had a hour long trip on the river. Its absolutely worth it. Its so relaxing, far away from all the chaos in the streets. No one shouting after you, just sit back and enjoy the ride. Id say its a must in Bangkok. You also get to see how many of the people acutally live by the river, very facinating. Recommended!!!
Great public transport.. The river boats are cheap and will take you wherever you want to go on the river. The staff are used to tourists so they don't mind when you make mistakes or need help.
Chao Praya River. This River is the biggest river of Bangkok! It looks absolutelly different in day time and in evening! Specially in evening the view of the river is great!!!
This is a must. A day trip to the former capital of Thailand eas really enjoyable. The tip was well organized and vehicle was in good condition .

Long Boat Ride. The long boat ride was the finale to our half day tour with East Meets West tours. The tour along the back waterways gives an insight to Bangkok. spotted a water lizard and were fascinated by the cat fish feeding by the temple.
We were therbin the pouring rain but still had a grat time

Floating market tour. A MUST DO!! Fantastic, so many boats, people, shopping, food and FUN. How they keep this bedlam of boats and people moving is incredible, but they do and it works. Shopping is great along the river, you get good buys of everything, and the food off the little boats was great. Try the deep fried crumbed banana slices, so yummy I'm going to make at home now.

River travel. This is more a fun way to get about, rather than an attraction. Lots of options but the cheapest is to use 'public transport'. We turned up at the only Skytrain terminal that is actually on the river bank (forget name but obvious on a map) where a helpful tourist office explained all we needed to know. We waited on the dock for about 15 mins until a long thin ferry boat sporting a bright orange flag on the stern pulled up. Standing room only at first but for 15 baht - paid on board -each it was a cool breezy ride to Grand Palace (stop 9). Great views that wouldn't otherwise be seen. Another day we were at Pier 5 and were treated to the feeding of hundreds of large catfish in the river - an amusing bonus that indicates the river is nowhere near as dirty as it seems.

The best way to get around Bangkok, but beware!. When we decided to stay on the river, we did some research and discovered that water taxis were the preferred way to get around. So we spent a fair amount of time on the water. It is much preferable to sitting in a hot taxi in traffic on the ground, but there are some tricky parts. There are no set fees, so when the guard at the dock quotes you a price, he's probably taking a cut, because you might go a block/dock down and get a taxi for 1/2 the price. And if a taxi is waiting at the dock (for example, at a wat), no other taxi will come near and offer you a better fare. There are "tour boats" that you can ride for much, much less, and the local boat/bus is even cheaper but very crowded and you will have to wait for it, and then stand. Just ask around until you understand what your options are.Also, keep your hands out of the water and be mindful of the splash as this is definitely NOT safe to drink!

The smart way to travel. This is the smart way to travel up and down bangkok. Its easy, quick, fun and cheap. The one downside is that as far as i could woirk out the river taxis stopped about 7 to 7.30pm. Its can be very crowded on the boats and its not easy sometimes to get on and off the boat; but its an experience definately worth doing and you dont have to put up with all that traffic in bangkok.

DONT FORGET YOU CAMERA. What fun we have had on this river you are able to see so much from a boat trip,you can book a trip which includes a meal its well worth the money,i would advise a boat trip by day and night as the sights are so different.Dont miss out by missing out on one of the best sights in Bangkok

So much to see .. jump on a ferrry or longtail and go!. The Chao Phraya River is a must see in Bangkok. In many ways it is just a river but it is the life along the river bank that catches my imagination. My recent trip included a longtail boat hire from Nonthaburi Pier that took us through the long canals. This is very easy to do from Nonthaburi as you'll probably be approached by the boat organiser. He will gladly take your money, about 1000 baht for 5 people and send you aboard the longtail. The trip includes a 2-3 hour meander through the long canal and eventually returns to the Chao Phraya River. A stop along the way seems usual however as our boat driver didn't speak English I couldn't say where we actually stopped. The second option for enjoying the river sights is the commuter ferries. Get your ticket and jump on quick for a ride down or up the river. The ferries are usually packed with locals. Just watch out for the ferry captain who nods off to sleep as he crosses the river. It happened.

Big River. This has to be one of the busiest rivers that I have ever been on that is in the middle of a city. Makes the Thames look like a quiet backwater. There are no end of boats tootling up and down all day and night. The best way to get to some of the sights was by river, beware though as some of the long boat drivers will try to rip you off with expensive trips. Stick to the river shuttles, cheap and reliable.Look out for the big catfish jumping.

Loved the river!. We travelled up and down the river on the comuter boats with no problems. Each journey cost 15 baht. The across the river ferry was only 3 baht. Avoid tourist boat which is 150 baht for much the same journeys.We also did a sunset river dinner cruise which was just amazing. Wat Arun looks wonderful lit up at night. The river looks amazing in the dark. I would highly recommend a dinner cruise especially for a special occasion.

very terible experience. i went there with my wife for fun and enjoyment bt i find it very cheap as there is noting in organised way and they are just piping money from tourists as nothing is special about it.

The heart of Bangkok traditional market life.... The pace has changed but you can still grab a frame of the slower pace of life experienced on Bangkok's river life - the markets, the people - simply wonderful...

River taxi a must do experience. Taking this fast river taxis is a must when you are visiting Bangkok. It's a fast cheap method of transportation.The boats have ther own flag to show how much stop they do colors are Orange, Blue , Yellow. see at piers what stops these boats make.Funny is the guys doing signaling by flute tones to the captain, it look easy but is you over have been on a ship you must know it difficult to move a ship so quickly to a pier. It's a good way of transport and as explained a must do experience.

Take the local public boat, avoid pricey gondolas.. The best way to experience this polluted urban river is by finding a local pier and ride the public boat. It is like a bus on the river. Get to see that side of Bangkok for less than a dollar I think. Be careful because the pier and the boats are not the safest places to be.

WOW...a romantic night on the river.. Take the dinner cruise with magnificient International buffet spread and sip MaiTai's with your loved one on a balmy night. Passby riverside hotels and myriad lights on shore. 2hr cruise could be longer as it passes quickly.....

Experience worthwhile.. It's one of most enjoyable activities during my many trips to Bkk, to just sit and relax on a boat and sail along the Chaopraya river. Taking in all the scents and sights.  Take a sky train to the Taksin bridge ( not if you are staying in one of the many five star hotels there) and hire one of those long tail boats ( about 800 baht for an hour trip, depends on how skilled you are at negotiating), note that there're two kinds of boats you could hire, the loud and fast long tail ones or slower and quieter ones, I assumed. Personally I liked the quiet one since you still can comunicate.  Along the boat ride they will stop for you to either get off for snake show ( with small fee of course), souvenir shops or what have you. Don't get mad, it's part of the bkk charm i guess, simply smile and decline. You could be mad and rude to them assuming you are a good swimmer, I kidded obviously.  Alternatively you could board passenger boats with very tiny fare, and just mingle with the locals. Cheap and very effective way to learn and see something new.
it's a romantic. i have been there with my bf and very nice place and good food as well.take by shuttle boat choaphraya river.

con men selling trips. Watch out for people posing as official tourist guides offering boat trips on the river taking you to markets and temples. They take you to low quality tourist attractions where admission prices are rediculous and the shows very poor.
busy!. always a treat to take a boat on the river, either complimentary from the hotel or a long boat, as well as to watch the activity of all the barges commuting up and down

Excellent and... terrible experience. Good transportation, less expensive than others, frequent stops everywhere. Use it!
But it also was a terrible experience, a good intro for a trip to India and the river Ganges. Very dirty, bad smelling, the riverside so called "houses" show us the real meaning of being poor.

Make sure you get a ferry boat somewhere at some point. If you're travelling somewhere near to the river, the Orange Flag ferry boats are likely to be the easiest, cheapest, and most pleasant way to get around. The ferry piers are marked on most tourist maps, and it's a great way to get away from the smoggy roads. Keep a look out for the boats with orange flags - they arrive at most piers every 20 minutes or so, and it costs THB 14, no matter how far up the river you go. Great for getting between Khao San and Wat Po, as just one example.
Take a long boat around the canals. An exciting experience with the chance to see the variety of life in Bangkok, from the high towers of luxury hotels to the stilt houses of the canals
you cant go to bangkok without a trip on the river. I love the river life, i love traveling on the public boats. I love the hussle & bussle & all the noise, makes me feel alive everytime.

Life Line to Thais. The River is so beautiful,from the area where major hotels are to distant towns.A must to see either on tour or on water taxi.The houses further out of main district are incredible to see.Many different structures,some very run down others not so,but all have a beauty about them.It seems to be the soul of the city.
River transport. Bought a day ticket 150 baht for hop on, hop off travel along the river. A lot of noise, overcrowding but not too far to swim to shore if the boat sinks!
Just a river. It is just a river..you can travel along the river using a boat to many different places..not very clean, but it still ok..

Good way to see the sights. It is very easy to connect with the Chao Phraya Tour Boat at the Saphan Taksin BTS station. For 150 baht, you get a hop on/off pass and booklet describing sites for 8 piers along the river. I road the tour to the end and double backed before getting off to see Wat Pho.

FIVE STAR CRUISE IN CHAO PHRAYA RIVER. We were picked up from our hotel and were taken to River City. Boarded the boat at 8 pm. This was brilliant. The boat was lovely, and we didn't expect such good live music. The whole event was very romantic. The food could have been better, but the staff more than compensated. Unfortunately, it started to rain after half an hour, but the staff was brilliant in moving everyone down under cover, and when it stopped raining we ventured upstairs where they resumed music and the staff had us all up dancing and clapping. Black Label added to our glory. We danced to the tune too. The singer was very lively and played hindi/panjabi songs. On both sides of the Chao Phraya River, a tourist can see many magnificent temples and architectural buildings including the First Presbyterian Church, the Royal Thai Navy Dockyard, the Thai Maritime Navigation Company, the Old Customs House, Wat Prayunwong, Wat Arun, the Grand Palace, Wat Rakhang Kositaram, and the Royal Boat House. At night we were dropped back to hotel. For four of us 1300 Bhatt was charged by the tour guide. Valu for money.
Great way to explore the city!. I love to explore Bangkok by boat. You can visit Wat Arun, Wat Pho, Grand Palace, etc. Remember to wear scarf and hat.
clean river. Wow, a clean river in the heart of Bangkok. I use boat many times to visit tourism objects and this one is one of my favorite in Bangkok :)

Floating Markets are a Must See. We had a ball at the Floating Market. We took a taxi for a two hour tour. This was a relaxing and cultural experience for us. Observing the temples and market place and learning how people live and work was the highlight of this trip. If you want great pictures and lasting memories this is a tour for you.

Get the daily pass. Well worth it to spend a whole day on the river. We did the whole route and saw lots of things the usual tourist misses. There are lots of stops and lots to see at many of them. Take your camera!
Great way to get around, a bit dirty. Take the water taxi for less than a buck. Great, entertaining way to get around and see the sights

nice cruising. Well, it felt great cruising this river while seeing the amazing Bangkok.I like it that people don't have to wait for a long time just to get into the next boat.It's very convenient that we can choose between purchasing a ticket at the pier or paying right at the boat while it is moving.We used the river boat a number of times in our 2 days in Bangkok.

Fast way to travel and see the city. There are several piers where you can take a river bus and visit Bangkok sights. The cheapest is just 15 Bahts and the other is 40 Bahts. Also private long tail boats can be hired and you may plan your own voyage on the river and see those exciting canals with local boat markets. Night time is a great time to go for a dinner cruise to one of the cruisers. Or then go to the river side luxury hotels, which always have their restaurants facing to the river. To go to Lebua state tower 68th floor cocktail bar to see the river passing through the enormous city.

the slow and quiete part of bangkok. we first explored bangkok by boat and it was a quiet and slow way to learn about the city. we made a trip through the klongs, where the people live at and with the water.

nice views !. you can either hire a regular boat or also book a fancy cruise trip with dinner experience....The cruise can get a bit crowded and the food is avg, there is some entertainment (band singing) on the cruise as well, this is a couple of hours ride... the best part is the sight of the city from during the evening with temples/buildings lit up .... the usual tourist traps are pictures and suveniers at steep prices.............
Buffet on budget?. There were very little choices on the buffet. The performers weren't very lively. The food tasted average.

Start at Central Pier!. No matter what anyone tells you, start at Central Pier and tell them you want the Visitor/Tourist boat. This boat will make designated stops, and you can hop on and off all day for one price. In addition, the guides know a whopping amount about the city and will give you great info. They will also tell you what sites are located at each pier stop. It makes a fantastic orientation to the city. I came once before for just 24 hours, and this was the first thing I went on -- glad I did.

Dirty - but got to do it!. Take a private long boat and cruise up to the temples and throu water front properties - not as westerners know water fron properties. You will be bombarded from floating souvenier vendors, just tell the driver NO firm enough and he wont stop at each one! Makes you realise how poor some people are :( Definately worth doing once!

Fun cultural experience if you avoid tourist boats. Don't pay expensive tourist boat prices! Take the regular and frequent river taxi up and down the river for less than a $1USD. You can disembark at any river stop, explore and hop on again.
cheap but nice. very pretty trip over the river you can atract many nice place near river

The Rice Barge. Take the Rice Barge Trip ,it is great and if you have time jump on the ordinary Boat and go as far as you can go and then turn around and go as far as you can in the other direction, it is great.
go there at night.... and enjoy the views. Take a boat ride, it will be worth it.

Easy way to see Bangkok. Get the Skytrain to Thaksin then the orange boat up as far as it will go to get a feel for river life in Bangkok.Easy to stop off near Khao San for a beer on the way back - or anywhere else that takes your fancy. Very Cheap.I do this every second time I visit Bangkok.

Many choices for all taste !!!!. You will actually find many different concepts for a dinner on the river. From the big disco dancing party dinner up to the very romantic luxurious one !!!The problem to find the concept you will enjoy... this is why you may see different reviews and markings. The river is always the same whatever the dinner you choose, it is impossible to dislike such typical place which makes Bangkok such a contrasted city. As a couple, we would like to recommend the Bayan Tree Boat restaurant Apsara... it is the finest romantic place for a dinner along the river. Only 24 guest will have the chance to live a special evening with this atmosphere where you feel that everything on the boat has been organized just for you !!! The food is very good (however not the best Thai food we founding BKK, see my review on Samsen Villa). There is a price to pay for this event but compared to some other touristic places witch are purely tourist attractions (i.e. Sirocco restaurant at the Dome which is actually, except the amazing view, very basic Italian food) this one worth the money !!!Frank

Dinner Cruise- Loy Nava. Had a wonderful time being looked after well by staff and the food was of excellent quality. Host was an Engliish man who not only gave detailed disriptions of the scenic features but also advise on the food types and degree of spicyness. Only problem was we were picked up later than told and did not get to see the river scenes in daylight as told. Totally reccomend this tour on a lovely old traditional Teak Barg.

Cheap and efficient way to get around in Bangkok. This is a very quick way to get to places around Bangkok. Especially good for Grand palace, Temple of the sleeping Buddha as well as Wat Aarun across the river. The four lines are clearly marked and based on where you need to go, you can pick the fastest ones. And yes, do not pay the silly all day pass thing or the "tourist" boat prices.
River Cruise. Its ok, but river smells and is very dirty, but you do get a great view of Bangkok.

Shows you parts of Bangkok you wouldn`t otherwise see.. The boat service is really good and you can get around very cheaply. At the same time you get to see many of the sights of the city with easy access to Grand Palace etc. I use it regularily to get where I want to go for 15 baht each way and a taxi would be many times that. The river and the traffic on it is amazing to see as are all the buildings like Wat Arun as you pass by.
chao phraya river. you could buy a day pass for about $3 Aus. Could get off and on as often as you wish. Boat pretty crowded but full of locals. Great way to see the city.
The Heart of the City. Catch the river taxi or just watch the city flow past you on the active river of commerce.

Best tip: take a Chao Phraya Express Boat. Contrary to the title the express boat (mainly used for tourist stops in and around Bangkok), there are other lines that are interesting as well. For instance the orange line goes for a small amount of Baths from one side of Bangkok to the other along the river. Stops a a lot of the piers and gives you all kind of opportunities to relax, see Bangkok from the waterfront and take a lot of pictures.

No traffic for this route.... I must say Chao Praya is the best route ever. We stayed at The Peninsula and we always use the Chao praya River everywhere, comparing the transportation on the street, it is much better on the river. I mean, the traffic in bangkok is just so frustrated, luckily they have chao praya river.

#1 respite from the heat of the city. Board at Saphan Taksin for a 75 minute trip to Nonthaburi (the last stop) around 3 PM. Walk around Nonthaburi and be reminded of what Bangkok was like 30 years ago. Try some food from the open market vendors. Sit on the shaded side of the boat (both ways) Return during rush hour. Don't worry about getting a seat since you will be boarding at the first stop. Runs until 7 PM. If this trip doesn't relax and refresh you see a doctor when you return home.
Boat Trip. We did a private boat trip. Need to bargain or will be ripped off. The smaller the boat the more fun. Pick one with a big engine and go fast. Amazing!

Cruise at Chao Phraya River. It bueatiful view when we ride the cruise at night as at the band of the river both side is lightning together with the building.It take at least 1 hr plus for us in the cruise to see all the panorama of the Bangkok city and Chao Phraya river. Fare is also quit expensive around 75 Bath included dinner.It interesting for the couple that just got marry for them to honeymoon
Get about Bangkok by river taxi. The river taxis are easy to use, cheap & a great way to reach the old city where you'll find the Grand Palace, Wat Po & Chinatown

MOST INTERESTING AND COLORFUL RIVER.. Life on this river is very interesting and colourful, I saw very
interesting foods in the boats in this river.

Respite from the chaos. If you have a little time but not much to do, then get on a Chao Phraya Express Boat for a cruise - all for Baht 15. Start at the Central Pier (Sathorn/Taksin) and head up north along the river for the sights (Grand Palace, Wat Pho etc) or just for a cruise to nowhere in particular. Best way to get away from the chaos and madness of downtown and the stifling heat.

"The Rice Barge" as they call it. The very first day we went on the rice barge river cruise which is where they take you on those thai boats around the river area and at last take you to an awaiting boat filled with fruits! You get to have juicy un-heard of fruits while Bangkok's finest breeze hitting you..

An inexpensive way to see the real Bangkok. Jumping on a ferry and meandering up and down the Chao Phraya River is an absolute delight. You will see both building s of every shape and size from magnificent temples, older style houses, modern skyscrapers, tiny shantys almost falling in to the river, and everything in between and for very little money. You can take the tourist ferry for a few dollars more with a commentary if you like or you could even jump on a Long tail boat for a quicker but slightly more expensive tour. either way, you are going to enjoy the experience.

Bangkok Life. Our trip along the river and through some of the waterways and canals was one of the highlights of our Bangkok experience. And we loved watching Bangkok life on the river from our hotel as well, day and night.

a 'never to forget memorable experience'. Everything was just 'perfect'. beyond expectation. had a memorable experience. from the pick up..driving through the roads of bangkok.. driving up the complex for a parking and then the welcome clicks.. and finally the cruise. sailing on the Chao Phraya River, will all the beautiful songs, music and dance.. till you let the cool breeze on your face and stand at the top of the cruise after the dinner... 'unparallel is the word'
interesting.... not a clean river, like u expectbut it's fun to go n see many new things from different side ( i mean from inside the boat )

Chao Phraya at Night. Dinner cruise at Chao Phraya gives a different feeling with crossing Chao Phrya under daylight.The food is buffet style and it tastes good. They just give us free refill mineral water and one glass of juice, if you want another drinks you can buy from the menu list.If you prefer elegant dinner, choose below deck, which is a room with glass wall so you can still enjoy night view of Chao Phraya, they give us live music mostly romantic-love song and air-conditioned room.Upper deck which is open air more lively, you can dance and sing together with the singer, they sings up-beat music here.The cruise takes us to see Wat Arun at night with the light around it. You also can see 'shining' Grand Palace from here..Okay,that's enough.. if you want to know more, just try it! ^.-Ohya.. There is a girl wearing Thai traditional clothes who will ask you to take a picture with them. They will sell the photo result inside the cruise.. You dont have to buy it..

Where Bangkok opens its heart. For most of Thailand's history, this river has been more important than the villages, then towns and now megalopolis it runs through. You can see more history on the banks of the river--and see it cheaper--than any other way. Take the Chaophraya Express boat with the crowds of Thai commuters, and get off wherever things look interesting: the old St. Theresa church at Kuti Jeen, where there have been Thai-Portuguese families living since the capital was in Ayutthaya; the atmospheric Old Customs House; the Temple of the Dawn; Rajawongse pier; or go right to the end of the line in Nonthaburi, and then cross the river for a delicious Thai meal in the open air at Taksura restaurant. A lot of the most interesting places require a few minutes' walk, and all of them are more fun to see if you've read up a bit on Thai history. But if you just sit on the boat watching the sights slide past, you'll have a wonderful time, too. For about B17 the whole trip, if memory serves; an absolutely unbeatable value.

Greatest "tour" of Bangkok. This is a great trip to see a lot of Bangkok and the area. It is not on most tours because it is only 15baht and there is no scam involved. Forget the tourist boat, overpriced. This boat goes up the river to Nonthaburi which is a local big city. I have been on this boat over 50 times and still not tired of the sights, sounds etc. I have taken over twenty people on this "tour" and 100% enjoyed the ride. When you get to Nonthaburi there is a local market that is... "local" very Thai. Very enjoyable boat ride!!! Commute time is very crowded which is fun as well. The monks stand along the side of the boat and most boats have a sign designating this area. If no monks, you are welcome to stand here. If monks get on board, be respective and give them the space. Have a great ride
Away from the city - respite. We took the traditional long boat ride on the Chao Phraya river. It allowed us to see a more traditional way of life. We enjoyed the respite from the city

Must take the Express Boat.... We usually take the Express Boat from Saphan Taksin to any & all attractions near the river! It is very inexpensive, easy to use & gives you a real taste of Bangkok. Stand at the rail & have your camera ready. You can take the boat to The Grand Palace, many Wats & within walking distance of Khao San Road. A great experience! (last there Jan 2011)

Great sighs and easy way to get to temples. We got the sky train down to the pier and got the regular ferry with the locals, there really isn't any need to go on a specialist cruise and waste money, we paid around 20p and really enjoyed it.It's a hop on and off boat and there is also narration and they let you know what stop to get off for each attraction.

Kinda nice. The boats will be usually crowded and the frequency is not something you can compare with BTS or MRT. But its cheap, convenient to reach the grand place and others around it for Visitors. My friend said the ride in the late evening is good (When its gets dark)

Not quite what you expect. The boat ride is a surprise. The one we took was disappointing in some ways – we did see some parts of "old" Bangkok, but they ride through the canal was mostly a visit to slums on stilts.

Amazing river of life.. You really haven't felt the real Bangkok until you load into a longtail boat on the river,so much is going on,well worth going as far as you can up river on the scheduled boats and turning around and coming back.Some amazing hotels and buildings along the river bank and occasional glimpses of "old Siam" with old warves derelect now and obviously to be pulled down to make way for new accomodation.afew old teak houses can still be seen along with chinese temples in glowing colours.Don't miss the ride.

A great way to see parts of Bangkok. We loved this area. We took an orange boat up and down here for 20 baht pp each way and it was a great way to see parts of the city. It is also refreshing as there is a bit of a breeze when you are travelling along. We didn't do a dinner cruise - only the cheap local boat but it was great. My 15 year old son really enjoyed this trip as well. Do make sure you find a way to cruise part of the river when you are here.

very nice river. travel by the river is the other choice to escape Bangkok traffic and this river is just great with big wave and very clean. we dont have use expensive tour boat or another tourist trap boat, just take regular boat called chao phya express like many local do. its very cheap and you can go even from asiatique to Khao san road for only 20 minute ride :)
River of Life. It seems everything happens on this river... very efficient way of traveling in Bangkok.
Long boat. Hire a long boat from Oriental pier. Great fun and great views
Nice. take the boat from Saphan Thaksin up to the grand palace.

What an excellent way to travel. There are many ways to get around the river and it is a popular route for many of the tourist attractions.One way is to go by the tourist ferry for 150 Thai bhats, which is an all day ticket allowing you to hop on and off as many times as you want to. There is a brief commentary about what is at various points along the river and which stops you would need to access them.A cheaper way of getting around is the water bus which was 15 Thai bhats per journey. All the boats are identified by different colour flags and these correspond mostly to the different piers/stops where you can hop on and off. It's a bit confusing to begin with but you soon get the hang of it and it is a wonderful way to mix with the locals and see a different way of life.

Spend a little time up a not so lazy river. Bangkok will be hot and humid and there will not be air conditioning everywhere, but the river offers a good breeze. It also makes for great shot of temples. Take a ferry, or better yet a long-tail (rat-tail) boat ride. Be a part of someone else's pictures!

what a river. i am visiting thailand since last 20 years,but never fell out of love from this river. i think bangkok will not have been the great city as on today with out this river. take it out and bangkok will lose half of its charm. it the life line of bangkok.the boat rides are simply fantastic. it is the cheapest and best mode of transport in bangkok.

A bustling waterway!. Try to use the river to move around the city. The tourist ferries are very reliable and cheap. You can buy a day tickets, costing about 150 baht, about £3, which will allow you to access local and tourist ferries and visit all the sights.

Get a cool breeze.... Sweating in Bangkok? Can't bear the heat anymore? Take a boat ride on the Chao Phraya River and enjoy the cool breeze. It is a good way to actually visit a number of Bangkok's attractions like What Phra Kaeo, Wat Pho and Wat Arun. It is also an opportunity to see the divide between reach and poor. Skyscrapers and seriously epsensive hotels next to dilapidated wooden houses on poles...Careful, don't fall for the scams when taking a boat. Use the official government run Chao Phray River Express boat which takes you everywhere for 15 THB while private operators will charge you 200 THB+++

Get on the River. My travel companions and I took one of the tourist boats so we could hop on and off at tourist sights all day long. It was great simply to travel on the river and see the city from that point of view.

Interesting. The river cruises can be interesting ,but we really cant call this the Venice of the east.The public ferries are very reasonable and the best bet to cross or sail on this river.Taking a private boat ride especially one suggested by your tuk tuk driver is a definite no no and a total ripoff

A must do!. Crusing the chao Pharaya river is a must do! you can either take a dinner cruise or just take the boats that run every 20 min taken by the locals. Do not take the Chao Pharaya tourist boat -it is a ripp off.

Good 1 hour trip by boat. If you want to see the river and floating market. Hire a boat and it's good 1 hour trip in main river and canal. You will enjoy good breeze , nice view . All this you can enjoy sipping beer in the boat :) . So don't miss same . Certianly morning / evening would be best time to take the ride.

romantic cruise. the river is very near the royal grand palace. and its banks are studded with splendid wats like wat arun to name afew. the cruise embraces history and architecture with romance and luxury. the cruise is wonderful in the evening. glittering temples reflecting in the river an experience one will never forget!!
Get the public boat. A good way to spend a few hours, hopping on and off the boat at various spots on the river.

You must experienced that!. I had the opportunity to use it several times, and this make your stay more enjoyable but from a different point of view. You will see the poor and the rich living together in an harmony. See the different transportation of goods, taxis and other. But you will also see trash and fishes together! This is the sad part ( not a lot)
we stayed in apartment with river. beautiful view. fun crossing river by ferry boat..children loved it..
Use the ferry. Use the ferry about 15 Bhat one way (40 mins) brilliant way of seeing Bangkok

Very nice to be on the river.. It is exciting to travel to the Grand Palace or anywhere using the tourist boats on the river and not expensive. You will be happy that you took a boat to see all the river side views with a cool breeze on the river. Sit near the back for a smooth ride. Take the skytrain to the tourist boat departure point, much cheaper than a taxi i believe.
nice views. ask your travel agent to give you a suitable ship....and then it will be a beautigul experience

Different point of view the city. It was not a beautiful water and sights during go through a bayou. You will see a back of many temples and how people live by river. Some point you can feed fish (cat fish) for good luck. Water is not clean but you will see many cat fish swimming. It was interesting to see this city from different angle.

love the boat ride. the boat ride was a really good eye opening to see how people live by the river. Though signage to get on the boat pier is not that easy... non existing just have to ask the local, they are more than happy to help.

Ferry to the Grand Palace.. We wanted to go to the Grand palace but didn't fancy the organised trips by coach through the city so decided on taking the ferry, so glad we did. really enjoyed the cooling breeze on the river. The river is very busy and there are lots of things to see as you make your way along the river.

Lovely history of Bangkok along the river. Whether you are on a boat going up and down the river or in a hotel looking over the river you can see the beautiful bridges that arch the river and the wonderful old temples that are along the river.
Most major cities have a great river (London, Paris, Cairo, etc.) and Bangkok should be proud of this natural gem.

Relaxing and the cool breeze are nice.. Taking a boat trip over the Chao Phraya is a nice way to see the Bangkok skyline and with the cool breeze around you, a perfect way to avoid the heat in the center of Bangkok. Take a longtail boat or just the ferry line to take you from Khao San road to downtown BKK.

A quick and simple way to get around Bangkok. The ferries arrive regularly and its a quick and cheap way to get from place to place - beware of the tuc-tuc drivers who take you to places they want you to go!
must in Bangkok. had a great time on cruise. food quality was good, music was good too. drinks though are expensive on board.
Cool travel. great way to feel the breeze, see the city from the river and travel to the stop (13) that will get you in walking distance of the buzzing and farang-packed Ko San Road

The experience was beyond horrible. Took the dinner cruise (Chao Phraya River dinner cruise) also the day trip cruising the river. For me it was not worth. The dinner experienced was beyond horrible. Food sucks.. Pay 1500Baht to received crap service.. Damn.. So my suggestion, dont ever, EVER get into the cruise...
Dirty river. The city view from the river is nice specially the temples but water is dirty and smells bad. River cruse or visiting floating market could not be a healthy choice.
A must during your stay. After arrival in Bangkok, go and catch a boat and enjoy.
The River Highway. The best way to visit so many of the top tourist spots and a wonderful dining experience at night

River cruise a must. One must go to the river in evening and take the river cruise dinner .
Its great feeling with full 8 course meal and crooner singing you top songs to make you dance for 2 hours all the way.

my favourite place. I love to travel up the Chao Phraya, by taxi boat, by longtail boat, by river cruise. This is the place to see a real part of Thai life. There is a lovely resteraunt between the River City Complex and Royal Orchid Sheraton, mmm. Take a trip up the klongs by longtail boat too, we saw a komodo
Dinner Cruise. Had taken a Dinner Cruise was an amazing experience.
Stroll on the river. relax and learn more about Bangkok and his habitants
Great cruises. Have done a number of cruises on the river, both afternoon and evening, all great.
Take a personal riverboat trip. Takes you down the back canals away from the luxury hotels & you see a completely different Bangkok
Majestic. Best to start a Bangkok experience by the river, it's lively, fun, interesting. Actually I would also stay in an hotel or vacation rental by the river, the air is better and the views......

A relaxing way to see Bangkok.. Took the tourist boat from Saphan Taksin BTS all the way down to the stop close to Kaohsan road ( 30 baht) then took a public boat all the way to Nothaburi (15 baht) a great way to see BKK from a different perspective. On the way back got of at the Chinatown stop.
The water smell!. This is the only river that cuts through and separate Bangkok into two halts, nothing extra-ordinary about it. its kind of beautiful at night.

Must See. The river itself is not beautiful, but it is a must see of the city. Just buy a cheap pass and hop on a boat. There is one boat stop that meets up with the metro...you an always ride to there. See some of the house shacks that are on the river and you can't see them from land...amazing hotels...etc.

A river treat.. A culture trip by itself. There are so many ways to see this. You can take a fast long tailed boat,or a slow local ferry,. The best way by far is on a dining cruise by either a new modern boat or an ancient rice barge.

Easy to use. Accessed this from the sky train was so easy to use and very cheap at only 30THB p/p each way, a real bargain, if you use the tourist boat 15THB I Think (can't recall how you differentiated them now) you get an overview of the area as you travel along the river, where as with the local boat you have to pay attention to the stop you wish to get off at.

Nice way to see the city. Many options, ranging from ferry ride (cheapest way, less than $1) to long boat (who knows the price they'll give you). Overall, on a nice day, this is definitely worth it to go along the whole river.

Great way to see the city and avoid the traffic queues. Traveling along the river in the Chao Phraya tourist boat is a great way to get around if the Sky Train isn't an option. A single trip costs approx. 40 baht regardless of your destination out of the 15 piers. It is a great way to get to the Leaning Buddha and Royal Palace and a cheap way to explore the city...a definite must do.

Interesting Mode of Transportation. A quick trip on the Express Boat Service on the Chao Phraya River will get you to your destination faster than any other style. Secondly, you can enjoy fantastic views on both sides of the river. A good half day trip would be to catch the boat at Thaksin Bridge and go all the way upriver to Nonthaburi. Have a snack and take the boat back to the pier nearest your next tourist destination, say the Grand Palace. Cheap and efficient. A little crowded in the city center but thins out nicely as you travel upstream.
River trip. Do river trip either ferry or river bus or better still hire you own boat
Nice ride. I took a boat ride to the Wat Po, Wat Arun and Grand Palace. This is a nice river with lots of pier connecting places.
Dirty looking. We stayed at hotel overlooking river and it was great to look out over river traffic. Very pleasant.
Chao Phraya express boats are super. the transportation via the river is very quick, cheap and good
Loved it. Such a throbbing lifeline through the city We spent hours on it in various modes of transport, especially liked the long tail boat ride around the smaller klongs.
polluted+. busy+, polluted+, must be travelled and awed..,access to many areas, reasonable cost.

Afternoon Breeze. We took hop n off boat along Chao Praya. Simply get off and on again anywhere we like. Easy to go to several temples, even to the great palace. In many tourist areas, independent guide will approach you to offer their service. Just refuse politely if you don't want to. They will bring you to certain souvenir shops to make you spend there.
Fun to travel upon. The breeze coming off the river is very cool. The river is brown and has trash floating around.

Impressive... but dirty (not unusual though). ...a cruise on the river is impressive... but don't ever expect a river like you'd see it in the mountains somewhere... it's a city's river... and when it rains, it gets even more brown-ish ;) not unusual tho! still a good experience !

Nice Boat trip. I love this river, If you like to see real Thai life you should ever miss this trip. There are boat trip available all along the river. Public boat cost 25 B. or private boat. Along the river side there are houses, market, temples, bank which are old building back to Siam when it was round 100 yrs ago. Fresh air and nice view.
Take free ferry to Asiatique. Vendors formerly from Suan Lam Bazaar Night Market. Trendy place for yoiung shoppers.Selection of good food.

great canal trip. we did a single tour from the pier for 2 hours, was great speeding along the river, then going up the canal to see how the locals live. fed the fish at the fish farm and had the market boats pull up besider us tryong to sell goodies. great way to see bangkok by river.
hot and humid. the water is brown , the weather is hot and humid though you are at river bank
Tourist boat tour. Liked the day pass as you could hop on and off all day.

Convenient way to travel in Bangkok. Unfortunately we were in Bangkok just as the major floods hit Ayutthaya in 2011, and the banks of the Chao Praya had risen dramatically. Nonetheless, we still travelled from Khao San Road to the connecting Skytrain using the river ferry.

The best single trip you can take in Bangkok. Take the entire ferry ride from one end to the other to get a great impression of Bangkok for minimal cost. Many piers are worth getting off at - for attractions, restaurants or simply getting somewhere else. Be careful getting on and off, it can be frantic and there have been accidents, but no problem if you act sensibly. Be sure to take a camera and get a good spot on the boat and you will get some excellent pictures. Choose a position so that you don't shoot into the sun.

interesting. A taxi boat is a must to view the river. China town from the river may put you off eating there but fascinating to see. Don't stand near the river taxi's engine really noisy and very squeezy try and stay out in the open is a hint. Regardless a worthwhile experience.

Just Use Public Transport. It's super easy to get around and costs 15 baht per person for transport. Don't be fooled by the companies trying to sell you the 150 baht day pass. It's not really necessary. Just ask them for the public ferry and they will point you in the right direction. They'll collect your coins on the ferry. It's refreshing, cool, and easy!
disappointing, a steep contrast of its formal years. completely changed,deserted. No commerce life. Zip. The waters are extremely choppy, lots of catfish. Save you money for this one.

Another way of exploring Bangkok. They say Bangkok traffic is very bad. It is and certainly will affect your trip, so If you want to skip the hustle and bustle of the local traffic. Do check out the Chao Phraya River. You can go here by riding the BTS. The BTS has several stations located at the main section/s of the city, depending on where you stay. You will ride the BTS and alight Saphan Taksin. The destination of the route is Wong Wian Yai but you alight 2 stations before hand for Saphan Taksin. As you exit the station, you have to take the exit where it says River Boat. Upon exiting that, you go down and find the port. The port offers 4 different companies that offer river tours.Just buy a single ticket journey ( around 40 Baht ) and you can ride the boat the will take you to various ports all through out the city by means of the river. The boat stops at various locations to pick up and drop off passengers to their destinations. You can now visit various temples as well as palaces, the Chinese market and various landmarks just by taking the boat ride.The route of the boat ends at the last stop and then returns to the places where it dropped off and picked up passengers. Duration of the boat ride is 30 mins but you have to wait every 30 mins before you see a boat, if you want to be picked up at the drop off point.Very convenient way to explore Bangkok, notice that this is only a river boat cruise of the city. If you are planning on visiting the floating market, that is another story. Because that is 1 1/2 hours away from the city and would require an actual tour unless you plan to taking taxi.
Busy little river. Used hotel boat from hotel to Saphan Taksin Pier. Hotels on river have free boats which are easy to use. Interesting seeing boats, long tails, transport etc. River quite polluted.

Cool. We had a view of the river from our hotel, it was nice sight but up close it was rather dirty! I guess this is probably true of most rivers. Nevertheless, take one of the river boats and go down, it's fairly peaceful.
Travel on the River to See Main Sights. A Water Taxi or Long-Tailed Boat can provide the transportation as you experience the wonderful sights along the river.
Try the public boat.. Just get on the public transport boat,for an inexpensive trip from the river.Easy to leave from the Saphin Taskin bridge jetty,maybe travel to Kho San and back.Just relax.
This is the best way to experience the old town of Bangkok!. Many many piers around stopped by, with lots of interesting attractions along the river.
Very nice view :). Along the Chao Phraya river, there are so wonderful view and nice atmosphere.

Don't pay the long boats.. Biggest rip off scams at the ferry stops. Don't pay the long boat drivers the asking price. Catch the ferry instead. Easy to be taken for a ride. Floating markets a disaster, don't waste your time.

The heartbeat of Bangkok. Allowing for the fact that this is the main river through a huge city the Chao Phaya retains a charm. It exposes you to the daily life of the residence. It gives you easy access to a whole range of tourist attractions from hotels to restaurants to shopping centres to tourist sites. You can book most things for river trips online of go to River City for irect access.

Best deal is the public water taxi service. We were told by some locals to hop on the public Chao River Express to get around and see some parts of the city from the water. After some confusion at the pier, just off the Saphan Taksin BTS station - trying to figure out where to stand and what boat to get on - we followed the local Thais onto the public transit boat. Be aware that there are tour operators offering to take you around, which are probably good. But if you want the best deal, take this one. You do not need to pre-purchase ticket and just pay cash, 30 Baht, once you get on board. It's an efficient way to get around and stops at the piers for Chinatown and the Grand Palace among others. Probably one of the best value-for-money sightseeing experiences in Bangkok.

Relaxed way to see the city. The river side view is very scenic, especially at night when the colorful lights of the city come alive. One can enjoy it in numerous ways, dining on a riverside restaurant, or by taking a cruise or by simply gazing it through your hotel window. During the day, ferry trips are also available to cross the river.

Great Experience. It a great experience riding ferry boat along the river as you can see local people and things around the river. Would suggest to chose local ferry rather and expensive ferry which will say it more safer and charge more.

Lovely night view from the water. Went on a night cruise, with dinner and dancing. The view is spectacular so if you like this kind of "sightseeing" this is a good way to spend the evening. The food is for the masses so don't expect too much. The dancing show was pretty, but no explanation of what the traditional dance was representing.
Not to miss!. The ferry cruise operated in the night gives an amazing glimpse of the temples lighted up and nice food aboard the cruise with music and dance on the open deck!!!
dinner cruise OK. OK, but a little pricey in the balance...- we stay far from the palaces, etc,,, I thought we would be closer...- you arrived in another place from where you boarded!
Bangkoks Tranport Hub. Pretty , I would have liked to be here in the early 1900s this area would have been a busy transport mecca.

must do in bkk. Bangkoks river is one of the major attractions. its always a bit of a breeze down there so just enjoy a ferry ride along the major must sees of bangkok. i also recommend an evening diner cruise on one of the smaller boats

Great Way to Get Around. Taki the Tourist Boat, is you have but a day or so to see Bangkok. Stary early, avoid the crowds at the tourist attractions. And, if you have time, take an evening cruise on one of the big boats. Good food, good sights and good relaxation.
Easy way to get around. Good value for tourist boats or other services and quick. Great views of many attractions from river.

Average river cruise. Went on the river cruise after a tiring day of sight seeing. Did not enjoy the very long wait to get onto the boat - the waiting area had no seats, torture for those with tired legs and sore feet. The music on the cruise was raucous and very touristy whereas I had expected something traditional. Food was average and the restrooms were not very clean. However, the view from the cruise was really nice, and a with a decrease in sound levels, it would have been a pleasant cruise.

If you want to experience everyday Bangkok, go ahead.. It's nothing spectacular, but if you want to dig into every day's life in Bangkok, go ahead and try. They also have all-in ticket for tourists for 150 Bahts, and you might want to consider it to drop by at every pier.

Dragon boats on the river. Our river trip in a private dragon boat was a highlight although the engines were very loud! A much cheaper way to explore the river is by the tourist boats which tour up and down all day.
On the River. You need to go there. Great food and shopping. Lots of large boats on the river.

A good look at Bangkok from the River. Catch the skytrain to the river and get on one of the River ferries. The tourist ferry only goes so far so catch the 'locals' ferry and go to the end of the river. You get a real taste of Bangkok - you will see the Temple of the Dawn and the Kings Palace as well as the Bangkok Navy all from the comfort of the ferry. You can also feed the catfish at some of the ferry stops.
Average. In september 2011, the river was very dirty.. But this not a problem, very exciting and worth of see

Wide river of charm. I honestly love the Chao Phraya. Yes, sometimes of a morning when the boats are cleaning out the fallen branches and picking out the stray rubbish it may be less appealing, but it truly is a gorgeous place to be and anywhere that you can score a hotel along the river that has its own river taxi will prove fruitful. On a clear and sunny day, it is truly spectacular.

Take the day ticket to visit Bangkok from the river. You would enjoy from Sathorn pier and up the river to the Royal Barges, with many interesting stops like Chinatown and Royal Palace.The day ticket permits you getting in and out from the regular boats at any of its stops as you decide.

Chao Phraya River. This was a truly wonderful experience - easy to get to the river with the Skytrain and helpful staff once you get to the Pier. The tourist boat is very convenient and amusing that the money gets collected once you are on board - a lady walks around and collects the money every time the boat stops - dont know how she knows who got on at each stop!You get to see the houses and dwellings and the grand restaurants and hotels from the river and of course the Wat Arun which is a very impressive sight from the river. To get to Wat Arun you have to get off the tourist boat and take a ferry across the river and back for 3 baht per person.Even a trip up the river and back is enjoyable.We got off the boat before the last stop and had a very interesting walk back to the pier. The area is much more affluent than around the central areas.

Get a real riverside feel of Bangkok. One of the trips I never tire of doing is a return river trip on a local, 'orange flag', ferry from Taksin Bridge to Nothaburi. I normally take the sky train to Taksin Bridge, jump on the regular ferry and watch the river sites go by all the way to Nonthaburi. Here there is an interesting local market to wander round and places to snack and have a coffee. I then take the ferry back, usually stopping off for a meal and to people watch at the back-packer mecca of Kao San Road. Often I stay here until later and go to the marvellous Blues Bar which is not far from Kao San Road. The other main ferry stop of interest is near the Grand Palace but many stops lead to interesting places to wander round. Note that the ferries stop at about 7.00 PM and so you will need to take a taxi to get back 'home' after that time.

Nothing Special. Nothing much with the river ride, they Called it The Venice of the East. The river was brown, they will let you buy fish food. the long tailed boats are safe. It gets boring once you see a couple of view its the same till the end of the ride. But overall it's worth the experience.
Makes for a great evening out in BKK. Lots to see, river taxi, dinner cruises. Don't miss seeing the War at dusk

Did a boat cruise from the old fish market area. Great cruise, got to see heaps all the old homes on the riverbanks, just hanging in there and the new mansions. Fed the fish, went under the great bridges etc. Really had a great trip.

Wonderful way to view the history of Bangkok. My daughter and I took a longboat ride from our hotel on the riverfront. It was so interesting to see how people have built their homes over the river and how they live. The locals were friendly, always waving from their porches. We even saw a few monks! We were able to buy some bread to feed to the fish that were swarming at one portion of the river...I think our captain mentioned a fish farm, not sure. Then another boat came up to ours and offered to sell us cold beer and little trinkets. We bought some beer for the boat captain and some Cokes for us, it was a nice way to support a local entrepreneur. I would bring your camera and have fun!

Central Artery of Bangkok. The river is a central fare for the commoners, with routine water taxis commuting between the various piers. As a tourist, you could watch it from the banks from one of the river side hotels, or attractions. The river water is quite murky and the piers are not upto standard in terms of facilities such as public toilets or sufficient seating area in case of rains.Tips: 1. You can do a budget ride for baht 100, take the metro to Saphan Taksin, slope down to the ferry stop and take a ride to Tha Tien Pier from where you can cover Wat Arun and Grand Palace.2. Protect your camera lens from splashing water in case you use the narrow speed boats.

Great Night Views. This was a dinner cruise and the food was not great but the views of the temples and buildings showing their glory in lights was beautiful. If you can skip dinner and just take a cruise it would be a better choice and have dinner on the pier.
Must be place. I had the chance to go on the river cruise and i ts one of the best things i did in Thailand don't miss it

Nothing overly amazing, to be honest!. Went on a cruise on the Chao Phraya River one evening. There really wasn't too much to look at! We did go by Wat Arun (temple) and it was beautiful, all lit up.. also the Grand Palace and the Rama 8 Bridge.. but overall, it wasn't that exciting!

Cruising with the locals ... or not ... you choose. This is the true heart of Bangkok.Forget Sukumvit, Siam or Patpong - this is what you came to see. Cruise down the river with the locals on the water taxi, jumping on and off at a seemingly endless collection of temples and shops. Or, participate in an upscale dinner cruise as you leisurely take in the river and the city views it offers.When you come to the river, you come away understanding Bangkok and its people a bit better.EXTRA: try to come during the Loi Krathong, the water celebration - AWESOME!
Mesmerising. From our balcony of the Chatrium we could sit and watch the craft on the river for hours. However, I fear that pollution in the river is a big problem, which will only get worse
Fun. It's a fun and "fast" way to see the city. Taking a boat really helps at the beginning to get a sense of the city and the location of the major sites.
Take the ferry. It's an easy and inexpensive way to get around the city, to various points along the river.

A Good Way to Spend a Day. Instead of the 150Baht Chao Phraya Tourist Boat, take the local boats with the orange flags. They only cost 15Baht each time you get on (in the event you want to get off at some of the piers and then return to the boats again). They run very regularly and stop at most of the piers up river. It's great for a leisurely way to see the sights along the river and to take great photos. Just look up the orange ferry routes on the Internet and jump on and off when you need to. To get to the Orange boats, just take the Skytrain to Saphan Taksin and you'll see the central pier as you exit the Skytrain (just make sure you head toward the river and not in the other direction! It's only a 1-2 minute walk). When you get to the river pier, the Orange boats leave from the pier to the left of the main peer where the tourist boats are.It's easy to reach Wat Pho and Wat Arun, the Grand Palace, Chinatown, etc. from the piers along the river. Try going all the way the end of the line to Nonthaburi - it becomes more rural and you can see a bit more of Thai life.Perhaps even make the return journey from Nonthaburi between 5 and 6pm and sit to the right of the boat. You can get some great photos of the sun setting to the west bank of the river.

Historical & Beautiful at Night. We did a dinner cruise along it and it was lovely. Ask at your hotel for a reputable company to go with. Take a video camera, as it's quite dark for photos but cool on video.

Colourful and fun. Staying at appartments beside the river meant that we had the opportunity to use the various Hotel shuttle boat services daily. These ferries are basically a hull with a permanent roof meaning that when they get going you get a lovely refreshing breeze blowing through - great on hot sticky Bangkok nights. These ferries are free and you get great lighting displays at the various Large Hotels and the other river traffic

no waterways pride. It is a great shame in Bangkok, and many Asian countries, that they just don't care about rubbish. The rivers and canals in Bangkok are just full of the most horrendous rubbish. There is no civic pride in this regard. Even after the flushing the canals received post the floods, they are now just open sewerage pits
Fun. It's always fun to zip down this mighty river with a multitude of interesting buildings and sea craft - good value for little money

Fun way to get around the river. We took one of the tourist boats. We wanted just the regular river taxi but couldn't find it... The longtail boats looked neat too but much more expensive so we passed on those. The all day tourist pass for the boat we chose was fine and got us to the various stops we wanted and some extras we're not quite sure how we got to. Nice way to spend the day but it was an UNGODLY hot day that day... I have NEVER sweat like I did that day... make sure you wear something cool if you'll be out on the river and walking around the markets near there.
Great experience. We went on a boat ride along the river, and it takes you back to olden times, people traveling by boat everywhere it was magical, and I would definitely do it again.

Take a Long Tail Ride. We decided to take a long tail boat for an hour instead of booking a tour. This worked out very well for us. We took the Sky Train to the River and just walked up and booked a boat for an hour for BHT1,500. We loved the ride and got to see everything we wanted. We had the baot to ourselves and it was very special.
Strong filling of being in Thailand!. When I crossing or enjoying navigating in Chao Phraya River, I feel all the best and bad things of being in Thailand! It is a must for any traveler.

The shortest route to Wat Pho, Wat Arun, Grand Palace and more. While the water is a bit dirty, the ferry ride in Chao Praya River is the cheapest and fastest way to get you to the famous temples in Bangkok. Sights to see while onboard the ferry is a lovely free attraction.

night cruise... not worth it, pass!. We tried the night cruise, we were underwhelmed. The only time we actually had bad food in Thailand. It took too long, by the end of it we couldn't wait to get of there. Do something else, it would have probably been more interesting during the day, when you can see all the local activities.
rich and poor. shanty housesnext door to mansions.very sad to see the mess and destruction from last years floods
Use the municipal river taxis. Great way to see the city - get off at pier 8 to visit a great market and the temples.
Excellent. The best way to see how the people live there! Authentic, spiritual, something You have to experience!

Be sure to ride the regular river taxi.. Ride it to the end each way, it is very cheap, only a few baht. It waill take you to Khao San Road, the Grand Palace, all the Wats. There are also tour boats that make fewer stops, good for tourists and still not very expensive. Lots of traffic on the water, barges, restauants, long tail boats...

Ferry time....!. make sure you take the ferry and hop on and off as much as you like. a great attraction and you get to see lots of things. quick and regular service (however stops early in the evening)
A beautiful and cheap way to see the city. For value and convenience the river can only be rivalled by the canals, do them both.
Wonderful night Cruising. It is amazing to see the night river life. I am really enjoying the tour.

flower market. Take a boat taxi to the memorial bridge pier and walk to the flower market and from there to What Po and Wat Phra Keo..cross the street towards the Royal hotel and find the Buddha casting street and from there towards Wat Saket..great trip..

Great way to feel like a local. Riding on the Chao Phraya River was an amazing experience. It's a great, cheap way to get into the grove of the Thai life. You ride the boats with the locals who are headed to work or just hanging out. It's pretty intimidating at first as the boats just make quick pit stops along the many piers and you have to jump off and onto the boat quickly with no rails to protect you from falling into the water. But after a few stops you get the hang of it and you're jumping on and off like a pro.

Good way to see how people live. We took a local boat just to cross the river for 3 bath...then we took a long boat for 1 hour cruise around the river and the Klongs for 1000 bath for the two of us. It was worth every bath as we saw how local people lived, also the terrible poverty around the Klongs and the river compared to the amazing hotels, wats and houses around, a real eye opener...

Combination of poverty and richness. We took the public transportation and did the whole root for 15 bat each. It was fantastic, you see the real Bankok with the mix of poverty and luxury. Only look around and take your time.
Must experience. One must experience the River travel to complete your experiencing Bangkok.

Tourist boat great!. Chao phraya river boat - tourist boat day ticket is a great deal. Hop on and off all day, free guide book with directions to main sights and attractions. Be warned though - royal barges quite a trek and hard to find

Best way to travel. We love traveling the water taxi up and down the Chao Phraya River! I cannot think of a better way to "commute" into the city from Nonthaburi. 15 baht and a relaxing commute. Why travel any other way?

Spectacular but dirty. The ferries that run up and down the river are definitely a nice way to access many points of interest along the riverside, such as the Palace or Wat Aurun. And it is pleasant with the breeze when it's a hot day in town. But the river in it self is dirty and probably poluted from dirty drainwater. We saw some of that. Easiest way to get onboard is from Taksin Bridge BTS station.
still clean. Great view on the boat ride.Go early in the morning so it is not so hot on the way back. Get the whole boat trip it is cheap.
Nice river ride in a ferry. It is a nice experience of traveling in a river with historical monuments on its sides.

Boogie down this river!. Everyone should travel with the locals on the river 'Busses" it is an experience at any time of the day or night. Cameras at the ready!!!!!!!Been here so many times.Lots of photo opportunities. A TIP.. Go up river, rather than down river. Get off at the top terminus. Have a look around the 'Real Bangkok market! Escape from the tourists! You will not be disappointed!
Interesting.. dirty dirty river but the difference between rich and poor was astounding.Fun feeding the fish, not so fun being splashed by passing speeding inconsiderate boats.

Amazing. Just Amazing.. I love everything about Bangkok, shopping and massages both. But on my second night in Bangkok, I met one a friend in the hotel and decided to go on a cruise together - ( Do take the speed-cruise) we booked the traditional boat ride that also serves dinner, overall, the view is AMAZING, along the Chao Phraya river, all of the temples were lit-up beautifully. The only thing that I regret was not taking the speed boat, as the traditional boat right was quite hard to get a great picture. :))
Take a Ride. I took a ride on a long tail boat and ferry's during the day and a dinner cruise at night. All were great. Recommend you see it at both times of the day.
A nice way to see Bangkok. Take a dinner cruise or a river tour to get a nice view of Bangkok while enjoying the breeze.

Take the tourist ferry. A great way to see the city if by this ferry. You cna either buy an on off pass or a one way pass. Both are very inexpensive and allow you to bypass the noise and traffic of the city.

Real Bangkok. The river is a must on any visit. You can use the Tourst Express boat if you want and is a good service, but you can alo use the local boat to get around and see some of the real Bangkok. A trip on an Orange flag boat to Nonthaburi, the street market, and back is a nice day out. River City Mall has the River View restaurant on the 1st floor and it is very good with a fantastic view of the river. Great for a sunset. The Wonton soup is lovely.
Chao Pharaya River Long Boat Cannal Trip. We took a long boat trip thru river and Old City cannals. Found nothing exciting , Too much hyped tour!, Water is dark green,
I could live there!. It's fantastic to sail around Chao Phraya in the different form of boats available. Very efficient way of getting around. Do not visit Bangkok with out "doing" the Chao Phraya!

On boat time..... it's cost RM200 for a boat, no matter how many of you is going to have this.
is a new expirence on taking the boat to the Grand Palace.

A cheap tour along a scenic river. Get off the BTS at the sky train's Sapan Taksin station. Head to the river and pay next to nothing to take a boat along the river. Get your camera ready and enjoy the view and the wind. I suggest you just head to Tha Chang where you can then see Wat Arun, Wat Pho and the Grand Palace.
Take a longboat ride!. The traditional longboats (available close to the main post office) may cost a bit but the ride is well worth it. These are unique!

Nice and a little dirty place!!!. Take a boat and enjoy the views!!! don´t miss it.
A little dirty and smelly in some piers!!

Awesome experience. It's my 4th visit to BKK and my first time travelling along the River. With my family we stayed nearby to the river. We we amazed to find that there were cross river ferry services as well as the normal ferry service. As Ben2222 below suggest, stick to the Orange Flag Ferry as its only 45baht one way and you can stay on it as long you want. We jumped on from Central Pier all the way to Grand Palace. It took not long at all and was cooler then the hassle of a taxi etc even in 40 degree heat. At night the river is beautiful to see. If anything it's an experience to see own the ferry captains drives these boats along the river with the currenta dn congestions etc.

A charming way to see a different side of Bangkok. We took a private long tail boat ride along the Chao Phraya River and through the network of canals and would highly recommend doing this trip or something similar (we booked through viator).It was such a calming, serene way to spend our first morning in bangkok and really quite romantic! We loved cruising past rice barges and other boats and down the winding canals to see some of the lesser known areas of Bangkok while checking out some the thai temples, buildings and houses along the way. Wonderful.
Ok. Unless you want to see the night view of the temples..them go for it otherwise food is average

Do a river trip. Ive been to Bangkok several times and had never been on the river, its cheap and fun..just hopping on and off is great, seeing the sites along the way is interesting, just dont fall in... its pretty murky...

BKK life line. Take my advice: just use "orange flag" boat to explore chao praya river. With flat fee of 15 baht u can go to any piers. Much much cheaper than the tourist boat.Check the boat website to download the routes map. (this river reminds me of Mahakam river at East Borneo)

Beautiful at night. I think if you get a chance, you should visit the riverside at least once. Its so lively and a different side altogether. There is a lot to see in Bangkok, but riverside is a must.

Nice way to cool off in the heat. As one reviewer said, "better rivers in other cities". Still it was interesting to see a giant python, a few water monitors and a peek at Bangkok river life whilst cooling off.

Dinner Cruise at its Best. I never had a dinner cruise in my life. Good thing I did it for the first time aboard the Chao Phraya Princess one night in May 2012. It was truly a stellar night as the illumination of the great historic buildings across the river plus the luxurious hotels create a great and majestic ambience!

Must see. But nothing special.. Use it as a means of transportation to get to many of the main sights. But don't expect anything in terms of a tourist attraction. There are nicer cities with nicer rivers.

A great way to sight see & get around Bangkok.. The tourist taxis don't offer much more than the express boats. The tourist taxis cost slightly more...but both are very cheap.
I've never done a dinner/lunch cruise boat, a rice barge tour, or rented a long boat. All of these options look like fun too.

A must.... If you don't go for a river cruise on the Chao Phraya River, you missed a major site in Bangkok. I remember loving it in 1973 when I was a boy and my memories were not disappointing when I was there in 2011. It is fascinating to say the least.

Other perspective. We went down to the rive via skytrain and took a boat trip at night up the river and back. It gives a total other perspective of Bangkok with the water and lights from both banks of the river. So beautifull. Next time we will take a restaurant boat and have dinneron the river. The whole river experience was so cooling on the otherwise very hot Bangkok.
Nice cool breeze on a hot day. The THB150 all day pass is the equivalent of a hop-on/hop-off bus but much more fun.
Interesting boattour around the city. Very interesting boattour. You get an good idea of how people live at and even in the river. recommendable

River Cruise at Bangkok. If somebody plans to visit Bangkok he/she must take a ride on this 2hours fun filled river cruise on river chhaopharaya.....ask you travel agent to book you on upper deck if you donot mind to have non-veg food......for vegetarian i suggest lowed deck.Upper deck is good for better view n better photography.

We took the taxi boat on the river and a dinner crusie. The taxi boat were a nice way to see the sites from the famous river and budget too. The dinner cruise took us a little further withe the added alcohol and food lol

Thai New Year. Travelling along the river is amust - we hired a longboat to travel along the canal - amazing. It was Thai new year and the policy is to have water thrown over you. Bought some water guns on the floating market and joined in, you can even aim at the police. The sights, sound, smell and fantastic people

So much to see and do!. This review is really just a place to add my photos of the Chao Praya River which flows through Bangkok and is a major transport network for hundreds of water taxis and ferries. This River of Kings flows 370 kilometers from north to south, starting in the Central Plains, through Bangkok and finally into the Gulf of Thailand.Many bridges cross this river and the beautiful Rama V111 Bridge which opened in 2002 is the one we climbed the stairs from the bottom and walked along the bridge. It is a cable stayed bridge with a single pylon, the longest span is 300metres and the bridge is 2.45 kilometres long. The views from the bridge are fantastic.
Express boat. Travel by river via the express boat is a must while in Bangkok because of the views. It's cheap and you can avoid the horrible traffic Bangkok is known for.
River view is so relaxing. The river is really busy and intereting with all sorts of craft going up and down. Its a great way to travel in the city as it makes you feel relaxed on your journey.

Take a river cruise, dinner or a boat trip. Whether it is just a short boat ride, a dinner cruise or a boat trip upstream - it is a unique way to see wonderful cultural and historical sights from the river.

Longtail and rice barge. Took a leisurely Sunday afternoon trip down the river from River City - we got on a long tail where we went down the river and explored the various canals..then later we transferred to a rice barge where we had a complimentary supply of fruit and soft drinks...a nice leisurely guided tour with no hard sells involved at all....

Take a long tail boat for an hour.. Just catch the skytrain and head to Saphan Taksin station and head to the river and hire a long tail boat for an hour. The skipper will take you on a trip on the river and go via the back canals for a look-see at other parts of Bangkok. Can also ask to stop at a copile of Wats for a visit.
Take the 5.30 boat trip. We took the 5.30pm boat trip and we saw the beautiful sunset and then the city lights, just amazing watching the city transform.

The great river. The Chao Praya River is the biggest feature of Bangkok (apart from the temples, the food, the market setc...) Life in Bangkok revolves around the river and it'sworth buying a full day riverboat pass and stopping off at the various wharves along the way to explore the local attractions. In fact after dloing that for a day grab another full day ticket (it costr about $3) and spend the day sitting back and cruising up and.down the river just relaxing and looking at the sights,or stopping off and grabbing a cheap meal amnd abeer at one of the little waterside cafes neaer the various wharves.

Boat Trip. It's a lovely and convenient way to see Bangkok quickly. The long-tailed boats are certainly an experience and it's great to watch the city whizzing past you as you ride on the water. You may also get a glimpse of what life is like for the 'real' people of Bangkok, in precariously balanced wooden huts that line the banks of the canals.The river is literally FULL of fish! Take some old, stale bread and feed them, as they will jump and dive and is great to see.
